There are three goblins that need to die. The first's name is Fugorg, and he lives in the caves around here. But I hear he's on a pilgrimage to that weird statue out in the wilderness. Maybe you can find him there and cut his head off?
quest_13101.SuccessText: You did it? Really? Wow. That's one down, two to go! I ... don't really feel like celebrating, somehow. My son is still dead. But you did well. Here. Let me teach you a few tricks of my trade in exchange. And, of course, here's the money I'd been saving up to pay for this assassination!

quest_13102.Description: George Madler has asked you to kill a goblin named Algapa. George thinks this goblin can be found in the dungeons beneath Eltibule Keep.
quest_13102.Name: Revenge For Slavery, Pt. 2
quest_13102.PrefaceText: The second goblin was the ship captain that held my wife as a slave. But that ship sank. So instead, I'll take revenge on his son, Algapa. Seems fair, right? And best of all, his son is right here! He's trying to make a name for himself under Eltibule Keep! I bet it'll be no trouble to kill him. Well... probably a little trouble. But it would help me sleep at night.
quest_13102.SuccessText: Algapa is dead? Hah! If only his father was still alive to weep for him. But no matter. Thank you. Here, let me give you what I can.

quest_13103.Description: George Madler asked you to kill a bear named Graz. He doesn't know where Graz lives, though, except that it's likely in a cave filled with goblins.
quest_13103.Name: Revenge For Slavery, Pt. 3
quest_13103.PrefaceText: The third person I need revenge on isn't really a goblin at all. It's a bear. A bear named Graz, famous for eating disobedient slaves. I lost track of where they'd moved Graz. There were some cave-ins around here recently, and the tribe that owned him is missing. Hell, Graz may be dead already. I just need to know Graz will never hurt another slave. Can you make sure of that?
quest_13103.SuccessText: Graz is dead? Graz is dead! Yes! That's wonderful news! Thank you so much!

quest_13104.Description: George Madler asked you for some cotton.
quest_13104.Name: Get Some Cotton
quest_13104.PrefaceText: Hey, if you're headed out into the wilds, mind picking any cotton you see for me?
quest_13104.SuccessText: Thanks. Here's some coin for your trouble!

quest_13105.Description: George Madler asked you to get some red asters. He's going to use the flowers to create dye.
quest_13105.Name: Flowers for Dye Practice
quest_13105.PrefaceText: I've been experimenting with dyes, but I still haven't really got the hang of it. Ran out of raw materials, though! Could you help? I need some more of those red flowers that grow here. Red asters I think they're called.
quest_13105.SuccessText: Thanks. Here's some coin for your trouble!

quest_132.Description: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!
quest_132.Name: Scorpion Nest Destroyed
quest_132.SuccessText: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!

quest_13201.Name: Milk!
quest_13201.PrefaceText: I need more milk! Always more milk! Those damned cows out there are so violent, too. Why can't they just calmly let me milk them?
quest_13201.SuccessText: Milk! Thank you! That was kind of you.

quest_13202.Description: Braigon mentioned needing more animal stomachs to make rennet.
quest_13202.Name: Stomachs!
quest_13202.PrefaceText: I wish I was a butcher. They must be overflowing with animal stomachs! But not me. My last batch of cheese used vegetarian rennet. Eugh! If you find some stomachs, save me a few, would you?
quest_13202.SuccessText:
Ohh perfect! These are perfect! I'm going to make some rennet right now.

Looks like I have too many of these, would you like them?

quest_13203.Description:
Braigon wants a perfect cow hide for an experimental cheese he's making.

(Perfect Cow Hides come from expert skinners who have mastered bovine anatomy. They're quite rare!)
quest_13203.Name: The Perfect Cow Hide
quest_13203.PrefaceText:
I have this crazy recipe for cheese that ripens within the hide of a cow. Crazy gimmick, right?! Trouble is, it requires a perfectly-skinned cow hide. I'm a pretty terrible skinner, so that's not going to happen.

But if you happen upon one, save it for me!
quest_13203.SuccessText: That's perfect! A perfect hide! Did you skin this yourself? No matter, no matter. What's important is that it's mine now, and I can get to work on this Cow's Paradise cheese! Here. Some of my private cheese stock should be ample payment!

quest_13204.Description: Braigon needs more quarter hoops for barrel making.
quest_13204.Name: Quarter Hoops!
quest_13204.PrefaceText: Gods, I am so sick of making barrels! It's so hard! And so stupid! Sigh... and I just ran out of quarter hoops. Great. Just great. That means I have to talk that idiot Kalaba into making me some more.
quest_13204.SuccessText: You got these just for me? Wow. Wow! That was really kind of you. Here, try this. It's my latest batch. Oh and let me give you some coin to cover your expenses.

quest_133.Description: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!
quest_133.Name: Scorpion Nest Destroyed
quest_133.SuccessText: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!

quest_13301.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get something written by the poet Gruzark. She didn't seem to know where Gruzark lives, though.
quest_13301.Name: Gruzark's Works
quest_13301.PrefaceText:
Both Hogan and I love poetry -- we met at a reading in the Vicious Bat in Statehelm. I miss my hometown a lot.

Hey, I heard that a  poet named Gruzark lives around here. I'm not sure where, exactly. But can you get me his autograph? Or just something he wrote? I'd really appreciate it!
quest_13301.SuccessText: You found Gruzark? He's dead?! Oh. Well, I guess that means this book will go up in value! Thanks. Here... it's one of my swords. It's got some silly enchantment on it, maybe that'll be fun for you.

quest_13302.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to obtain some obsidians so she can pay off her debtors before they cut off her head and lay eggs down her neck. But no rush.
quest_13302.Name: Paying Debts
quest_13302.PrefaceText: I... kind of have a gambling problem. Had a gambling problem. I'm better now! But there's these mantises that I owe money to. Like, several million councils. Don't look at me like that! How was I supposed to know they were psychics?! So, yeah. They're gonna rip off my head and lay eggs in my neck unless I get them their money. But they said they'd give me more time if I got them some gems they want. I've gotten a lot of them, but I need a few more. If you happened upon some obsidian, save them for me?
quest_13302.SuccessText: You got it? Whew! You saved my life for another month! Let me get you something.

quest_13303.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get some "hook-claw things."
quest_13303.Name: Hooks
quest_13303.PrefaceText:
I like Hogan a lot. And more importantly, he can protect me from the mantises if they come looking for me here. I wanted to get him something nice, to stay on his good side. Can you help?

Hogan keeps talking about a "claw-staff" he wants to make. But he needs some sort of hook claw things to make it. Can you get some of those, whatever they are?
quest_13303.SuccessText: Are those them? Wow. I guess, yeah, that'd make a pretty good staff! Let me give you something nice for your trouble! Do you like drugs? I'm trying to quit. Take my stash.

quest_13304.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get some game chips. She wasn't picky about the type.
quest_13304.Name: Game Night Is Calling
quest_13304.PrefaceText: It's just so boring here! I figured maybe I could get a card game going. But I need some supplies! Can you get me some game chips? Whatever denomination doesn't matter. I just need a handful of them to get the games started!
quest_13304.SuccessText: Ah hahaha perfect! I'm gonna make a killing with these! Thanks! Hey, you want this dumb thing? Take it!

quest_134.Description: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!
quest_134.Name: Scorpion Nest Destroyed
quest_134.SuccessText: You destroyed the erupting nest of Tunnel Scorpions!

quest_13401.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to kill Gnasher Matriarchs. He says they are near a waterfall to the west.
quest_13401.Name: Preventing a Predictable Problem
quest_13401.PrefaceText:
Sie Antry and I have been working to keep the roads safe, but it's a very hard battle. But I foresee a new problem that I'd like to nip in the bud. Can you help?

To the west of here, near the waterfall, a herd of Gnashers has moved in. And they're breeding! This will be very bad soon. Can you kill off some of the Gnasher Matriarchs before the whole land is overrun?
quest_13401.SuccessText: Good. Good! You're quite a proficient warrior! Here. Perhaps you will have use of this.

quest_13402.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to collect some guavas.
quest_13402.Name: Guavas of the Land
quest_13402.PrefaceText: I'm a bit of a fruit nut. (Do you get it?) I love the guavas that grow around here. Wish I had time to collect some.
quest_13402.SuccessText: Guavas! Thank you very much. Let me teach you a preparation technique for these.

quest_13403.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to visit Sie Antry at her home southwest of Hogan's Keep.
quest_13403.MidwayText:
Oh, don't you start with me! Hogan hasn't killed a single damned Tor-Urak in months! If it's not right outside his castle gate, he doesn't give a crap about it. I work my ass off, and he has the gall to suggest...

Sorry, kid. I don't mean to get you mixed up in this. I'll take it up with him tomorrow.
quest_13403.Name: Sie's Roadside Assistance
quest_13403.PrefaceText: My friend Sie Antry and I share the duty of keeping the monster population thinned out. But recently I feel that Sie's been shirking her duties. Perhaps she's overwhelmed. Can you visit her and see?
quest_13403.SuccessText:
Well, I'm glad she wasn't hurt or anything. Still, she'll have to listen to reason: I spend several days every week clearing the roads, and I've never seen her out there.

You don't suppose she works evenings while I work mornings, do you? Hah, no, that's the sort of misunderstanding you'd read in a bad adventure poem!

quest_13451.Description: Mythander in Eltibule said, "I suppose I could teach you horse-riding if you did a favor for me. You see, I despise goblins for obvious reasons, and there's talk of goblin miners in this area. I need to know what they're mining. You know how to kill a goblin, right? And swing a mining pick? Good, this should be easy for you! [Note: Completion requires Mining 15.] I've heard there is a "model home" somewhere around here -- a fake house. If you climb into the basement and get past some goblins, there's a cave underneath. Find out what the goblins are mining in that cave! Go to the very end and mine whatever's there. Bring me a sample."
quest_13451.Name: Mystery Rocks
quest_13451.PrefaceText: I suppose I could teach you horse-riding if you did a favor for me. You see, I despise goblins for obvious reasons, and there's talk of goblin miners in this area. I need to know what they're mining. You know how to kill a goblin, right? And swing a mining pick? Good, this should be easy for you! [Note: Completion requires Mining 15.] I've heard there is a "model home" somewhere around here -- a fake house. If you climb into the basement and get past some goblins, there's a cave underneath. Find out what the goblins are mining in that cave! Go to the very end and mine whatever's there. Bring me a sample.
quest_13451.SuccessText: This is what you found? Hmm. Well, it's definitely xedrite. Mythander licks the rock. But it's low-quality. Which means the goblins mining it are desperate and weak. It's unlikely we'll see a xedrite-rush from the goblands. So the news could be worse, but humans' Council should really take care of this goblin problem anyway. What's xedrite? Oh, just a stupid goblin metal. Enough about that. Let me teach you the basics of riding a horse!

quest_135.Description: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!
quest_135.Name: Gargoyle Invasion Thwarted
quest_135.SuccessText: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!

quest_13501.Description: Thimble Pete asked for a bunch of prepped cotton.
quest_13501.Name: Cotton Pickin'
quest_13501.PrefaceText: Oh, you look like the sort who works with their hands. Have you any cotton to spare? I could use some. Seeded and carded, of course.
quest_13501.SuccessText: Ah. Thank you. Here's something for your efforts!

quest_13502.Description: Thimble Pete asked for some fruit cocktail.
quest_13502.Name: Cocktails for Thimble Pete
quest_13502.PrefaceText: It gets so boring eating Hogan's cooking! What I wouldn't do for some fruit cocktail. Any kind would do, really. I'm not picky.
quest_13502.SuccessText: Why, thank you. That's fruit cocktail all right! And I guess I did say I didn't care what kind of fruit cocktail, didn't I? Me and my big mouth. Oh well, a favor's a favor! Here. This is for you.

quest_13503.Description: Thimble Pete asked for a Trophy Rat Skin, which is a rare item found by expert skinners.
quest_13503.Name: An Experiment Involving Rats
quest_13503.PrefaceText: I have a new idea for my fall line up! But I need something really crass to push it over the top. I know just the thing. Can you get me a really high-quality rat pelt? It'll make an amazingly awful hat.
quest_13503.SuccessText: Perfect! I'm not sure how this will become a hat just yet, but I'll think of something. Here, take this failed experiment.

quest_136.Description: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!
quest_136.Name: Gargoyle Invasion Thwarted
quest_136.SuccessText: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!

quest_13601.Description: Malvol has asked you to obtain Basic Metal Slabs. These can be acquired with the Mining skill.
quest_13601.Name: Slabs for Malvol
quest_13601.PrefaceText: I need more basic metal slabs for my sword designs. Get me some.
quest_13601.SuccessText: Good work. Here, take this breastplate. It's inferior to mine, but I'm sure it's better than... whatever that thing is that you're wearing.

quest_13602.Description: Malvol has asked you to obtain Expert Volatile Ink.
quest_13602.Name: Malvol's Calligraphy Needs
quest_13602.PrefaceText: I ran out of volatile ink yesterday. Get me more. The good stuff, for experts, not whatever worthless ink you use!
quest_13602.SuccessText: Good work. Here, take these pants. They don't stink like your current ones do.

quest_137.Description: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!
quest_137.Name: Gargoyle Invasion Thwarted
quest_137.SuccessText: You dissipated the gargoyles' toxic cloud and repelled the invasion!

quest_13701.Description: Gorvessa hinted strongly that she would like some danablu cheese.
quest_13701.Name: Gorvessa's Cheesy Demand
quest_13701.PrefaceText: I heard there's a fancy cheese maker out in Eltibule somewhere! Could you find her? Make her give you some danablu. That's the best kind! And get some for me.
quest_13701.SuccessText: Mmm. Sweet and pungent. You are too kind! Here. Take this as a sort of gesture of thanks.

quest_13702.Description: Gorvessa is trying to create panther-themed lingerie and needs a Trophy Panther Skin. Or at least she thinks she does.
quest_13702.Name: The Sexy Panther
quest_13702.PrefaceText:
Sex with Malvol is getting old. And that's bad! It's my job to keep it interesting. But I'm really a shield-basher at heart. I'm no good at this.

I have an idea! I could make a sexy panther suit and pretend to hunt him. Hmm he may like that. But I'd need an extremely good panther skin.
quest_13702.SuccessText: Wow, this is larger than I expected! Thank you. Here, you can keep this skin -- it was my first idea, but turns out it's not sexy at all.

quest_13751.Description: Ultashk demanded animal fat before he will open the gate into the further reaches of Hogan's 'basement'.
quest_13751.Name: Convince Ultashk to Help
quest_13751.PrefaceText: You rub my feet enough, I might rub yours. Not feet, though - more like bring me some premium candle-quality fat. Then we'll see if I let you in.
quest_13751.SuccessText: Is this premium fat? It looks like shitty fat to me. And it stinks! Ugghh... this is disgusting! This is how you make candles!? Screw this!

quest_138.Description: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.
quest_138.Name: Orc Invaders Repelled
quest_138.SuccessText: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.

quest_13801.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule asked you to find a crate of gratflower millet. She thinks there's some left in the storage tower in Eltibule Keep.
quest_13801.Name: Gratflower Millet
quest_13801.PrefaceText:
I wish I'd had time to get all the supplies out of the keep before I left! Those squatters make it hard to get my stuff out of there now. I had a crate of gratflower millet in there, and I think it's still good! Could you go get it for me? It's in the front tower -- you'll walk under it as you enter the keep.

Oh, the wooden stairs to the towers were torn down, so you'll have to be a little creative.
quest_13801.SuccessText: This is the stuff! Thank you! I'll use this for my famous gratflower tongba. That will take a while to prepare, though. In the mean time, try this! It's another of my specialties.

quest_13802.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule complained about a lack of sour cream.
quest_13802.Name: Cream for Potatoes
quest_13802.PrefaceText: My main food is potatoes. I use other foods when I can get 'em, but potatoes are what get me through the long winters. Anyway, I fucking hate potatoes! At the very least, it'd be nice to have some sour cream, you know?
quest_13802.SuccessText: You got this for me? Well that's really kind of you! I was just complaining, I didn't mean to make you go to all that trouble. But I'm glad you did! Let me teach you some gardening tips. I wish I had more to offer!

quest_13803.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule has pined for an exotic spice, "muntok pepper". It's a common spice among orcs, so you might be able to find some in the Kur Mountains.
quest_13803.Name: Muntok Peppercorns
quest_13803.PrefaceText: When I was the chef for Lord Eltibule, he let me import all kinds of exotic spices! One that I used to love was muntok pepper. Hard to find it if you're not an orc, or insanely rich! But it makes the best spicy soups.
quest_13803.SuccessText: What... this is real muntok pepper! Why, you're a gem in the gold pile! Thank you so much! Let me give you some soup! No, no, that's not nearly good enough. Wait. Here, take this. I, uh, borrowed it when I was leaving the keep. It was the younger Lord Eltibule's hunting weapon. I thought I could use it for safety, but it's too fiddly for me.

quest_139.Description: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.
quest_139.Name: Orc Invaders Repelled
quest_139.SuccessText: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.

quest_13901.Description: Percy in Eltibule encouraged you to kill Bear Groupies near The Mangler.
quest_13901.Name: Groupie Killing
quest_13901.PrefaceText: Seen them green bears out there? They're dangerous as hell, but don't bother killin' em, they're fey! They just come right back a week later! And so do those damned green panthers, must be fey too. But there are some ordinary bears that follow 'em around, charmed by their magic. Kill those ordinary bears and we can at least start to lower the danger!
quest_13901.SuccessText:
Good job. Any little bit helps. Of course, the only way to really solve the problem is to go through the rift and kill them... that would have to kill 'em permanently, right?

Anyway, I bet ya used a bunch of arrows getting that done, huh? I have some spares for ya.

quest_13902.Description: Percy in Eltibule has asked for saltpeter. He intends to use it to blow up a portal.
quest_13902.Name: Saltpeter for Percy Evans
quest_13902.PrefaceText: Been thinking about the portal those green bears use to get back into our world. I'm gonna try blowin' it up! I know an old recipe for explosions... just need a bunch of saltpeter.
quest_13902.SuccessText:
Thanks! This will work. I'll try it out in a while.

I haven't got much, but here's some of my old emergency potions. You might as well use 'em, they're just going stale sitting on my shelf.

quest_13903.Description: Percy in Eltibule asked you to talk to a goblin named Jumjab on behalf of his dead wife. You'll need to know some Goblinese to do so.
quest_13903.MidwayText: Percy? Old human near the fairy bears? Ugh. Wants me to tell him his dead wife is "at peace." Tell him I'll come by, but it will cost him. I've sensed his wife's spirit. She's not "at peace." But I'll think of something to tell him...
quest_13903.Name: Lydia's Ghost
quest_13903.PrefaceText: There's this goblin off a long way from here. Met him? Named Jumjab. He says he can talk to dead people. I want him to visit here and tell me if he can sense my Lydia in the ground. I dunno why. Just... to know. Oh, you know goblinese, right?
quest_13903.SuccessText: Jumjab said he'd come, but expects payment? Well, of course. No goblin works for free. And you shouldn't have to, either. Here's some coin for your trouble.

quest_14.Description: Obtain 2 perfect giant snail shells and return to Sie Antry.
quest_14.Name: Collect Giant Snail Shells

quest_140.Description: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.
quest_140.Name: Orc Invaders Repelled
quest_140.SuccessText: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.

quest_14001.Description: Flia has asked for a pair of antlers.
quest_14001.Name: New Spiky Headgear
quest_14001.PrefaceText: I have a deer friend who lost his antlers in a fight. He's very traumatized about it, even though I explained that they'd grow back. Can you get me a pair of replacement antlers?
quest_14001.SuccessText: Thanks. I hope you didn't have to kill too many deer for these! But I'm glad you understand that sometimes deer have to die for inexplicable reasons. That's part of nature's way.

quest_14002.Description: Flia has asked for a pair of cat eyeballs.
quest_14002.Name: The Cat's Glassy Stare
quest_14002.PrefaceText: I need some cat eyes for a special spell I'm working on! Can you get me some? Remember to kill the cats humanely. If you can.
quest_14002.SuccessText: Thank you. Culling cats just for their eyeballs may seem wasteful and stupid, but nature is often wasteful and stupid. You and I, we are one with nature.

quest_14003.Description: Flia has asked for a peridot.
quest_14003.Name: Peridots Needed
quest_14003.PrefaceText: Oh drat, I need more peridots to enhance my calligraphy. Do you happen to have a few?
quest_14003.SuccessText: Thanks! Let me give you something in exchange.

quest_14004.Description: Flia has asked for a large amount of Iocaine Powder.
quest_14004.Name: Flia's Odd Mushroom Request
quest_14004.PrefaceText: A poor transmogrified pigeon has been stopping by recently, begging for my help. Well, I can't help him, so I think it's time I put him down. Can you get me some Iocaine Powder? It's the most humane way.
quest_14004.SuccessText: Thank you! Would you like a snack? These are the unpoisoned ones, I promise! Tee hee!

quest_141.Description: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.
quest_141.Name: Orc Invaders Repelled
quest_141.SuccessText: You destroyed the orcs' war machines and sent them back into the mountains.

quest_14101.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for some onions.
quest_14101.Name: Sachets of Onion Powder
quest_14101.PrefaceText: I use special fetish pouches when I commune with the dead. One of the ingredients is dried onion, and I'm out. I'll give you good money if you have some!
quest_14101.SuccessText: Good! These are indeed onions. Here is your money!

quest_14102.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for some perfectly round pebbles. He says there's no common place to find them, but they can be found "all over the place".
quest_14102.Name: Perfectly Round Pebbles
quest_14102.PrefaceText: I'm about to make another batch of fetish powder, and I'm out of pebbles! I need a couple of really smooth round pebbles. They help agitate the mixture while it's cooking. There's no easy place to find them, but they seem to pop up all over the place. Do you have any?
quest_14102.SuccessText: Thank you. It takes so long to collect these! Here, let me give you some Council money.

quest_14103.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for oversized mandibles, sometimes found on Tor-Uraks.
quest_14103.Name: Urak Mandibles
quest_14103.PrefaceText: I set up camp here so that I could kill the Tor-Uraks and take their mandibles. Sometimes you get a good, strong mandible from them, and those are precious to me! But it turns out Tor-Uraks are much, much too dangerous for me to kill. Do you have any mandibles, by chance?
quest_14103.SuccessText: You got them. I'm impressed! Here's some money! Oh, and here's a sample of one of the things I make with the mandibles.

quest_142.Description: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!
quest_142.Name: Crazed Animals Subdued
quest_142.SuccessText: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!

quest_14201.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked you to find proof that her daughter is dead. She said, "In the note, the sage told her to find his lean-to under a giant boulder. He said he could just hear the sounds of a waterfall."
quest_14201.Name: Finding Yasinda's Daughter
quest_14201.PrefaceText:
It's been almost a decade since I heard from my daughter. Last I heard she'd taken up with filthy human "sage" who promised to teach her secret human knowledge. Ha! Human knowledge! Anyway, the sage traveled here and then contacted Sinda and told her to come find him. I'm sure they're both dead by now. But I want to know. Please bring me proof of Sinda's death.

In the note, he told her to find his lean-to under a giant boulder. He said he could just hear the sounds of a waterfall.
quest_14201.SuccessText: Oh no. This is definitely Sinda's. Her father gave it to her, and I... I... need a moment. Thank you for your help. Here. It is customary to pay coins for services here, correct?

quest_14202.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked you to find out if Sir Villas Wake has any children, so she can kill one to avenge her daughter's death. Villas Wake is dead, but she believes he may have left some personal belongings at Eltibule Keep.
quest_14202.Name: Kar-Get on Villas Wake

Objectives.Description: Find Personal Info about Villas Wake

quest_14202.PrefaceText:
Well, Sinda's dead. I blame that human that brought her to this horrible place. Unfortunately he has no mate to commit Kar-Get upon. Perhaps he has children. Find out for me. I am not an expert at combat, but I will have my vengeance.

I know that the human stayed at Eltibule Keep years ago, before the duke abandoned it. And like all human sages, he was a prolific journaler. Perhaps he left something there that would illuminate matters.
quest_14202.SuccessText: Ah, good. Let me see this. (Yasinda reads quickly, with intense concentration.) I see. He has a daughter in Statehelm. But he also seemed genuinely fond of Sinda. Argh! I wish I was first-generation; this would be so much easier without a conscience! Well. Thank you. I will contemplate my options. Here, take this ring back. As a gift for Sinda, I'd commissioned a spell to enhance the ring her father gave her. I went ahead and used the spell, figuring I could wear the ring myself, but it's too painful to keep. Please get rid of it for me.

quest_14203.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked for some explosive ink.
quest_14203.Name: Explosive Ink for Yasinda
quest_14203.PrefaceText: I have decided not to take Kar-Get on Wake's daughter. It is right and just, but I would feel too guilty. Instead I will use my trade to honor her. I will make an explosive map, and give Sinda a symbolic burial by fire. Hm, I am out of explosive ink. Do you have any?
quest_14203.SuccessText: Thank you. I will perform the wake privately. I would invite you to join me, but I fear I may cry, and I will not be seen in that state. Oh, but here is some money to compensate for your purchase.

quest_143.Description: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!
quest_143.Name: Crazed Animals Subdued
quest_143.SuccessText: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!

quest_14301.Description: Jaime Fatholm asked for some hard-boiled eggs.
quest_14301.Name: Eggs for The Road
quest_14301.PrefaceText: I'm gonna head out and do some mining soon, but need to get some supplies in. Can you help? I want some hard-boiled eggs. Good travelling food.
quest_14301.SuccessText: Thanks! Mm, smell that sulfury goodness.

quest_14302.Description: Jaime Fatholm asked for some Healing Potions.
quest_14302.Name: Stocking Up on Travel Meds
quest_14302.PrefaceText: Before I head off into the wilderness to collect gems, I should fill up on healing potions. Do you have any? I just need the weak kind -- the strong ones make me sick to my stomach.
quest_14302.SuccessText: Perfect! When a tiger takes a bite out of you, nothing like these little cherry-flavored babies to fix you back up!

quest_14303.Description: Jaime Fatholm asked for a lot of clownfish.
quest_14303.Name: All The Fish You Could Want
quest_14303.PrefaceText: I'm gonna go out collecting minerals soon. But on the way I'm gonna visit a ... friend. And when I do that, I'm gonna need a lot of fish. Don't ask why. It's hard to explain. But if you have some handy, I'd appreciate your help!
quest_14303.SuccessText: Wow. Ned'll love this. Thank you so much! Here, let me give you some pointers on surveying.

quest_14304.Description: Jaime Fatholm would appreciate if you killed a sheep that's humiliated her. She said, "He lives on a hill south of here. Not the hill immediately south, but the one past that, in between the Baroness and the old hunting lodge."
quest_14304.Name: Kill That Wooly Bastard
quest_14304.PrefaceText: Look. We're friends so I'm gonna level with you. I'm... I'm a little scared to go back out there. There was a sheep that nearly killed me. Just a fuckin' sheep. But I couldn't outfight him and I couldn't outrun him. I'd feel a lot better if I knew he was gone. He lives on a hill south of here. Not the hill immediately south, but the one past that, in between the Baroness and the old hunting lodge.
quest_14304.SuccessText: You killed him?! Thank you so much! And now if you promise never to tell anyone I was scared of a sheep, I'll teach you some of my fanciest mining tricks.

quest_144.Description: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!
quest_144.Name: Crazed Animals Subdued
quest_144.SuccessText: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!

quest_14401.Description: Lana Songtree in Serbule Hills asked you for wool so she can make a sweater. Wool comes from sheep. Sheep that you murder.
quest_14401.Name: The Sweater
quest_14401.PrefaceText: Do you have any wool? I love wool clothing! I've been trying to make my own sweater. You'd think having all those sheep out in the meadow would make it easy, but they aren't tame. At all. I can't even get near them! Well, anyway, if you have some wool, I would buy it from you!
quest_14401.SuccessText: Thank you so much! I don't know how you managed to shear the sheep without getting hurt. You must be pretty agile! Here's the money I owe you.

quest_14402.Description: Lana Songtree in Serbule Hills asked you to deliver some homemade bear repellent to her friend Jara in Serbule. Jara lives in a farmhouse outside of town.
quest_14402.MidwayText:
What's this? Oh. From Lana in the inn? I told her not to bother! Bear repellent might cause an attacking bear to go away, but this bear is literally living in my barn! I'm not gonna try to repel it, it'd just kill me! Why doesn't she listen?! Human youth are so stupid!

Sigh... but no, don't tell her that. Tell her thanks, and that I appreciate it and I'll try it out soon.
quest_14402.Name: Repelling a Bear
quest_14402.PrefaceText: After my mom ditched me in the woods, I lived with a little old lady who taught me some useful recipes. Which is great news for my friend Jara! She has a bear living in her barn, and I have just the thing: bear repellent! I brewed it up for her last night. Can you go give it to her? She lives outside of Serbule. Look for the farmlands.
quest_14402.SuccessText:
She liked it? Oh, good! I was worried. She said she didn't want my help, but I figured that was just elves being stuck up about getting help from humans. I'm sure her bear problem is a thing of the past.

Here, take this as thanks: it's spider repellent!

quest_145.Description: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!
quest_145.Name: Crazed Animals Subdued
quest_145.SuccessText: You put down some of the infected beasts, and ran the others off!

quest_14501.Description: Sirine in Rahu said, "Ever killed a rhino? Quite a rush, isn't it?! They're so dangerous! I'm not really in shape to hunt rhinos right now, though... my bow broke. And not coincidentally, the bow uses ivory rhino horn. You probably see where this is going... if you find some, please let me know!"
quest_14501.Name: Repairing the Horn Bow
quest_14501.PrefaceText: Ever killed a rhino? Quite a rush, isn't it?! They're so dangerous! I'm not really in shape to hunt rhinos right now, though... my bow broke. And not coincidentally, the bow uses ivory rhino horn. You probably see where this is going... if you find some, please let me know!
quest_14501.SuccessText: Great! Now I can start to work repairing my bow. Here, would you like some leather?

quest_14502.Description: Sirine in Rahu said, "Well, the bow's almost ready, but I need to restring it. I need cat gut! Bring me a bunch of cat meat and I'll dig through it to find what I need."
quest_14502.Name: Restringing the Horn Bow
quest_14502.PrefaceText: Well, the bow's almost ready, but I need to restring it. I need cat gut! Bring me a bunch of cat meat and I'll dig through it to find what I need.
quest_14502.SuccessText: There's bound to be a good bowstring in here somewhere. Thanks a lot!

quest_14503.Description:
Sirine in Rahu said, "I went hunting with the bow you helped me repair! And it sucks. It's frankly unusable. It turns out the only reason it worked before was due to all the magic, because normal ivory doesn't bend or flex at all! I guess I let all the magic out when I replaced the ivory, and now it's junk. But not to worry! I can research the spells necessary to fix it! But that will take a while. For now, I need a substitute.

I've always hunted with a bow I made myself, even back when I was a child. I'm not going to just use some store-bought bow now at age 438! Can you get me some really perfect cedar wood for a temporary bow?"
quest_14503.Name: A Substitute for the Horn Bow
quest_14503.PrefaceText:
I went hunting with the bow you helped me repair! And it sucks. It's frankly unusable. It turns out the only reason it worked before was due to all the magic, because normal ivory doesn't bend or flex at all! I guess I let all the magic out when I replaced the ivory, and now it's junk. But not to worry! I can research the spells necessary to fix it! But that will take a while. For now, I need a substitute.

I've always hunted with a bow I made myself, even back when I was a child. I'm not going to just use some store-bought bow now at age 438! Can you get me some really perfect cedar wood for a temporary bow?
quest_14503.SuccessText:
Good. This is good. I'll make a new bow the same way I did as a young elf. I still have some cat gut left, so this is all I should need. You've been a great help!

I wanted you to have this. I made it from the ivory I replaced on my bow. I know it's not much, but if you don't need it, maybe someone who loves ivory would appreciate it.

quest_14601.Description: Percussa in Rahu said, "I was hired to play at a wedding, and I need good publicity, so this gig has to be great! The requested music is not a problem since I'm amazing. But these foreigners have a weird custom: near the end of the ritual, rice is thrown at the couple. I asked if balls of ordinary Rahu rice would do, and they said no -- they're too heavy! So I guess that I'll need secret rice. You know: the incredibly deliciously fluffy rice that can't be found in stores. The trick is: how do I get some? Do you have any?"
quest_14601.Name: The Perfect Rice For Weddings
quest_14601.PrefaceText: I was hired to play at a wedding, and I need good publicity, so this gig has to be great! The requested music is not a problem since I'm amazing. But these foreigners have a weird custom: near the end of the ritual, rice is thrown at the couple. I asked if balls of ordinary Rahu rice would do, and they said no -- they're too heavy! So I guess that I'll need secret rice. You know: the incredibly deliciously fluffy rice that can't be found in stores. The trick is: how do I get some? Do you have any?
quest_14601.SuccessText: This is the famous secret rice? Let me try it. Hmm... it's slightly lighter-weight than Rahu rice. I guess this will have to do for the wedding. Thanks! Oh, and here: I was going to make a cream sauce for my rice balls, but I think this secret rice will throw best ungarnished. Maybe these ingredients are useful to you?

quest_14602.Description: Percussa in Rahu said, "I like to make my own drums so I can get exactly the sound i need. My newest drum needs to have a perfect resonance, and for that, I need really great animal skin! Don't tan it -- I know it'll stink, but bring me the untanned hide. I need to process it myself in a special way. I'll pay you for the work!"
quest_14602.Name: Drumskins
quest_14602.PrefaceText: I like to make my own drums so I can get exactly the sound i need. My newest drum needs to have a perfect resonance, and for that, I need really great animal skin! Don't tan it -- I know it'll stink, but bring me the untanned hide. I need to process it myself in a special way. I'll pay you for the work!
quest_14602.SuccessText: Hmmmmm. Hmmmmm. I thought they'd be thicker. But okay, fine, these skins will do. Thank you, and here's your coins.

quest_14603.Description: Percussa in Rahu said, "Do you like my clothes? A wandering elven bard taught me how to make them! They're much stronger than they look, too. One of the secrets is spider silk, a cloth that's made from spiderwebs. I buy it from Shirogin, but he's been out of stock for months. If you find some spider silk, I'd love to buy it from you."
quest_14603.Name: Spiderwebs for Beautiful Clothes
quest_14603.PrefaceText: Do you like my clothes? A wandering elven bard taught me how to make them! They're much stronger than they look, too. One of the secrets is spider silk, a cloth that's made from spiderwebs. I buy it from Shirogin, but he's been out of stock for months. If you find some spider silk, I'd love to buy it from you.
quest_14603.SuccessText: Oh thank you! This spider silk is enough to make a new pair of pants. Here's your money. And hey, take my old pair of pants, too. There's a hole in the crotch, but nobody will notice.

quest_14701.Description:
Daniel Murderdark in Rahu said, "Pst... a little bird told me the most exciting rumor: there's some weird kind of skeletons in a cave under Rahu... and they're easily controllable by necromancers! I bet they're the restless undead from that rakkie war! Those rakkies could supposedly shapeshift... imagine a shapeshifting skeleton! Orrrr... they say there were dragons during the war... imagine a dragon skeleton at our command!

Well, I don't care what it is, really... I have to see one! If you find it, you've gotta show me. Promise me!"
quest_14701.Name: A Secret Type of Skeleton
quest_14701.PrefaceText:
Pst... a little bird told me the most exciting rumor: there's some weird kind of skeletons in a cave under Rahu... and they're easily controllable by necromancers! I bet they're the restless undead from that rakkie war! Those rakkies could supposedly shapeshift... imagine a shapeshifting skeleton! Orrrr... they say there were dragons during the war... imagine a dragon skeleton at our command!

Well, I don't care what it is, really... I have to see one! If you find it, you've gotta show me. Promise me!
quest_14701.SuccessText: That skeleton is... AMAZING! What is it? A rat-man? Look at that hat! Did you put that hat on him?! Nevermind that... you must teach me how to raise one. I command you! Please? Here! Do you want money? No, no, of course not. You want power! Very well. In exchange for your secret, I will teach you my best secret ritual! [New Hangout Available]

quest_14702.Description: Daniel Murderdark in Rahu said, "Hey, thanks for teaching me that little ratkin-skeleton trick! It's not as amazing as the trick I taught you... but it's still pretty good! But, um... in my excitement I forgot something. I don't have one of those summoning talismans! Can you give me yours? I'll give you a lifetime of riches for it!"
quest_14702.Name: A Ratkin Talisman for Daniel
quest_14702.PrefaceText: Hey, thanks for teaching me that little ratkin-skeleton trick! It's not as amazing as the trick I taught you... but it's still pretty good! But, um... in my excitement I forgot something. I don't have one of those summoning talismans! Can you give me yours? I'll give you a lifetime of riches for it!
quest_14702.SuccessText:
Thank you! This isn't your last talisman, is it? Oh, who cares! You can just go get another, right?

Here: as promised, a lifetime's worth of riches! Well, it's a lifetime's worth if you live very, very frugally. Or die very soon.

quest_14801.Description:
Lady Windsong in Rahu said, "There are crystals down in the sewer which remove filth, salt, and any other contaminants from the water. Quite amazing magic! But we do not know how long the magic will last, so each year we test the water. Can you do it this year?

Here is the special beaker I was given. I counted ten pools of water with functioning crystal fountains. Wade into each pool and test the water in the center of the room. The beaker will hum if the water is clean and screech horribly if there is a problem."
quest_14801.Name: Sewer Crystal Water Samples
quest_14801.PrefaceText:
There are crystals down in the sewer which remove filth, salt, and any other contaminants from the water. Quite amazing magic! But we do not know how long the magic will last, so each year we test the water. Can you do it this year?

Here is the special beaker I was given. I counted ten pools of water with functioning crystal fountains. Wade into each pool and test the water in the center of the room. The beaker will hum if the water is clean and screech horribly if there is a problem.
quest_14801.SuccessText: All of the water samples were clean? No screeches from the bottle? Oh, good. I have no idea what we'd do if they weren't working! Did you happen to notice if the treants are looking well? They were happy to see me last year! Wait.. wait, you aren't a friend of treants! How is that possible? Did the treants attack you?! I apologize. I should have thought of this earlier: Dreva's boons are not quite the same as Ri-Shin's boons, are they? But fear not, because I believe I can share this one with you. [Lady Windsong hops around you, and you feel something changing. Sewer treants will no longer be aggressive to you.]

quest_14802.Description: Lady Windsong in Rahu said, "The sewers connect to a cave system, and last year I noticed that some of the ratkins' snails had escaped and wandered into the caves. The ratkin didn't seem interested in recovering them, and I really want to know why. In this case I think the death of a few innocent snails is justified. Bring me a sample so that I can examine it."
quest_14802.Name: Escaped Snail Meat
quest_14802.PrefaceText: The sewers connect to a cave system, and last year I noticed that some of the ratkins' snails had escaped and wandered into the caves. The ratkin didn't seem interested in recovering them, and I really want to know why. In this case I think the death of a few innocent snails is justified. Bring me a sample so that I can examine it.
quest_14802.SuccessText:
It is as I feared: this snail meat is poisoned with traces of that weird metal they mine down there. That explains why the ratkin don't eat them!

Hmm. The meat almost seems rotted from within, as if a druid had cast Rotflesh on it. Hmm? No, not "Rotskin"... what's Rotskin? I mean Rotflesh! The druid spell? Oh... this must be another one of those differences between druid types. Why don't I teach you our version?

quest_14901.Description: Kalaba in Eltibule taught you the basics of Transmutation. He asked you to find weak magical items ("Uncommon" rarity items, with a green label) and turn them into Phlogiston. You learned a Transmutation recipe to do this -- it's in your Recipes menu.
quest_14901.Name: Phlogiston Basics

Objectives.Description: Distill Simple Magic Items Into Phlogiston
Collect Some of the Resulting Phlogiston

quest_14901.PrefaceText: Since I already taught you Transmutation, you're ready to go find weak magical items and turn them into phlogiston for me. Bring me some low-grade packets of Phlogiston. [As a Transmutation beginner, you'll need to find Uncommon (green-label) magic items that are no higher than level 30. Use the Transmutation recipe you learned to distill these items to Phlogiston.]
quest_14901.SuccessText: You did it! I knew I was a great teacher! I'll teach you the next technique now. This lets you distill slightly better magic items! Oh and here: take these prisms. Sometimes they break, so you need a lot of them. I actually need a lot more phlogiston than this -- but don't worry, I'm not asking you to work free! When you're ready to help more, let me know. [New Favor Unlocked.]

quest_14902.Description: Kalaba in Eltibule said, "Did you know phlogiston comes in many quality levels? The worst kind is 'Unsturdy Phlogiston'. Well, Makara called it 'Shoddy Phlogiston'. Either way, it's garbage. Then there's 'Semi-Sturdy Phlogiston', which Makara calls 'Rough Phlogiston'. It's okay, but not very sturdy. What I need is Sturdy Phlogiston, which Makara called 'Crude Phlogiston'. Just bring it to me and I'll deliver it." [Hint: Crude Phlogiston comes from magic items whose level is 30+. If you're only getting lower-grade phlogiston, you just need to transmute better items!]
quest_14902.Name: Sturdy Phlogiston
quest_14902.PrefaceText:
Did you know phlogiston comes in many quality levels? The worst kind is 'Unsturdy Phlogiston'. Well, Makara called it 'Shoddy Phlogiston'. Either way, it's garbage. Then there's 'Semi-Sturdy Phlogiston', which Makara calls 'Rough Phlogiston'. It's okay, but not very sturdy.

What I need is Sturdy Phlogiston, which Makara called 'Crude Phlogiston'. Just bring it to me and I'll deliver it.
quest_14902.SuccessText: Thanks! This is the stuff. You know, I'm never really sure what quality of phlogiston will come out of an item. Have you figured out a pattern? Oh, who cares. Anyway, here's some more prisms, and some money! And stick around because I think I have more work for you! [New Favor Unlocked!]

quest_14903.Description: Kalaba in Eltibule said, "I've sent the phlogiston off to my buyer, and now she wants some more! I need the same grade of phlogiston as before. Are you up for it?"
quest_14903.Name: More Sturdy Phlogiston
quest_14903.PrefaceText: I've sent the phlogiston off to my buyer, and now she wants some more! I need the same grade of phlogiston as before. Are you up for it?
quest_14903.SuccessText:
Excellent work. Here's some more prisms and some more money. Come back in a week and I'll probably need more!

Oh, and by the way, I've learned some more Transmutation techniques. When you're ready, come see me for more training.

quest_14904.Description:
Kalaba in Eltibule said, "I have another delivery of phlogiston for my buyer in the Ilmari desert, but I don't have time to go all that way. I know it's dangerous, but I believe in you: you're sturdy enough to go in my place!

Take this to Makara. She's in the northeast part of the Ilmari desert. She's living in a ruined building with a red-and-white striped tarp for a roof.

And listen to me carefully: when I go to the desert, I always travel with Kleave or at least Oritania. I'm sturdy, but I'm not stupid! The desert is way more dangerous than here. You can still do this, though. Discretion can be sturdy! Avoid confrontation!

Oh, how do you get to Ilmari? It's just past the Kur Mountains to the north. You, uh, might need to bring some warm-weather gear for that part of the trip..."
quest_14904.MidwayText: Hello? Oh. This is from Kalaba. I accept the delivery. Tell him I'll need more in a week.
quest_14904.Name: Delivering Phlogiston to Makara
quest_14904.PrefaceText:
I have another delivery of phlogiston for my buyer in the Ilmari desert, but I don't have time to go all that way. I know it's dangerous, but I believe in you: you're sturdy enough to go in my place!

Take this to Makara. She's in the northeast part of the Ilmari desert. She's living in a ruined building with a red-and-white striped tarp for a roof.

And listen to me carefully: when I go to the desert, I always travel with Kleave or at least Oritania. I'm sturdy, but I'm not stupid! The desert is way more dangerous than here. You can still do this, though. Discretion can be sturdy! Avoid confrontation!

Oh, how do you get to Ilmari? It's just past the Kur Mountains to the north. You, uh, might need to bring some warm-weather gear for that part of the trip...
quest_14904.SuccessText: She wants more phlogiston in a week? That's great news! Here's your delivery fee. And more importantly, I introduced you to my teacher! Makara taught me basic Transmutation. She can probably teach you the fancier techniques, if you're nice enough to her.

quest_15.Name: Find Bones
quest_15.PrefaceText: Hey, you've been killing those damned skeletons, right? Got any good, strong femurs? I need a half-dozen for this project I'm working on.
quest_15.SuccessText: Thanks, these will work great for my marionettes!

quest_15001.Description: Kleave has asked you for some leather strips.
quest_15001.Name: Strips
quest_15001.PrefaceText: Drat! Out of scrap pelts again! Can you run and get me some leather strips?
quest_15001.SuccessText: Thank you. Here, have some free tanning supplies.

quest_15002.Name: Power Potions!
quest_15002.PrefaceText: I have a long work order to get through today. I need refreshment! You've been down into the goblin basement, no? Do you have any power potions? The goblins love to carry them.
quest_15002.SuccessText: Thank you. I mix these with rhak whiskey for a truly energizing beverage. Here, let me show you a few pointers for your trouble.

quest_15003.Description: Kleave wants some low-value paintings. Paintings worth less than 50 councils would probably work best.
quest_15003.Name: Scrap Paintings
quest_15003.PrefaceText: Those goblins love artwork. I hate it! Bring me some of the lesser-valued pieces. I use them as floor coverings to keep my tanning chemicals from seeping into the groundwater.
quest_15003.SuccessText:
Yes, these will do. Thank you.

Here, let me show you how I mix the tannins. There's a trick to it, you see...

quest_15004.Description: Kleave has asked you to slay The Mauler and bring back his claw as proof.
quest_15004.Name: The Mauler

Objectives.Description: Kill The Mauler and Get His Claw

quest_15004.PrefaceText: North and east of here is a very powerful, semi-sentient fey bear named The Mauler. He and his mate dominate whole swaths of the countryside, maiming and killing any caravans that try to come here. Can you put him down? Bring me his claw when you've done the deed.
quest_15004.SuccessText: Yes, this is it! The very claw that nearly killed me. Who's laughing now, Mauler? I outlived you! Fool bear! (Kleave tosses the bloody paw over her shoulder.) Good work. Here. Let me show you a clever stitching technique.

quest_15101.Description:
Rappanel in Serbule Hills said, "Durstin behind the bar is good for a scrambled egg or a bit of fried bread, but he's just not willing to broaden his horizons! And yet right down the road is a rare delicacy: ranalan-style pickled fish! Get some for me. I'll convince him to try them some evening, and he'll finally see what he's been missing.

Look for the ranalans around the big lake. They like to leave pickling jars outside their huts. And don't worry -- they're not actually intelligent, they just seem that way. I read all about them in bard college back home in Verta!"
quest_15101.Name: Ranalan Pickles
quest_15101.PrefaceText:
Durstin behind the bar is good for a scrambled egg or a bit of fried bread, but he's just not willing to broaden his horizons! And yet right down the road is a rare delicacy: ranalan-style pickled fish! Get some for me. I'll convince him to try them some evening, and he'll finally see what he's been missing.

Look for the ranalans around the big lake. They like to leave pickling jars outside their huts. And don't worry -- they're not actually intelligent, they just seem that way. I read all about them in bard college back home in Verta!
quest_15101.SuccessText: Perfect. Now I'll wait for him to be good and drunk, so he won't remember the taste. You see, the first time you eat these, they're disgusting. But the second time, they're only moderately disgusting, and by the eighth time... wait. Wait! I just realized that these are actually an acquired taste, and it's not really a taste worth acquiring. Oh well, it's too late for me: I love 'em! I'll just eat these myself. Here, for your labor!

quest_15102.Description: Rappanel in Serbule Hills said, "Have you met Joeh over in Serbule? He's a dirty one, isn't he! I mean, I like to use food in the bedroom as much as the next elf, but his bacon fetish is... well, I shouldn't judge. I guess we all get a little crazy, so far from home! And I have to admit that some of his ideas sound intriguing. Did he tell you about the thing he does with the two boar tusks? It sounds painful to me, but I guess I have to try it: the bardic creed demands I gather lore! So... do you have any boar tusks, perchance?"
quest_15102.Name: Boar Tusks For Bardic Lore
quest_15102.PrefaceText: Have you met Joeh over in Serbule? He's a dirty one, isn't he! I mean, I like to use food in the bedroom as much as the next elf, but his bacon fetish is... well, I shouldn't judge. I guess we all get a little crazy, so far from home! And I have to admit that some of his ideas sound intriguing. Did he tell you about the thing he does with the two boar tusks? It sounds painful to me, but I guess I have to try it: the bardic creed demands I gather lore! So... do you have any boar tusks, perchance?
quest_15102.SuccessText: Ah, these tusks aren't as big as I'd feared! Okay, this won't be so bad. Did you want to join me in the lodge behind the inn? We can learn together... No? Well, suit yourself. Here. Take this money and stop judging!

quest_15103.Description: Rappanel in Serbule Hills said, "I need new catgut for my lute strings! Most catgut is made from sheep intestine, but I'm an artist, not some slob. I need actual cat gut! You're a lover of the arts, right? Don't do this for me. Do this for art. Find a tiger out there, kill it, and use your butcher knife to scoop up the guts. You do have a butcher knife, right? Because I don't! But I'm sure Fainor in Serbule town would..."
quest_15103.Name: Real Catgut
quest_15103.PrefaceText: I need new catgut for my lute strings! Most catgut is made from sheep intestine, but I'm an artist, not some slob. I need actual cat gut! You're a lover of the arts, right? Don't do this for me. Do this for art. Find a tiger out there, kill it, and use your butcher knife to scoop up the guts. You do have a butcher knife, right? Because I don't! But I'm sure Fainor in Serbule town would...
quest_15103.SuccessText: Oh gods they stink so bad! Augh! You didn't clean them?! No, no, it's fine. I'll have Lana do it for me. And here: I was going to give this to you. It's made of a goat's horn! Impressive, isn't it? I made it myself.

quest_15104.Description:
Rappanel in Serbule Hills said, "I really must have better food than what Durstin can cook. Even the ranalan pickles are getting old. Hmm, how about some of those 'grapefish'? I have to know why the humans call them that!

I hear they're in the lakes and streams around here, but they can be pretty quick. I'm sure with some practice you'll manage, though."
quest_15104.Name: The Grapefish Roundup
quest_15104.PrefaceText:
I really must have better food than what Durstin can cook. Even the ranalan pickles are getting old. Hmm, how about some of those 'grapefish'? I have to know why the humans call them that!

I hear they're in the lakes and streams around here, but they can be pretty quick. I'm sure with some practice you'll manage, though.
quest_15104.SuccessText:
Ew. Ew! What?! I am an artist! You expect me to fillet my own fish?! Take these away and fillet them for me. Please.

You do know how, right? Because I'm certainly not going to teach you. And that lunk Durstin won't either. I bet Fainor in Serbule town would do it, though. Go pester him. Here's some coins in case he's in one of his moods and tries to charge you for the lesson.

quest_15105.Description: Rappanel in Serbule Hills said, "So, do you have those filleted grapefish for me yet?"
quest_15105.Name: The Grapefish Roundup, Part 2
quest_15105.PrefaceText: So, do you have those filleted grapefish for me yet?
quest_15105.SuccessText: Thank you. You cleaned these yourself? Huh. You learn fast! I could hardly do better myself, and I was a fisherman for a few decades in my youth! But I gave that all up for my art. Sigh, I guess I'll have to cook these fish myself, though. I have a recipe all picked out: eggs! They go with anything! Here, let me teach you my recipe.

quest_15201.Description: Melandria in Gazluk Keep said, "My brother is a gru-maghi in one of the aboveground houses. You know, up above, where the best-connected orc leaders live? Anyway, my brother and I each smuggled in a pemphredo eye so we could talk to each other at night. But mine was taken as contraband almost as soon as I arrived, and I haven't been able to find another anywhere in Gazluk. Can you find me another one from outside? I miss my brother..."
quest_15201.Name: Contacting Melandria's Brother
quest_15201.PrefaceText: My brother is a gru-maghi in one of the aboveground houses. You know, up above, where the best-connected orc leaders live? Anyway, my brother and I each smuggled in a pemphredo eye so we could talk to each other at night. But mine was taken as contraband almost as soon as I arrived, and I haven't been able to find another anywhere in Gazluk. Can you find me another one from outside? I miss my brother...
quest_15201.SuccessText: Thank you! Hopefully Demerius still has his pemphredo eye! I'll try to contact him soon. You're so kind to get this for me. Here, this is for you. I stole it from my master. He thinks he lost it in a drunken card game.

quest_15202.Description: Melandria in Gazluk Keep said, "I try to be brave and upbeat about my fate because it makes things a little less horrible, you know? And some days aren't too bad... but some days are really pretty awful. I wish I had some dry gin for those occasions. Do you have any?"
quest_15202.Name: Melandria's Little Helper
quest_15202.PrefaceText: I try to be brave and upbeat about my fate because it makes things a little less horrible, you know? And some days aren't too bad... but some days are really pretty awful. I wish I had some dry gin for those occasions. Do you have any?
quest_15202.SuccessText: This is gin! Thank you so much. Will you have a drink with me some time? I hear gin mixed with this orcish drug called 'gur-horta' can be mind-expanding. When you have time to hang out, we'll try it together.

quest_15203.Description: Melandria in Gazluk Keep said, "I'm supposed to make a special dinner tomorrow to honor my master's wife's birthday. I'm getting kind of freaked out, because I can't make my famous mint cookies without mint! Do you have any? It's important!"
quest_15203.Name: Mint for Melandria
quest_15203.PrefaceText: I'm supposed to make a special dinner tomorrow to honor my master's wife's birthday. I'm getting kind of freaked out, because I can't make my famous mint cookies without mint! Do you have any? It's important!
quest_15203.SuccessText: Finally, mint! Thank you. Here, I was trying to make an alternative treat in case you couldn't find mint in time. You want it?

quest_15204.Description: Melandria in Gazluk Keep said, "Psst... I need your help! My friend Avgal -- he's another gru-maghi -- was caught trying to escape yesterday! And you know the penalty for that: they strip you naked and leave you in the mountains to freeze to death. You've probably never seen somebody die from hypothermia, but it's horrible. Not to worry, though: I have a plan. I just need some cold resistance potions! A lot of them!"
quest_15204.Name: Resisting Extreme Punishment
quest_15204.PrefaceText: Psst... I need your help! My friend Avgal -- he's another gru-maghi -- was caught trying to escape yesterday! And you know the penalty for that: they strip you naked and leave you in the mountains to freeze to death. You've probably never seen somebody die from hypothermia, but it's horrible. Not to worry, though: I have a plan. I just need some cold resistance potions! A lot of them!
quest_15204.SuccessText:
Five of them? Okay, I think that will be enough. Because I'm such a model slave, I'm allowed to go out in the mornings to pick fresh berries. I'll hide these potions for Avgal, along with some clothes and food. With some luck, he'll live. Thanks so much!

Here, take this. I was so angry about how they're treating Avgel that I stole it. I was planning to fight my way out to save him, but that would be suicide. Take it so I'm not tempted.

quest_15301.Description: Otis in Red Wing Casino said, "CLUB MAKE CRACK SOUND IN ARENA. NEED NEW CLUB! WILL MAKE. GET PERFECT WOOD. CEDAR!"
quest_15301.Name: NEW CLUB
quest_15301.PrefaceText: CLUB MAKE CRACK SOUND IN ARENA. NEED NEW CLUB! WILL MAKE. GET PERFECT WOOD. CEDAR!
quest_15301.SuccessText: MM. IS NOT PERFECT! BUT IS GOOD. WILL USE. TAKE OLD. STILL WORK!

quest_15302.Description: Otis in Red Wing Casino said, "OTIS STOMACH ACHE. OTIS NEED NEW STOMACH. YOU GET! OGRE STOMACH! NOT TROLL STOMACH! OGRE!!"
quest_15302.Name: NEW STOMACH
quest_15302.PrefaceText: OTIS STOMACH ACHE. OTIS NEED NEW STOMACH. YOU GET! OGRE STOMACH! NOT TROLL STOMACH! OGRE!!
quest_15302.SuccessText: THIS DISGUSTING! WHAT THIS!? OH. OHHH. OTIS STOMACH NOT HURT NOW... OTIS KEEP FOR LATER. HERE. TAKE GARBAGE STOMACH.

quest_15303.Description: Otis in Red Wing Casino said, "NEED STINGER OF SCORPION. NOT TELL REASON."
quest_15303.Name: NEED STINGER
quest_15303.PrefaceText: NEED STINGER OF SCORPION. NOT TELL REASON.
quest_15303.SuccessText: HEH HEH HEH HEH. WILL HIDE STINGER IN VIZLARK BED. VIZLARK ASSHOLE BUG. WILL MAKE MAD! HEH HEH HEH!

quest_15304.Description: Otis in Red Wing Casino said, "USHUG HAS SECRET. USHUG TELL OTIS IF GIVE POTION. YOU GET POTION. IS STAFF POTION FOR ARENA!"
quest_15304.Name: NEED POTION
quest_15304.PrefaceText: USHUG HAS SECRET. USHUG TELL OTIS IF GIVE POTION. YOU GET POTION. IS STAFF POTION FOR ARENA!
quest_15304.SuccessText: THIS POTION? OKAY. OTIS LEARN SECRET. THEN OTIS SMASH POTION! TEACH USHUG NO CHEATING IN ARENA!

quest_15401.Description: Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "I have been instructed to sell more 'baubles and trinkets' to appeal to drunken bipeds with lots of cash. They often ask for lucky tokens, so I wish to procure some rabbit feet. If you bring me three, I shall pay 1200 Councils for them, plus some Red Wing Tokens."
quest_15401.Name: Lucky Rabbit Feet
quest_15401.PrefaceText: I have been instructed to sell more 'baubles and trinkets' to appeal to drunken bipeds with lots of cash. They often ask for lucky tokens, so I wish to procure some rabbit feet. If you bring me three, I shall pay 1200 Councils for them, plus some Red Wing Tokens.
quest_15401.SuccessText: These rabbit appendages are much less attractive than I had anticipated. Perhaps there is a special method to preparing them? I doubt these bloody stinky objects will appeal to rich bipeds! Hmm... but in any case, here is the promised payment. Thank you.

quest_15402.Description:
Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "I need the assistance of a Red Wing named Mandibles. She will only aid me if I produce something called 'paralytic chicken meat'.

The meat of several different bird-like creatures would work, but Mandibles said the most accessible meat is in a tower in Kur. I cannot go to Kur, it is too cold. She knows this and she taunts me with knowledge I cannot use! Please aid me?"
quest_15402.Name: Paralytic Chicken Meat
quest_15402.PrefaceText:
I need the assistance of a Red Wing named Mandibles. She will only aid me if I produce something called 'paralytic chicken meat'.

The meat of several different bird-like creatures would work, but Mandibles said the most accessible meat is in a tower in Kur. I cannot go to Kur, it is too cold. She knows this and she taunts me with knowledge I cannot use! Please aid me?
quest_15402.SuccessText: This is the meat? It stinks of toxins! Mandibles feeds this to guests?! Interesting. Thank you for your kindness -- here, I have stashed some currency away for such an occasion.

quest_15403.Description: Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "It was a mistake to speak with my superior about personal matters. While conversing amicably to my boss, Qatik, I mentioned my attraction to Tavilak. Qatik became emotional and demanded that I never mate with Tavilak. I suspect Qatik wants to mate with me herself. I enjoy Qatik's company more than any other Red Wing mantis, but I am not interested in mating with her. Could you explain this to Qatik for me? Make it seem like the topic is entirely your idea."
quest_15403.MidwayText: What? Did Irkima put you up to this? Look, I don't want to mate with Irkima. I am busy wooing a Red Wing general and do not need to add further complexity to my relationships! I simply need him to pick a different mate than Tavilak. She is a good worker and a dangerous warrior, but she is not a good mate for Irkima. Tell him that I will be happy to find a nice willing mate for him... one that doesn't kill their partners!
quest_15403.Name: Letting Qatik Down Gently
quest_15403.PrefaceText: It was a mistake to speak with my superior about personal matters. While conversing amicably to my boss, Qatik, I mentioned my attraction to Tavilak. Qatik became emotional and demanded that I never mate with Tavilak. I suspect Qatik wants to mate with me herself. I enjoy Qatik's company more than any other Red Wing mantis, but I am not interested in mating with her. Could you explain this to Qatik for me? Make it seem like the topic is entirely your idea.
quest_15403.SuccessText: Oh. Qatik does not wish to mate with me? And Tavilak has eaten her mating partners in the past?! That is the piece of information I needed. Qatik's behavior now makes sense, although I still do not like it! Please, I need another favor of you...

quest_15404.Description: Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "Please speak to Tavilak about her previous mates -- the ones she killed. Why did she do it? Is this why she is unwilling to mate with me?"
quest_15404.MidwayText: Oh, Irkima. Even asking me these questions causes emotional pain. Tell him that I have indeed killed my mate before. I was unable to control my instincts. I will not make the same mistake again. Tell him to find a different mate!
quest_15404.Name: Probing Tavilak's History

Objectives.Description: Speak with Tavilak about her previous mates

quest_15404.PrefaceText: Please speak to Tavilak about her previous mates -- the ones she killed. Why did she do it? Is this why she is unwilling to mate with me?
quest_15404.SuccessText: But I do not want a different mate than Tavilak! Surely there is a resolution to this. She could simply refrain from killing me, for instance... I need to meld with Tavilak and understand her concerns. Could you cover my storefront for a few minutes while I see her? It shouldn't take too long. [New Hangout available.]

quest_15420.Description:
Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "I have a pigeon with a broken wing, and I am in need of some supplies to try and heal it. There is a special realm where Phoenixes dwell that is occupied by the Fae.
Go there and kill these creatures until you can get a good, undamaged phoenix feather. I can use the feather's regenerative abilities to help accelerate the healing process. Bring the feather back to me as soon as you can! I need it as fresh as possible."
quest_15420.Name: Broken Wings

Objectives.Description: Loot a phoenix feather from a phoenix

quest_15420.PrefaceText:
I have a pigeon with a broken wing, and I am in need of some supplies to try and heal it. There is a special realm where Phoenixes dwell that is occupied by the Fae.
Go there and kill these creatures until you can get a good, undamaged phoenix feather. I can use the feather's regenerative abilities to help accelerate the healing process. Bring the feather back to me as soon as you can! I need it as fresh as possible.
quest_15420.SuccessText: Excellent! I'll get her wing wrapped up right away to start the healing.

quest_15421.Description:
Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "I'm feeling a little foolish about this, but could I trouble you to go back where you were and get me a fresh phoenix egg? I know I should have asked you before, but I completely forgot about it. I mix the egg with the feed for sickly pigeons to aid in healing.
I have asked to speak with the Queen about your request, and will let her know of your extra effort to aid me."
quest_15421.Name: Don't Forget the Egg

Objectives.Description: Loot a phoenix egg from a phoenix

quest_15421.PrefaceText:
I'm feeling a little foolish about this, but could I trouble you to go back where you were and get me a fresh phoenix egg? I know I should have asked you before, but I completely forgot about it. I mix the egg with the feed for sickly pigeons to aid in healing.
I have asked to speak with the Queen about your request, and will let her know of your extra effort to aid me.
quest_15421.SuccessText: Thank you for your help. I'll get some feed mixed up and complete treatment. The Queen says she will consider your request. It will be a few hours before I know anything on our patient or hear from the Queen, so check back with me a little later. [You must wait at least 3 hours before continuing this conversation]

quest_15422.Description: Irkima in Red Wing Casino said, "I have given you my recipe for the bird feed we use here. Collect the ingredients and bring me 10 units of it back. You can find the recipe in the Lore category of your recipe book."
quest_15422.Name: Need for Feed

Objectives.Description: Keep 10 units of bird feed for Irkima

quest_15422.PrefaceText: I have given you my recipe for the bird feed we use here. Collect the ingredients and bring me 10 units of it back. You can find the recipe in the Lore category of your recipe book.
quest_15422.SuccessText:
Very nice job! I'm sure my birds will enjoy it. I am scheduled to see the Queen about your request in a couple hours. Check back with me in about 3 hours and I should have an answer for you.

For now, get acquainted with your new pet!

quest_15501.Description: Eveline Rastin in Red Wing Casino said, "I have run out of quartz for new jewelry. I would ask Willem, but ... it's complicated. Can you get some for me?"
quest_15501.Name: Quartz Jewelry
quest_15501.PrefaceText: I have run out of quartz for new jewelry. I would ask Willem, but ... it's complicated. Can you get some for me?
quest_15501.SuccessText: Thank you! Here, this is more valuable! But less useful in jewelry-making.

quest_15502.Description: Eveline Rastin in Red Wing Casino said, "I need a lot of cotton for a new dress I'm making. I wouldn't ask if you looked busy, but since you just seem to be standing around, maybe you could card some cotton for me? Just a little bit. Like ten cards?"
quest_15502.Name: Cotton For Dresses
quest_15502.PrefaceText: I need a lot of cotton for a new dress I'm making. I wouldn't ask if you looked busy, but since you just seem to be standing around, maybe you could card some cotton for me? Just a little bit. Like ten cards?
quest_15502.SuccessText: Oh you're good at this! No seeds at all. Thank you! Here: I made this for you and I hope you like it!

quest_15503.Description: Eveline Rastin in Red Wing Casino said, "Fairies have a kind of cloth called fae felt. There's also a drug called fae felt, so it gets kind of confusing... but I really want some of the cloth. Just to understand what it feels like, looks like, smells like. If you find some, can you bring it to me?"
quest_15503.Name: Fae Felt
quest_15503.PrefaceText: Fairies have a kind of cloth called fae felt. There's also a drug called fae felt, so it gets kind of confusing... but I really want some of the cloth. Just to understand what it feels like, looks like, smells like. If you find some, can you bring it to me?
quest_15503.SuccessText: Oh my... this is the softest material I've ever felt! I'm in love with this felt! In fact... this is the perfect ingredient for the clothing I've been designing! [New Training Recipes available.]

quest_15504.Description: Eveline Rastin in Red Wing Casino said, "Can you give this note to Willem for me? Now don't read it! Promise you won't!"
quest_15504.MidwayText: Did you read this?! It's not even in an envelope! Tell the daft girl not to let people know about us! What in Ormorek's Beard am I going to do with her?
quest_15504.Name: A Message For Willem
quest_15504.PrefaceText: Can you give this note to Willem for me? Now don't read it! Promise you won't!
quest_15504.SuccessText: That's all he said? He didn't say anything about the contents of my letter? I mean, I trust you, so why isn't that enough for him?! Hmph. Oh, here. Now... please leave me alone... I just need to be alone for a minute.

quest_15601.Description: Willem Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "I need more sulfur for my gem-cleaning solution, but for some reason sulfur is very rare around here, which makes no sense. None at all. Anyway if you find some, bring it here!"
quest_15601.Name: Sulfur Bath
quest_15601.PrefaceText: I need more sulfur for my gem-cleaning solution, but for some reason sulfur is very rare around here, which makes no sense. None at all. Anyway if you find some, bring it here!
quest_15601.SuccessText: Yep, that's sulfur. Here's some gems for the trouble.

quest_15602.Description: Willem Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "Do ya know what 'cheshire' is? It's a kinda cheese. Look, I can't explain why, but it's important that I find some. I need ta appear cultured."
quest_15602.Name: Cheese For Reasons
quest_15602.PrefaceText: Do ya know what 'cheshire' is? It's a kinda cheese. Look, I can't explain why, but it's important that I find some. I need ta appear cultured.
quest_15602.SuccessText: This is cheshire? Smells disgusting! But I bet she'll like it. Thanks!

quest_15603.Description: Willem Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "So that last cheese, the 'cheshire', turned out to be slightly too bitter, so it doesn't go well with wine. Look, I don't fuckin' know, it's all just cheese ta me. But I need a different one. A 'gloucester'. It's supposed to be better, accordin' to my cousin that runs a stall down the hall. Ya got any of that?"
quest_15603.Name: Better Cheese Needed
quest_15603.PrefaceText: So that last cheese, the 'cheshire', turned out to be slightly too bitter, so it doesn't go well with wine. Look, I don't fuckin' know, it's all just cheese ta me. But I need a different one. A 'gloucester'. It's supposed to be better, accordin' to my cousin that runs a stall down the hall. Ya got any of that?
quest_15603.SuccessText: Thanks. I swear by Ormorek's snipped beard if the daft girl hates this cheese too, I... sigh anyway here's payment for your cheese!

quest_15604.Description: Willem Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "I'm sorry to say this, but the last cheese didn't work out either. But this time I know exactly what's needed. I called in some expert help! I need a 'brunost' cheese, it's the best for the cheap wine I've been usin'. Guaranteed ta work this time. I fuckin' hope."
quest_15604.Name: Still Better Cheese
quest_15604.PrefaceText: I'm sorry to say this, but the last cheese didn't work out either. But this time I know exactly what's needed. I called in some expert help! I need a 'brunost' cheese, it's the best for the cheap wine I've been usin'. Guaranteed ta work this time. I fuckin' hope.
quest_15604.SuccessText: Ugh, this is the rankest cheese ya've brought me yet! And hopefully the last! Dwarves weren't made to eat cheese, I tell ya!

quest_15701.Description: Kib the Unkillable in Red Wing Casino said, "I learned something fascinating yesterday: there are relatively low-cost fire resistance potions on this continent. Those are quite rare in my homeland. Sadly they don't see much use here in the casino. I bought Ragabir's stock, but I have more tests to run. Can you bring me several doses?"
quest_15701.Name: Kib Wants Fire Resistance
quest_15701.PrefaceText: I learned something fascinating yesterday: there are relatively low-cost fire resistance potions on this continent. Those are quite rare in my homeland. Sadly they don't see much use here in the casino. I bought Ragabir's stock, but I have more tests to run. Can you bring me several doses?
quest_15701.SuccessText:
I graciously accept your gift of potions! Did you make these yourself? It can't be that difficult, then!

If this works out, it could be just the thing to survive the heat of the deserts back home. Not that my people need heat protection, of course, but I can sell it to less-hardy species! I bet the ranalons will pay well for it...

quest_15702.Description: Kib the Unkillable in Red Wing Casino said, "I need a favor from a goblin, and for that I need some goblin ale. A keg of it should be enough."
quest_15702.Name: Goblin Ale
quest_15702.PrefaceText: I need a favor from a goblin, and for that I need some goblin ale. A keg of it should be enough.
quest_15702.SuccessText: Thank you. I've found the beer on this continent to be vile, but we Aktaari are not fond of beer anyway, so I am trying not to judge beer-makers too harshly! I hope this is appropriate compensation.

quest_15703.Description: Kib the Unkillable in Red Wing Casino said, "My second-favorite sword needs to be repaired. I've searched the countryside near the casino and found nothing appropriate. I need metal of expert quality! I've seen armor made of amazing metal, so I know it must exist somewhere in this land..."
quest_15703.Name: Metal for Repairs
