quest_15703.PrefaceText: My second-favorite sword needs to be repaired. I've searched the countryside near the casino and found nothing appropriate. I need metal of expert quality! I've seen armor made of amazing metal, so I know it must exist somewhere in this land...
quest_15703.SuccessText: Ah, expert-quality indeed. I shall visit the boiler room after work. Dorimir keeps one of the burners hot enough to forge metal! The dwarves here are even more clever than the ones back home.

quest_15704.Description: Kib the Unkillable in Red Wing Casino said, "My friend Irkima has told me a fanciful tale! There are insects on this continent that secrete lac that is so strong that it has different properties. Irkima called it 'ultra-lac', but of course I'm certain that sages in this land have a more appropriate name for it. I must see this substance! Can you procure some?"
quest_15704.Name: Better Lac Than Lac?
quest_15704.PrefaceText: My friend Irkima has told me a fanciful tale! There are insects on this continent that secrete lac that is so strong that it has different properties. Irkima called it 'ultra-lac', but of course I'm certain that sages in this land have a more appropriate name for it. I must see this substance! Can you procure some?
quest_15704.SuccessText: This is the so-called ultra-lac? But this is just regular lac! Wait, I think we have a terminology problem. What you call 'regular lac' must be what we call 'worthless bug secretions'. Ah well. Thank you for helping me solve the mystery!

quest_15801.Description: Arianna Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "Have ya met my goat Fiddler? He's immortal! Or nearly. But immortal goats need special care! His fur is so strong normal shears can't cut it, and my last pair o' diamond shears got swiped by somebody. A goblin probably... anyway, I know what we need to make a new comb! I saw it when I was in Kur. There's an Urak near a spring in Kur that my orc guide called Fluffy. Typical orc joke, right, 'cuz Fluffy's got no fur. And it eats orcs and terrorizes the land. Anyway, I need a tooth from that big fucker. Can ya get it?"
quest_15801.Name: Fiddler's New Comb
quest_15801.PrefaceText: Have ya met my goat Fiddler? He's immortal! Or nearly. But immortal goats need special care! His fur is so strong normal shears can't cut it, and my last pair o' diamond shears got swiped by somebody. A goblin probably... anyway, I know what we need to make a new comb! I saw it when I was in Kur. There's an Urak near a spring in Kur that my orc guide called Fluffy. Typical orc joke, right, 'cuz Fluffy's got no fur. And it eats orcs and terrorizes the land. Anyway, I need a tooth from that big fucker. Can ya get it?
quest_15801.SuccessText: So ya killed Fluffy? Good! Stupid thing hit me with a rock the size of my head. I coulda died in the snow! I swore revenge, and thankfully you revenged me, plus I can make a comb outta this. A great day's work!

quest_15802.Description: Arianna Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "My goat Fiddler just loves juniper berries. They taste awful ta me but goats will be goats! They don't seem ta grow around here though. Seen any?"
quest_15802.Name: Fiddler's Favorite Snack
quest_15802.PrefaceText: My goat Fiddler just loves juniper berries. They taste awful ta me but goats will be goats! They don't seem ta grow around here though. Seen any?
quest_15802.SuccessText: Oh Fiddler will love these! Thank-you!

quest_15803.Description: Arianna Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "Fiddler over there's immortal, as in 'never grows old' immortal. Nice trick, right? But he can still die of disease! His hoofs are hundreds 'a years old and need to be cleaned. I need one more thing for my cleaning kit: yeti hair. Or any super-strong hair balls, really. Werewolf hair'd do."
quest_15803.Name: Fiddler's Hoof Scrubber
quest_15803.PrefaceText: Fiddler over there's immortal, as in 'never grows old' immortal. Nice trick, right? But he can still die of disease! His hoofs are hundreds 'a years old and need to be cleaned. I need one more thing for my cleaning kit: yeti hair. Or any super-strong hair balls, really. Werewolf hair'd do.
quest_15803.SuccessText: Oh, good. I already went at Fiddler's hooves with a metal file, but I need these hairballs to scrub the more delicate parts of the feet. I thank you, and so does Fiddler!

quest_15804.Description: Arianna Fangblade in Red Wing Casino said, "The food here's nice enough, but not what I'm used to. I've got a craving for a classic cottage pie! Do ya know where to get one around here? 'Cuz I surely don't!"
quest_15804.Name: Cottage Pie
quest_15804.PrefaceText: The food here's nice enough, but not what I'm used to. I've got a craving for a classic cottage pie! Do ya know where to get one around here? 'Cuz I surely don't!
quest_15804.SuccessText: This smells delicious! Thank you so much, dear!

quest_15901.Description: Ragabir in Red Wing Casino said, "Damn it all, I'm out of my secret ingredient! I need run-off water from stones in Kur. It's used in all my best potions! I'll pay well for it!"
quest_15901.Name: Dirty Snow Water
quest_15901.PrefaceText: Damn it all, I'm out of my secret ingredient! I need run-off water from stones in Kur. It's used in all my best potions! I'll pay well for it!
quest_15901.SuccessText: Hmm, is this pure? It doesn't smell right. You got too many impurities in it! I'm sorry, but I have to dock your pay for that. Here's what you deserve.

quest_15902.Description: Ragabir in Red Wing Casino said, "Qatik told me there's a set of secret tunnels underneath Eltibule and they're full of magical darkness! I need it! I NEED IT! Get the magical darkness for me! It shouldn't be hard to find: just look for the source of the darkness, kill it, take some darkness, done. So easy even you can do it."
quest_15902.Name: Darker Than Dark
quest_15902.PrefaceText: Qatik told me there's a set of secret tunnels underneath Eltibule and they're full of magical darkness! I need it! I NEED IT! Get the magical darkness for me! It shouldn't be hard to find: just look for the source of the darkness, kill it, take some darkness, done. So easy even you can do it.
quest_15902.SuccessText: This is all the darkness you could get?! This is only enough for a few incredibly-powerful potions! [Ragabir sighs.] If you'd brought more, I could have paid better, but here's what you're owed.

quest_15903.Description: Ragabir in Red Wing Casino said, "So much for dwarves being great miners. I need a little bit of paladium, and you'd think with all these idiot dwarves around that'd be easy. Nope. Not easy. Are you any better than a dwarf? I just need a few chunks! I'll pay well!"
quest_15903.Name: Paladium Potions
quest_15903.PrefaceText: So much for dwarves being great miners. I need a little bit of paladium, and you'd think with all these idiot dwarves around that'd be easy. Nope. Not easy. Are you any better than a dwarf? I just need a few chunks! I'll pay well!
quest_15903.SuccessText: I'm a generous goblin so I'm going to overlook the tiny size of these paladium samples and pay what we agreed on. But in the future, try to get decent-sized ore samples!

quest_15904.Description: Ragabir in Red Wing Casino said, "Okay this is a secret, but I guess I have to trust somebody here, so congrats, it's you! Now don't fuck this up! For my best potions I need oil of hatred. HATRED. Not oil of malaise, not oil of greed, not oil of disgust. Oil of hatred! Can you handle that? No, I don't know where it comes from. Back home we just bought it at the market. Around here it's harder to find, but it's gotta be somewhere..."
quest_15904.Name: Hatred Oil
quest_15904.PrefaceText: Okay this is a secret, but I guess I have to trust somebody here, so congrats, it's you! Now don't fuck this up! For my best potions I need oil of hatred. HATRED. Not oil of malaise, not oil of greed, not oil of disgust. Oil of hatred! Can you handle that? No, I don't know where it comes from. Back home we just bought it at the market. Around here it's harder to find, but it's gotta be somewhere...
quest_15904.SuccessText: You finally did something right! Wait... the top's not sealed properly. How much of my hatred oil evaporated? Look, the bottle's partially empty! Everybody knows that hatred oil is supposed to be wax-sealed. This has been tampered with! We're going to have to renegotiate your pay... here's what I think you deserve.

quest_160.Description: You repelled Grosark's invasion into our realm!
quest_160.Name: Grosark's Truish Form Thwarted
quest_160.SuccessText: You repelled Grosark's invasion into our realm!

quest_16001.Description: Sir Arif has asked for some venison.
quest_16001.Name: Deer In The Crypt
quest_16001.PrefaceText: I am so sick of Summoned Council Rations. Can you get me some fresh meat? How about ham? No! Venison!
quest_16001.SuccessText: Thanks! This is great! Here, in exchange, let me teach you some swordfighting pointers.

quest_16002.Description: Sir Arif has asked you to kill the dinosaurs that roam the crypt.
quest_16002.Name: Damned Dinosaurs
quest_16002.PrefaceText: So we accidentally summoned a portal to an area infested with dinosaurs. And now this tomb is crawling with them! I've cleared out a bunch from this area, but can you hunt down some more?
quest_16002.SuccessText: Thanks! Here, take this. It's not much, but it's a token.

quest_16003.Description: Sir Arif wants you to kill Ursula and bring her creepy stuffed bear as proof.
quest_16003.Name: Ursula's Creepy Bear
quest_16003.PrefaceText:
Lady Rasheen was a fellow engineer with a whole lot more experience fixing portals. I wish she was here now, but she was killed by her own curiosity. She opened the tomb nearby and a skeleton climbed into her mind. Said the only way to cure it was to kill the skeleton, but we weren't strong enough. She died blubbering in the corner about how children were throwing fire at her. Very sad.

Anyway! Can you go kill that thing? She has a plush toy - bring it to me as evidence.
quest_16003.SuccessText: That's it! I guess that's the last we'll see of her! Hah, who am I kidding, this is an emotion resonance chamber down here, the undead are just rising back up out of the ground continuously. Unless we can get a squad of Placid Seers down here to wipe everything out, I give her a month, two tops before she's right back at it. So you pretty much wasted your time. But I appreciate the effort! Here's something for your trouble.

quest_161.Description: You repelled the spontaneous ranalon invasion of Statehlm!
quest_161.Name: Dreadfin Absolum Defeated
quest_161.SuccessText: You repelled the spontaneous ranalon invasion of Statehlm!

quest_16101.Description: A monstrosity named Yalox asked you for a really good bandage.
quest_16101.Name: Bandage The Soul

Objectives.Description: Obtain an Expert's First Aid Kit

quest_16101.PrefaceText: Dalvos gave us healing! The power to heal! But magical healing cannot stop the pain! I need mundane healing! Bring it to me!
quest_16101.SuccessText: Yes. Yalox eats the bandage. It does nothing! NOTHING!

quest_16102.Description: A monstrosity named Yalox asked you to just kill some goblins as some sort of pointless revenge.
quest_16102.Name: Goblin Genocide
quest_16102.PrefaceText: We were sent here by Dalvos to find ancient Dwarf treasure. There are no Dwarves! Only goblins! And they enslave us with promises of healing. They lie! Kill them! Vindicate us!
quest_16102.SuccessText: Ha ha ha ha! Now the pain... is still here! It's not gone! No! Noooo!

quest_16201.Description: A rakshasa named Zealo asked you to collect mana sponges that she placed in jars all through the area.
quest_16201.Name: Mana Sponges
quest_16201.PrefaceText: Can you go collect my mana sponges? They're in jars all through the area. If you bring me six, you can keep any others you find. And I'll teach you a recipe that uses them.
quest_16201.SuccessText: Thanks. Let me teach you a recipe that uses these!

quest_16202.Description: A rakshasa named Zealo asked you to collect toxic sludge for her potions.
quest_16202.Name: Sludge!
quest_16202.PrefaceText: The mantises have been augmenting the oozes in here, making them more dangerous. Morons! But there's a silver lining: their mucus is very useful for potions. If you happen to kill some oozes, can you look for their sludge?
quest_16202.SuccessText: Ugh. This stuff is gross. Thanks, though. I use it for everything from potions to food seasoning. Hm? Oh, a reward? Uh... here. This is... valuable, maybe?

quest_16203.Description: Nishika in Rahu asked you to obtain a large amount of meat from grimalkins in the desert.
quest_16203.Name: Nishika's Meat Request
quest_16203.PrefaceText: My specialty is cat-meat recipes. A lot of visitors expect the meat to be disgusting, but with the right seasoning, it's quite good! And plentiful, too ... or at least it usually is. Right now I seem to be running low. If you have nothing better to do, maybe you could hunt and butcher up some grimalkin meat for me?
quest_16203.SuccessText: That stench can only mean one thing: you've got my cat meat! Thanks! Hey, as a thank-you, I'd be willing to teach you how I make my famous Orange Cat recipe. [ Recipe 'Orange Cat' added to Nishika's Training menu. ]

quest_16204.Description: Nishika in Rahu asked you to obtain several decent chairs.
quest_16204.Name: Furnishing Nishika's Restaurant
quest_16204.PrefaceText: A bunch of idiots got into another fight here yesterday. I think they all lived, but not all of my furniture did. I've cleaned up all the mess and replaced what I could, but we're still low on chairs. You wouldn't happen to be a carpenter, would you?
quest_16204.SuccessText: Thank you! You're too kind. Would you like some of my famous travel rations? Here!

quest_16205.Description: Nishika in Rahu asked you to obtain grapefish. It's an ingredient in her "famous" travel snacks.
quest_16205.Name: Grapefish for Snacks
quest_16205.PrefaceText: I'll let you in on a secret. My famous travel snacks are only mostly cat meat. They've also got fish in them -- grapefish, to be exact. But don't tell anyone! Grapefish isn't common around here so I have to import it, and some customers might get upset about me not using local ingredients. But you and I are above that sort of thing, right? I'll pay you well if you can get me some! Filet them before you bring them in here, though. Fillets draw less attention than whole fish.
quest_16205.SuccessText: You have my fish? Perfect! Now remember, tell nobody. But, since you already know, I guess I can teach you the recipe, if you'd like. [ Recipe 'Nishika's Travel Snack' unlocked in the Training menu. ]

quest_16206.Description: Nishika in Rahu asked you to obtain oregano. She doesn't know where it comes from, but it's not from the desert.
quest_16206.Name: Spice For The General's Dish
quest_16206.PrefaceText: I need your help! Rumor is that General Pask may be coming for dinner soon! That's pretty terrifying, but his endorsement would really help my restaurant. I want to impress him with my masterpiece dish, but I need an exotic spice and I can't find it in the market! It's called 'oregano'. I don't know where it comes from, but it's definitely not from around here. Can you get me some?
quest_16206.SuccessText:
That's it! Oregano! I'm saved! Thank you. Here, let me pay you for your time.

And, hey, if you wanted to help me make the meal, come hang out with me some time soon.

quest_16301.Description: A goblin in the Rahu Sewers said that you would be allowed entrance to the goblins' sanctuary if you retrieve a lost notebook. He said it was in the "ratkin nesting warrens", and not too far from their hideout.
quest_16301.Name: Bogaku's Lost Notebook

quest_16401.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "The ratkin are farming fish in here... freshwater fish! That's not unusual further inland, but this close to the sea, it seems odd, doesn't it? Maybe these fish are atypical somehow. Oh, you don't understand biology anyway... look, just get me a bunch of these fish, okay?"
quest_16401.Name: Sewer Chicken
quest_16401.PrefaceText: The ratkin are farming fish in here... freshwater fish! That's not unusual further inland, but this close to the sea, it seems odd, doesn't it? Maybe these fish are atypical somehow. Oh, you don't understand biology anyway... look, just get me a bunch of these fish, okay?
quest_16401.SuccessText: These are all cave tilapia? Hmm... it's such a bland, generic meat that I can't even tell where it came from! if I had more equipment here I could tell if these fish were atypical, but they just look like regular cave tilapia to me. I guess I know what I'm making for dinner tonight, though! Here, have some shinies!

quest_16402.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "Ratkin often farm snails for meat and shells, but the ones down here are huge! They must be mutants! Go stab some to death and see if they explode into glowing goo."
quest_16402.Name: Ratkin Snails
quest_16402.PrefaceText: Ratkin often farm snails for meat and shells, but the ones down here are huge! They must be mutants! Go stab some to death and see if they explode into glowing goo.
quest_16402.SuccessText: So NONE of the snails exploded into glowing goo? Are you sure you did it right? Hmm... maybe they're undead snails! No, not even the ratkin would eat undead meat... well, I have no idea why the snails are so big. But I suppose that's only partially your fault, so here is your shiny reward.

quest_16403.Description:
Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "The ratkin seem to be growing an orchard of sentient trees down here! That is FASCINATING! Right? But how old are these trees? Go and chop down some of these trees and see how many rings they have.

Wait, trees can be over a hundred years old. Can you count all the way to 100, monster? Well, try your best! Hurry, now."
quest_16403.Name: Underground Trees
quest_16403.PrefaceText:
The ratkin seem to be growing an orchard of sentient trees down here! That is FASCINATING! Right? But how old are these trees? Go and chop down some of these trees and see how many rings they have.

Wait, trees can be over a hundred years old. Can you count all the way to 100, monster? Well, try your best! Hurry, now.
quest_16403.SuccessText:
So none of the trees were planted in the past decade? But the ratkin have only been here for a few years! Which means... the ratkin didn't plant those tree monsters!

Wait, I've got it! They're mutated trees... which means they used to be regular trees. You see, there used to be nice normal trees in Ilmari, but when it turned into a desert, these trees must have mutated, and then they climbed down here to escape the blistering sun. It all makes sense now. Good job! For that, you get a shiny!

quest_16404.Description:
Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "Ratkin love to gamble, of course, but each region's ratkin have different methods. The ones around here seem to enjoy dice games. I need samples of their dice!

I suppose any ratkin could be carrying some dice, but off-duty ratkin are most likely to have 'em."
quest_16404.Name: Ratkin Gaming Habits
quest_16404.PrefaceText:
Ratkin love to gamble, of course, but each region's ratkin have different methods. The ones around here seem to enjoy dice games. I need samples of their dice!

I suppose any ratkin could be carrying some dice, but off-duty ratkin are most likely to have 'em.
quest_16404.SuccessText: These are the dice? Oh well. This is pretty typical ratkin garbage. But I'll keep them... I have some new game ideas I wanted to prototype! Here's a shiny for your trouble.

quest_16405.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "I wonder where these ratkin are getting their appetizers. Can you get some for me so I can check them?"
quest_16405.Name: Ratkin Appetizers
quest_16405.PrefaceText: I wonder where these ratkin are getting their appetizers. Can you get some for me so I can check them?
quest_16405.SuccessText:
Oh, finally! The appetizers!

Well, the stench is pretty typical. But see how thick it is? That means it's not very fresh. These ratkin aren't making their own aparatifs... which means they must be trading with other ratkin... which means there's a tunnel-caravan that passes by here!

That explains how they're staying well-stocked. Now, if I knew exactly which caravan route we were on, maybe I could isolate cultural variations from that! Oh, sorry to keep you wating. Here's your shiny.

quest_16406.Description:
Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "The ratkin around here rely heavily on necromancy to help them mine faster. And I noticed the necromancers often have giant white rats with them. They don't look like good tunneling rats... I wonder what they're for?

No, stop talking. I don't care about a monster's opinions... make yourself useful and go murder some rats. See if they're living or undead. Remember, undead ones don't bleed much!"
quest_16406.Name: Necro-Rats!
quest_16406.PrefaceText:
The ratkin around here rely heavily on necromancy to help them mine faster. And I noticed the necromancers often have giant white rats with them. They don't look like good tunneling rats... I wonder what they're for?

No, stop talking. I don't care about a monster's opinions... make yourself useful and go murder some rats. See if they're living or undead. Remember, undead ones don't bleed much!
quest_16406.SuccessText: The white rats aren't undead? You're sure? Then they must be using them as necromantic Familiars! I've never heard of that happening before! This demands further study... but not right now. I need to think first. Here's your trinket.

quest_16407.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "Rattus root is a favorite snack of these barbaric vermin. I'm sure to a mutant like you it just looks like a root, right? But to a gobthropologist, it's like an open book! A book of secrets! So go get me my secret books! I mean rattus roots!"
quest_16407.Name: Rattus Root, The Book Of Knowledge
quest_16407.PrefaceText: Rattus root is a favorite snack of these barbaric vermin. I'm sure to a mutant like you it just looks like a root, right? But to a gobthropologist, it's like an open book! A book of secrets! So go get me my secret books! I mean rattus roots!
quest_16407.SuccessText:
Ugh. These aren't fresh at all! Which means they aren't growing crops down here after all, these must be bartered from caravans. Unfortunately I can't learn much from roots that are this old!

Hm, how do I explain the problem to a monster like you? They're like books of knowledge, but the books have gotten wet, and ... wait, do you know what a book is? Oh, nevermind! You did fine, here's your shiny.

quest_16408.Description:
Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "These ratkin are unusually good at necromancy. I wonder exactly how powerful they are? Hmm...

Oh, hi there mutant, I have a small test for you. Go and get yourself shot by some ratkin necromancers. Try not to die, though! I need to ask you some questions after, and I can't speak with the dead! Because I'm not a necromancer!"
quest_16408.Name: Necromancy Target Practice
quest_16408.PrefaceText:
These ratkin are unusually good at necromancy. I wonder exactly how powerful they are? Hmm...

Oh, hi there mutant, I have a small test for you. Go and get yourself shot by some ratkin necromancers. Try not to die, though! I need to ask you some questions after, and I can't speak with the dead! Because I'm not a necromancer!
quest_16408.SuccessText:
So I see you didn't die from the necromancy blasts. I guess that means they aren't TOO dangerous! How painful would you consider their blasts, on a scale of zero to 60?

Hmm. I see. Well that experience may be a fluke. I have some more tests in mind... and here is your reward! Good monster!

quest_16409.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "Even if these ratkin aren't growing crops here, they're surely making their own cheese! I need a sample of their aged cheese... perhaps it will tell us secrets. Now, when I say that, I don't mean cheese can talk. So don't be afraid. Just get the cheese."
quest_16409.Name: Cheese Testing
quest_16409.PrefaceText: Even if these ratkin aren't growing crops here, they're surely making their own cheese! I need a sample of their aged cheese... perhaps it will tell us secrets. Now, when I say that, I don't mean cheese can talk. So don't be afraid. Just get the cheese.
quest_16409.SuccessText: This cheese has been aged locally. Perfect! I'm packing this up to take back home with me. I didn't bring my cheese-ometer with me, I'm sorry to say. Good job! Here is your reward!

quest_16410.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "I had a thought: how relaxed are these ratkin? Sneak into their home areas and kick them! Now, I only need to know about the off-duty ones: do they fight, or flee, or something else? Of course, you can kick whoever you want! But for this test, it has to be the off-duty ones."
quest_16410.Name: Punt Some Loungers
quest_16410.PrefaceText: I had a thought: how relaxed are these ratkin? Sneak into their home areas and kick them! Now, I only need to know about the off-duty ones: do they fight, or flee, or something else? Of course, you can kick whoever you want! But for this test, it has to be the off-duty ones.
quest_16410.SuccessText: So they fought back? Well, damn. That was definitely the likely outcome, but I try to be optimistic! I'll write that down in my notebooks. Thank you.

quest_16411.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "I just don't understand how the necromancers convince their skeletons to mine! I'm not a necromancer myself, but I thought it was difficult to get them to do anything besides attack. Maybe there's a secret in the bones. Kill some and see if there's anything special about them."
quest_16411.Name: Some Miner Tests
quest_16411.PrefaceText: I just don't understand how the necromancers convince their skeletons to mine! I'm not a necromancer myself, but I thought it was difficult to get them to do anything besides attack. Maybe there's a secret in the bones. Kill some and see if there's anything special about them.
quest_16411.SuccessText: They just looked like bones, you say? Did you hit enough of them? Nothing special? Hm. Fascinating. By which I mean not fascinating. Maybe there's a better test...

quest_16412.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "You said the skeleton miners were just like regular skeletons, right? But what about the NON-skeleton miners? Hmm? You didn't take notes on those, did you? Well go back and see if the living miners are weird in any way. Remember to search their guts for clues!"
quest_16412.Name: More Miner Tests
quest_16412.PrefaceText: You said the skeleton miners were just like regular skeletons, right? But what about the NON-skeleton miners? Hmm? You didn't take notes on those, did you? Well go back and see if the living miners are weird in any way. Remember to search their guts for clues!
quest_16412.SuccessText: Nothing? No clues at all? They were just regular ratkin?! I know you aren't lying, but I really feel like you aren't giving me your best effort. [Bogaku sighs.] No, it's not your fault. It's mine, for expecting too much. Here is your shiny.

quest_16413.Description: Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "Have you found that these ratkin are superstitious? Most are! They even carry good-luck charms, the pathetic things. Hmm, go and find me some of their charms."
quest_16413.Name: Lucky Teeth
quest_16413.PrefaceText: Have you found that these ratkin are superstitious? Most are! They even carry good-luck charms, the pathetic things. Hmm, go and find me some of their charms.
quest_16413.SuccessText: Now see, this is sort of interesting: the good-luck charms you brought me are from humans. Where the heck are they getting exotic teeth from?! I bet these are actually magical, and used in some sort of shamanic activity... hmm... well, I'll get to the bottom of this! Here is your reward.

quest_16414.Description:
Bogaku in the Rahu Sewers said, "I had a thought about the tree-mutants down here. Have you tried pruning them? You have? But they just wilt away? Hmmm.

Well, there must be some way to save part of the tree. Try chopping them up after you kill them and see what you can find."
quest_16414.Name: If Trees Could Talk
quest_16414.PrefaceText:
I had a thought about the tree-mutants down here. Have you tried pruning them? You have? But they just wilt away? Hmmm.

Well, there must be some way to save part of the tree. Try chopping them up after you kill them and see what you can find.
quest_16414.SuccessText:
Oh you're right, these leaves do seem to be... wait... wait. These are fucking TREANT LEAVES! What have you done?! Get these away from me, you idiot! Druids kill people who steal these!

... Actually, nevermind, I'll keep them. I've always wanted to runs some experiments on these, and there don't seem to be too many avenging druids down here! Haha!

So those trees are treants, not mutants. Well, they're VERY small for treants... so they're probably mutated treants! Whew. I thought for a moment there that I'd made a miscalculation. But all is well. Here is your shiny!

quest_16501.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "Strike their means of production! Kill the ratkin fishermen! They will surely starve!"
quest_16501.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin Fishtenders
quest_16501.PrefaceText: Strike their means of production! Kill the ratkin fishermen! They will surely starve!
quest_16501.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Good.

quest_16502.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "The enemy lounges and relaxes as if they were not at war! Fix it! By murdering every lazy ratkin you see!"
quest_16502.Name: Goblin Avenger: Off-Duty Ratkin Miners
quest_16502.PrefaceText: The enemy lounges and relaxes as if they were not at war! Fix it! By murdering every lazy ratkin you see!
quest_16502.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Nice.

quest_16503.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "Go to the caves and destroy the living ratkin miners. With only undead miners left, their necromancers will be overwhelmed, and we can strike!"
quest_16503.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin Miners
quest_16503.PrefaceText: Go to the caves and destroy the living ratkin miners. With only undead miners left, their necromancers will be overwhelmed, and we can strike!
quest_16503.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Decent.

quest_16504.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "The weak point in the enemy's production is the Ratkin Necro-Shamans who control undead miners. With those shamans dead, the undead will revolt! Maybe."
quest_16504.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin Necro-Shamans
quest_16504.PrefaceText: The weak point in the enemy's production is the Ratkin Necro-Shamans who control undead miners. With those shamans dead, the undead will revolt! Maybe.
quest_16504.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Fine.

quest_16505.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "Nevermind subtlety. We want them to stop mining, so just destroy their undead miners!"
quest_16505.Name: Goblin Avenger: Undying Ratkin Miners
quest_16505.PrefaceText: Nevermind subtlety. We want them to stop mining, so just destroy their undead miners!
quest_16505.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Sufficient.

quest_16506.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "Those creepy red-eyed rats must be a source of their power. Destroy them! No mercy!"
quest_16506.Name: Goblin Avenger: Necro Rats
quest_16506.PrefaceText: Those creepy red-eyed rats must be a source of their power. Destroy them! No mercy!
quest_16506.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Adequate.

quest_16507.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "The ratkin seem all too comfortable... probably because of those soldiers who wander around protecting them. Kill the soldiers, and surely their morale will falter!"
quest_16507.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin Soldiers
quest_16507.PrefaceText: The ratkin seem all too comfortable... probably because of those soldiers who wander around protecting them. Kill the soldiers, and surely their morale will falter!
quest_16507.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Impeccable.

quest_16508.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "There are way too many snakes in this place. I bet they have some nefarious purpose. Let's outsmart the ratkin by killing these snakes before their secret scheme comes to fruition!"
quest_16508.Name: Goblin Avenger: Vipers
quest_16508.PrefaceText: There are way too many snakes in this place. I bet they have some nefarious purpose. Let's outsmart the ratkin by killing these snakes before their secret scheme comes to fruition!
quest_16508.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Pleasant.

quest_16509.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "These ratkin are gorging themselves on snail meat! Unacceptable! Desnailitize them immediately!"
quest_16509.Name: Goblin Avenger: Meat Snails
quest_16509.PrefaceText: These ratkin are gorging themselves on snail meat! Unacceptable! Desnailitize them immediately!
quest_16509.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Reasonable.

quest_16510.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "I don't understand why those trees are down here. And I hate that! The ratkin stay away from there, as if they know some secret. I hate that, too! Kill the trees!"
quest_16510.Name: Goblin Avenger: Treants
quest_16510.PrefaceText: I don't understand why those trees are down here. And I hate that! The ratkin stay away from there, as if they know some secret. I hate that, too! Kill the trees!
quest_16510.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Fine.

quest_16511.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "The skeletal ratkin mages with electricity powers... those are very annoying! Kill them!"
quest_16511.Name: Goblin Avenger: Undying Ratkin Blasters
quest_16511.PrefaceText: The skeletal ratkin mages with electricity powers... those are very annoying! Kill them!
quest_16511.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Better.

quest_16512.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "We've lost the element of surprise! Time to reclaim that surprise by killing their necromancers when they're resting. Fools! Hahahaha!"
quest_16512.Name: Goblin Avenger: Off-Duty Ratkin Shamans
quest_16512.PrefaceText: We've lost the element of surprise! Time to reclaim that surprise by killing their necromancers when they're resting. Fools! Hahahaha!
quest_16512.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Capital.

quest_16513.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "I thought goblinkind eradicated the wily cave hippo years ago, but they've been hiding here! No doubt the ratkin are breeding them in a scheme to flood our waterways. Destroy the wily water-beasts before they fill our waterways and rob good, kind-hearted goblins of crucial custom!"
quest_16513.Name: Goblin Avenger: Accursed Hippos
quest_16513.PrefaceText: I thought goblinkind eradicated the wily cave hippo years ago, but they've been hiding here! No doubt the ratkin are breeding them in a scheme to flood our waterways. Destroy the wily water-beasts before they fill our waterways and rob good, kind-hearted goblins of crucial custom!
quest_16513.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Unexpected.

quest_16514.Description: Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "The ratkin just keep... surviving! How is it possible?! Perhaps we need to broaden our approach. The sewer rat may seem harmless... but it's wily and dangerous and probably somehow the secret crux of our problem!"
quest_16514.Name: Goblin Avenger: Sewer Rats
quest_16514.PrefaceText: The ratkin just keep... surviving! How is it possible?! Perhaps we need to broaden our approach. The sewer rat may seem harmless... but it's wily and dangerous and probably somehow the secret crux of our problem!
quest_16514.SuccessText: You struck a blow for goblinkind. Bonafide.

quest_16515.Description:
Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "Blast it all, how can you have killed hundreds of the enemy, and yet the path home is still full of the creeps?!

I bet that they're at their breaking point. Just go and kill another hundred of 'em. Doesn't matter what kind: living or dead, just kill ratkin!"
quest_16515.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin!
quest_16515.PrefaceText:
Blast it all, how can you have killed hundreds of the enemy, and yet the path home is still full of the creeps?!

I bet that they're at their breaking point. Just go and kill another hundred of 'em. Doesn't matter what kind: living or dead, just kill ratkin!
quest_16515.SuccessText:
You... killed a hundred ratkin?!

Hey, Grommewik, is it safe to go home? ... There are HOW many ratkin in the hallway? ARGH! How can they breed this fast?!

quest_16516.Description:
Glortok in the Rahu Sewers said, "I give up. I'm out of ideas.

Well we can't have you just staying around here, can we? You should go kill a thousand more ratkin. Just keep killing until you die. Or until a thousand ratkin are dead! It's a win-win! For me, I mean.

What? Of course I'll make it worthwhile, buddy: if you kill a thousand ratkin I'll give you 10 pieces of xedrite. Totally worth your time, right?"
quest_16516.Name: Goblin Avenger: Ratkin!!!
quest_16516.PrefaceText:
I give up. I'm out of ideas.

Well we can't have you just staying around here, can we? You should go kill a thousand more ratkin. Just keep killing until you die. Or until a thousand ratkin are dead! It's a win-win! For me, I mean.

What? Of course I'll make it worthwhile, buddy: if you kill a thousand ratkin I'll give you 10 pieces of xedrite. Totally worth your time, right?
quest_16516.SuccessText:
You actually killed a thousand ratkin?!

HAHAHAHAHAHAhahahaha what? You're like a god among mortals... and you've killed a thousand of our enemy just because I asked you to? HAHAHAHAHAHAHhahaha hahaha haha...

Hahahahahahaha! Hahaha! HAHAHA! You crazy idiot! Here's your xedrite! HAHAHA! Oh man. You're definitely the kind of idiot that goblin chiefs love to have around! Hell, I'm gonna throw in an extra xedrite for a job well done! Hahahahaha!

quest_16551.Description: Mirraverre has asked you to weaken Gulagra's hold on this dream by indiscriminately killing the dream monsters.
quest_16551.Name: Weakening the Dreamscape
quest_16551.SuccessText: Hm. I expected your efforts to have more impact. No matter, we shall simply work harder! Let me aid you: while you're in this dream realm, your legs aren't necessarily controlled by physics. Use this technique carefully lest you fling yourself into terrible monsters!

quest_16552.Description: Mirraverre has asked you to find three pieces of a nightmare hidden in the ghost town to the north.
quest_16552.Name: Awakening the Nightmare
quest_16552.SuccessText:
These are his fear? Let us see. Yes, this will work, for the dreamer's nightmare is our salvation: he fears Gulagra!

It is done. As anticlimactic as that! Gulagra has been repelled. But I shall not end this dream. No, that would be too kind. The mortal who dared to dream it shall never awaken; this will stay in this nightmare until his body perishes.

You have my gratitude! If you need to leave now, please go with my blessing. If you had a bit more time, there's one remaining clean up task to see to...

quest_16553.Description: Mirraverre has asked you to find and destroy ten "anxiety propagators" hidden throughout the dream realm.
quest_16553.Name: The Anxiety Propagators
quest_16553.PrefaceText:
Thank you again for repelling gulagra's scion. Mortals will sleep safely for another night!

If you have time to help me further, there is something of an annoying clerical problem to deal with: the scion dreamt up a series of ten "anxiety propagators", devices dreamt up by Gulagra. They are causing distress to dreamers. They should dissipate in a few hundred years, so this isn't too critical of a problem, but it would help mortals dream well if they were destroyed. Now that the dreamer is thwarted you should simply be able to touch them to destroy them. If you find all ten, I shall be very grateful. But you will need help: some are guarded by ferocious beasts!

quest_17.Description: Use Blanche's awl to chip the giant crystal near a lake somewhere around Serbule. You aren't sure what will happen when you do this. You've been told to be careful.
quest_17.Name: Get Crystal Samples

quest_17001.Description: Therese has asked for bone meal. She thinks it's most easily obtained in the crypt at the back of the small graveyard beneath Serbule.
quest_17001.Name: Bone Meal
quest_17001.PrefaceText:
Hmm, running low on bone meal! Can you get me some more? The easiest way to get it is to rob tombs. Oh, it's okay, they aren't using it!

Try the crypt at the back of the graveyard outside of town. It'll be pretty far in, since dumb old Marna already excavated all the easily-reached bone meal.
quest_17001.SuccessText:
Perfect! Thanks! You're good at this fetching stuff!

Let me show you a couple little gardening tips.

quest_17002.Description: Therese has asked for some hash browns.
quest_17002.Name: Therese Wants Hash Browns
quest_17002.PrefaceText:
You know what I could go for? Some venison hash browns! But it's a secret family recipe. I guess regular old hash browns would do, too.

If you happen to be cooking, could you fry me up some Hash Browns? Don't go to any trouble on my account, though.
quest_17002.SuccessText:
Mmm, smells delicious! Thanks!

Let me show you a couple little gardening tips.

quest_17003.Description: Therese has asked for some dinosaur scales. She thinks there are dinosaurs living deep in the crypt beneath Serbule.
quest_17003.Name: Dinosaur Scales For Therese
quest_17003.PrefaceText:
I've been working on a new fertilizer using some dinosaur scales I had delivered from Statehelm. It's not working yet, but I think I'm getting closer! But I need more scales.

Say, I heard someone say there were dinosaurs in the crypt! You know, the crypt at the back of the graveyard? I only ever saw horrible spiders, but I didn't go in very far. Could you look?
quest_17003.SuccessText: Perfect! Scaly! I'm going to turn them into powder and try to grow things with them. Wish me luck! Oh, here, let me show you a handy gardening trick.

quest_171.Description: Thinking about it, you're pretty sure you could master drawing a bone symbol if you had about a thousand bones on hand to study.
quest_171.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Bone"
quest_171.PrefaceText: Thinking about it, you're pretty sure you could master drawing a bone symbol if you had about a thousand bones on hand to study.
quest_171.SuccessText: You carried a lot of bones and mastered the Bone symbol.

quest_17101.Description: Midge in the Fae Realm said, "Look, I don't need random help from random mortals! I used to be an expert alchemist, and I know there was a method to inhibit memory. If I could remember how to make memory-inhibitors, maybe I could find a reversal effect... anyway, if you happen to have a memory-inhibitor potion, that'd be great. Otherwise, you can help best by bringing me the ingredients I need! I'll barter for royal jelly."
quest_17101.Name: Bad Memory Potion
quest_17101.PrefaceText: Look, I don't need random help from random mortals! I used to be an expert alchemist, and I know there was a method to inhibit memory. If I could remember how to make memory-inhibitors, maybe I could find a reversal effect... anyway, if you happen to have a memory-inhibitor potion, that'd be great. Otherwise, you can help best by bringing me the ingredients I need! I'll barter for royal jelly.
quest_17101.SuccessText: What's this? This fixes memory problems? No, this is a memory inhibitor! Why would you give me this?! Wait.. wait, I asked you for this, didn't I? Because I can study it! Hmm. Okay! Okay! I have to take some notes, but thanks! Thank you. This is great! Here: this doesn't work.

quest_17102.Description: Midge in the Fae Realm said, "Look, I don't need random help from random mortals! Somebody brought me this potion of memory inhibition, and I've been studying it. I think I can invert the effect. Well, I can invert something: memories, emotions, internal organs, something. And something is better than nothing. I wrote down the things that I need, but hmm, they'll have to come from a mortal world. Wait, you're a mortal! Here. Get this stuff! Hurry! Go!"
quest_17102.Name: Bad Memory Fixer
quest_17102.PrefaceText: Look, I don't need random help from random mortals! Somebody brought me this potion of memory inhibition, and I've been studying it. I think I can invert the effect. Well, I can invert something: memories, emotions, internal organs, something. And something is better than nothing. I wrote down the things that I need, but hmm, they'll have to come from a mortal world. Wait, you're a mortal! Here. Get this stuff! Hurry! Go!
quest_17102.SuccessText: What's all this? You think this can help fix memory problems? Oh, hmm. You know, I think you're right! This might work! There's some missing ingredients, but I think I have those. You're a genius, thank you! I have to mix this up right now before I forget. [Midge works horriedly, then takes a deep breath and drinks her concoction.] Oh, you're still here? That's nice. ... hmm. I think I may have helped my brain just now. I'll be able to tell in a bit. Hey, you're an alchemist too, right? Here, let me show you a related formula that I devised this earlier. It's not quite what I was looking for. In fact, it's a LOT of work for a short-term boost... maybe it'll help somebody somewhere, though!

quest_17103.Description: Midge in the Fae Realm said, "If I can make a potion to fix my mind, it might fix yours too! Can you bring me some ingredients I'm missing?"
quest_17103.Name: Pile of Parasols
quest_17103.PrefaceText: If I can make a potion to fix my mind, it might fix yours too! Can you bring me some ingredients I'm missing?
quest_17103.SuccessText: This is a good start! We're on our way to... Umm. What are we doing?

quest_17104.Description: Midge in the Fae Realm said, "If I can make a potion to fix my mind, it might fix yours too! Can you grind up some mushroom flakes for me?"
quest_17104.Name: Pile of Parasol Flakes
quest_17104.PrefaceText: If I can make a potion to fix my mind, it might fix yours too! Can you grind up some mushroom flakes for me?
quest_17104.SuccessText: Thank you! This is exactly what I needed. Not sure what I needed it for, but I'll remember eventually. I hope.

quest_17105.Description: Midge in the Fae Realm said, "Maybe it's for the best that we can't remember anything. Maybe we don't want to remember. But it's not fair that I can't make new memories! It's not my fault I died over and over! Not this time! [Midge sighs.] There's a mortal drink I like. It tastes awful, but it does help me relax a little. I think it's called a Perker Up? Peaky Cup? Pick Me up? Something like that."
quest_17105.Name: Maybe For the Best
quest_17105.PrefaceText: Maybe it's for the best that we can't remember anything. Maybe we don't want to remember. But it's not fair that I can't make new memories! It's not my fault I died over and over! Not this time! [Midge sighs.] There's a mortal drink I like. It tastes awful, but it does help me relax a little. I think it's called a Perker Up? Peaky Cup? Pick Me up? Something like that.
quest_17105.SuccessText: Thank you. [Midge sips the drink and smiles. ] I feel so much better.

quest_172.Description: The Wizard Hat symbol Is highly-regarded, for only true wizards can master its delicate details. You vow to achieve this!
quest_172.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Wizard Hat"
quest_172.PrefaceText: The Wizard Hat symbol Is highly-regarded, for only true wizards can master its delicate details. You vow to achieve this!
quest_172.SuccessText: You became a wizard just to be able to use the Wizard Hat symbol!

quest_17201.Description:
Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "When night happens, vicious Blinding Wasps come out. Sends the bees into hiding. Bees prefer sunlight anyway, but if there weren't so many wasps, I think they'd spend another hour or so working each day.

So anyway, I need you to kill wasps, and you can take your pick of reasons: for safety, or just to help me make more honey."
quest_17201.Name: Blinding Wasp Removal
quest_17201.PrefaceText:
When night happens, vicious Blinding Wasps come out. Sends the bees into hiding. Bees prefer sunlight anyway, but if there weren't so many wasps, I think they'd spend another hour or so working each day.

So anyway, I need you to kill wasps, and you can take your pick of reasons: for safety, or just to help me make more honey.
quest_17201.SuccessText:
Good riddance, I say. I have a theory about those Doom Wasps south of here: I think they're the offspring of a wasp and a bee! Raina says that's impossible, the queen bee would just get killed by the wasps, not lay their eggs. But maybe it goes the other way! Hmm? Bees cozying up to a wasp queen? Interesting theory, right?

Anyway, just another reason to make sure wasps are kept far from here.

quest_17202.Description: Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "This land is just infested with spriggan weeds! I think the pixies plant them or something. They spend the days gathering sun, but at night they hunt for meat! There's a bunch growing south of town, and if you think about it, it'd be really irresponsible for you to NOT kill those pests."
quest_17202.Name: Dangerous Weeds
quest_17202.PrefaceText: This land is just infested with spriggan weeds! I think the pixies plant them or something. They spend the days gathering sun, but at night they hunt for meat! There's a bunch growing south of town, and if you think about it, it'd be really irresponsible for you to NOT kill those pests.
quest_17202.SuccessText:
Now did you pull them up by their roots? If you don't pull up all the roots, the spriggan weed will just grow back! And you didn't let the root bulbs crack, did you? Oh no! That lets their tiny spores escape in the wind!

Well... maybe you should let a professional handle the weeding duties in the future, but you showed willing, and I like that.

quest_17203.Description: Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "We've managed to get the bears out of the western bee fields, but south and east of here, they're a real problem! They're especially dense during the day when they hunt for honey. Yes, they eat my damned crop! Why can't they be more like the panthers?! Anyway, you just gotta stop 'em. They're a menace!"
quest_17203.Name: Honey-Loving Bears

Objectives.Description: Kill Bears in the Fae Realm

quest_17203.PrefaceText: We've managed to get the bears out of the western bee fields, but south and east of here, they're a real problem! They're especially dense during the day when they hunt for honey. Yes, they eat my damned crop! Why can't they be more like the panthers?! Anyway, you just gotta stop 'em. They're a menace!
quest_17203.SuccessText: Did you get all the bears? Eight of 'em? Well... that sounds like all of 'em, maybe? I never really counted. So... good work.

quest_17204.Description:
Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "You can do amazing things with the goo of a ripe fairy puff. Usually they explode too violently to be useful, but if you pop one that's perfectly ripe, you won't be hurt! Instead, you'll get coated in their goo.

Go get yourself coated, then come see me. I'll use that goo for hive maintenance."
quest_17204.Name: Fairy Puff Goo

Objectives.Description: Get Coated in Spore Bomb Goo

quest_17204.PrefaceText:
You can do amazing things with the goo of a ripe fairy puff. Usually they explode too violently to be useful, but if you pop one that's perfectly ripe, you won't be hurt! Instead, you'll get coated in their goo.

Go get yourself coated, then come see me. I'll use that goo for hive maintenance.
quest_17204.SuccessText:
Thanks for the goo. I'll use this to make sure the hives around here are able to survive the fluctuations of winter. Here, this is for your trouble.

And please return tomorrow, I need fresh fairy puff goo every day!

quest_17205.Description: Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "You need to take your bee out to the beehive to the west to introduce yourselves."
quest_17205.Name: Meet the Hive
quest_17205.PrefaceText: You need to take your bee out to the beehive to the west to introduce yourselves.

quest_17206.Description: Crelpin in the Fae Realm said, "Will you do me a favor? I want to try out some mortal recipes I've learned. To master them, I figured I'll need about two thousand potatoes. I can't do that all myself! So I'm asking everyone I see to bring me a few potatoes. Can you bring me a handful?"
quest_17206.Name: Two Thousand Potatoes
quest_17206.PrefaceText: Will you do me a favor? I want to try out some mortal recipes I've learned. To master them, I figured I'll need about two thousand potatoes. I can't do that all myself! So I'm asking everyone I see to bring me a few potatoes. Can you bring me a handful?
quest_17206.SuccessText: Thank you! Bizz was just telling me about you. He asked me to show you a few things you may have forgotten. A reward for helping us out.

quest_173.Description: You've realized that the beautiful symmetry of dice can only be understood with use. This is the path to the Die symbol.
quest_173.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Die"
quest_173.PrefaceText: You've realized that the beautiful symmetry of dice can only be understood with use. This is the path to the Die symbol.
quest_173.SuccessText: You rolled the dice and learned the Die symbol!

quest_17301.Description:
Raina in the Fae Realm said, "I try to keep my shop stocked with the essentials... but what IS an essential, anyway? I don't personally need much, so I've been stocking a bit of everything, in case it's essential to somebody else. Despite this, sales are... not good.

But I have a lead on a sale: Crelpin asked if I had any fresh pears, and I realized I didn't! Mine are old! If you're headed out of town, please pick me up some really fresh ones. And don't eat them!"
quest_17301.Name: Freshest Pears
quest_17301.PrefaceText:
I try to keep my shop stocked with the essentials... but what IS an essential, anyway? I don't personally need much, so I've been stocking a bit of everything, in case it's essential to somebody else. Despite this, sales are... not good.

But I have a lead on a sale: Crelpin asked if I had any fresh pears, and I realized I didn't! Mine are old! If you're headed out of town, please pick me up some really fresh ones. And don't eat them!
quest_17301.SuccessText:
Perfect! Except Solgribue just told me he doesn't need them anymore.

In retrospect I should have brokered some sort of business arrangement BEFORE I asked you to get these... but I'll take the blame, it's on me. Here's a fair payment.

quest_17302.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "Don't tell Crelpin, but I've got a special order for some bee stingers. The only catch is that they have to be fresh! A certain troll will pay well for them, and I'll give you half. Deal?"
quest_17302.Name: Freshest Stingers
quest_17302.PrefaceText: Don't tell Crelpin, but I've got a special order for some bee stingers. The only catch is that they have to be fresh! A certain troll will pay well for them, and I'll give you half. Deal?
quest_17302.SuccessText:
Oh my, they stink horribly! Did the bees scream when they died? No, don't tell me...

This is... dreadful. What have I done?! I hate having stuff like this in my shop. But I guess it won't be for long. Here's your cut of the money!

quest_17303.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "Psst... thanks for your help getting those fresh bee stingers. I've got another order for really fresh butterfly wings. I'd collect them myself, but I'm very fluent in butterfly speech, and I just can't handle their dying screams right now..."
quest_17303.Name: Freshest Shimmerwing Wings
quest_17303.PrefaceText: Psst... thanks for your help getting those fresh bee stingers. I've got another order for really fresh butterfly wings. I'd collect them myself, but I'm very fluent in butterfly speech, and I just can't handle their dying screams right now...
quest_17303.SuccessText:
Aw... poor butterflies! I feel terrible about this special order. But the store needs an income stream, or it can't be a part of this community! The needs of the many etcetera! Forgive me? ... Please?

Wait, who am I asking forgiveness from?! You're the monster who killed these butterflies in the first place! You should be ashamed!

... Sorry. Here's your blood money.

quest_17304.Description:
Raina in the Fae Realm said, "I've stopped accepting special orders for fresh body parts. It's just too existentially painful. But orders for fresh mushrooms should be fine!

I need some extremely fresh Pixie's Parasols. I'd pick them myself, but... well, I'm scared of pixies."
quest_17304.Name: Freshest Pixie's Parasols
quest_17304.PrefaceText:
I've stopped accepting special orders for fresh body parts. It's just too existentially painful. But orders for fresh mushrooms should be fine!

I need some extremely fresh Pixie's Parasols. I'd pick them myself, but... well, I'm scared of pixies.
quest_17304.SuccessText: Thank you for the fresh mushrooms! You know, I asked my buyer why she needed super fresh mushrooms particularly, since mushrooms last a really long time in storage. You know what she said? "I don't eat anything that's been dead for more than a week." Isn't that just the height of entitlement? I mean, for an immortal. Oops... not that she's immortal. Might be, might not be... okay fine, it's Midge. And she has brain damage, so don't you be mean to her!

quest_17305.Description:
You've awakened in a strange place and you don't remember anything. You get the feeling this has happened to you before... but maybe not as badly as this.

A fairy woman standing nearby waves and flutters more quickly when she sees you. Maybe she can help you.
quest_17305.Name: Re-Awakening
quest_17305.PrefaceText:
You've awakened in a strange place and you don't remember anything. You get the feeling this has happened to you before... but maybe not as badly as this.

A fairy woman standing nearby waves and flutters more quickly when she sees you. Maybe she can help you.

quest_17306.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "You really should talk to Crelpin about your pets. Who knows what they might have gone through?"
quest_17306.Name: Visit Crelpin
quest_17306.PrefaceText: You really should talk to Crelpin about your pets. Who knows what they might have gone through?

quest_17307.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "Pegast may be able to use muscle memory to remind you about some basic skills. "
quest_17307.Name: Visit Pegast
quest_17307.PrefaceText: Pegast may be able to use muscle memory to remind you about some basic skills.

quest_17308.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "Felmer can be a handy person to know when things get... Um... chaotic. You should say hello."
quest_17308.Name: Visit Felmer
quest_17308.PrefaceText: Felmer can be a handy person to know when things get... Um... chaotic. You should say hello.

quest_17309.Description: Raina in the Fae Realm said, "Midge the Apothecary lost her memory also! Maybe she can help you with yours!"
quest_17309.Name: Visit Midge
quest_17309.PrefaceText: Midge the Apothecary lost her memory also! Maybe she can help you with yours!

quest_17310.Description: You've awakened in a strange place and you don't remember anything. You need to get your feet under you, get your wings flapping, and figure out what happened and where you are.
quest_17310.Name: A New Life

Objectives.Description: Learn Fishing from Squidlips in Sun Vale
Learn Skinning from Silvia in Sun Vale
Learn Butchering from Silvia in Sun Vale
Learn Pathology from Preta in Sun Vale
Learn Foraging from Lisi in Sun Vale
Learn Nature Appreciation from Rohina in Sun Vale

quest_17310.PrefaceText: You've awakened in a strange place and you don't remember anything. You need to get your feet under you, get your wings flapping, and figure out what happened and where you are.

quest_174.Description: The Footprint symbol. So iconic. And yet so unknowable. Feet can take all sorts of shapes; how can you stereotype a whole body part like that? You'll need to stretch your feet in all new ways to discover the tantalizing secret of the Footprint symbol.
quest_174.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Footprint"

Objectives.Description: Kick Goblins (and Kill Them While Barefoot

quest_174.PrefaceText: The Footprint symbol. So iconic. And yet so unknowable. Feet can take all sorts of shapes; how can you stereotype a whole body part like that? You'll need to stretch your feet in all new ways to discover the tantalizing secret of the Footprint symbol.
quest_174.SuccessText: You've kicked and ... kicked your way to the Footprint symbol!

quest_17401.Description:
Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "The Winter Trolls south of here are a real pest. They're not native to this area! Only the green ones are! Remember: green good, blue bad.

The Winter Court uses trolls as laborers and guards everywhere, but here they also use them to spread misinformation throughout troll society. If you see one, execute it!"
quest_17401.Name: Winter Troll Extermination
quest_17401.PrefaceText:
The Winter Trolls south of here are a real pest. They're not native to this area! Only the green ones are! Remember: green good, blue bad.

The Winter Court uses trolls as laborers and guards everywhere, but here they also use them to spread misinformation throughout troll society. If you see one, execute it!
quest_17401.SuccessText: Great work on the troll-slaying. And trolls are true immortals, so killing them isn't even that big of a deal. They'll be reborn in just a few years! Hopefully they'll make better decisions next time.

quest_17402.Description: Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "Even soldiers need refreshment, and the mortals have a bitter booze called Beer which is quite amusing. I'm attempting to craft some of my own, but I need some 'hops'. They don't grow here! Do you have any?"
quest_17402.Name: Refreshment Duty
quest_17402.PrefaceText: Even soldiers need refreshment, and the mortals have a bitter booze called Beer which is quite amusing. I'm attempting to craft some of my own, but I need some 'hops'. They don't grow here! Do you have any?
quest_17402.SuccessText: These are hops? They smell bad... well, I'll take your word for it. Thank you! Here's something from my shop in return.

quest_17403.Description: Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "Vines keep attacking people south of town. I don't mean the spriggan weeds, I mean the OTHER kind! Floxie calls them carnivines. And really, Floxie should be the one to deal with these pests, given she's on plant duty, but she refuses! Will you remove these vicious weeds before someone gets hurt?"
quest_17403.Name: Plant Duty
quest_17403.PrefaceText: Vines keep attacking people south of town. I don't mean the spriggan weeds, I mean the OTHER kind! Floxie calls them carnivines. And really, Floxie should be the one to deal with these pests, given she's on plant duty, but she refuses! Will you remove these vicious weeds before someone gets hurt?
quest_17403.SuccessText: Very good work! I'll tell Floxie a mortal did her job for her. Won't she be shamed! Haha!

quest_17404.Description:
Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "You're a friend, and I trust your discretion. We both know that the Winter Court is infiltrating this land, and they need to be stopped. But we dare not attack them until they attack first.

You, on the other hand... you could just kill 'em all, as the humans say..."
quest_17404.Name: Just Kill 'Em
quest_17404.PrefaceText:
You're a friend, and I trust your discretion. We both know that the Winter Court is infiltrating this land, and they need to be stopped. But we dare not attack them until they attack first.

You, on the other hand... you could just kill 'em all, as the humans say...
quest_17404.SuccessText:
This is perfect! Those fairies will be back soon, but you've put them on the defensive. You're one of the worst kinds of pests: a powerful mortal interfering with fairy politics!

Of course, this means they'll be hunting for you. But I'm sure you'll be fine.

If you feel like killing some more of them, just let me know first!

quest_17405.Description: Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "You plan to kill more of the Winter Court menace? Wonderful! Go and 'mortal everything up' for the Winter Court!"
quest_17405.Name: Keep Killing 'Em
quest_17405.PrefaceText: You plan to kill more of the Winter Court menace? Wonderful! Go and 'mortal everything up' for the Winter Court!
quest_17405.SuccessText: I'm glad you understand the importance of this work. Those fairies will be right back in a few days, but one does not quickly get over the shame of being killed by a mortal! You're demoralizing them quite dramatically! In a few days, I hope you can make time to murder some more.

quest_17406.Description: Pegast in the Fae Realm said, "I'll teach you Armor Patching if you bring me some strange, finely ground dirt to help me polish my equipment."
quest_17406.Name: Pegast's Armor Patching
quest_17406.PrefaceText: I'll teach you Armor Patching if you bring me some strange, finely ground dirt to help me polish my equipment.
quest_17406.SuccessText: Good. Here, take this... yes, and this too. Now here, you can pop this dent out like this. And then some cleaning and polishing... The muscles remember!

quest_17501.Description:
Floxie in the Fae Realm said, "I'm working on becoming a better botanist! It's not as exciting as hunting, but I'm doing what I can. My biggest focus right now is on the carnivines, which are super amazing plants. They have a top area that's like a head, and they grow plates in their head that look like teeth! That's super strange, right? Can you get me some? The teeth, I mean. I need samples from several different carnivines so I can compare them.

You'll find carnivines most commonly when daytime happens -- they burrow into the ground at night."
quest_17501.Name: Carnivine Teeth
quest_17501.PrefaceText:
I'm working on becoming a better botanist! It's not as exciting as hunting, but I'm doing what I can. My biggest focus right now is on the carnivines, which are super amazing plants. They have a top area that's like a head, and they grow plates in their head that look like teeth! That's super strange, right? Can you get me some? The teeth, I mean. I need samples from several different carnivines so I can compare them.

You'll find carnivines most commonly when daytime happens -- they burrow into the ground at night.
quest_17501.SuccessText: Hmm, these teeth aren't terribly sharp. I mean they cut flesh, but they aren't razor sharp... hmm. That probably means something. But it turns out I know almost nothing about botany, so I'm not sure what to make of it. Oh well. I give up. But not on you! You did great!

quest_17502.Description: Floxie in the Fae Realm said, "Oh hey, I had another botany idea. No, this one's great! See, you got me carnivine teeth, but I have nothing really to compare them to. Why don't you ALSO get me some spriggan weed teeth? Then I can compare them! Go, go! There's science to do!"
quest_17502.Name: Spriggan Weed Teeth
quest_17502.PrefaceText: Oh hey, I had another botany idea. No, this one's great! See, you got me carnivine teeth, but I have nothing really to compare them to. Why don't you ALSO get me some spriggan weed teeth? Then I can compare them! Go, go! There's science to do!
quest_17502.SuccessText:
Okay, so these teeth are very much not like the other teeth. The carnivines grow wood-like plates, but the spriggan weed teeth are little nuggets of hard stuff.

Therefore it's my expert opinion that carnivines are completely unrelated to spriggan weeds. Science accomplished! This is fun! Oh speaking of botany, here's some exotic seeds I found for you!

quest_17503.Description:
Floxie in the Fae Realm said, "I've found a way to take my mind off my fear: cooking! I've been experimenting with vegetarian food from the nearby mortal realm, and they have something called a lemon which is VERY sour, and it's given me lots of dessert ideas. It's probably considered poisonous to mortals due to their simplistic digestive systems, but I can eat lemons just fine!

I'm growing some lemon trees now but it seems like it might take years before they yield fruit...? That's super weird. I think I might hate mortal trees. Anyway, long story short, I really need some lemons!"
quest_17503.Name: Mortal Lemons
quest_17503.PrefaceText:
I've found a way to take my mind off my fear: cooking! I've been experimenting with vegetarian food from the nearby mortal realm, and they have something called a lemon which is VERY sour, and it's given me lots of dessert ideas. It's probably considered poisonous to mortals due to their simplistic digestive systems, but I can eat lemons just fine!

I'm growing some lemon trees now but it seems like it might take years before they yield fruit...? That's super weird. I think I might hate mortal trees. Anyway, long story short, I really need some lemons!
quest_17503.SuccessText:
Oh these are perfect! Give them to me! I'm going to make so many sour things!

Here: this recipe isn't too sour, so your mortal frame should be able to survive it.

quest_17504.Description: Floxie in the Fae Realm said, "Pegast will not relent! He wants me to hop to the next mushroom circle and take out the winter court there. But I can't bring myself to do it! Could you ... do it for me? Just a few kills should be enough to get him out of my nest for a bit."
quest_17504.Name: Just a Hop Away
quest_17504.PrefaceText: Pegast will not relent! He wants me to hop to the next mushroom circle and take out the winter court there. But I can't bring myself to do it! Could you ... do it for me? Just a few kills should be enough to get him out of my nest for a bit.
quest_17504.SuccessText:
Oh thank you so much! Did you have to travel far from the circle?

Oh... you do know how to hop mushroom circles, right? No? Let me show you! It's really very simple teleportation magic. I'm sorry, I should have checked before you went all that way.

quest_176.Description: You don't think you'd need to study more than, say, 100 fireworks in order to draw a symbol of one. But you'd have to light them yourself.
quest_176.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Celebrate"
quest_176.PrefaceText: You don't think you'd need to study more than, say, 100 fireworks in order to draw a symbol of one. But you'd have to light them yourself.
quest_176.SuccessText: You lit fireworks until you could figure out how to draw the Celebrate symbol!

quest_17601.Description:
Bendith in the Fae Realm said, "Last time I was banished from the Winter Court, I had the good sense to prepare first. But this time I was caught off-guard. I miss some of the silliest things, like the desserts served with military meals. If you wage battle with Winter Court Scouts, please search the fallen for candied ice beetles. I'll reward you!

It may be hard to find a scout that hasn't eaten all their beetles yet... I know! Look for especially thin scouts."
quest_17601.Name: Snack From The Homeland
quest_17601.PrefaceText:
Last time I was banished from the Winter Court, I had the good sense to prepare first. But this time I was caught off-guard. I miss some of the silliest things, like the desserts served with military meals. If you wage battle with Winter Court Scouts, please search the fallen for candied ice beetles. I'll reward you!

It may be hard to find a scout that hasn't eaten all their beetles yet... I know! Look for especially thin scouts.
quest_17601.SuccessText:
Wonderful! Mmm... actually... these beetles are vile. Too much pixie sugar, not enough ice. I knew they were terrible! I have an excellent memory. But once I couldn't have them anymore, I started craving them. I seem to be losing my objectivity: my memories of home are becoming a maudlin soup. This angers me! For I despise soup.

That's a joke. Nevermind. Here: Floxie suggested this recipe to take my mind off the beetles, but now I don't need it.

quest_17602.Description: Bendith in the Fae Realm said, "Would you 'be a deer' as the humans say, and pick me up a certain thing while you're out hunting? It's... a slightly delicate issue: I need a few barghest snouts. Please don't tell Marrowchomp -- I'm already 'on thin ice' with him, as the humans say."
quest_17602.Name: Barghest Snouts
quest_17602.PrefaceText: Would you 'be a deer' as the humans say, and pick me up a certain thing while you're out hunting? It's... a slightly delicate issue: I need a few barghest snouts. Please don't tell Marrowchomp -- I'm already 'on thin ice' with him, as the humans say.
quest_17602.SuccessText: These organs will work well, thank you. I use them as part of the catalyst for my... well, I've said too much already. Here's something for your trouble. Don't tell anyone where you got that!

quest_17603.Description: Bendith in the Fae Realm said, "My... studies... require icebreeze moth wings. They are one of the only insects immune to cold, and so they are quite common back home. I'm sure plenty have flown through the portal to this land; look for areas where the Winter Court has taken control."
quest_17603.Name: Icebreeze Moth Wings
quest_17603.PrefaceText: My... studies... require icebreeze moth wings. They are one of the only insects immune to cold, and so they are quite common back home. I'm sure plenty have flown through the portal to this land; look for areas where the Winter Court has taken control.
quest_17603.SuccessText:
Excellent. These are quite valuable for alchemy.

(Psst, don't worry, I'll get that curse off of you soon!)

quest_17604.Description: Bendith in the Fae Realm said, "My dark ritual requires a large number of fae rhino horns. Just go out and get some for me."
quest_17604.Name: Fae Rhino Horns
quest_17604.PrefaceText: My dark ritual requires a large number of fae rhino horns. Just go out and get some for me.
quest_17604.SuccessText:
Very good. I like to powder these and use as a food additive. They can cut down the potency of pixie sugar without reducing the sugar high. Very useful for overclocking the tongue! If you're not afraid of Gastronomancy, maybe I'll teach you the dark ritual sometime.

In the mean time, here's a much less dangerous technique. It's unusable here due to lack of ingredients, but you can use it when you get home.

quest_177.Description: If you snorted some flowers, you believe you could learn to draw one by osmosis.
quest_177.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Flower"
quest_177.PrefaceText: If you snorted some flowers, you believe you could learn to draw one by osmosis.
quest_177.SuccessText: You snorted flowers until you mastered the Flower symbol.

quest_17701.Description: Noita the Green in the Fae Realm said, "Since you're an outsider, you can help fix a tricky problem. Fae panthers have been increasing in number and they're hunting quite close to town. The fairies dealt with other threats such as rhinos very easily, yet they've ignored the panthers... and I've finally realized that it's due to ME. Pegast is afraid of offending me. I've tried to explain that these are just ordinary animals, barely smarter than a mortal cat... but he thinks I SHOULD be offended, even if I'm not. Anyway, if you were to just go and remove those panthers near town, that'd be great."
quest_17701.Name: Fae Panther Hunt
quest_17701.PrefaceText: Since you're an outsider, you can help fix a tricky problem. Fae panthers have been increasing in number and they're hunting quite close to town. The fairies dealt with other threats such as rhinos very easily, yet they've ignored the panthers... and I've finally realized that it's due to ME. Pegast is afraid of offending me. I've tried to explain that these are just ordinary animals, barely smarter than a mortal cat... but he thinks I SHOULD be offended, even if I'm not. Anyway, if you were to just go and remove those panthers near town, that'd be great.
quest_17701.SuccessText: Thank you. You may be wondering why I didn't hunt them myself: I did at first, but realized the fairies found that barbaric as well. Fairies have a complicated and annoying sense of honor, or decency, or... something. I'm much more comfortable with the trolls: they're very pragmatic!

quest_17702.Description: Noita the Green in the Fae Realm said, "Have you met Marrowchomp? Oh, hmm, actually, you should probably keep your distance from him: he can be ornery. But he's an amazing cook! And he's told me about something called barbecue, which I simply must try. Unfortunately it requires a lot of meat. A LOT of meat! But it doesn't really matter what kind, as apparently he can barbecue anything! Just make sure there's a lot of it."
quest_17702.Name: Gigantic Barbecue
quest_17702.PrefaceText: Have you met Marrowchomp? Oh, hmm, actually, you should probably keep your distance from him: he can be ornery. But he's an amazing cook! And he's told me about something called barbecue, which I simply must try. Unfortunately it requires a lot of meat. A LOT of meat! But it doesn't really matter what kind, as apparently he can barbecue anything! Just make sure there's a lot of it.
quest_17702.SuccessText: That is an impressive amount of meat! It looks delicious already! But I'll keep my appetite. I'm so excited to try barbecue! Thank you! And don't worry: if Marrowchomp refuses to serve you, I'll slip some to you when he's not looking. Here's something to tide you over.

quest_17801.Description: Felmer in the Fae Realm said, "Once again I'm going to have to trek out into the dangerous wilds to collect the slime of fae molluscs... say, you know how to milk a snail, I presume? Would you mind doing it? Take some clean bottles with you to collect it!"
quest_17801.Name: Precious Buckets of Slime
quest_17801.PrefaceText: Once again I'm going to have to trek out into the dangerous wilds to collect the slime of fae molluscs... say, you know how to milk a snail, I presume? Would you mind doing it? Take some clean bottles with you to collect it!
quest_17801.SuccessText: Thank you. Now I'll turn the slime into silk. Would you like to watch? You'll be able to pick up my technique. [New hangout available when your Textile skill is at least 50.]

quest_17802.Description:
Felmer in the Fae Realm said, "Did you hear about that unfortunate fire-rift that opened south of here? I was thinking... while the Winter Fae portal is also open, that means there's three potent elemental sources here: Fire, Cold, and Nature. You know what that means: party time!

Oh, sorry, you don't know what I mean, do you. Well, If you can find three elementals big enough and old enough to drop nice-sounding crystals, I can fashion those crystals into beautiful fairy chimes.

I'm not sure if mortals are capable of playing them... but we could find out!"
quest_17802.Name: Creating Fairy Chimes (GROUP)
quest_17802.PrefaceText:
Did you hear about that unfortunate fire-rift that opened south of here? I was thinking... while the Winter Fae portal is also open, that means there's three potent elemental sources here: Fire, Cold, and Nature. You know what that means: party time!

Oh, sorry, you don't know what I mean, do you. Well, If you can find three elementals big enough and old enough to drop nice-sounding crystals, I can fashion those crystals into beautiful fairy chimes.

I'm not sure if mortals are capable of playing them... but we could find out!
quest_17802.SuccessText:
You found crystals from all three elements? These are excellent quality! Here, let me... and then we merge... and there we are!
