Can you play it? Well... give it some time! I'm sure you'll get the hang of it eventually.

quest_17803.Description: Felmer in the Fae Realm said, "If you bring me dinosaur scales to make buttons, I'll show you how to use First Aid."
quest_17803.Name: Felmer's First Aid
quest_17803.PrefaceText: If you bring me dinosaur scales to make buttons, I'll show you how to use First Aid.
quest_17803.SuccessText: These are just what I wanted. Thank you! Now hand me that kit and I'll show you the best way to wrap bandages. This works for bondage as well as injuries.

quest_17804.Description: Felmer in the Fae Realm said, "Floxie has been helping me gather local flowers to test as dyes, but the ocelots keep running her off. I told her not to be afraid of little kittens, and she told me to go get my own flowers! Can you clear some of them out for me? If anyone can deal with harmless felines, it's you! "
quest_17804.Name: Fashion Kittens
quest_17804.PrefaceText: Floxie has been helping me gather local flowers to test as dyes, but the ocelots keep running her off. I told her not to be afraid of little kittens, and she told me to go get my own flowers! Can you clear some of them out for me? If anyone can deal with harmless felines, it's you!
quest_17804.SuccessText:
Good job slaughtering the kitties! No, I'm just joking. You can slaughter anything you want. Thanks!

Now since you helped me out, I'll show you a little trick or two...

quest_17805.Description: Felmer in the Fae Realm said, "My friend Lisi in Sun Vale is very good at making images. Of course now she needs to use paper, but it's still not bad. She's holding a, uh... a book for me. Like an an art book, you know? With sketches of ... nature. Look, nevermind. Just go to Sun Vale and bring me back that book!"
quest_17805.MidwayText: Felmer sent you? [Lisi glances around anxiously, then sighs.] He always does this. If Silvia finds out... [She shoots you a pointed look.] Nevermind! I didn't say anything! You didn't even talk to me! Here's the 'art book' for Felmer. And tell him I won't keep doing this! This is the last time!
quest_17805.Name: Elven Sketches

Objectives.Description: Talk to Lisi in Sun Vale

quest_17805.PrefaceText: My friend Lisi in Sun Vale is very good at making images. Of course now she needs to use paper, but it's still not bad. She's holding a, uh... a book for me. Like an an art book, you know? With sketches of ... nature. Look, nevermind. Just go to Sun Vale and bring me back that book!
quest_17805.SuccessText: Very nice! Very ... ah ... natural. Would you excuse me for a moment?

quest_17851.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. The nibbling sprouts burrow under the ground.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
They ambush us while we pollinate. You must kill them!

BzzRtxl!"
quest_17851.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17851.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. The nibbling sprouts burrow under the ground.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
They ambush us while we pollinate. You must kill them!

BzzRtxl!

quest_17852.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. The spriggan weeds ambush us while we pollinate.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17852.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17852.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. The spriggan weeds ambush us while we pollinate.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17853.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Bears attack while we sleep, stealing our resources and injuring our warriors.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17853.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17853.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Bears attack while we sleep, stealing our resources and injuring our warriors.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17854.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We cannot pollinate the red flowers nearby. This endangers future honey potential!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!"
quest_17854.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17854.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We cannot pollinate the red flowers nearby. This endangers future honey potential!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!

quest_17855.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Frost Hippogriffs graze on our flowers. Unlike other ungulates, their beaks are freezing cold, and they kill most flowers they touch. They do not belong in this world!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17855.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17855.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Frost Hippogriffs graze on our flowers. Unlike other ungulates, their beaks are freezing cold, and they kill most flowers they touch. They do not belong in this world!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17856.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We cannot pollinate our distant flower holdings. This endangers future honey potential!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!"
quest_17856.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17856.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We cannot pollinate our distant flower holdings. This endangers future honey potential!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!

quest_17857.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
Our plan is ruined! We invented pre-germinated seeds to help flowers grow in far-away places. But ice fairies have dug them up and are eating them!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please retrieve some of our seeds!"
quest_17857.Name: Help the Hive

Objectives.Description: Obtain Honeyed Seeds from Winter Court Scouts

quest_17857.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
Our plan is ruined! We invented pre-germinated seeds to help flowers grow in far-away places. But ice fairies have dug them up and are eating them!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please retrieve some of our seeds!

quest_17858.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Fae canines, barghest, ambush us while we pollinate.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17858.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17858.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Fae canines, barghest, ambush us while we pollinate.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17859.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Our two freshest flowers are covered in pixies and we cannot approach.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!"
quest_17859.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17859.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Our two freshest flowers are covered in pixies and we cannot approach.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
Please pollinate them for us!

quest_17860.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
Serpent creatures are attacking our hidden caches of honey! Our strongest warriors could not stop them. We need your help... Bzzz... But you will need more help!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 Join your hivemates and kill the basilisks!"
quest_17860.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17860.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
Serpent creatures are attacking our hidden caches of honey! Our strongest warriors could not stop them. We need your help... Bzzz... But you will need more help!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 Join your hivemates and kill the basilisks!

quest_17861.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. We yearn to pollinate, but travel is unsafe! Raptors attack our troops in transit!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17861.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17861.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. We yearn to pollinate, but travel is unsafe! Raptors attack our troops in transit!

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17862.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Winter seems to be arriving and we must prepare to hibernate. Fire elementals will ambush us while we sleep.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!"
quest_17862.Name: Help the Hive
quest_17862.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...
We need your help, fairy. Winter seems to be arriving and we must prepare to hibernate. Fire elementals will ambush us while we sleep.

Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
 You must kill them!

quest_17865.Description:
A beehive in the Fae Realm said, "Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
We need your help, fairy. Our enemies burrow under the ground to ambush us while we pollinate.

Zzrt bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
We cannot care for our young flowers. You must go instead.

BzzRtxl!
Pollinate our young flowers!"
quest_17865.Name: Pollinate
quest_17865.PrefaceText:
Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
We need your help, fairy. Our enemies burrow under the ground to ambush us while we pollinate.

Zzrt bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
We cannot care for our young flowers. You must go instead.

BzzRtxl!
Pollinate our young flowers!
quest_17865.SuccessText:
BzzZz!
Thank you, fairy!

Bzz. BzzZZzzz ...Bzz. ZzzZzzZzzBz ... zzzBzt!
While you pollinated, the sprouts attacked. You must kill them!

BzzRtxl!

quest_17901.Description: Backfat in the Fae Realm said, "I'm pretty tired of the mushroom scene. I'm much more into physical fitness these days! But people have certain expectations of an immortal pig. Everyone expects me to know the quality of the local fungi, but I haven't done a survey in a while. Saaaaay... why don't you go out and pick some for me? It'll be great exercise!"
quest_17901.Name: Mushroom Samples
quest_17901.PrefaceText: I'm pretty tired of the mushroom scene. I'm much more into physical fitness these days! But people have certain expectations of an immortal pig. Everyone expects me to know the quality of the local fungi, but I haven't done a survey in a while. Saaaaay... why don't you go out and pick some for me? It'll be great exercise!
quest_17901.SuccessText: These are the mushrooms? Hmm, yep, pretty standard. You can keep those. And as for the exercise you just got: you're welcome!

quest_17902.Description:
Backfat in the Fae Realm said, "So that fairy over there -- yeah, that one, Pegast. He came over and asked for my help. Finally, recognition of my expertise! But did he want help getting fit and healthy? Nope. He just wanted explosive mushrooms. I gave him what I had, but he still needs more. So now I have to go foraging for this guy.

Hey, you look like you could use some exercise... you ready for a jog into the wilds? Great! These are very tricky mushrooms to pick, so be careful!"
quest_17902.Name: Explosive Mushrooms
quest_17902.PrefaceText:
So that fairy over there -- yeah, that one, Pegast. He came over and asked for my help. Finally, recognition of my expertise! But did he want help getting fit and healthy? Nope. He just wanted explosive mushrooms. I gave him what I had, but he still needs more. So now I have to go foraging for this guy.

Hey, you look like you could use some exercise... you ready for a jog into the wilds? Great! These are very tricky mushrooms to pick, so be careful!
quest_17902.SuccessText:
Great, you didn't explode! And you look a little fitter and leaner, too!

That fairy is trying to use these mushrooms to recharge the wall turrets. Seems pretty insane, huh? But we did our part already! Now we can just watch. Marrowchomp's giving me 3-to-1 odds he explodes. Want in?

quest_18.Description: Fainor the elf doesn't trust you since you're an animal. Collect 20 apples in the forest to convince him to do business with you.
quest_18.Name: Collect Apples

quest_18001.Description: Marna asked you for some lapis lazuli.
quest_18001.Name: Lapis Lazuli for Marna
quest_18001.PrefaceText: You know how every kind of crystal has certain magical attunements? Well, lapis lazuli is attuned to alchemy. It has many uses for empowering potions. And I'm fresh out. Get me some?
quest_18001.SuccessText: Perfect! Let me give you something in return. Hmm, I know, here: take my stash. I've sworn off the stuff. But it's great when you need a little extra kick. Just don't get hooked on it, okay? It can really mess you up.

quest_181.Description: You know the Shield symbol should depict strength, honor, and something else. But what's the secret ingredient? You'll need to investigate.
quest_181.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Shield"
quest_181.PrefaceText: You know the Shield symbol should depict strength, honor, and something else. But what's the secret ingredient? You'll need to investigate.
quest_181.SuccessText: You've defended yourself with the Shield and achieved the Shield symbol.

quest_18101.Description: Mox Warcut in New Prestonbule said, "The 'cinnamon' that grows in Council Lands isn't the same plant that we have growing overtop Mt. Aufghel. I need to collect some of the stuff for a report back home. Can you help me collect it? It grows on trees in the snow out there."
quest_18101.Name: Fake Cinnamon
quest_18101.PrefaceText: The 'cinnamon' that grows in Council Lands isn't the same plant that we have growing overtop Mt. Aufghel. I need to collect some of the stuff for a report back home. Can you help me collect it? It grows on trees in the snow out there.
quest_18101.SuccessText: Yes! See, this cinnamon bark is actually a kind of cassia tree bark. It works fine as a spice, but it's not the same thing at an alchemical level! It's not a kind of cassia I recognize, either. Very interesting. Thank you. On behalf of the Aufghel Naturists Society, I present this bounty.

quest_18104.Description: Mox Warcut in New Prestonbule said, "I need a sample of the Vol's Kiss that can be found in Gazluk. Can you get it for me? It's a yellow crystal that's warm to the touch. You can find it all over the mountainside. But listen VERY carefully: carrying it will make you sick. So get the ore and then run back here to me as quick as you can. Don't dally! I only need three pieces, so don't get any more than that."
quest_18104.Name: Deadly Yellow Crystals
quest_18104.PrefaceText: I need a sample of the Vol's Kiss that can be found in Gazluk. Can you get it for me? It's a yellow crystal that's warm to the touch. You can find it all over the mountainside. But listen VERY carefully: carrying it will make you sick. So get the ore and then run back here to me as quick as you can. Don't dally! I only need three pieces, so don't get any more than that.
quest_18104.SuccessText: Thank you. I have a lead-lined box to hold these pieces. Are you feeling okay? Here. Take this to ease the discomfort. And here's a bounty for your hard work.

quest_18105.Description: Mox Warcut in New Prestonbule said, "While I was exploring Foothills Cave, I uncovered mummies. I think orcs buried an army of mummies in there after a war and forgot about them. Well, you know how we dwarves feel about mummies! So I killed a few, but there were so many other nasty undead in that cave that I had to retreat. Can you go back in there and get rid of a bunch?"
quest_18105.Name: Cave Mummies
quest_18105.PrefaceText: While I was exploring Foothills Cave, I uncovered mummies. I think orcs buried an army of mummies in there after a war and forgot about them. Well, you know how we dwarves feel about mummies! So I killed a few, but there were so many other nasty undead in that cave that I had to retreat. Can you go back in there and get rid of a bunch?
quest_18105.SuccessText: Good work. Here's a bit of money as a thank-you. And if you decide to go back in there and destroy more mummies, bring me their wrappings. We have a priesthood back in Aufghel that can consecrate the wrappings... we think it might help release the mummys' souls from their purgatory. [A new Barter option has been added.]

quest_18106.Description:
Mox Warcut in New Prestonbule said, "You know, I bet there's a master mummy in Foothills Cave. When a mummy remains alive for long enough, there's a chance it can regain its free will and rise up from its inherent bitterness. When that happens, it become VERY dangerous. They're usually yellowed or blackened with age. If you see one, RUN! You'd need a team of trained warriors to kill it!

Of course, if you happen to have a few friends and wanted to kill the damned thing, I'd be happy to reward such heroism."
quest_18106.Name: Mummy Mastermind

Objectives.Description: Kill a boss mummy in Foothills Cave

quest_18106.PrefaceText:
You know, I bet there's a master mummy in Foothills Cave. When a mummy remains alive for long enough, there's a chance it can regain its free will and rise up from its inherent bitterness. When that happens, it become VERY dangerous. They're usually yellowed or blackened with age. If you see one, RUN! You'd need a team of trained warriors to kill it!

Of course, if you happen to have a few friends and wanted to kill the damned thing, I'd be happy to reward such heroism.
quest_18106.SuccessText: So there was a higher-order mummy in the cave! That's pretty scary. Where one mummy gains free will, it's only a matter of time before more start sparking to life. We still have a horrible mummy pit back home because of that. Can't get rid of the damned things! I'll make a full report when I get back New Aufghel... not that they'll be able to do anything about this cave! What with the war and all. So anything you can do to help is appreciated.

quest_18201.Description: Bellema Deftwhisper in New Prestonbule said, "There's a beast that lives in the caves here that I really hope I get a chance to hunt! They're sort of like dogs, but ... not dogs. Barghests! If you find any, can you try to get some patches of their flesh for me to study?"
quest_18201.Name: Barghest Hunt
quest_18201.PrefaceText: There's a beast that lives in the caves here that I really hope I get a chance to hunt! They're sort of like dogs, but ... not dogs. Barghests! If you find any, can you try to get some patches of their flesh for me to study?
quest_18201.SuccessText: This is barghest flesh? Hmm, it's very similar to dog flesh, isn't it? Legend says barghests were genetically engineered by goblins, but that seems unlikely to me... I mean, we know how their bugbears turned out! Barghests seem like graceful creatures in comparison. I think they're just some sort of magic-infused super-dog. But I'll let Mox examine these later and see if he finds any clues to their origin. Thanks! Uh, here's some stuff for you.

quest_18202.Description: Bellema Deftwhisper in New Prestonbule said, "I'm Mox's backup when we go out on expeditions. The stuff in the caves isn't too bad, but the stuff in the snow can be pretty scary! I'm not confident my crossbow can handle those huge bears before they have time to maul one of us. Can you kill some and let me know how hard they are to kill? Just a few will do. Like... five. No! Eight. That's a more scientific number."
quest_18202.Name: Grisly Polar Bear Deaths

Objectives.Description: Kill Polar and Tundra Bears in Gazluk

quest_18202.PrefaceText: I'm Mox's backup when we go out on expeditions. The stuff in the caves isn't too bad, but the stuff in the snow can be pretty scary! I'm not confident my crossbow can handle those huge bears before they have time to maul one of us. Can you kill some and let me know how hard they are to kill? Just a few will do. Like... five. No! Eight. That's a more scientific number.
quest_18202.SuccessText: So? That's it? No mangled limbs or ripped-off faces to show for it? I guess the bears should be easy, then! Thanks for doing the research for me. Oh, you need a payment... hmm... here! These are for you.

quest_18203.Description: Bellema Deftwhisper in New Prestonbule said, "When we were checking altitude measurements the other day, we found some very unusual creatures on top of the mountains. They're like slimes, but ice cold! A few fiery crossbow bolts can take 'em out. There's something inside, though... a sort of gunk. I'm thinking it might help make a nice kind of crossbow bolt. If you run across any ice slimes out there, check 'em for sludge!"
quest_18203.Name: Ice Sludge
quest_18203.PrefaceText: When we were checking altitude measurements the other day, we found some very unusual creatures on top of the mountains. They're like slimes, but ice cold! A few fiery crossbow bolts can take 'em out. There's something inside, though... a sort of gunk. I'm thinking it might help make a nice kind of crossbow bolt. If you run across any ice slimes out there, check 'em for sludge!
quest_18203.SuccessText: Ew! Haha, that's the stuff all right! It smells even worse than I remember! Chemistry's not exactly my strong suit, but fortunately my betrothed over there is an expert, so I'll get him to make me some icy bolts from this!

quest_18301.Description: Rick Snapley in New Prestonbule said, "We have a lot of beer stored away here from the previous tenants. And I know how to summon Council Rations, which are just barely enough to keep us all alive. But I would kill for something else to eat! This is a cave, so you'd think you could catch cave fish in here, right? But no. No deep water, no cave fish. Can you get us some?"
quest_18301.Name: Cave Fishing
quest_18301.PrefaceText: We have a lot of beer stored away here from the previous tenants. And I know how to summon Council Rations, which are just barely enough to keep us all alive. But I would kill for something else to eat! This is a cave, so you'd think you could catch cave fish in here, right? But no. No deep water, no cave fish. Can you get us some?
quest_18301.SuccessText: Okay... remind me, if you would: why in the FUCK did I ask you for cave fish? I should have asked for a tastier fish! Damn it! Damn it! Cave fish taste like feet. But what's done is done. Here, take these: some of my best throwing knives. And don't give me any lip, those are valuable! Learn to throw a knife, why don'tcha?

quest_18302.Description: Rick Snapley in New Prestonbule said, "The settlers who lived in the houses outside were adherents of Arisetsu, the goddess of Hope and Warmth. You know what that means, right? Blankets! Arisetsu nuts always bring tons of their blankets to give to the needy. Well, they're dead, and we're needy. They brought a lot of their stuff into this cave when they fled, but when the survivors died, they were buried in... you guessed it: Arisetsu blankets. So now we're very low. I'm betting that there's more in those houses, though. Sneak past the ghosts and get us some!"
quest_18302.Name: Blankets From Ghosts
quest_18302.PrefaceText: The settlers who lived in the houses outside were adherents of Arisetsu, the goddess of Hope and Warmth. You know what that means, right? Blankets! Arisetsu nuts always bring tons of their blankets to give to the needy. Well, they're dead, and we're needy. They brought a lot of their stuff into this cave when they fled, but when the survivors died, they were buried in... you guessed it: Arisetsu blankets. So now we're very low. I'm betting that there's more in those houses, though. Sneak past the ghosts and get us some!
quest_18302.SuccessText: Blankets! I was sure I'd just gotten you killed, but you're not as stupid as I thought! That's good. Yeah. Okay... so now piss off. Oh! Your reward! Right. Here, take these. I nicked 'em from Mox when he wouldn't pay up his bets with me.

quest_18303.Description: Rick Snapley in New Prestonbule said, "Sona's recovering well after her incident. Mox helped a lot. But she's still walking with a slight limp. Mox says he can make something for that, but he needs ghost puke. So if you find some, save it."
quest_18303.Name: Ghost Puke
quest_18303.PrefaceText: Sona's recovering well after her incident. Mox helped a lot. But she's still walking with a slight limp. Mox says he can make something for that, but he needs ghost puke. So if you find some, save it.
quest_18303.SuccessText: This is the stuff. Ugh, it stinks. Well, I'll get it to Mox. Thanks.

quest_18304.Description: Rick Snapley in New Prestonbule said, "Mox is mixing that potion you helped get the stuff for. But Sona caught a whiff of it and says she won't drink it! Stupid girl would rather have a limp all her days than spend a few nights in digestive agony! Well, if she's going to be a child about it, we'll have to treat her like one. And how do you make a child take their medicine? Honey! Lots of it."
quest_18304.Name: Puke Sweetener
quest_18304.PrefaceText: Mox is mixing that potion you helped get the stuff for. But Sona caught a whiff of it and says she won't drink it! Stupid girl would rather have a limp all her days than spend a few nights in digestive agony! Well, if she's going to be a child about it, we'll have to treat her like one. And how do you make a child take their medicine? Honey! Lots of it.
quest_18304.SuccessText: Nice, that's a lot of honey! I bet Mox can use this to make the potion drinkable.

quest_18305.Description:
Rick Snapley in New Prestonbule said, "First off: you're on my shit list for keeping me in the dark about all this. I can't believe you would go off and kill that sand rat Tal-Saka without me!

But all signs do point to Rahu itself being involved. If that were true, there should be proof of it somewhere. The Onkara keep their records up on a hill in Rahu. Unfortunately, going there would be suicide. Even for me. Even for you! So for now, I guess that's where this mystery will stand."
quest_18305.Name: Proof of Rahu's Involvement
quest_18305.PrefaceText:
First off: you're on my shit list for keeping me in the dark about all this. I can't believe you would go off and kill that sand rat Tal-Saka without me!

But all signs do point to Rahu itself being involved. If that were true, there should be proof of it somewhere. The Onkara keep their records up on a hill in Rahu. Unfortunately, going there would be suicide. Even for me. Even for you! So for now, I guess that's where this mystery will stand.
quest_18305.SuccessText: Well suck my balls and call me Remga, you found actual proof that the Onkara were involved! This is incredible! ... No! It was authorized by Lt. Flakis... and he's dead! He was killed by an orcish terrorist last month. Damn it all! Well, there must be more to this. I'll head to Rahu soon and see if I can bribe some friendly rakkies until I get answers. You've done more than enough for us. Thank you. You're off my shit-list now. I don't have a lot of coin, but here's some merchandise I've come across. And hey. If you ever need to kill someone 'less than honorably', I can help you out with that. [New Sales options added.]

quest_18401.Description: Fluffikins in Gazluk said, "I'm supposed to be in charge of the campsite, which is why the jealous humans constantly slack off to make me look bad. I keep telling them to repair these stalls so they're ready for the heavier snows to come. So they head off to gather wood, and then come back empty-handed. "Chased by a bear" or "bit by a slime"... always some excuse so they don't have to work. Can you help me? We need spruce."
quest_18401.Name: Lumber for Campsite Repairs
quest_18401.PrefaceText: I'm supposed to be in charge of the campsite, which is why the jealous humans constantly slack off to make me look bad. I keep telling them to repair these stalls so they're ready for the heavier snows to come. So they head off to gather wood, and then come back empty-handed. "Chased by a bear" or "bit by a slime"... always some excuse so they don't have to work. Can you help me? We need spruce.
quest_18401.SuccessText: Thank you! Now I just have to harrass the humans into doing the repairs. What I wouldn't give for hands so I could do the work myself! But I digress. You've proven very resourceful! Here is a token of my... and my master's... appreciation.

quest_18402.Description: Fluffikins in Gazluk said, "My master left me with a long list of tasks, and we've fallen behind. I'd love your help! This one's tricky: I need samples of a mineral that grows in the caves around here. It's called cinnabar, and it's pretty hard to mine. But if you can get some, I'll pay you ... let's see... ten thousand Councils."
quest_18402.Name: Sampling Local Cinnabar
quest_18402.PrefaceText: My master left me with a long list of tasks, and we've fallen behind. I'd love your help! This one's tricky: I need samples of a mineral that grows in the caves around here. It's called cinnabar, and it's pretty hard to mine. But if you can get some, I'll pay you ... let's see... ten thousand Councils.
quest_18402.SuccessText: This is the cinnabar? Good. Here's your money. That's one task off the list... maybe I won't get in trouble after all!

quest_18501.Description:
Hemmit Magmagrip in New Prestonbule said, "I need you to go spelunking! There are caves all through the mountains, and some of them have mushrooms growing inside.

There's a kind of mushroom found only in this mountain range. Orcs call it 'Groxmax'. You'll know them by the stench of rotten meat. I'll pay well for them! Oh, and if you find other kinds of mushrooms, hold on to them too; I may need them."
quest_18501.Name: Groxmax Mushrooms for Hemmit
quest_18501.PrefaceText:
I need you to go spelunking! There are caves all through the mountains, and some of them have mushrooms growing inside.

There's a kind of mushroom found only in this mountain range. Orcs call it 'Groxmax'. You'll know them by the stench of rotten meat. I'll pay well for them! Oh, and if you find other kinds of mushrooms, hold on to them too; I may need them.
quest_18501.SuccessText: So this is the infamous groxmax mushroom. Orcish alchemists say these inedible mushrooms have powerful alchemical uses... but don't worry. Orcish alchemists are notoriously sloppy and lazy, so I'll do my own experiments. Here, a bounty from the Aufghel Naturist Society.

quest_18502.Description: Hemmit Magmagrip in New Prestonbule said, "I need another kind of mushroom. These are common everywhere: black foot morels. Delicious in stews! I need to make sure the kind that grow here are alchemically identical to the kinds grown elsewhere."
quest_18502.Name: Black Foot Morels for Hemmit
quest_18502.PrefaceText: I need another kind of mushroom. These are common everywhere: black foot morels. Delicious in stews! I need to make sure the kind that grow here are alchemically identical to the kinds grown elsewhere.
quest_18502.SuccessText: These definitely look like black foot morels. Thank you. I'll do some quick tests to make sure they're typical for the species. Here is a bounty for your hard work.

quest_18503.Description: Hemmit Magmagrip in New Prestonbule said, "Mox and Bellema don't believe me, but I swear I saw another one of those mushroom men in a cave near here! It was in 'Snowblood Shadow Cave'. I can't understand his way of communicating, but I'm sure he knows the secret of these mushroom rings. If you figure out the secret, tell me!"
quest_18503.Name: The Mushroom Man's Secret
quest_18503.PrefaceText: Mox and Bellema don't believe me, but I swear I saw another one of those mushroom men in a cave near here! It was in 'Snowblood Shadow Cave'. I can't understand his way of communicating, but I'm sure he knows the secret of these mushroom rings. If you figure out the secret, tell me!
quest_18503.SuccessText:
So you were able to talk to the mushroom man? And he showed you how to teleport?! I knew it! I knew they were a transit system! Oh this is huge news! You've gotta hang out here and fill me in on the details!

Here's a little cash incentive! But if you let me in on the secret, I'll teach you my personal secret mushroom-farming techniques in exchange.

quest_186.Description: It's almost unknowable, the Brain symbol. But you must have its secrets! This will be taxing on your own brain, but you will find the knowledge you need or die trying!
quest_186.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Brain"
quest_186.PrefaceText: It's almost unknowable, the Brain symbol. But you must have its secrets! This will be taxing on your own brain, but you will find the knowledge you need or die trying!
quest_186.SuccessText: You've brain-blitzed your way to the Brain symbol!

quest_18601.Description: Sona in New Prestonbule said, "I've been trying to convince Mox that Transmutation can revolutionize mining. But he won't listen. So I need your help. It will be dangerous... but worthwhile! I need a piece of the evil yellow crystals that can be found outside, plus some high-quality phlogiston. I believe I can make the crystal safe for transit!"
quest_18601.Name: Safer Crystal Transport
quest_18601.PrefaceText: I've been trying to convince Mox that Transmutation can revolutionize mining. But he won't listen. So I need your help. It will be dangerous... but worthwhile! I need a piece of the evil yellow crystals that can be found outside, plus some high-quality phlogiston. I believe I can make the crystal safe for transit!
quest_18601.SuccessText:
Excellent. Let me work quickly... yes! I knew it! These yellow crystals are just a kind of enchanted hassium, which phlogiston renders relatively safe! Wait until I show Mox!

Unfortunately the technique does not seem to be very cost-effective, but I believe I can improve the ratios a bit...

Here. You seem to be more open-minded about learning from a 'child' than Mox is. Here is my improved crystal transit formula. It may be too expensive to use routinely, but I hope that some day it proves useful.

quest_18602.Description:
Sona in New Prestonbule said, "I would like your help on a delicate subject. I need to know if the goblin Urzab had anything to do with what happened to me in the desert. He lives in Amulna.

There is a catch, however: he only speaks goblinese. Rick has confronted him, but Rick's goblinese is poor and he is not sure he understood everything. Do you happen to be fluent? If so, could you speak to Urzab about the attempt on my life?"
quest_18602.MidwayText:
Who? Sona? I don't know a Sona. ... ohhh, THAT Sona. The teenage rakshasa with all the customers. Very sad. She was a good tenant.

What? Me?! I had nothing to do with it! Almost certainly nothing! Okay, look. I feel bad about it, but I had no choice: an Onkara trooper came in here and demanded a key to her shop. He was huge and terrifying, and I figured he was just stealing magical secrets, so I let him in. The very next evening, Sona was attacked by bandits.

Believe me, I didn't want her gone! She was earning me a lot of money in rent, and more importantly, she was making Amulna famous! When she disappeared, her assistants wandered off to become bandits themselves... if I had to guess, one of those two is to blame for the attack! Now excuse me. I have a lot of paperwork to attend to.
quest_18602.Name: Confronting Urzab
quest_18602.PrefaceText:
I would like your help on a delicate subject. I need to know if the goblin Urzab had anything to do with what happened to me in the desert. He lives in Amulna.

There is a catch, however: he only speaks goblinese. Rick has confronted him, but Rick's goblinese is poor and he is not sure he understood everything. Do you happen to be fluent? If so, could you speak to Urzab about the attempt on my life?
quest_18602.SuccessText: The story Urzab told you is also what he told Rick. But this bit about the Onkara soldier breaking into my shop is a new detail. That's terrifying! Thank you for your hard work. Here -- I don't have much money left, but I want  to give you something.

quest_18603.Description: Sona in New Prestonbule said, "I have thought about what Urzab told you: that my assistants may be involved in the attempt on my life. Rick already tracked down one of them, and she knew nothing. He couldn't find the other one... But I know where Tal-Saka would have gone. I did not tell Rick because I won't let him get hurt for me! But if you wanted to go and confront Tal-Saka... I would be grateful. Tal-Saka often spoke of his vagabond friends that live in a ruined desert outpost. To find the outpost, start at Amulna, then head due east. It is a long journey, so bring water. And be careful! It will be dangerous."
quest_18603.Name: Confronting Tal-Saka
quest_18603.PrefaceText: I have thought about what Urzab told you: that my assistants may be involved in the attempt on my life. Rick already tracked down one of them, and she knew nothing. He couldn't find the other one... But I know where Tal-Saka would have gone. I did not tell Rick because I won't let him get hurt for me! But if you wanted to go and confront Tal-Saka... I would be grateful. Tal-Saka often spoke of his vagabond friends that live in a ruined desert outpost. To find the outpost, start at Amulna, then head due east. It is a long journey, so bring water. And be careful! It will be dangerous.
quest_18603.SuccessText: Tal-Saka is dead?! Oh, that is tragic news. I knew I shouldn't have sent you! Terrible deeds pile upon terrible deeds, and although I did not spill his blood, it is on my hands! [ Sona sighs. ] What's done is done. You say he had a Rahu trade coin? That could be coincidence... perhaps he found it somewhere in the sand. But most likely it means that the city of Rahu paid him for a service. Perhaps they hired him to explain my stolen research notes. It would seem the very city of my birth wants me dead. This is the worst outcome I could have imagined! I cannot keep this from Rick anymore. Talk to him, see if he knows what to do next. [ New Favor for Rick Snapley. ]

quest_187.Description: Mastering the Rabbit symbol just seems so hard! You can't get into the mind of your subject. Perhaps if you lived as a rabbit for a while...
quest_187.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Rabbit"
quest_187.PrefaceText: Mastering the Rabbit symbol just seems so hard! You can't get into the mind of your subject. Perhaps if you lived as a rabbit for a while...
quest_187.SuccessText: You lived as a rabbit long enough to understand the subtlities of the Rabbit symbol!

quest_18701.Description:
Gasu'um in New Prestonbule said, "There is a necklace I wish to have returned to me. It was my mother's, and she gave it to me. To ME! Because I was her favorite! My worthless brother stole it from me... and then... I had to leave it behind.

Leave this cave and venture right. You will see the camp of the feckless Aguva clan... go past them. Continue right until you find the camp on a hill.  That camp is what remains of the Uga'th clan. The necklace is in there somewhere."
quest_18701.Name: Sentimental Jewelry
quest_18701.PrefaceText:
There is a necklace I wish to have returned to me. It was my mother's, and she gave it to me. To ME! Because I was her favorite! My worthless brother stole it from me... and then... I had to leave it behind.

Leave this cave and venture right. You will see the camp of the feckless Aguva clan... go past them. Continue right until you find the camp on a hill.  That camp is what remains of the Uga'th clan. The necklace is in there somewhere.
quest_18701.SuccessText: It is mine again! Mine! As it should be! Wait... it is broken! You fool! How could you break... no! I will control my anger! Remember the past, Gasu'um! Remember! [Gasu'um glares at you a while until she regains her composure.] Thank you. Here is coin for your... for your effort. I can repair the necklace. You will help me, and I will reward you.

quest_18702.Description: Gasu'um in New Prestonbule said, "To repair my necklace, I need pyrite. Obtain for me the finest pyrite! I will reward you."
quest_18702.Name: The Chain of Gasu'um's Necklace
quest_18702.PrefaceText: To repair my necklace, I need pyrite. Obtain for me the finest pyrite! I will reward you.
quest_18702.SuccessText:
Good. This pyrite will serve.

I will tell you a secret: I once made jewelry. My mother taught me. And I have a necklace stored away that is ugly. So it would be perfect for you! Here. Take it! Wear it proudly!

quest_18703.Description: Gasu'um in New Prestonbule said, "The central decoration of the necklace you broke is a rare and beautiful crystal known as vervadium. It will be difficult to find. But should you find a piece, bring it to me. I will pay you ten times its value!"
quest_18703.Name: The Gem in Gasu'um's Necklace
quest_18703.PrefaceText: The central decoration of the necklace you broke is a rare and beautiful crystal known as vervadium. It will be difficult to find. But should you find a piece, bring it to me. I will pay you ten times its value!
quest_18703.SuccessText:
Very good, hand me the vervadium. This?! This gem has too many flaws! Did you not see them? Or were you trying to trick me into buying your worthless... Nnhgggg... be CALM Gasu'um, be calm!

Very well. I will take this worthless Vervadium and give you NOTHING, because it is not valuable, and ten times nothing is still nothing. However, I have an easier task for you instead. If you do this task for me, I will pay you... a large pile of coins. I haven't counted it. But it is significant.

quest_18704.Description: Gasu'um in New Prestonbule said, "I have decided to replace the crystal in my mother's necklace with obsidian. Go find a piece for me! Obsidian is not as beautiful as vervadium, but I suspect you will at least be able to find a piece that does not disgust me."
quest_18704.Name: The Gem in Gasu'um's Necklace (round 2)
quest_18704.PrefaceText: I have decided to replace the crystal in my mother's necklace with obsidian. Go find a piece for me! Obsidian is not as beautiful as vervadium, but I suspect you will at least be able to find a piece that does not disgust me.
quest_18704.SuccessText:
This is... good. Actually, this is a good piece of obsidian! I will reward you, as I said I would.

Here. In addtion to the coins, I have a ring that may fit you. For once I made rings, in the manner my mother taught me, long ago.

quest_188.Description: The Horse symbol is a potent idea that should never be misused. To control its forces you should collect many example horses. Then you can compare and contrast them.
quest_188.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Horse"
quest_188.PrefaceText: The Horse symbol is a potent idea that should never be misused. To control its forces you should collect many example horses. Then you can compare and contrast them.
quest_188.SuccessText: You've become a horse person to unlock the Horse symbol.

quest_18801.Description:
Torgan in New Prestonbule said, "Snapley told me the pitiful tale of the settlement outside. Here is a detail he did not know: the strike was ordered by General Naurlok himself, and was executed by his elite legion. And here is where things become interesting. For you see, ghosts often retain something of what they had when they died. And if they died with spear heads from Naurlok's Avengers still stuck in them... that metal is precious! I cannot even make it myself.

You should destroy some of those ghosts and see if you can find orcish metal. I will pay in Councils."
quest_18801.Name: Steel From Ghosts
quest_18801.PrefaceText:
Snapley told me the pitiful tale of the settlement outside. Here is a detail he did not know: the strike was ordered by General Naurlok himself, and was executed by his elite legion. And here is where things become interesting. For you see, ghosts often retain something of what they had when they died. And if they died with spear heads from Naurlok's Avengers still stuck in them... that metal is precious! I cannot even make it myself.

You should destroy some of those ghosts and see if you can find orcish metal. I will pay in Councils.
quest_18801.SuccessText: Ha ha! I knew it! This steel will make a monstrous new hammer! You have done well!

quest_18802.Description: Torgan in New Prestonbule said, "The metal that humans use is weak and deficient. I use it to make horseshoes and tools, but never for armor. Armor requires the astounding metal found in the mines of Gazluk! In fact, it can often be found exposed at the tops of mountains here. I will pay a bounty for a pile of it, for I must repair Vughal's helmet, and I will not use feeble metal!"
quest_18802.Name: True Orcish Ore
quest_18802.PrefaceText: The metal that humans use is weak and deficient. I use it to make horseshoes and tools, but never for armor. Armor requires the astounding metal found in the mines of Gazluk! In fact, it can often be found exposed at the tops of mountains here. I will pay a bounty for a pile of it, for I must repair Vughal's helmet, and I will not use feeble metal!
quest_18802.SuccessText: Good! You are efficient. It seems you have orc blood in you.

quest_18803.Description: Torgan in New Prestonbule said, "My new hammer must have a handle of impeccable quality. Spruce is, of course, the ideal wood for gripping, but its strength is substandard... except for very occasional pieces of spruce. I need those perfect specimens of spruce wood!"
quest_18803.Name: Only The Best Handles
quest_18803.PrefaceText: My new hammer must have a handle of impeccable quality. Spruce is, of course, the ideal wood for gripping, but its strength is substandard... except for very occasional pieces of spruce. I need those perfect specimens of spruce wood!
quest_18803.SuccessText: Yes, yes, very good. I find it fascinating that you were able to complete this task. It often takes many orcs many weeks to find spruce of this quality! You must be more impressive than you look!

quest_189.Description: Try as you might, the Pig symbol seems just beyond your skill. Perhaps if you lived and worked as a pig yourself! Yes, that's the only way.
quest_189.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Pig"
quest_189.PrefaceText: Try as you might, the Pig symbol seems just beyond your skill. Perhaps if you lived and worked as a pig yourself! Yes, that's the only way.
quest_189.SuccessText: You lived as a pig long enough to understand the subtlities of the Pig symbol!

quest_18901.Description: Sem the Myconian (in a cave in New Prestonbule) said, "It is atypical for members of my species to desire the destruction of meatlings. However, the snails in this cavern are of egregious proportions and they enjoy consuming many of the same food sources that I do. They also enjoy consuming me directly. For this reason, I request their dissolution."
quest_18901.Name: Dissolution of Cave Snails

Objectives.Description: Kill Giant Snails in Sem's Cave

quest_18901.PrefaceText: It is atypical for members of my species to desire the destruction of meatlings. However, the snails in this cavern are of egregious proportions and they enjoy consuming many of the same food sources that I do. They also enjoy consuming me directly. For this reason, I request their dissolution.
quest_18901.SuccessText: It is with relief that I acknowledge your completion of this task! You will find this substance to be of value.

quest_18902.Description: Sem the Myconian (in a cave in New Prestonbule) said, "Although my species is generally able to cohabit with slimes and fungi of all types, there exist herein a species that reduces the ambient temperature. This is clearly unacceptable behavior. Please extinguish these slimes before they make the environment uninhabitable!"
quest_18902.Name: Inconsiderate Slime Organisms

Objectives.Description: Kill Huge Ice Slicks in Sem's Cave

quest_18902.PrefaceText: Although my species is generally able to cohabit with slimes and fungi of all types, there exist herein a species that reduces the ambient temperature. This is clearly unacceptable behavior. Please extinguish these slimes before they make the environment uninhabitable!
quest_18902.SuccessText:
At last! Now perhaps it will be possible to lie dormant without needing to expend energy to maintain core temperature! Ha ha! Oh, that is not a joke in your language. ... Nevermind.

There is a way to use the remnants of those slimes, combined with myconian give-offs, to enhance your own safety. Let me show you the method. Perhaps it will be useful to you in a future moon cycle.

quest_18903.Description: Sem the Myconian (in a cave in New Prestonbule) said, "One single meat creature that inhabits this cavern is so poisonous and foul that I am unable to filter out its toxins, and must flee if it approaches. This creature was bred for some ill purpose. I know this from spying upon the minds of green-skinned bipeds that came to feed it. They called the creature 'Murklinger'. It would please me to no longer need to fear this creature."
quest_18903.Name: The Worst Slug
quest_18903.PrefaceText: One single meat creature that inhabits this cavern is so poisonous and foul that I am unable to filter out its toxins, and must flee if it approaches. This creature was bred for some ill purpose. I know this from spying upon the minds of green-skinned bipeds that came to feed it. They called the creature 'Murklinger'. It would please me to no longer need to fear this creature.
quest_18903.SuccessText: The creature Murklinger is deceased! And you have not suffered the loss of even a single limb or core organ! You are a more competent warrior than I had expected!

quest_19.Description: Harry says he'll give you some of his precious antidote. But you'll have to pay him handsomely for it!
quest_19.Name: Un-cow-ification

quest_190.Description: You've tried to master the Deer symbol, but all your attempts ring hollow. You're an artist and you need to get this RIGHT! This can only be achieved by literally getting into the mind of your subject.
quest_190.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Deer"
quest_190.PrefaceText: You've tried to master the Deer symbol, but all your attempts ring hollow. You're an artist and you need to get this RIGHT! This can only be achieved by literally getting into the mind of your subject.
quest_190.SuccessText: You lived as a deer long enough to understand the subtlities of the Deer symbol!

quest_19001.Description: Tadion wants some firewood to keep his forge hot.
quest_19001.Name: Lumber for the Forge
quest_19001.PrefaceText:
I know Velkort thinks I should be able to keep the forge hot through my magic, but I'm afraid I was never very good at it. Hammering's more my thing.

Can you get me some non-magical fuel for my fire? I'm running low.
quest_19001.SuccessText: Thanks! That's perfect. Here, let me give you some cash for that.

quest_19002.Description: Tadion needs some metal slabs for his current project.
quest_19002.Name: Metal Slabs
quest_19002.PrefaceText: Blacksmithing is all about shaping metal. But we've been a little low on metal for a while now. I mean, there's not exactly an iron mine nearby. I generally make do, but I wouldn't mind some spare metal, that's for sure!
quest_19002.SuccessText: You're good. Not great, but good. I respect that. Greatness is overrated. Here. Take some money.

quest_19003.Name: Ivory Horn
quest_19003.PrefaceText: I'm making a special ... device. For Ivyn. It's a ... well, anyway, it doesn't matter. I need a horn. A really nice one, maybe made of ivory? Or something even better if you come across it. Thanks.
quest_19003.SuccessText: You found one?! Wow. Thanks! Here's some cash for your trouble.

quest_191.Description: How to depict the Wind symbol? Its mysteries are limited only by the forces of nature itself. You must delve ever deeper into the heart of the storm to comprehend the Wind.
quest_191.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Wind"
quest_191.PrefaceText: How to depict the Wind symbol? Its mysteries are limited only by the forces of nature itself. You must delve ever deeper into the heart of the storm to comprehend the Wind.
quest_191.SuccessText: You got blustered until you realized the Wind symbol.

quest_19101.Description: Brianna Willer in Serbule Hills said, "My bitchy old friend Gretchen taught me a special brewing recipe. I'm eager to try it, but it needs potatoes. I hate growing potatoes! You do it."
quest_19101.Name: Potato Beer?
quest_19101.PrefaceText: My bitchy old friend Gretchen taught me a special brewing recipe. I'm eager to try it, but it needs potatoes. I hate growing potatoes! You do it.
quest_19101.SuccessText:
Thanks. If you want to know how to make the stuff, I'm sure Gretchen in Eltibule can teach you. Just hang out and help her chop potatoes some time.

Oh, here, this is for you. Hold on to these! You need 'em for brewing beer.

quest_19102.Description: Brianna Willer in Serbule Hills said, "Sometimes delicious beer uses gross ingredients. Mushrooms, for instance! But I've found that my boletus-and-apple pale ale is incredibly delicious! I've just run out of boletus mushrooms. Can you gather some for me?"
quest_19102.Name: Mushrooms for Beer
quest_19102.PrefaceText: Sometimes delicious beer uses gross ingredients. Mushrooms, for instance! But I've found that my boletus-and-apple pale ale is incredibly delicious! I've just run out of boletus mushrooms. Can you gather some for me?
quest_19102.SuccessText:
Thanks. Now don't try to copy me: my boletus-and-apple ale is unique. Your beer will be different, even with the same ingredients!

Take these hops and don't lose 'em. You need hops for brewing beer, and they're not so easy to come by.

quest_19103.Description: Brianna Willer in Serbule Hills said, "Go over to the Tapestry Inn and ask Durstin what beer he wants to order for next month."
quest_19103.MidwayText:
My beer order? Oh, Brianna sent you. Hmm... Let me check.

I need a cheap lager for the regulars, a brown ale for Mr. Song-and-Dance Elf over there, and let me get a keg of goblin ale. Just in case it comes in handy.
quest_19103.Name: Collecting Keg Orders
quest_19103.PrefaceText: Go over to the Tapestry Inn and ask Durstin what beer he wants to order for next month.
quest_19103.SuccessText:
Three barrels? Sounds like Durstin's business is picking up! Finally, some good news!

Hold on to these hops. You need a ton of them for brewing.

quest_19104.Description:
Brianna Willer in Serbule Hills said, "I'm trying to brew a toxic beer. I know, I know, that's against the Council's Brewing Code of Ethics, but the Council's not here, and monsters are! If goblins find me, I want to give them kegs of beer that will make them sick enough that I can flee.

I'm still experimenting with the recipe, but I think a key ingredient is rotten strawberries. Not fresh ones -- they've gotta be really rotten. Dig me up some, okay?"
quest_19104.Name: Rotten Beer Needs Rotten Fruit
quest_19104.PrefaceText:
I'm trying to brew a toxic beer. I know, I know, that's against the Council's Brewing Code of Ethics, but the Council's not here, and monsters are! If goblins find me, I want to give them kegs of beer that will make them sick enough that I can flee.

I'm still experimenting with the recipe, but I think a key ingredient is rotten strawberries. Not fresh ones -- they've gotta be really rotten. Dig me up some, okay?
quest_19104.SuccessText:
Whew. Gross! Yeah, these strawberries are rotten enough. I'll get them into the brew right away, thanks. Here's some coins to cover any expenses, or whatever.

And here's some hops. Don't lose these! They're hard to come by. You need them for brewing beer.

quest_192.Description: If you knew how to catch fish with angling, you could study them better while they were dangling on the line. Yes, that's it: you must angle some fishes to master the Fish symbol.
quest_192.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Fish"
quest_192.PrefaceText: If you knew how to catch fish with angling, you could study them better while they were dangling on the line. Yes, that's it: you must angle some fishes to master the Fish symbol.
quest_192.SuccessText: You caught enough fish to truly comprehend the Fish symbol.

quest_19201.Description:
Paul Vaughn in Serbule Hills said, "You know the only good thing about staying here? It's the food! I know, most of it's nothing to write home about. But some days, Durstin makes his fried mycena bites, and they are delicious! They're my one weakness, really. I could eat a million of 'em!

Sadly, Durstin's not made any in a while. He offered to teach me the recipe so I could make 'em myself, but that's way too much work! Say... you wanna do it for me?"
quest_19201.Name: Paul's Mycena Weakness
quest_19201.PrefaceText:
You know the only good thing about staying here? It's the food! I know, most of it's nothing to write home about. But some days, Durstin makes his fried mycena bites, and they are delicious! They're my one weakness, really. I could eat a million of 'em!

Sadly, Durstin's not made any in a while. He offered to teach me the recipe so I could make 'em myself, but that's way too much work! Say... you wanna do it for me?
quest_19201.SuccessText: Oh yes. Hot mycena bites! So simple! Yet so delicious! Thanks!

quest_19202.Description: Paul Vaughn in Serbule Hills said, "This is gonna sound silly. But you know that watery beer Durstin sells? I found a way to improve it: strawberry juice! I just need a few strawberries for each cup. If you have some, I'll buy 'em from you for... I dunno, ten times their value!"
quest_19202.Name: Paul's Beer Additive
quest_19202.PrefaceText: This is gonna sound silly. But you know that watery beer Durstin sells? I found a way to improve it: strawberry juice! I just need a few strawberries for each cup. If you have some, I'll buy 'em from you for... I dunno, ten times their value!
quest_19202.SuccessText: Thank you! Oh, I said I'd pay you, right? Well, here's what I have. Sorry, I just don't have any more money than that! You can't get blood from a stone! Oh, fine, let me throw in some lumber. Everybody likes lumber!

quest_19203.Description:
Paul Vaughn in Serbule Hills said, "The lumber camps east of here were made by humans. I helped build the fences myself! But then goblins came and ran us out, and now they're chopping our wood!

Goblins have huge numbers on their side, but most goblins are stupid. To really hurt 'em, you gotta kill the overseers! Look for the mage-casting goblins in the camps, and kill 'em.

And hey, if you want help with how to attack the camps, just ask me."
quest_19203.Name: The Logging Camp Overseers
quest_19203.PrefaceText:
The lumber camps east of here were made by humans. I helped build the fences myself! But then goblins came and ran us out, and now they're chopping our wood!

Goblins have huge numbers on their side, but most goblins are stupid. To really hurt 'em, you gotta kill the overseers! Look for the mage-casting goblins in the camps, and kill 'em.

And hey, if you want help with how to attack the camps, just ask me.
quest_19203.SuccessText:
You killed the overseers? Great job! I'm sure they'll send up some new ones soon enough, but that'll slow 'em down for a few days. If we keep it up, they'll abandon the camps out here and retreat back into Sedgewick Forest!

Here's a reward for the good news you brought me.

quest_19204.Description:
Paul Vaughn in Serbule Hills said, "I was one of the last lumberjacks to leave our logging camp. Thought I could hold out against some lousy goblins, but they just kept coming! Eventually I had to run. I left behind a lot of great beer, which I'm sure is all gone by now. But more importantly, I left behind my lucky belt buckle. I'd really like it back.

The camps are east of here, over some hills. The buckle is in the northernmost camp, if that helps."
quest_19204.Name: Paul's Lucky Buckle
quest_19204.PrefaceText:
I was one of the last lumberjacks to leave our logging camp. Thought I could hold out against some lousy goblins, but they just kept coming! Eventually I had to run. I left behind a lot of great beer, which I'm sure is all gone by now. But more importantly, I left behind my lucky belt buckle. I'd really like it back.

The camps are east of here, over some hills. The buckle is in the northernmost camp, if that helps.
quest_19204.SuccessText: My dad gave me this buckle. I don't wear it, 'cuz it'd get scuffed up. But it's the only thing the deadbeat gave me before he died. So thanks. I mean it.

quest_193.Description: Unless and until you can become a bat yourself, there's just no way you can master the trick Bat symbol.
quest_193.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Bat"
quest_193.PrefaceText: Unless and until you can become a bat yourself, there's just no way you can master the trick Bat symbol.
quest_193.SuccessText: You lived as a bat long enough to comprehend the Bat symbol!

quest_19301.Description:
Baroness Marith Felgard in Serbule Hills said, "The goblins are keeping the ranalon very focused on their west flank. The eastern flank, the one facing us, has only a handful of guards. If we attack it, they'll have to split their forces up more, giving the goblins a better chance to take them out for us.

Focus on the guards at the outpost down the road. That will get their attention. I will pay you 350 Councils if you kill six of them."
quest_19301.Name: Distracting the Ranalon
quest_19301.PrefaceText:
The goblins are keeping the ranalon very focused on their west flank. The eastern flank, the one facing us, has only a handful of guards. If we attack it, they'll have to split their forces up more, giving the goblins a better chance to take them out for us.

Focus on the guards at the outpost down the road. That will get their attention. I will pay you 350 Councils if you kill six of them.
quest_19301.SuccessText: Good work. And yes, I know, trying to help the bloody goblins is terrible... but the enemy of my enemy is an ally. Let's hope the goblins make a move soon.

quest_19302.Description: Baroness Marith Felgard in Serbule Hills said, "We need to slow down the ranalon food production. They have a massive number of farmers in those lakes. Dispatch them! I shall reward you with 500 Councils."
quest_19302.Name: Attacking Ranalon Farms
quest_19302.PrefaceText: We need to slow down the ranalon food production. They have a massive number of farmers in those lakes. Dispatch them! I shall reward you with 500 Councils.
quest_19302.SuccessText: Excellent work. There will be more gardeners when the next clutch hatches, but we slowed them down for a little while.

quest_19303.Description: Baroness Marith Felgard in Serbule Hills said, "The ranalon have a sort of outdoor temple near the lake. You'll know it by the two large stone obelisks sticking out of the water nearby. Go there and slay the prayermaster and his minions. The prayer-master is an important leader, and his death will cause chaos among their ranks. I shall pay you 400 Councils."
quest_19303.Name: Clearing the Ranalon Temple
quest_19303.PrefaceText: The ranalon have a sort of outdoor temple near the lake. You'll know it by the two large stone obelisks sticking out of the water nearby. Go there and slay the prayermaster and his minions. The prayer-master is an important leader, and his death will cause chaos among their ranks. I shall pay you 400 Councils.
quest_19303.SuccessText: Good. Here's the money, but I had better not hear complaints about how I 'incited terror amongst the devout', understand? Let's keep this little skirmish between us.

quest_19304.Description: Baroness Marith Felgard in Serbule Hills said, "I know that most of the farms in Serbule Hills have been abandoned, but I still need to soil samples from each one. It's part of my scientific duties, you understand. Here. Put a bit of soil from each farm in here and bring it back. Simple as cake! And I shall award you 700 Councils."
quest_19304.Name: Serbule Hills Farm Samples

Objectives.Description: Get Soil from Brianna Willer's Farm
Get Soil from Julius Patton's Farm
Get Soil from Abandoned North Farm
Get Soil from Farm in Ranalon Territory
Get Soil from Farm in Goblin Territory

quest_19304.PrefaceText: I know that most of the farms in Serbule Hills have been abandoned, but I still need to soil samples from each one. It's part of my scientific duties, you understand. Here. Put a bit of soil from each farm in here and bring it back. Simple as cake! And I shall award you 700 Councils.
quest_19304.SuccessText: Very good. These soil samples will tell me how viable each farm is for future crops. I'm thinking about the future, you see! Here is your payment.

quest_194.Description: If only they had fewer legs! The Spider symbol has proven elusive. But perhaps... Yes, perhaps if you were yourself a spider, and lived as one for some time. Could it work?
quest_194.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Spider"
quest_194.PrefaceText: If only they had fewer legs! The Spider symbol has proven elusive. But perhaps... Yes, perhaps if you were yourself a spider, and lived as one for some time. Could it work?
quest_194.SuccessText: You lived as a spider until you knew the essence of the Spider symbol!

quest_19401.Description: Sammie Grimspine in Serbule Hills said, "Some of my calligraphy projects require unusual paper. Right now I've been experimenting with paper made out of watercress! Do you happen to have any? And don't worry about freshness: I'm going to pound it into a paste anyway."
quest_19401.Name: Cress Paper
quest_19401.PrefaceText: Some of my calligraphy projects require unusual paper. Right now I've been experimenting with paper made out of watercress! Do you happen to have any? And don't worry about freshness: I'm going to pound it into a paste anyway.
quest_19401.SuccessText:
Thanks! These should make a few pieces of cress paper. It gives a nice old-timey feel to my calligraphy.

Oh, here. This is the runt of my sword collection, and nothing too special, but I thought you might find it useful.

quest_19402.Description: Sammie Grimspine in Serbule Hills said, "Oh my gosh I really could use some grapes! They're my favorite snack. I should learn to grow them myself or something. Have you seen any?"
quest_19402.Name: Grapes for Sammie
quest_19402.PrefaceText: Oh my gosh I really could use some grapes! They're my favorite snack. I should learn to grow them myself or something. Have you seen any?
quest_19402.SuccessText: You got me grapes? Oh, that's so sweet of you!

quest_19403.Description: Sammie Grimspine in Serbule Hills said, "I heard that goblins took the logging camps to the northeast... and that they're using fairies as slaves! So terrible! Now, I could never condone killing anybody, but IF a slave were to HAPPEN to perish, and if they had cold iron shackles in good condition, and IF those shackles made it back to me, I would be very grateful. Not that I want you to kill anybody, though! No no no. Just... be on the lookout for cold iron shackles. That's all."
quest_19403.Name: Cold Iron Shackles
quest_19403.PrefaceText: I heard that goblins took the logging camps to the northeast... and that they're using fairies as slaves! So terrible! Now, I could never condone killing anybody, but IF a slave were to HAPPEN to perish, and if they had cold iron shackles in good condition, and IF those shackles made it back to me, I would be very grateful. Not that I want you to kill anybody, though! No no no. Just... be on the lookout for cold iron shackles. That's all.
quest_19403.SuccessText:
Oh, these are cold iron all right. And just about dwarf-sized. Perfect! Thanks. What? Oh, no, I just wanted them for... um, a project I'm working on. A special ink! Right, they're for a special ink.

Let me show you some sword techniques I learned back home.

quest_19404.Description: Sammie Grimspine in Serbule Hills said, "You know those flying monsters the ranalon have? Those 'scray'? Yeah. Well, I need a stinger from one. If you find one, bring it to me!"
quest_19404.Name: A Scray Stinger
quest_19404.PrefaceText: You know those flying monsters the ranalon have? Those 'scray'? Yeah. Well, I need a stinger from one. If you find one, bring it to me!
quest_19404.SuccessText:
Good, the hollow tube is still intact. Oh, no no no, I would never poison anybody! I'm going to use it as a drip-tube for water. For... um, for a project. Yes.

Here, let me show you some calligraphy tips. This trick will really make your writing beautiful!

quest_195.Description: How can the Butterfly symbol truly capture the essence of the wind? It can't: that's the job of the Wind symbol! Even so, you must understand the way the wind works on the subject. It wouldn't take but a moment to understand it, if only you were a butterfly yourself!
quest_195.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Butterfly"

Objectives.Description: Say "I am the wind!" in chat whilst a Butterfly

quest_195.PrefaceText: How can the Butterfly symbol truly capture the essence of the wind? It can't: that's the job of the Wind symbol! Even so, you must understand the way the wind works on the subject. It wouldn't take but a moment to understand it, if only you were a butterfly yourself!
quest_195.SuccessText: You discovered the powerful Butterfly symbol technique!

quest_19501.Description: Julius Patton in Serbule Hills said, "I used to grow veggies myself, but I don't move as smoothly as I used to. Gotta save my energy for the grapes! Which means I'm in a bit of an embarrassing situation: I need to restock my larder with onions. Can you grow some for me?"
quest_19501.Name: A Crop of Onions
quest_19501.PrefaceText: I used to grow veggies myself, but I don't move as smoothly as I used to. Gotta save my energy for the grapes! Which means I'm in a bit of an embarrassing situation: I need to restock my larder with onions. Can you grow some for me?
quest_19501.SuccessText: Thank you! Nothing like a good onion to go in an omelete, am I right? Let me show you how I make my omeletes. Could be useful to you.

quest_19502.Description: Julius Patton in Serbule Hills said, "Do you know how to make spore bombs? I need some nice potent ones. I use 'em to scare away pests that get on the farm."
quest_19502.Name: Spore Bombs for Julius
quest_19502.PrefaceText: Do you know how to make spore bombs? I need some nice potent ones. I use 'em to scare away pests that get on the farm.
quest_19502.SuccessText: Ahh! Yep, those will do. Thank you! Now as long as the critters stay small, I'm all set. Say, did I ever tell you about the time I saw a giant wolf prowling out in the field at night? Biggest damned wolf! It was a full moon so I could see it perfectly. And I swear... it was eating my grapes! What a wolf would want with grapes, I can't guess. But I know these spore bombs would just piss it off! Haha! Oh, since I'm talking your ear off anyway, let me teach you the best way to throw one of these bombs.

quest_19503.Description: Julius Patton in Serbule Hills said, "Man, I wish I had a watercress salad for lunch! The spice, with a hint of vinegar dressing... delicious! But I'm just getting myself worked up for nothing. I don't have any of the ingredients on hand!"
quest_19503.Name: Watercress Salad
quest_19503.PrefaceText: Man, I wish I had a watercress salad for lunch! The spice, with a hint of vinegar dressing... delicious! But I'm just getting myself worked up for nothing. I don't have any of the ingredients on hand!
quest_19503.SuccessText: You made me a watercress salad? That was... weirdly kind of you. Thank you. Well, here. You like grapes?

quest_19504.Description:
Julius Patton in Serbule Hills said, "I loaned old Vera my best garden spade a year ago. Then, of course, she was killed and horrifically eaten by goblins. But my spade might still be in her house! If I was braver, I'd go look for it.

Vera's farm is northeast of here."
quest_19504.Name: The Lost Spade
quest_19504.PrefaceText:
I loaned old Vera my best garden spade a year ago. Then, of course, she was killed and horrifically eaten by goblins. But my spade might still be in her house! If I was braver, I'd go look for it.

Vera's farm is northeast of here.
quest_19504.SuccessText: Spadey! You found Spadey! Thank you! I made a new spade, of course, but it's just not the same. Here, you can keep Spadey II. And let me give you some gardening tips to go with it!

quest_19601.Description: Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "I know my wife gave one of the chapters to old Julius Patton. He lives on the farm nearby. He's not a bad sort; explain things to him and see if he'll give the chapter to you."
quest_19601.MidwayText:
So Durstin's trying to put the book back together, huh? I guess it's part of the healing process.

Yeah, Durstin really messed up! His wife was on her deathbed and he went and slept with her best friend. He was so ashamed. His wife forgave him before she died, though. And I guess he's forgiven himself now, too. Let me get those pages for ya.
quest_19601.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 1
quest_19601.PrefaceText: I know my wife gave one of the chapters to old Julius Patton. He lives on the farm nearby. He's not a bad sort; explain things to him and see if he'll give the chapter to you.
quest_19601.SuccessText: Thanks. I have info on another chapter, if you're interested in helping more.

quest_19602.Description:
Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "I know exactly where this chapter is. Well, not exactly. There used to be a caretaker that lived on a hill south of here. George left years ago, but he told me he kept a chapter of the book in a box somewhere on his farm.

There's some dwarf living there now by the name of Sammie. Go search around the place, see if you can find the chapter."
quest_19602.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 2
quest_19602.PrefaceText:
I know exactly where this chapter is. Well, not exactly. There used to be a caretaker that lived on a hill south of here. George left years ago, but he told me he kept a chapter of the book in a box somewhere on his farm.

There's some dwarf living there now by the name of Sammie. Go search around the place, see if you can find the chapter.
quest_19602.SuccessText: Thanks. I have info on another chapter, if you're interested in helping more.

quest_19603.Description:
Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "One of the chapters is in that old spider-infested cave northeast of here. Tyler -- the drunk over there in the corner -- said he saw them when he was exploring, but he didn't think the pages were worth anything. And now he's too afraid to go back in.

He said they were on top of some cobweb-encrusted crates deep in the cave. I'll pay extra for that one, since it sounds dangerous."
quest_19603.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 3
quest_19603.PrefaceText:
One of the chapters is in that old spider-infested cave northeast of here. Tyler -- the drunk over there in the corner -- said he saw them when he was exploring, but he didn't think the pages were worth anything. And now he's too afraid to go back in.

He said they were on top of some cobweb-encrusted crates deep in the cave. I'll pay extra for that one, since it sounds dangerous.
quest_19603.SuccessText: Thanks. I have info on another chapter, if you're interested in helping more.

quest_19604.Description: Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "My wife's diary says one of the chapters is hidden at her favorite reading spot. I guess that'd be the old watchtower overlooking the Serbule Hunting Lodge. Not a very safe reading spot these days! It's on a hill. Go past the lodge and climb the hills a little south of it."
quest_19604.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 4
quest_19604.PrefaceText: My wife's diary says one of the chapters is hidden at her favorite reading spot. I guess that'd be the old watchtower overlooking the Serbule Hunting Lodge. Not a very safe reading spot these days! It's on a hill. Go past the lodge and climb the hills a little south of it.
quest_19604.SuccessText: Thanks. Soon we'll have them all, and I can put this part of my life behind me.

quest_19605.Description: Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "That old bi-- err, old biddy Brianna Willer has one of the chapters. But she won't give it to me. Says my wife deserved... well, she won't give it to me. Can you snoop around her farm, see if you can find it?"
quest_19605.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 5

Objectives.Description: Find chapter on Brianna Willer's farm

quest_19605.PrefaceText: That old bi-- err, old biddy Brianna Willer has one of the chapters. But she won't give it to me. Says my wife deserved... well, she won't give it to me. Can you snoop around her farm, see if you can find it?
quest_19605.SuccessText: Thanks. I'm glad you could find it. Brianna's stubborn, but I guess in her own way, she's dutiful to her friends.

quest_19606.Description: Durstin Tallow in Serbule Hills said, "[Durstin sighs.] Very bad news. I was talking to Paul the lumberjack -- he's around here somewhere -- and he knew where the last chapter was. He said it was hidden in a box near the lumber mills east of here. So he went to go get it for me... and he ran into a pack of boars on the way back. And here's the kicker: one of the boars ate the pages! Paul's scared stiff of this boar. He called it 'Mudtusks'. Seems to think it's tougher than a usual boar. But a boar's a boar, right? I think if you hurry you could get the pages out of its belly. I'll pay extra! Hurry!"
quest_19606.Name: 'Leeka and the Blade Trials' Chapter 6
quest_19606.PrefaceText: [Durstin sighs.] Very bad news. I was talking to Paul the lumberjack -- he's around here somewhere -- and he knew where the last chapter was. He said it was hidden in a box near the lumber mills east of here. So he went to go get it for me... and he ran into a pack of boars on the way back. And here's the kicker: one of the boars ate the pages! Paul's scared stiff of this boar. He called it 'Mudtusks'. Seems to think it's tougher than a usual boar. But a boar's a boar, right? I think if you hurry you could get the pages out of its belly. I'll pay extra! Hurry!
quest_19606.SuccessText: You found them! Well, they're not in good shape, but they're legible. That should be good enough.

quest_19701.Description: Solgribue in the Fae Realm said, "Need more aquamarine gems. Need... hmm... four. Plus one extra."
quest_19701.Name: Aquamarine Gems for Solgribue
quest_19701.PrefaceText: Need more aquamarine gems. Need... hmm... four. Plus one extra.
quest_19701.SuccessText: Very pretty little aquamarines! Solgribue is happy.

quest_19702.Description: Solgribue in the Fae Realm said, "Want to help troll friends? Help with spiders on fire! Walk around all over near Firebird Mountain. Very scary to trolls. You kill. Good relations."
quest_19702.Name: Spiders On Fire
quest_19702.PrefaceText: Want to help troll friends? Help with spiders on fire! Walk around all over near Firebird Mountain. Very scary to trolls. You kill. Good relations.
quest_19702.SuccessText: You kill spiders, Solgribue likes! Maybe tell troll friends you good. Maybe.

quest_19801.Description:
Trekker in Gazluk said, "Psst... you're with the Wardens? Whew! I was hoping backup would arrive!

A few days ago, teams of orcs from Gazluk Keep were up here clearing out their secret system of mountain trails. And today we found out that there are now hundreds of slimes in the southern valley! That has to be connected. Right?

Sometimes ice slimes fall down the mountain, but not in numbers like this. The animals that live in the valley don't know how to avoid ice slimes. They're sitting ducks! And deer, and goats, and other animals! Not to mention those dwarves that live in the New Prestonbule cave. Please help me lower the number of ice slicks down there!"
quest_19801.Name: Ice Slick Explosion

Objectives.Description: Kill [Huge or Normal] Ice Slicks in Southern Valley

quest_19801.PrefaceText:
Psst... you're with the Wardens? Whew! I was hoping backup would arrive!

A few days ago, teams of orcs from Gazluk Keep were up here clearing out their secret system of mountain trails. And today we found out that there are now hundreds of slimes in the southern valley! That has to be connected. Right?
