Sometimes ice slimes fall down the mountain, but not in numbers like this. The animals that live in the valley don't know how to avoid ice slimes. They're sitting ducks! And deer, and goats, and other animals! Not to mention those dwarves that live in the New Prestonbule cave. Please help me lower the number of ice slicks down there!
quest_19801.SuccessText: You're back! I just got back myself a bit ago. There's still more slimes than I'm happy with, but I think I can take it from here. I appreciate your backup! Here, take this, nobody'll miss it.

quest_19802.Description:
Trekker in Gazluk said, "Am I glad to see you! This one's too tough for me. Apparently the orcs of Gazluk Keep have a barghest breeding program, and last night they released their excess animals. Suddenly there's hundreds of barghests south of the keep! And they're hungry. We can't let them settle up here or they'll destroy the delicate ecosystem, and eat me.

Don't worry, these aren't true barghests -- these are just animals. Big dogs! You can take 'em! I mean, I can't, but you can!"
quest_19802.Name: Barghests Loose

Objectives.Description: Kill Barghests in the Mountains South of Gazluk Keep

quest_19802.PrefaceText:
Am I glad to see you! This one's too tough for me. Apparently the orcs of Gazluk Keep have a barghest breeding program, and last night they released their excess animals. Suddenly there's hundreds of barghests south of the keep! And they're hungry. We can't let them settle up here or they'll destroy the delicate ecosystem, and eat me.

Don't worry, these aren't true barghests -- these are just animals. Big dogs! You can take 'em! I mean, I can't, but you can!
quest_19802.SuccessText: I hope you got enough of them! Maybe you should check in on me tomorrow... see if I got eaten. Nah, nah, I'm kidding, I'll be fine. Thanks! Want a shiny rock?

quest_19803.Description:
Trekker in Gazluk said, "I'm so glad you could make it! It's mummies!

I was patrolling near the mouth of Foothills Cave in the far northwest, and mummies were pouring out! At first I thought they were activated by some evil necromancer, but they aren't marching anywhere. They're... well, they're just wandering around killing things. And they're trampling the delicate vegetation! And also they're fucking MUMMIES! I don't even know how to kill a mummy. I'm just a pig. I didn't sign up for this!"
quest_19803.Name: Mummy Outbreak!
quest_19803.PrefaceText:
I'm so glad you could make it! It's mummies!

I was patrolling near the mouth of Foothills Cave in the far northwest, and mummies were pouring out! At first I thought they were activated by some evil necromancer, but they aren't marching anywhere. They're... well, they're just wandering around killing things. And they're trampling the delicate vegetation! And also they're fucking MUMMIES! I don't even know how to kill a mummy. I'm just a pig. I didn't sign up for this!
quest_19803.SuccessText: Thanks. Um, when you report in, can you not tell them mummies creep me out? I'd never hear the end of it! Here. Take these warming rocks as a bribe. Don't worry, Fluffikins said they're safe.

quest_19901.Description:
Lumpfuzz in the Ilmari Desert said, "So yeah, thanks for coming. I heard about this from that elf seer across town: part of the desert is coated in giant spiders that are, like, mated with tornados? I don't understand it, but wherever the spiders walk, the tornados go too. And the elf says that they've come topside to lay their eggs in the wind to scatter far and wide. That's not good.

I've been out killin' em all morning, but there's plenty left for you! Claws and fangs don't work too well, but they go down with some lightning bolts. Head southeast, you'll hear 'em before you see 'em."
quest_19901.Name: Tornadoes and Spiders!
quest_19901.PrefaceText:
So yeah, thanks for coming. I heard about this from that elf seer across town: part of the desert is coated in giant spiders that are, like, mated with tornados? I don't understand it, but wherever the spiders walk, the tornados go too. And the elf says that they've come topside to lay their eggs in the wind to scatter far and wide. That's not good.

I've been out killin' em all morning, but there's plenty left for you! Claws and fangs don't work too well, but they go down with some lightning bolts. Head southeast, you'll hear 'em before you see 'em.
quest_19901.SuccessText: Hopefully not too many spiders laid eggs before we managed to kill 'em. But I guess if they hatch, I'll see you back out here. Until next time, pal.

quest_19902.Description:
Lumpfuzz in the Ilmari Desert said, "Okay, so the rakkies in the southwest have been breeding extra-vicious sand dogs. You need to kill those.

Look, I know what this sounds like and I don't want to hear it. Those sand dogs aren't like us... they're not even mammals! They're dinosaurs or something! Wardens hate dinosaurs, right? Well... they aren't native to here! They're disrupting the natural order and shit.

Look, the bandits were already a big problem for Amulna, and now they're much worse. And those sand dogs creep me out. Just fill out the forms however you need to, but those freaks need to go."
quest_19902.Name: Sand Dogs of Doom
quest_19902.PrefaceText:
Okay, so the rakkies in the southwest have been breeding extra-vicious sand dogs. You need to kill those.

Look, I know what this sounds like and I don't want to hear it. Those sand dogs aren't like us... they're not even mammals! They're dinosaurs or something! Wardens hate dinosaurs, right? Well... they aren't native to here! They're disrupting the natural order and shit.

Look, the bandits were already a big problem for Amulna, and now they're much worse. And those sand dogs creep me out. Just fill out the forms however you need to, but those freaks need to go.
quest_19902.SuccessText:
Thanks. We're fighting the good fight here. And don't worry, most of those sand dogs are dumb as shit. And the ones that can talk? Super racist. Against werewolves, at least.

I'll clean up the rest when the sun sets. You can get outta here.

quest_19903.Description:
Lumpfuzz in the Ilmari Desert said, "Ever seen a wave of nature elementals? Well they're right here, so take a look outside. They're coming from the west.

I'll stay here and protect the citizens from any that manage to make it to town. In the mean time you can pick off their numbers. Just remember: they hate lightning. You know what to do."
quest_19903.Name: March of the Elementals
quest_19903.PrefaceText:
Ever seen a wave of nature elementals? Well they're right here, so take a look outside. They're coming from the west.

I'll stay here and protect the citizens from any that manage to make it to town. In the mean time you can pick off their numbers. Just remember: they hate lightning. You know what to do.
quest_19903.SuccessText: So I overheard the elven seer talking about nature elementals. She says they only form when certain types of magic erupt. And she's never seen this many spontaneously appear before. So there's something bad going on down beneath town... but that's not a "today" problem. That's a "some other day" problem. Here's something I got for ya.

quest_2.Description: Find all 6 gravestones in the little graveyard nearby.
quest_2.Name: Find Gravestones

quest_20.Description: Maybe you should talk to Harry about how to fix your unfortunate cow-hood. If there's one person who knows animal transformation curses, it's Harry.
quest_20.Name: Talk to Someone Who Knows

quest_20001.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked for Ice Cores.
quest_20001.Name: Ice Cores for Landri the Cold
quest_20001.PrefaceText: I need more Ice Cores to research better cold spells. Do you happen to have any?
quest_20001.SuccessText: Thank you! Here's something for your trouble. If you find more, come back in a week. I'm sure I'll need more soon enough.

quest_20002.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked you to cull the Fire Sheep that have been recently appearing up in Kur.
quest_20002.Name: Anomalous Fire Sheep

Objectives.Description: Kill Fire Sheep in Kur Mountains

quest_20002.PrefaceText: Have you seen those damned sheep that are always on fire? It's genetic, apparently. Some insane wizard did something to them and let fire sheep loose on the land. A stray fire sheep must have made its way here and started mating with the local population. Unfortunately it's dominant, so we need to cull these before it gets too widespread.
quest_20002.SuccessText: Good, good. Wizards have a bad enough reputation without passersby dying from sheep explosions. Here, maybe this old staff will be of use to you.

quest_20003.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked for Saltpeter.
quest_20003.Name: Saltpeter for Landri the Cold
quest_20003.PrefaceText: I know it's quite rare, but I might as well ask: have you stumbled on any extra saltpeter? I'm trying to master a few fire spells I missed. Just for completeness' sake, you understand.
quest_20003.SuccessText: Perfect! Thank you. Here, take a few of these.

quest_201.Description: The heft of the battlehammer is not quite coming through in your Hammer (Weapon) symbol. In fact, you aren't managing to capture the calloused hands of the user or the heavy sweat on their brow. You're going to need to get up close and personal with the subject.
quest_201.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Hammer (Weapon)"
quest_201.PrefaceText: The heft of the battlehammer is not quite coming through in your Hammer (Weapon) symbol. In fact, you aren't managing to capture the calloused hands of the user or the heavy sweat on their brow. You're going to need to get up close and personal with the subject.
quest_201.SuccessText: You hammered until you could depict the Hammer (Weapon) symbol.

quest_20101.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Tufts of Fur.
quest_20101.Name: Ukorga's Fur Order
quest_20101.PrefaceText: I'm trying to fill this order for fur-lined coats. I don't get many orders, you know? Pretty satisfying knowing my reputation's getting around. Trouble is, I'm out of fur to finish the last one. Can you get me some?
quest_20101.SuccessText: Thanks! Uh, here, take these as trade.

quest_20102.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Cedar Wood Chips to keep the kitchen stocked.
quest_20102.Name: Keep the Kitchen Stocked
quest_20102.PrefaceText:
I didn't lay in enough cedar wood chips for all the cooking that Laura's been doing. She brings in lots of customers and I don't want her to get upset!

I have plenty of maple wood, but she only uses cedar for cooking. Can you get some more?
quest_20102.SuccessText: Perfect! You're the best! Here, take this old thing. It looks good on you!

quest_20103.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Wool.
quest_20103.Name: Wool Supply
quest_20103.PrefaceText: Hey can you go get some wool off the mountain sheep? Don't bother trying to shear them, they'll just kick your ass. You have to take 'em out. All the docile sheep live in pleasant territory. The sheep here are all assholes.
quest_20103.SuccessText: Thanks, that's plenty. Got lots more pairs of pants to insulate! Here, take this.

quest_20104.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you to procure some nice chairs.
quest_20104.Name: Better Chairs
quest_20104.PrefaceText: Nobody likes sitting on the stools in here. I wish I had better chairs. Real nice ones! But I don't know how to make those.
quest_20104.SuccessText: You did it, thank you! I'll just take these into the back and let them sit for a few days while I pretend to make them. No offense, I just have to keep up appearances! But here. This is something I did make.

quest_20105.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for lots of Trophy Wolf Skins.
quest_20105.Name: Trophy Wolves
quest_20105.PrefaceText: I've been making these crazy wolf-hood hats, right? And they're really popular. But I haven't got any more wolf pelts. Whenever I try to skin them, it doesn't come out right. Are you good at skinning wolves? Care to help me out? I'll pay handsomely.
quest_20105.SuccessText: Thanks! Perfect! You're really good at skinning wolves. Here, let me pay you for those. And let me show you a couple of leatherworking pointers, too!

quest_20106.Description: Ukorga asked you to collect some Unrefined Silver Ore.
quest_20106.Name: Silver Ore for Swords
quest_20106.PrefaceText: Hey, you any good at mining? There's silver ore out there in the lowlands, just waiting to be mined! But I don't know how to do that part. I can smelt it, though. Tell you what, bring me some, and I'll give you one of my special silvered swords.
quest_20106.SuccessText: That's the stuff. Here's your sword, hope you like it!

quest_20201.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you to kill nearby deer to reduce the predator food supply.
quest_20201.Name: Thin The Food Supply
quest_20201.PrefaceText: So here's the thing: nature takes care of itself, usually. But when fifty werewolves show up, not so much. The prey is so abundant that they're mating like crazy. Let's try to work smarter: try killing a bunch of deer so they can't eat 'em. That's smart, right? Or is it stupid? Hmm.
quest_20201.SuccessText: Good. Now we wait a year and see how many werewolves are born! Damn. Yeah, this was a stupid plan. Nevermind. Take these shoes and let's pretend this never happened.

quest_20202.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you to collect a bunch of Wolfsbane.
quest_20202.Name: Wolfsbane Needed
quest_20202.PrefaceText: Wolfsbane is this horrible poisonous flower that grows in the winter months. You should be able to find some around here. It's good for killin' wolves... and werewolves. There's a lot of ways to use it, and I'll show you one technique if you get me some.
quest_20202.SuccessText: Yep, this is the shit. Okay, so here's what you do. You take a mushroom bomb, see, and...

quest_20203.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you for wool
quest_20203.Name: Wooly Needs
quest_20203.PrefaceText: Can you go head to the plains south of here and kill some of those idiot sheep for wool? I'm trying to make better equipment since apparently we're gonna be stuck here a while...
quest_20203.SuccessText: Thanks! Here, this is for you.

quest_20204.Description:
Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains said, "You're the Warden they sent? Good. Little Red told us to contact you if the forest werewolves seemed to be acting more intelligently.

The caves near here are full of werewolves, but usually only a few wander out into the woods. Until today. Scores more poured out. They're still fighting mindlessly, but something is up.

Sanja and me have killed our fill and need a bit of rest before we go again. Hopefully you can pick up the slack."
quest_20204.Name: Werewolf Overflow
quest_20204.PrefaceText:
You're the Warden they sent? Good. Little Red told us to contact you if the forest werewolves seemed to be acting more intelligently.

The caves near here are full of werewolves, but usually only a few wander out into the woods. Until today. Scores more poured out. They're still fighting mindlessly, but something is up.

Sanja and me have killed our fill and need a bit of rest before we go again. Hopefully you can pick up the slack.
quest_20204.SuccessText: Impressive work! Now I'm starting to understand why the Wardens exist. And don't worry: I may be a human, but I'm no snitch. I promised to keep your organization secret, and I will. So nobody'll ever know about your heroism today. Except us. Here, it's for you. I hope collars aren't offensive or nothin'.

quest_20301.Description: Sanja in the Kur Mountains asked you to kill the mindless werewolves in the forest.
quest_20301.Name: Werewolves
quest_20301.PrefaceText: A favor for me? Help me finish my objective here: kill all these mindless werewolves!
quest_20301.SuccessText: That helped. Not enough, but a start. Thank you. I don't have much, but here's some coin.

quest_20302.Description: Sanja in the Kur Mountains asked you to bring her some raw venison.
quest_20302.Name: Deer Meat
quest_20302.PrefaceText: I hunger. I should go kill deer... but I need to stay here for a bit longer. Can you bring me a few carcasses?
quest_20302.SuccessText: Thank you. Do you use potions? I don't, but Jace brought a supply for me anyway. Here, take this.

quest_20303.Description: Sanja in the Kur Mountains asked you to ruthlessly kill some mountain bears in her name.
quest_20303.Name: Bear Massacre
quest_20303.PrefaceText: Those bears attack even stronger predators! They need to be shown their place. But I don't dare waver in my goal. You, however, might be able to waver a little bit? Just a tad? Make them suffer.
quest_20303.SuccessText: Yes. Good! Do you like swords when in your other form? Here, take this spare.

quest_20304.Description: Sanja in the Kur Mountains asked you to find magic teeth from werewolves. They apparently are rather rare.
quest_20304.Name: Magic Teeth
quest_20304.PrefaceText: Werewolves who never leave wolf form eventually start leaking magic into their bones and organs. It's happened to me, and I quite like the feeling, but I wish to study the phenomenon more... without dissecting myself. See if you can find werewolves whose magic has bled into their teeth. I doubt they'll be too common, but please look around.
quest_20304.SuccessText: Ah, yes! I'll grind them to powder and see what I can figure out. Thank you. Here: a less-useful powder, but some mages like it.

quest_20401.Name: Find Spoons
quest_20401.PrefaceText: I thought I saw some spoons lying around here somewhere. They could be anywhere on the island, though. Can you see if you can find a couple? I want to use them in my art.
quest_20401.SuccessText: Thanks! These will be the faces of my marionettes! Here, want this pretty stone I found?

quest_205.Description: Without truly understanding its explosive portent, how could you ever hope to actualized the Bomb symbol?
quest_205.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Bomb"
quest_205.PrefaceText: Without truly understanding its explosive portent, how could you ever hope to actualized the Bomb symbol?
quest_205.SuccessText: You exploded enough to understand the Bomb symbol.

quest_20501.Description: Lamashu has asked for some oak wood.
quest_20501.Name: Lamashu Wants Lumber
quest_20501.PrefaceText: There's lots of good cedar here, and a little bit of maple, but no oak. You wouldn't happen to have oak wood with you, by chance?
quest_20501.SuccessText: Thanks! Let me show you a clever way to prepare oak planks. [You gain Carpentry XP.]

quest_20502.Description: Lamashu has asked for some meditation stools.
quest_20502.Name: Stool Order
quest_20502.PrefaceText: That drunkard Ukorga asked me to make him some meditation stools to decorate his inn. That'd be a waste of time. I need to focus on honing my skills! But I already told him I'd do it. Can I delegate that task to you?
quest_20502.SuccessText: Hmm, yep, these are decent, thanks! I'll give you the money Ukorga promised me for these stools.

quest_20601.Description: Gurki asked you for some Advanced Reservoir Arrows
quest_20601.Name: Arrows for the Occasion
quest_20601.PrefaceText: Shadow Keepers are lookin' for me. But they don't come up here, since it's a worthless hell hole. But if they do, I'm ready with my bow... except I'm out of arrows. Can you get me some good arrows for shootin' poison?
quest_20601.SuccessText: These will work. Thanks. Here's some coin. I don't expect to survive a fight with the Shadow Keepers, but I don't want to make it too easy, either.

quest_20602.Description: Gurki asked you for some Floral Soap.
quest_20602.Name: Smelly Gurki
quest_20602.PrefaceText: Ugh, I stink. I know it, you don't have to make that face! Ain't bathed in days. Ukorga's out of soap again. What a moron. You got any soap by chance?
quest_20602.SuccessText: Great. Now get lost so I can bathe. Here's some cash for your trouble.

quest_20603.Description: Gurki asked you to obtain some unrefined silver ore.
quest_20603.Name: Gurki Wants Silver
quest_20603.PrefaceText: Been working on a new tailoring technique where I inlay the cloth with silver. But I ain't got no silver left. Get me some?
quest_20603.SuccessText: Yep, that's the stuff. Here, take this. It was my first attempt, but I think I can do better.

quest_20604.Description: Gurki asked you for a Nice Calligraphy Bench
quest_20604.Name: A Bench For Writing
quest_20604.PrefaceText: Been drawing up new tailoring plans. Gotta keep my mind off the Shadow Keepers! But it's a bitch to draw anything in this frozen hellhole. What I wouldn't do for a nice calligraphy bench!
quest_20604.SuccessText: Wow, I didn't expect you to manage that. Thank you. Ain't got much to repay you with, but here's some tailoring supplies.

quest_207.Description: You know now that you'll need to practice with the bow if you ever want to properly render the twanginess of the Bow symbol.
quest_207.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Bow"
quest_207.PrefaceText: You know now that you'll need to practice with the bow if you ever want to properly render the twanginess of the Bow symbol.
quest_207.SuccessText: You practiced with the bow and discovered the secret of the Bow symbol.

quest_20701.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked for tundra lichen, which he believes grows in Kur.
quest_20701.Name: Lichens for Research
quest_20701.PrefaceText: The reason I'm here in Kur is the tundra lichen. They grow here, though I've not found very many. I need more tundra lichen for my research. If you see any, I will pay handsomely.
quest_20701.SuccessText:
Yes. This is the lichen. Thank you. With this acting as a power chamber, I should be able to break the dimensional barrier and discover entire new worlds of existence. But I need a lot more research to test my theory.

Sorry, I didn't mean to ramble. Here, take some coin for your work.

quest_20702.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked you to deliver a note to an elf named Landri the Cold. He said Landri was in an inn somewhere in Kur Mountains.
quest_20702.MidwayText: What's this? Landri takes the letter and reads it with incredible speed. Hm. A valid hypothesis, though I do not think it will work. Tell the author that she should substitute other elemental energy foci in place of ice foci. I believe that all the elemental planes are very close together, and using other energy types will open micro-portals to those planes, which may coalesce into a full portal more easily. And tell her good luck; she will need it.
quest_20702.Name: Ice Plane Research

Objectives.Description: Deliver a note to Landri the Cold

quest_20702.PrefaceText: There is a disgraced Ice Magus staying in that little inn on the mainland. Her theorycrafting is already spreading among outsiders, but her own society has vilified her, just for a single murder. Elven society is foolish. But no matter: I must take advantage of this opportunity. Unfortunately because of their rampant racism, I cannot walk into the inn and have a conversation. I would be attacked. Instead, please deliver this note for me.
quest_20702.SuccessText: You relay Landri the Cold's words. Thank you. Her theory is plausible. I will try my method first, but if it doesn't work, I'll try hers.

quest_20703.Description: You've been asked to obtain Fulgurites for Ratuk the Thinker.
quest_20703.Name: The Lightning Connection
quest_20703.PrefaceText: My experiments have proven fruitless. Landri's idea seems more compelling. But sadly I don't have any electricity power sources. Can you get me some? Fulgurite will do. Just look for creatures that inherently give off lightning. ... Admittedly there are probably none of those in Kur, but, well, if you end up travelling elsewhere... keep it in mind.

quest_20704.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked for some orcish spell pouches, which can occasionally be found on orcish wizards.
quest_20704.Name: Killing Kin
quest_20704.PrefaceText: I have a ... delicate request to make. You see, my spell pouch is depleted, and I cannot take the time to travel all the way home to replenish it. But there are other orcish wizards in the area, and some of them have spell pouches. Could you choose some of the stupider ones and kill them for their pouches? Make it look like an accident, if you can.
quest_20704.SuccessText: Hmm. Well these are low on sulfur, but they will do. Thank you, my friend. We shall not speak of this again, but when the time comes, I will remember who my friends are.

quest_20801.Description: Nelson Ballard in Serbule has asked you to obtain some cheese he ordered from a man in Eltibule Keep.
quest_20801.MidwayText: Oh, yes, the Veltan Blue for Mr. Ballard. Um. Well... The reason I haven't delivered it yet is because it isn't ready yet. He does understand that a custom blue cheese will take time to ripen, right? Obviously not. Tell him that I will bring him his cheese as soon as it is perfect, and not a moment before!
quest_20801.Name: Cheese Run
quest_20801.PrefaceText: Well if you're heading all the way out to Eltibule, could you stop by the keep and pick up my cheese from an Elf named Braigon? I need it right away, and I think he forgot about me.
quest_20801.SuccessText:
What? Not ready? It's been weeks! Cheese-making is so stupid.

I just wanted the Velten Blue because it was my wife's favorite, and tomorrow would have been our anniversary. I don't even like it!

You know what? Go tell him to cancel the order. No, no, don't do that. I already paid for the stuff. I'll just give it away when it finally arrives.

Thank-you. Here's a few coin for your trouble.

quest_20802.Description: Nelson Ballard asked you to deliver a Praetor's Order to a shady potion seller living in a tent outside of town.
quest_20802.MidwayText: What? A Praetor's Order? He seriously wants to issue a Praetor's Execution out here? In front of those Elves? What would they think? They'd revolt! No, he's just bluffing. Tell him I'm not going anywhere!
quest_20802.Name: The Trespassing Charlatan
quest_20802.PrefaceText: There was a charlatan visiting town a couple days ago. Well, his potions are magical, but Velkort said they were incredibly toxic. I ordered him to leave Serbule, but I hear he's still around somewhere, selling potions out of his tent. So now I have to make it official. Can you deliver this? It's a Praetor's Order, declaring him illegal in this area.
quest_20802.SuccessText:
He said he won't leave? Damn it. He's called my bluff: the only way to enforce a Praetor's Order is through execution. I could have an execution squad teleported in to dispatch him, but that would be a bit much for simple trespassing! Hm. Well, I'll think of something to get rid of him.

Thanks for helping with these errands! Here, you look handy with a sword, do you want this? It's my old backup blade. Maybe you'll find it useful.

quest_20803.Description: Nelson Ballard asked you to be on the lookout for a super-intelligent rat. If found, Nelson needs the rat's head decoration -- some sort of tiara or headband.
quest_20803.Name: The Rat Tiara
quest_20803.PrefaceText:
The nonsense I have to deal with. An Elf in town recently reported a theft of his magic headband. But get this: he said a super-intelligent rat stole it from him in the dead of night. Clearly more is going on here, but he won't say anything else.

And the frustrating part about this idiotic story is that I believe him! So, if you're travelling in the woods outside of town and you come across a super-intelligent rat with a tiara or something, can you bring it to me? I need to get to the bottom of this, and I think that head thing will be a useful bargaining chip.
quest_20803.SuccessText: This is it? This is the thing Echur wanted back? Huh. Well, thanks! Here, let me reward you. I don't have a lot of cash, but here's a Council Note.

quest_20901.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Syndra, who is residing somewhere in a barn in Kur Mountains. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Syndra to teach you her unusual craft skill.
quest_20901.MidwayText: Huh? Nightshade sent you? Really? Well... tell him thanks. I'm okay. Just... cold and miserable.
quest_20901.Name: Check In On Syndra
quest_20901.PrefaceText:
The easiest of my friends to find would probably be Syndra. She's in this frozen hell-hole somewhere. She said she'd found a shack or a barn or something, and it had a magical fire to keep her warm. That's all I know. But it's out there somewhere!

Find her, report back to me, and I'll help you convince her to train you in her special craft skill.
quest_20901.SuccessText: You found her and she's okay? Great! Are you a crafter? If so, I bet she'd be happy to teach you her craft. Tell her I vouch for you. If she needs proof, tell her you know her old guild nickname: "Frisky Ferret".

quest_20902.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Malgath, who is deep within a cave full of wolves. The cave is somewhere in the Kur Mountains. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Malgath to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20902.MidwayText: Nightshade sent you? Well, at least he didn't come after me himself. He'd die! Tell him I'm fine. I'm just infected with lycanthropy. I'm a werewolf now. I've just got to get this under control, and if I succeed, I'll come find him.
quest_20902.Name: Check In On Malgath
quest_20902.PrefaceText: Malgath was staying here with us at first, but one day he came back from hunting and said he was "infected". Said he had to go take care of his infection, and he moved into a cave not too far from here. I went to check on him a week ago, and the cave is full of wolves! Couldn't get very far in there. I guess he's dead... but if you find him in there, let me know. If he's still alive, I'll help you convince him to train you.
quest_20902.SuccessText: Malgath caught lycanthropy from a wolf?! What a moron! That's sexually transmitted, right? So he just went out and humped a wolf in the woods?! I didn't think rakkies went for that sort of... what? Oh. Transmitted through bites? So any of the wolves out there could be infected? Well, that's terrifying! I guess we just wait and see if Malgath retains his sanity. Hmm, are you a crafter by trade? If so, maybe you should go learn anything he's willing to teach you... while he's still sane. If he's reluctant to train you, tell him Nightshade is calling in a favor.

quest_20903.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his business associate Gribburn, a goblin who lives within Hogan's Keep in Eltibule. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Gribburn to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20903.MidwayText: Ah, Nightshade, I'd forgotten about him. He was a good business partner, but then he went and got a guild of human assassins after him. Tell him that his concern is appreciated, but misplaced. We've both moved on. I'm going to stay here: free food and a bed, and nobody's trying to kill me!
quest_20903.Name: Check In On Gribburn
quest_20903.PrefaceText:
You aren't racist, are you? The next one's a goblin. Don't kill him! He's the best helm-enchanter I know! Not exactly a friend, but he's friendly as far as goblins go. He went to visit his old "tribe", and ended up moving into some castle.

I'm worried he's doing stuff that will get him killed. You know, normal goblin stuff. Go see how he is. He's staying in a place called "Hogan's Keep". It's somewhere in Eltibule.

In return, I'll help you convince the little bastard to train you in his secretive craft skill.
quest_20903.SuccessText:
I'm glad Gribburn hasn't gotten himself killed by an overzealous human. It sounds like he's found a sweet setup for himself, too!

But if he's going to live in some castle, that means I need more people who know how to do what he does. Say... are you a crafter? Why don't you learn his techniques? If he refuses to teach you, tell him that I'll have him killed! He'll think that's a hilariously bad bluff, and his levity will give you an opening to negotiate.

It'll work. Goblins are incredibly predictable. Trust me.

quest_20904.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Poe, a myconian who lives somewhere beneath Serbule. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Poe to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20904.MidwayText: Nightshade? Oh, the overworlder that named itself after a plant. I remember. I like Nightshade. Tell Nightshade that I am well, and that I am grateful for the concern.
quest_20904.Name: Check In On Poe
quest_20904.PrefaceText:
Well, I'll tell you about Poe, but I don't expect you'll be able to find him. He's a myconian. A mushroom man! Weirdest thing I've ever seen wield a jeweler's hammer, I assure you! He was never part of our guild, but we invited him to come with us anyway. Sadly, he refused: he hates the cold. Can't blame him. He said he was going home, "under the ground in Serbule." So I guess you go there and start digging? How big is Serbule anyway?

Do this for me, and I'll put in a good word with you to Poe!
quest_20904.SuccessText:
You found Poe! I'm glad he's alive. How many oils did he send back with you? ... None at all?! You went all that way and got nothing for me?!

No, no, I'm not angry. I'm just very disappointed. Hm. Why don't you go back and ask him to teach you his techniques? I bet you'd be a faster crafter than a myconian could ever be!

quest_21.Description:
Velkort wants me to go grab a piece of blue crystal from a nearby crypt. The entrance is in the graveyard.

I'm to avoid the central room with the giant spider, and work my way around the perimeter until I reach an energy barrier. The secret code for the barrier is 397.
quest_21.Name: Unlocking the Crystal Lattice

Objectives.Description: Snap off a small chunk of blue crystal

quest_21001.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains has asked for some wood for her fire. Any wood will do.
quest_21001.Name: So... Cold...
quest_21001.PrefaceText: I thought this stupid magic fire would keep me warm, but it keeps shutting out! I guess I need to put firewood in it. Like a savage. But I'm too cold to go looking for wood... could you bring me some?
quest_21001.SuccessText: Thanks! This will keep me warm for a little while. I appreciate it! I don't have much to give you in exchange, but here's a few coins.

quest_21002.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains asked for a trophy sheep skin.
quest_21002.Name: Ultimate Woolly Comfort
quest_21002.PrefaceText: Making armor isn't really my main thing, but I'm not terrible at it. I wish I had one of those big sheep skins -- a perfect one, a flawless one. I could make a really cozy jacket!
quest_21002.SuccessText: Oh, wow. This will work great! I'm going to get started right now. Here... would you like my old coat? It's pretty warm.

quest_21003.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains wishes she had some dragon scales to take home with her.
quest_21003.Name: Scales of a Dragon!
quest_21003.PrefaceText: Back in Sinoca I had a state of the art research laboratory for inventing new augmentation oils. I had a breakthrough design that requires dragon scales, but, of course... I could never find any dragon scales! Wouldn't it be great if I found some dragon scales to take home with me? It'd almost make this experience worthwhile. Uh... do you know where any already-dead dragons are? ... Me neither.
quest_21003.SuccessText: Oh my goodness. You're too much! You found a dead dragon and pried off its scales for me?! Thank you so much! I hope it wasn't too scary. Even if it was long-dead I'd be a little scared of such a fearsome monster. I wish I had something to offer you... hm, here. This is... a thing!

quest_21101.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den asked you to obtain some wolfsbane for him.
quest_21101.Name: Anti-Lycanthropy Potion
quest_21101.PrefaceText: I was once a professional alchemist, and I'm certain there's a formula that will help me keep my sanity when the full moon comes. The secret is those horrible flowers that grow out in the snow: wolfsbane. But it's hard for me to pick them, because they're very toxic to me now. Can you get some for me?
quest_21101.SuccessText: Augh! Irhetsu bless my nose! The stench of those flowers! Haha, the secret has to be locked in these! Thank you. Here. This was one of my demonstration weapons when I used to sell weapons door to door.

quest_21102.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den asked you to obtain orange juice.
quest_21102.Name: Orange Juice for Malgath
quest_21102.PrefaceText: For my alchemical experiments, I need a liquid that's sweet and full of citric acid. Orange juice should work. But, of course, this is Kur! No oranges for thousands of miles! What should I do?
quest_21102.SuccessText: You got orange juice! But how? You're quite adroit at obtaining unusual things, aren't you? Here. I'll trade you for a few of these unusual coins I found lying around the cave.

quest_21103.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den needs "worm teeth" from Tor-Uraks. It would take a skilled butcher to get the tooth out in one piece, though!
quest_21103.Name: Worm Teeth
quest_21103.PrefaceText:
I need an injector that can go through my wolfen skin when I change form. It needs to be as sharp as a knife, but hollow for my potion to flow through.

And I know just the thing: the teeth of the Tor-Urak would work! And there's a bunch out in Kur. Of course, I'd need to kill a bunch of Tor-Uraks and then carefully butcher them to try to find a viable tooth... that seems unlikely in my current state. Unless you can help?
quest_21103.SuccessText: You got them! Wow, these are larger and sharper than I expected. Intimidated? No! No. ... I'm just scared. It's not the same. Here. Take these coins for your trouble.

quest_212.Description: You realize that you can't quite visualize the precise grip angle you'd need for the Sword symbol. The solution is simple: learn.
quest_212.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Sword"
quest_212.PrefaceText: You realize that you can't quite visualize the precise grip angle you'd need for the Sword symbol. The solution is simple: learn.
quest_212.SuccessText: You've studied the blade and mastered the Sword symbol.

quest_21201.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for a goblin hairpin.
quest_21201.Name: Gribburn's Hair Pin
quest_21201.PrefaceText: See Gorvessa over there? She's pretty amazing, huh? And I hear she's only 'temporarily' Malvol's consort. Which means I have a chance! I need a gift, though. Can you get me a goblin hairpin? I'll imbue it with magic and impress her.
quest_21201.SuccessText: This will do. Thank you. Now go! Don't let Gorvessa see you giving it to me! I need her to think I crafted it for her. Here, just take some money and shut up about this!

quest_21202.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for some eel kabobs.
quest_21202.Name: Gribburn Wants Eel Kabobs
quest_21202.PrefaceText: Gorvessa is beautiful, but her cooking is... well, it's adequate. But my refined palate needs something better. I could really go for eel kabobs right now!
quest_21202.SuccessText: Mmm. Thanks! All mine, no sharing! Here, you can have the meal Gorvessa made for me.

quest_21203.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for a bunch of long rubbery tongues from Ranalan Warriors. A tribe of them live in far-off Sun Vale, among other places.
quest_21203.Name: Tongues for Shoes
quest_21203.PrefaceText: So I was enchanting Ultashk's boots, and he mentioned that they keep slipping around on his foot. This is a common goblin problem because our armor is crafted by slaves with low morale. But I think I can fix it! I just need some ranalan flesh! You know, the frog people? They're super rubbery and gross. I think I could dry out their tongues and use them as foot padding. Can you get some for me?
quest_21203.SuccessText: Ewww, so gross! Hahaha! Good job. Here. These shoes are too big for goblins: no amount of padding will save them! But they might fit you.

quest_213.Description: Only the truly feral can master the Face (Dog) symbol. You may just not have what it takes. And that's okay. Best to leave the symbol to the worthy.
quest_213.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Face (Dog)"
quest_213.PrefaceText: Only the truly feral can master the Face (Dog) symbol. You may just not have what it takes. And that's okay. Best to leave the symbol to the worthy.
quest_213.SuccessText: You accessed your feral nature and mastered the Face (Dog) symbol!

quest_21301.Description: Poe the Myconian asked you to retrieve some blusher mushrooms. Poe will use them to inhibit premature sporing.
quest_21301.Name: Inhibiting the Sporing
quest_21301.PrefaceText: I am young for my kind, but I am already sporing! My adventures into the overworld have caused me to bloom prematurely. I am not ready to clone myself, so I must delay the sporing. Do you have some of the inhibitor medicine? Your kind calls it 'Blusher Mushrooms'. I need much of it.
quest_21301.SuccessText: I am grateful. These will prohibit my sporing for several more seasons so that I may have further adventures in the overworld. Would you like these? They are but toys to my kind, but dangerous weapons to your kind.

quest_21302.Description: Poe the Myconian asked you to retrieve some ectoplasm. It can often be found on ghosts.
quest_21302.Name: The Secret Ingredient
quest_21302.PrefaceText: My special art requires a very uncommon ingredient. In fact, it is so rare that I have never obtained it directly myself; I have only ever received it from others. Can you fulfill this role now? I require ectoplasm. It is the give-off of ghosts, banshees, wailing spirits, and other incorporeal former-meatlings.
quest_21302.SuccessText: This is a valuable gift. Thank you. I wish for you to have this in exchange.

quest_21303.Description: Poe the Myconian asked for a bunch of unrefined gold ore.
quest_21303.Name: Gold Ore For Poe
quest_21303.PrefaceText: I must ask you again for aid in preparing my special augments. I will need many such items to fund my travels. Gold works well for creating the augments. Unrefined gold ore is best. I've noticed that overworlders often keep gold on hand. Do you happen to have any?
quest_21303.SuccessText: Thank you for sharing your overworlder wealth with me. In exchange, I shall share knowledge with you. [ You gain Jewelry Augment Brewing XP ]

quest_21351.Description: Yoy the Myconian asked you to kill Senzur the mindworm, deep in the myconian cave.
quest_21351.Name: The Sad End of Senzur
quest_21351.PrefaceText: It would calm my spores to know Senzur was deceased. He is a mighty psychic presence, and he is quite dangerous. To find him, head down the hall and turn right. Then a left. Then right. If you run into Greta the garden tender then you have failed to follow my very simple instructions.
quest_21351.SuccessText: You have slain my friend. I am indebted to you, but yet -- all that I have learned of meat-plants is pain. Senzur taught me the signature psychic technique of his species. He called it, appropriately, the Mindworm. I could teach you the Mindworm... It will keep his memory alive. [New Training Option Available.]

quest_21401.Description: Amutasa in Rahu asked you to obtain a large amount of lac. It can be found on the corpses of many insects.
quest_21401.Name: Lac for Amutasa
quest_21401.PrefaceText: I am running low on lac. Normally we trade with the orcs for it, but their ships have been fewer in number of recent months. I suppose there are local sources, though: giant beetles, for instance. But I suspect the easiest way to get it is the Urak creatures that the orcs use as war-beasts. A pity there are none around here! If you meet an orcish trader, can you purchase any lac they have? I shall repay you.
quest_21401.SuccessText: You got this for me? I did not see an orcish ship come into port, so I suppose you obtained it from some other means. You must be quite resourceful!

quest_21402.Description: Amutasa in Rahu asked you to get Masterwork Metal Slabs for her.
quest_21402.Name: Amutasa's Metal
quest_21402.PrefaceText: My tools are only as good as the materials they're made of. This metal is "good", but it's not great. I need masterwork metal! Do you know any miners who might have some?
quest_21402.SuccessText: With this metal I shall be able to finish the order of tack hammers for that fool Ufkar. Your aid is much appreciated.

quest_21403.Description: Amutasa needed someone to help her fill an order for six Good Skinning Knives.
quest_21403.Name: The Knife Backlog
quest_21403.PrefaceText: I am overwhelmed with work requests! This is a good thing, but I am just not able to keep up! I must learn to say 'no', I suppose. But it is too late for that now. Are you capable of making tools? I could use your help in filling a simpler order: I need six good skinning knives.

quest_21404.Description: Amutasa requested some Enhanced Cranium Powder so that she can work faster.
quest_21404.Name: Amutasa Wants To Work Faster
quest_21404.PrefaceText: No matter how much I work, I cannot seem to stop being overwhelmed by work requests. Perhaps a different approach is needed. A visiting elf once invited me to a "dance party" which ended up having very little music and a lot more nakedness than I was expecting. But the highlight of the evening was a powder he brought with him, called 'Enhanced Cranium Powder'. Perhaps if I had some of this... I could finish this work more efficiently! Do you know how to get some?
quest_21404.SuccessText: This is the powder! I admit to being nervous. What if it works so well that I never want to stop using it? I shall become addicted to it, and all my effort will crumble! Ah, but I'm sure I'm worrying too much. I just need to complete these work orders. And your gift will let me do so. Thank you so much.

quest_21405.Description: Amutasa requested some Cranium Balm to overcome her addiction to Cranium Powder.
quest_21405.Name: Amutasa Needs To Stop Working Faster
quest_21405.PrefaceText: I need to ask for your help. I am quite addicted to cranium powder. The powder you brought me was so wondrous, so efficacious, that I quickly completed my backlog. But then more orders came pouring in, and I needed more of the powder. I found a nefarious rakshasa merchant who sold me more -- at ridiculously high prices! -- but now I need even more... and I realize that I have been a fool. Please, before this gets even worse, can you help me break this cycle? My contact claims that the only way to cure this headache is more cranium powder, but I know there must be a balm or ointment that can sooth my brow until I can feel normal again.
quest_21405.SuccessText: Is this it? Thank you! Oh, thank you so much. I can already feel it working... I can think straight! You've been a good friend. Here, let me give you something in return.

quest_215.Description: The ornate shape of the Beer symbol will require a bit of hands-on study.
quest_215.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Beer"
quest_215.PrefaceText: The ornate shape of the Beer symbol will require a bit of hands-on study.
quest_215.SuccessText: You drank until you could draw Beer.

quest_21501.Description: Mittens in Kur Mountains asked for some agates. She is trying to make gray dye to disguise Fox Outpost better.
quest_21501.Name: Disguising Fox Outpost
quest_21501.PrefaceText:
I want to show Red how useful I am. First idea: I want to hide Fox Outpost better. Red says it used to be hidden by a glamour, but now it's just stuck out here in the open.

I'll have to experiment with what works best, but my first idea is just to use paint to camouflage things. Can you help me get the paint ready? I need agates. They should make a paint that's similar to the color of the rocks around here.
quest_21501.SuccessText: Thanks! Oh, wait, I also need some lac to make the paint! But one step at a time, right? Here: this is for you.

quest_21502.Description: Mittens in Kur Mountains asked for some lac to help make paint. She says that it can be found on giant insects, including Tor-Uraks.
quest_21502.Name: Disguising Fox Outpost, pt 2
quest_21502.PrefaceText: Okay, these agates are great. But to make a useful paint I also need some lac. It comes from insects... but harvesting little insects would take too long. I bet the tor-urak that live around here would have it in larger quantities.
quest_21502.SuccessText:
Okay, thanks. I haven't ever actually made paint before, but I saw someone make it once, and it's probably pretty easy.

Here, I don't have much to offer, but I wanted you to have this. Master taught me that wizards use these to learn how to shoot lightning. Maybe you can sell it to a wizard and buy yourself something nice.

quest_21503.Description: Mittens in Kur Mountains asked for some winterhue flowers. They bloom all around Kur Mountains starting at 5am, but they die off as the afternoon sun reaches its peak.
quest_21503.Name: The Dawn Flower
quest_21503.PrefaceText:
I have a very personal request. Red told me he likes winterhues! You know, that flower that grows here? Can you get me a few to give to him?

Winterhues bloom at dawn, but they die off very quickly in the afternoon hours. So your best bet is to hunt for them starting at 5 am.
quest_21503.SuccessText: They're pretty! Thank you. Red will love them. Here... it's embarrassing, but this is all I have to offer in exchange.

quest_216.Description: Your attempts at the Cheese symbol just don't depict its savoriness. You must go back to the cutting board.
quest_216.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Cheese"
quest_216.PrefaceText: Your attempts at the Cheese symbol just don't depict its savoriness. You must go back to the cutting board.
quest_216.SuccessText: You've eaten cheese until the Cheese symbol became obvious to you!

quest_21601.Description: Gloria Stonecurl in Kur Mountains said, "I'd like to engrave a blessing of safety into the door of Ukorga's inn. It'll act as a protective charm. But I need some special items to do it! First, I need lapis gems. They're the favorite gem of Arisetsu. Can you find me some?"
quest_21601.Name: Lapis for the Priest
quest_21601.PrefaceText: I'd like to engrave a blessing of safety into the door of Ukorga's inn. It'll act as a protective charm. But I need some special items to do it! First, I need lapis gems. They're the favorite gem of Arisetsu. Can you find me some?
quest_21601.SuccessText: Thank you! Now if I can get the right ink, I can perform the inscription. Oh here, do you want this? It's the best ink Ukorga had on hand. But it's not good enough for a blessing!

quest_21602.Description: Gloria Stonecurl in Kur Mountains said, "I just need some quality ink to complete the blessing of safety on Ukorga's inn. And I know that human Laura Neth has the ink I need. But she won't sell it to me! [Gloria takes a deep breath and calms herself.] Can you see if you can buy some ink from her? Or from anywhere, really. I don't care, I just need to get this done!"
quest_21602.Name: Ink for the Inscription
quest_21602.PrefaceText: I just need some quality ink to complete the blessing of safety on Ukorga's inn. And I know that human Laura Neth has the ink I need. But she won't sell it to me! [Gloria takes a deep breath and calms herself.] Can you see if you can buy some ink from her? Or from anywhere, really. I don't care, I just need to get this done!
quest_21602.SuccessText: Perfect! All I wanted to do was make people safer. But there's always so many obstacles. Thank you for your help.

quest_21603.Description: Gloria Stonecurl in Kur Mountains said, "That blasted human! Laura Neth! She doesn't like me, and she's very mean. And she's a huge fucking racist, just like most humans, and I am so sick of her shit! [Gloria breathes deeply.] I'm sorry. I can fight a horde of zombies without breaking a sweat, but one bitchy old human who knows how to get under my defenses... anyway, I'm trying to befriend her. I know she needs more sharp cheddar cheese for her biscuits. Do you have any? I'll buy it from you for, say, 600 Councils?"
quest_21603.Name: Cheddar of Friendship
quest_21603.PrefaceText: That blasted human! Laura Neth! She doesn't like me, and she's very mean. And she's a huge fucking racist, just like most humans, and I am so sick of her shit! [Gloria breathes deeply.] I'm sorry. I can fight a horde of zombies without breaking a sweat, but one bitchy old human who knows how to get under my defenses... anyway, I'm trying to befriend her. I know she needs more sharp cheddar cheese for her biscuits. Do you have any? I'll buy it from you for, say, 600 Councils?
quest_21603.SuccessText: Thank you. This looks tasty! Hopefully that biddy will be appreciative. I'll wait until the right time... she can be a mean drunk. Oh, here's your money!

quest_217.Description: You almost have it: the legendary Soup symbol! You just need a bit more slurping experience to understand how to craft a perfect universal indicator for the concept.
quest_217.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Soup"
quest_217.PrefaceText: You almost have it: the legendary Soup symbol! You just need a bit more slurping experience to understand how to craft a perfect universal indicator for the concept.
quest_217.SuccessText: You've souped and souped until the Soup symbol was bested!

quest_21701.Description: Red in Kur Mountains said, "Thanks for answering my summons. I know me and the Wardens don't always agree, but this one's bad: an invasion of werewolves! I don't know where they came from, but there's lots of 'em are prowling around northeast of here, along the beach past the orcs. Sanja's camp is too far northwest to be much help. So it's up to you!"
quest_21701.Name: Werewolf Invasion
quest_21701.PrefaceText: Thanks for answering my summons. I know me and the Wardens don't always agree, but this one's bad: an invasion of werewolves! I don't know where they came from, but there's lots of 'em are prowling around northeast of here, along the beach past the orcs. Sanja's camp is too far northwest to be much help. So it's up to you!
quest_21701.SuccessText: Did you figure out what they were up to? No? Well, I'll keep trying to gather intel. Thanks again, friend.

quest_21702.Description: Red in Kur Mountains said, "Oh good, you're here! There's a new threat to the wildlife of Kur: a huge swarm of hook beasts! They normally live in the yeti caves beneath the ground, but I guess food has become too scarce. You'll find them north and east of the yeti crevice."
quest_21702.Name: Yeti Hook Beasts
quest_21702.PrefaceText: Oh good, you're here! There's a new threat to the wildlife of Kur: a huge swarm of hook beasts! They normally live in the yeti caves beneath the ground, but I guess food has become too scarce. You'll find them north and east of the yeti crevice.
quest_21702.SuccessText: You took care of the hook beasts? Thank you! I know this was a tough request. Here: this is a necklace a friend made for me, but I think you'll have more use for it. You make me proud to have been a Warden.

quest_21703.Description:
Red in Kur Mountains said, "You're finally here! We have a panther problem. An orcish ship came in the night and unloaded hundreds of war panthers! They must be planning a war or something. But who cares about that! They let their panthers hunt freely all through yeti territory, which is also where most of the surviving fox dens are!

They're getting really close to this outpost, too. I saw one watching me from across the river earlier! I've programmed the turrets to target the panthers... but I don't know if they'll be enough. If Mittens and I are dead when you get back, please avenge us!"
quest_21703.Name: Razorslash Panther Invasion
quest_21703.PrefaceText:
You're finally here! We have a panther problem. An orcish ship came in the night and unloaded hundreds of war panthers! They must be planning a war or something. But who cares about that! They let their panthers hunt freely all through yeti territory, which is also where most of the surviving fox dens are!

They're getting really close to this outpost, too. I saw one watching me from across the river earlier! I've programmed the turrets to target the panthers... but I don't know if they'll be enough. If Mittens and I are dead when you get back, please avenge us!
quest_21703.SuccessText: Oh, thanks. Sorry I was freaking out earlier. It turns out the turrets can handle the panthers just fine! Yeah, a panther came too close, got zapped, and just ran away. So Mittens and I weren't in any immediate danger. But other foxes still were, so thank you for helping us!

quest_218.Description: Mastering the Tree symbol shouldn't be hard. You'll just pay extra special attention the next few times you harvest wood.
quest_218.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Tree"
quest_218.PrefaceText: Mastering the Tree symbol shouldn't be hard. You'll just pay extra special attention the next few times you harvest wood.
quest_218.SuccessText: You lumberjacked your way to the Tree pictogram.

quest_219.Description: There is a universal meat symbol. You just know it! How can you find it? Only through savoring meat of all kinds.
quest_219.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Meat"
quest_219.PrefaceText: There is a universal meat symbol. You just know it! How can you find it? Only through savoring meat of all kinds.
quest_219.SuccessText: You've eaten meat until the Meat symbol became clear!

quest_22.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on the candles inside the nearby crypt. In return she'll teach me some first aid techniques.
quest_22.Name: Fiery Secrets
quest_22.PrefaceText:
Hey, do me a favor, go burn yourself on some of those eldritch candles scattered around the crypt southwest of town. I want to study the burn patterns. Each candle should leave a distinct burn mark. Just go touch four of them and come back.

Oh it won't hurt THAT much, you big baby!
quest_22.SuccessText: Hm, nope... not enough candles. I need more data than that! But a deal's a deal, let me teach you how to bind eldritch wounds a bit better. [You gain First Aid XP]

quest_220.Description: While a pedestrian symbol to some, the Cutlery symbol is a symbol of high honor to others. You long to bring the necessary gravitas to the task: you yourself must become a gourmand.
quest_220.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Cutlery"
quest_220.PrefaceText: While a pedestrian symbol to some, the Cutlery symbol is a symbol of high honor to others. You long to bring the necessary gravitas to the task: you yourself must become a gourmand.
quest_220.SuccessText: You've finally come to understand the true meaning of the Cutlery symbol!

quest_22001.Description: Mu the Myconian asked you to collect the heartshrooms of any Myconians you're forced to kill.
quest_22001.Name: Heartshrooms
quest_22001.PrefaceText: If you travel in these caves you will meet violent myconians. Either you or they shall die. If it is they who die, please bring back any intact heartshrooms you find. We can regrow myconians from them.
quest_22001.SuccessText: Thank you. We will regenerate these myconians and retrain them. It will take several years, but if you return I will make sure they thank you for saving them. [You gain Myconic XP.]

quest_22002.Description: Mu asked you to locate Poe, a myconian that may not entirely be under Tidal's influence, and deliver a message-spore.
quest_22002.MidwayText:
This message spore is from Mu? I see.

He understands me well. Tell him that so long as I am alive, I will serve him. But I must keep up appearances with Tidal, or be torn apart!
quest_22002.Name: Find Poe
quest_22002.PrefaceText: Most myconians have turned away from my counsel. But Poe -- loyal Poe is out there somewhere. I don't really believe Poe has turned away from me. Find Poe and deliver this message-spore. And if Poe needs help, please do whatever is necessary.
quest_22002.SuccessText: Poe is alive? Thank you! In return, let me teach you what I can of our language. [You gain Myconic XP.]

quest_221.Description: You're inspired to master the lovely bulbous globes of the grape. You'll need to taste several in order to depict their juciness just right.
quest_221.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Grapes"
quest_221.PrefaceText: You're inspired to master the lovely bulbous globes of the grape. You'll need to taste several in order to depict their juciness just right.
quest_221.SuccessText: You ate grapes and mastered the Grape symbol.

quest_22101.Description: Way asked you to be on the lookout for his yo-yo, which he believes is in the posession of a sentinel spider.
quest_22101.Name: Way's Lost Yo-Yo
quest_22101.PrefaceText:
A few moons back, an elf visited us and gave me an exotic item called a 'yo-yo'. It has a string. It goes up and down via magic. I loved it!

Unfortunately I left it lying about, and one of the sentinel spiders took it to their nest. If you happen upon it, please return it.
quest_22101.SuccessText: That's it! But the string has been digested by spider acid. Sadness and happiness collide! Nevertheless, thank you.

quest_22102.Description: Way has asked for some string with which to fix Way's lucky yo-yo.
quest_22102.Name: Fixing Way's Yo-Yo
quest_22102.PrefaceText: Could you find me some replacement string for my yo-yo? It doesn't work anymore.
quest_22102.SuccessText: Thank you! Happy day! Here, let me shower you with human coins!

quest_222.Description: There's so many types of hammers! You'd love to give the hammer-as-tool its due in a symbol, but how to capture its unique essence? You grit your teeth: only hands-on work at the forge will do.
quest_222.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Hammer (Tool)"
quest_222.PrefaceText: There's so many types of hammers! You'd love to give the hammer-as-tool its due in a symbol, but how to capture its unique essence? You grit your teeth: only hands-on work at the forge will do.

quest_22201.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to kill a bunch of Garden Tenders in the Myconian caverns.
quest_22201.Name: Too Many Tenders
quest_22201.PrefaceText: There are just so many Garden Tenders! It's hard to convince fellow myconians to resist Tidal when they see his massive army of tenders. They're so scary! Can you kill the scary monsters for us?
quest_22201.SuccessText: Well done! Well done! Here, take this. Never speak to anyone of what I asked you to do. They wouldn't understand.

quest_22202.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to kill Greta, the Garden Tender.
quest_22202.Name: Greta Must Die
quest_22202.PrefaceText:
Thanks for helping clear out some tenders, but there's still so many!

We buy our Garden Tenders from goblins. I do not know what their true species is; that's just what we call them. They are loyal and strong, but the goblins only sell us males. However, last season, they made a mistake. They left us a female! Now we have several females, but still only one at reproductive age. And you must kill her.

It is very sad, I know, but she is under the control of Tidal's renegade myconians. Look on the bright side: tenders are just meatlings, not mushrooms! Oh, I guess that doesn't help you, does it.
quest_22202.SuccessText: Hooray, you killed Greta! You are the cold-blooded murderer our pod needed! I'm confident that befriending such a violent sociopath as you cannot possibly have any negative repercussions. Here, take this token of our appreciation. Please do not kill us.

quest_22203.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to deliver sporelings to a storage cave somewhere in the myconian caverns.
quest_22203.Name: Cross-Pollination
quest_22203.PrefaceText: There is another seed repository deeper in the caves. I believe at least one myconian there will be friendly to you - can you go there and deliver these sporelings for safe keeping? We can't afford to keep all our sporelings in one place.
quest_22203.SuccessText: Thank you! Now if these storage mushrooms are destroyed, our pod can live on. Here, take these potions I found on a dead meatling. You like potions, right? Meatlings seem to love them for some reason. I guess it's because you have mouths.

quest_223.Description: Its perfectly not-quite-symmetrical shape lends an air of mystery to the Lemon symbol -- and an air of difficulty! For only those who brave the sourness can see clearly enough to depict the lemon.
quest_223.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Lemon"
quest_223.PrefaceText: Its perfectly not-quite-symmetrical shape lends an air of mystery to the Lemon symbol -- and an air of difficulty! For only those who brave the sourness can see clearly enough to depict the lemon.
quest_223.SuccessText: You sucked lemons to master the Lemon symbol.

quest_22301.Description: Voo the myconian asked for some Iocaine Mushrooms.
quest_22301.Name: Iocaine Samples
quest_22301.PrefaceText: I need more iocaine mushrooms. Can you obtain them?
quest_22301.SuccessText: Thank you. These are a little underripe, but they will do. Here... perhaps these toys will be useful to you?

quest_224.Description: Iconic and yet so hard to master! The Mushroom symbol eludes you now, but you know you're on the right track. Just 500 or so freshly-plucked examples should do it.
quest_224.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Mushroom"
quest_224.PrefaceText: Iconic and yet so hard to master! The Mushroom symbol eludes you now, but you know you're on the right track. Just 500 or so freshly-plucked examples should do it.
quest_224.SuccessText: You've plucked so many mushrooms! Finally, the Mushroom symbol is yours to wield.

quest_22401.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked for humanoid skulls in order to continue his phrenological research.
quest_22401.Name: Looking at Skulls
quest_22401.PrefaceText: I had hoped to master the phrenological areas of humans and elves from the corpses in this crypt, but I didn't find nearly enough skulls. Could you find some humanoid skulls for me? There should be a few lying around in here. Or heck, if you have some from elsewhere, I'd take those too. I just need to continue my studies!
quest_22401.SuccessText: Great! Look, see this bump here? He points to an almost imperceptible bump on one of the skulls. Associated with feelings of neglect. And here, this skull has the same rise! All of the people here seem to have had low self esteem. How odd, I have to study this further. Oh, right after you left, I remembered there's a much easier way to get skulls. You can just use a skull extractor on corpses! Here, you can take mine.

quest_22402.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked you to bring him some of the odd goblets lying about the dungeon.
quest_22402.Name: Necromancy Goblets
quest_22402.PrefaceText: I noticed something weird: there are a bunch of magical goblets lying around down here. They have necromantic magic, but I don't know what they do. If you find any of them, could you let me have them?
quest_22402.SuccessText: Hmm, they're warm! What was that old mnemonic we learned in school? "Hatred is Hot, Despair is Cold, Fear is Tingly, Greed is Slimy". (It rhymes in Goblin, but not in Common.) I guess... I guess I don't really know enough about Necromancy to tell what these do. But I'll study them. Thanks! Here, take some money for your trouble.

quest_22403.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked you to bring him some impressive humanoid skulls.
quest_22403.Name: Better Skulls Needed
quest_22403.PrefaceText: I need better skulls to further my study. Look for humanoids that are especially brave, or daring, or horrifying. Pop out their skulls after you kill them, and see if the skulls look impressive.
quest_22403.SuccessText: Wow, these are better than I expected. But enough about that. I noticed that you didn't have much compunction about ripping the skulls out of your fellow creatures using a small knife. You must have a fucked up past! What? No memory? Well, here. This might help you remember things better.

quest_225.Description: To master the Female symbol, you need but study females.
quest_225.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Female"
quest_225.PrefaceText: To master the Female symbol, you need but study females.
quest_225.SuccessText: You've glared at enough females that you feel you have mastered the Female symbol!

quest_22501.Description: The Sand Seer in Amulna asked for some Geometric Rune Scrolls. She said that many Rakshasa in the nearby city of Rahu are gifted in making them.
quest_22501.Name: Geometric Rune Charts
quest_22501.PrefaceText: I found a most interesting item yesterday, and entirely by chance. The tempestuous young Rakshasa that sells dyes -- I forget her name -- had a scroll for sale. This scroll is covered in geometric lines that closely resemble the area's ley lines. It was quite warm to the touch, too. It's quite fascinating. I assumed it was the work of some sage, but she said they're very common in her home city and that many people there can make them. If you go to Rahu, see if you can find some for me.
quest_22501.SuccessText: Thank you for these. I will study them. Oh, I spoke with Firaki some more -- that's the vendor I mentioned -- and she told me the most depressing thing: the Rakshasa have handed down the knowledge of how to make these scrolls, but they don't remember what their purpose is. They use them as heating pads on cold nights. Isn't that the saddest thing? Well, I will figure out their purpose, don't you worry about that!

quest_22502.Description: The Sand Seer in Amulna wanted you to be on the lookout for an "ancient magical stencil". She suggested that she would pay well for it.
quest_22502.Name: A Stencil to Make Runes
quest_22502.PrefaceText: Do you recall those rune charts you found for me? Well, I've studied them a little bit, and now I wish to try to make my own. I just need something to guide my hand. You wouldn't happen to have any ancient magical stencils, by any chance? Well, keep an eye out for one! I've got a fat sack of coins burning a hole in my dress.
quest_22502.SuccessText: Ah, this will do. I should be able to reproduce these rune charts myself now, thank you. I shall let you know what I discover!

quest_22503.Description: The Sand Seer in Amulna asked for some very particular, very amazing ink. She is attempting to reproduce the Rakshasas' Geometric Rune Charts with higher-quality materials.
quest_22503.Name: The Ink For Something Amazing
quest_22503.PrefaceText: I may have figured out what the rune charts are for, but I need to make one more -- a really powerful one. Hmm... I have some very high-quality paper, but I really need some amazing ink. Holistic ink would do well here, I think. Yes. Do you have any amazing holistic ink in that huge backpack of yours?
quest_22503.SuccessText: Oh, the ink, thank you. I hope it wasn't any trouble! Let's see what happens when I use it to create a geometric chart. [ You wait for the Sand Seer to work. ] Oh my. Did you see that? I felt that healing wave all the way to my toes! Hah! It's a sigil! Quite unusual, too. If you're skilled enough in the art of sigil scripting, I'd be happy to show you how to make it. [ Ability 'Health Glyph' added to Sand Seer's Training menu. ]

quest_22601.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache S-1'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Let's get right to work. The Sand Seer has located a new war cache entrance. Follow this map. Remember: the entrance isn't stable. You should be able to get inside and back out again, but don't expect to be able to go back a second time! The hole will collapse quickly. So you have one shot to get my Weaponized Xedrite! This seems like a pretty straightforward one. Just get in, get my Xedrite, and get out without being buried in the sand."
quest_22601.Name: War Cache
quest_22601.PrefaceText:
Let's get right to work. The Sand Seer has located a new war cache entrance. Follow this map. Remember: the entrance isn't stable. You should be able to get inside and back out again, but don't expect to be able to go back a second time! The hole will collapse quickly. So you have one shot to get my Weaponized Xedrite!

This seems like a pretty straightforward one. Just get in, get my Xedrite, and get out without being buried in the sand.
quest_22601.SuccessText:
You say you had to kill scorpions for their venom glands? Well, it looks like you handled yourself fine. Good job.

Wait! Wait a minute... if there was a rakkie in there already, that means they already knew about the entrance before we found it. My informants may be keeping secrets from me. I'll have to look into this.

quest_22602.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache S-2'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "I've talked with my informants about those scorpions you found. And they WERE keeping secrets from me! Apparently scorpion poison is very valuable on the rakkie bandit market, so they've been keeping their existence secret from me. Like I give a fuck about poison glands! I just want the weaponized xedrite. Working with me should be a win-win! Why are they hiding this?! I convinced them to give me the location of another scorpion-filled pit. You're the only agent I trust in this desert -- aside from the Seer, of course -- so this one's all yours. There are two objectives this time: get my xedrite, and also get me a sample from one of these scorpions. Look for a decently scary-looking one, kill it, and bring back... well, just bring the whole thing back, I guess. The Seer wants to examine it. You should expect scorpions, of course, but I wouldn't be surprised if there were bandits in there, too. Be ready for anything! Here's the map. Get me my xedrite!"
quest_22602.Name: War Cache
quest_22602.PrefaceText:
I've talked with my informants about those scorpions you found. And they WERE keeping secrets from me! Apparently scorpion poison is very valuable on the rakkie bandit market, so they've been keeping their existence secret from me. Like I give a fuck about poison glands! I just want the weaponized xedrite. Working with me should be a win-win! Why are they hiding this?!


I convinced them to give me the location of another scorpion-filled pit. You're the only agent I trust in this desert -- aside from the Seer, of course -- so this one's all yours. There are two objectives this time: get my xedrite, and also get me a sample from one of these scorpions. Look for a decently scary-looking one, kill it, and bring back... well, just bring the whole thing back, I guess. The Seer wants to examine it.

You should expect scorpions, of course, but I wouldn't be surprised if there were bandits in there, too. Be ready for anything! Here's the map. Get me my xedrite!
quest_22602.SuccessText: The bandits had been there for days before you arrived? Damn it all! Well, at least you got my xedrite. You did well. I'll have the Sand Seer take a look at this corpse you brought. That's all for now.

quest_22603.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache S-3'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "The Sand Seer examined the scorpion remains you brought back, and she found something interesting. That scorpion's carapace was infused with xedrite! She thinks xedrite dust got into their shells or something. I don't buy it. We need a lot more information. It took some bribery, but I got the location of another scorpion-filled pit for you. There's no xedrite in this one. Just go in, kill every scorpion, and bring me back those carapaces."
quest_22603.Name: War Cache
quest_22603.PrefaceText:
The Sand Seer examined the scorpion remains you brought back, and she found something interesting. That scorpion's carapace was infused with xedrite! She thinks xedrite dust got into their shells or something. I don't buy it. We need a lot more information.

It took some bribery, but I got the location of another scorpion-filled pit for you. There's no xedrite in this one. Just go in, kill every scorpion, and bring me back those carapaces.
quest_22603.SuccessText: Have I ever told you how much I hate the stench of dead scorpion? Probably not, because I didn't even realize I hated it until you started bringing back these disgusting things! Anyway, I'll get them to the Sand Seer. Here's your pay. Good work.

quest_22604.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache S-4'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Remember those xedrite-laced scorpion corpses you brought back? Well, that xedrite is useless. It's just raw metal infused into their shells. I need weapons-grade xedrite! However, the Seer thinks there's weaponized xedrite involved. She asked for an agent to undergo an extremely dangerous assignment. So I told her you'd be right over! Here's your map. See her for further briefing."
quest_22604.MidwayText:
Oh, you're the one going after the mama scorpion? Well, I hope you're up for the task!

The hole you're going into has a very tough scorpion inside. The 'mama scorpion', the bandits call her. We only know about her location because she's stopped laying eggs and she's become too aggressive for the bandits to deal with. So they sold her location to us.

I'm no fan of killing exotic wildlife, but I think we should make an exception here in the name of science. Kill her, see if you can figure out what makes her special, and report back.
quest_22604.Name: War Cache
quest_22604.PrefaceText:
Remember those xedrite-laced scorpion corpses you brought back? Well, that xedrite is useless. It's just raw metal infused into their shells. I need weapons-grade xedrite!

However, the Seer thinks there's weaponized xedrite involved. She asked for an agent to undergo an extremely dangerous assignment. So I told her you'd be right over! Here's your map. See her for further briefing.
quest_22604.SuccessText:
You found this weaponized xedrite INSIDE the scorpion? How did it... hmm.

Good job. I'll take this to the Sand Seer.

quest_22605.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache F-1'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "I've got a nice easy one for you. Here's the map to the war cache. We believe the cache was originally located in a Crone military city called New Argolis. Well, not really a city, more like a recreational area for off-duty Hegemony troops. Should be pretty safe. The report says there's some weird animals in there, but no bandits. Follow the map, get in, find the Weaponized Xedrite, and get out. Don't screw up! You've only got one chance -- you won't be able to get back in a second time."
quest_22605.Name: War Cache
quest_22605.PrefaceText:
I've got a nice easy one for you. Here's the map to the war cache. We believe the cache was originally located in a Crone military city called New Argolis. Well, not really a city, more like a recreational area for off-duty Hegemony troops. Should be pretty safe. The report says there's some weird animals in there, but no bandits.

Follow the map, get in, find the Weaponized Xedrite, and get out. Don't screw up! You've only got one chance -- you won't be able to get back in a second time.
quest_22605.SuccessText:
Good job. You run into any trouble? A flooded basement, eh? Well that's interesting.

You fought a what? A hip o? I don't know what that is. But it's dead, so problem solved! Here's your tickets.

quest_22606.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache F-2'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "We've found another war cache in the region that used to be 'New Argolis'. It wasn't on the front lines. Hegemony troops went there for booze and whores. So there shouldn't be any spike traps or death beams or anything. Nice and easy!
