In fact, I almost gave this job to my second-best finder, Kella, so I could save you for the hard ones. But she declined it... so it's all yours. She said the area is full of snakes, and she's afraid of snakes. Whoever heard of a rakkie that's afraid of snakes? What is this world coming to, I ask you? Anyway, I guess she might know what she's talking about. Bring some antivenom."
quest_22606.Name: War Cache
quest_22606.PrefaceText:
We've found another war cache in the region that used to be 'New Argolis'. It wasn't on the front lines. Hegemony troops went there for booze and whores. So there shouldn't be any spike traps or death beams or anything. Nice and easy! In fact, I almost gave this job to my second-best finder, Kella, so I could save you for the hard ones. But she declined it... so it's all yours. She said the area is full of snakes, and she's afraid of snakes. Whoever heard of a rakkie that's afraid of snakes? What is this world coming to, I ask you?

Anyway, I guess she might know what she's talking about. Bring some antivenom.
quest_22606.SuccessText: So there were snakes in there after all? I'm glad to hear that. I thought Kella was lying to me, and I couldn't figure out why... but I guess she just doesn't like snakes! I'm glad you aren't as squeamish. Here's your pay.

quest_22607.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache F-3'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "I've got a real easy one for you! This one's in the remains of 'New Argolis', the old R&R camp for Hegemony soldiers during the war. The Seer didn't go in, of course, but she said it smells like beer in there. I can't imagine it's still drinkable, though. Remember: wine ages, but beer just goes bad after a few decades. Don't make yourself sick!"
quest_22607.Name: War Cache
quest_22607.PrefaceText: I've got a real easy one for you! This one's in the remains of 'New Argolis', the old R&R camp for Hegemony soldiers during the war. The Seer didn't go in, of course, but she said it smells like beer in there. I can't imagine it's still drinkable, though. Remember: wine ages, but beer just goes bad after a few decades. Don't make yourself sick!
quest_22607.SuccessText: Oh boo hoo, so you got wet. And slimy. You're still alive, and you got the Weaponized Xedrite, so how hard could it have been? Here's your tickets!

quest_22608.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache F-4'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Here's the map to your next mission. It used to be a holding cell for war prisoners. It sounds like it's been flooded for a while, which means the bandits will have moved on, but I'm sure there's snakes and other dumb animals in there. Oh, and ghosts. Ghosts always show up in military prisons... you're not scared of ghosts, are you? I just give 'em a stunning bash with my shield. That shuts 'em up."
quest_22608.Name: War Cache
quest_22608.PrefaceText: Here's the map to your next mission. It used to be a holding cell for war prisoners. It sounds like it's been flooded for a while, which means the bandits will have moved on, but I'm sure there's snakes and other dumb animals in there. Oh, and ghosts. Ghosts always show up in military prisons... you're not scared of ghosts, are you? I just give 'em a stunning bash with my shield. That shuts 'em up.
quest_22608.SuccessText:
That's quite a haul of xedrite! Ghosts give ya any trouble? Haha! I'm sure it was nothing you couldn't handle.

Here's your pay, and if you meet my second-best finder Kella, tell her she missed out on easy money when she turned this one down!

quest_22609.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache D-1'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Here's your next map. A new gang of bandits moved into the area, so make yourself useful and figure out what they're up to. And get my xedrite too, obviously."
quest_22609.Name: War Cache
quest_22609.PrefaceText: Here's your next map. A new gang of bandits moved into the area, so make yourself useful and figure out what they're up to. And get my xedrite too, obviously.
quest_22609.SuccessText:
They're manufacturing drugs? That sounds... bad. Are you sure it's not just another ill-conceived perfume line?

Hmm. Well, this is the first I've heard of it, and hopefully the last. Thanks for the intel.

quest_22610.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache D-2'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Remember those drug-manufacturing rakkies you found? Well, I've been hearing more rumors about it. It sounds powerful. Could be an alchemical recipe we could use in the Council military. Here's a map to a hole without any Xedrite in it. But it's in the same general area as that gang. I'm guessing it'll be swarming with the kitties, so be careful. Get in there and steal me a clean sample of the drug."
quest_22610.Name: War Cache
quest_22610.PrefaceText: Remember those drug-manufacturing rakkies you found? Well, I've been hearing more rumors about it. It sounds powerful. Could be an alchemical recipe we could use in the Council military. Here's a map to a hole without any Xedrite in it. But it's in the same general area as that gang. I'm guessing it'll be swarming with the kitties, so be careful. Get in there and steal me a clean sample of the drug.
quest_22610.SuccessText: Perfect. The Sand Seer knows a goblin who knows a goblin who can get this analyzed. I'll let you know what we learn.

quest_22611.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache D-3'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Here's the map for your next assignment. And you might want to hurry, I've had reports of smoke, screams, and commotion coming from there today."
quest_22611.Name: War Cache
quest_22611.PrefaceText: Here's the map for your next assignment. And you might want to hurry, I've had reports of smoke, screams, and commotion coming from there today.
quest_22611.SuccessText: Good job. No, don't tell me about the freakish monsters you had to kill, because I don't care, and if you tell me I'd be obliged to care. So let's just leave it at: here's your pay.

quest_22612.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache D-4'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "So the drug you found out there, that Telka's Tits or whatever... it's garbage. Only works on rakkies! Most worthless drug since I got my hands on 'bounceweed'. But there's good news: the stuff is made from the silk of the rare giant sand worm, and we think other, better drugs could be made from the same stuff. And I have a lead on a cache infested with 'em! If we're lucky, you can get some samples of their silk while you're getting my xedrite. Before you leave, go see if the Sand Seer has any advice for ya on Sand Worm killin'. Or just take my advice: use archery. But no, no, the elf woman's gotta make it more complicated than that!"
quest_22612.MidwayText:
Ah, Johnson picked you for the sand worm job? Makes sense.

If you're not prepared, sand worms can be surprisingly nasty, but with some prep work they're nothing to worry about.

Sand worms live at tremendous depths, so their bodies are immune to crushing and physical trauma. They can be burned, although they're not especially vulnerable to it. I'd choose cold magic, myself.

They attack by sticking their pincers in you and vibrating your body with sonic blasts. They can also entangle you in sticky silk that will sap your energy, but they have to be pretty close to do that, so try to keep your distance.

That's all you need to know. I'm sure you'll be fine!
quest_22612.Name: War Cache
quest_22612.PrefaceText:
So the drug you found out there, that Telka's Tits or whatever... it's garbage. Only works on rakkies! Most worthless drug since I got my hands on 'bounceweed'. But there's good news: the stuff is made from the silk of the rare giant sand worm, and we think other, better drugs could be made from the same stuff. And I have a lead on a cache infested with 'em! If we're lucky, you can get some samples of their silk while you're getting my xedrite.

Before you leave, go see if the Sand Seer has any advice for ya on Sand Worm killin'. Or just take my advice: use archery. But no, no, the elf woman's gotta make it more complicated than that!
quest_22612.SuccessText: Good work. This is... stickier than I expected. It's actually... pretty vile. I'll go foist it on the Sand Seer.

quest_22613.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache T-1'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "This one might be tricky. The Sand Seer insists this area of the desert has "unusual isolated weather patterns". What kind of patterns, you ask? Wind storms. Wind storms! Those are completely natural for the Ilmari! But she's an elf. They're supposed to be sensitive to nature, or whatever. Anyway I hired her for her expertise, so I'd be a fool to ignore her. Here's the map. The Seer will brief you further. We've detected a lot of xedrite in this one, so do whatever it takes!"
quest_22613.MidwayText:
I fear an invasive species from another continent has taken hold in some of the old war bunkers. There are weird whirlwinds in that area and I've never seen those here... but they remind me of the terrible desert spiders of Fosulf. I hope I'm mistaken!

If this is the creature I fear, it will be protected by a powerful wind. Shooting arrows into it will be difficult, and most weapons will have reduced effect. But these creatures have a weakness: explosions! Burst magic, bombs, explosion sigils... whatever you have, use it.
quest_22613.Name: War Cache
quest_22613.PrefaceText:
This one might be tricky. The Sand Seer insists this area of the desert has "unusual isolated weather patterns". What kind of patterns, you ask? Wind storms. Wind storms! Those are completely natural for the Ilmari! But she's an elf. They're supposed to be sensitive to nature, or whatever. Anyway I hired her for her expertise, so I'd be a fool to ignore her.

Here's the map. The Seer will brief you further. We've detected a lot of xedrite in this one, so do whatever it takes!
quest_22613.SuccessText:
So there's some new kind of nightmare spiders? That's just great. This job just keeps getting harder!

But you're definitely not part of the problem. You're part of the solution! Good job!

quest_22614.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache T-2'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "We've got another war cache in that problematic spider area. The Sand Seer wants you to collect some legs from those wind spiders while you're in there. Here's the map. Remember: spider legs are great and all, but don't leave without my Weaponized Xedrite!"
quest_22614.Name: War Cache
quest_22614.PrefaceText: We've got another war cache in that problematic spider area. The Sand Seer wants you to collect some legs from those wind spiders while you're in there. Here's the map. Remember: spider legs are great and all, but don't leave without my Weaponized Xedrite!
quest_22614.SuccessText: That's a lot of spider legs. Well, I guess they do come eight to a body. What is that, two spiders' worth? Eh, whatever. You got the metal, and the Seer can study these for whatever thing she cares about... so you did it! Take a rest, soldier.

quest_22615.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache T-3'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Got another spider-hole for you. No xedrite detected, though, so you're not going in for that. You're going in because the Sand Seer needs more spider legs or something. I'm starting to regret listening to her about this... but she says it might be a huge crisis, so now I can't just tell her to ignore it! Do whatever she needs, and try to be quick about it. We've got xedrite to find!"
quest_22615.MidwayText:
He assigned you again? Good. I've got bad news and worse news. The bad news is those spiders you found are definitely tornado spiders, and the infestation is already too deep. There's no hope of really being rid of them, but maybe we can keep them contained to a small part of the desert.

Now here's the worse news: tornado spiders are the weak ones. When an infestation of tornado spiders gets large enough, they somehow spontaneously start laying eggs for the REAL dangerous spiders, the Hurricane Spiders. And those eggs have been spotted in the hole you're headed to.

Go in and burn those eggs. And I mean that literally: you should be prepared to burn them! They're very difficult to damage with weapons, and they regenerate health like crazy unless they're on fire. If you can't manage any other type of fire, I noticed the fairy has some Trollbane Oil for sale in the 'commissary'. That will at least keep them from regenerating! Good luck.
quest_22615.Name: War Cache
quest_22615.PrefaceText: Got another spider-hole for you. No xedrite detected, though, so you're not going in for that. You're going in because the Sand Seer needs more spider legs or something. I'm starting to regret listening to her about this... but she says it might be a huge crisis, so now I can't just tell her to ignore it! Do whatever she needs, and try to be quick about it. We've got xedrite to find!
quest_22615.SuccessText:
You're back. Was the mission successful? No, don't explain, just tell me this: is the Sand Seer gonna be happy, or is she gonna be pissed?

You sure? Okay. Good, then! Here's your tickets.

quest_22616.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache T-4'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "You're finally back. Been saving this one for you! I sent my second-best xedrite-finder in already, and she came back empty-handed and mostly-dead. So it's time to show 'em why you're the best! There's xedrite in there, plus some big bug the Sand Seer wants killed. Go talk to her first."
quest_22616.MidwayText:
Remember how I told you that 'tornado spiders' are the weak ones, and it was very important to destroy all the giant eggs before they became much bigger problems? Well, we found another cave where an egg already hatched, and we've got a much bigger problem. But it's still an adolescent, so there might be time left to kill it!

It will have extreme regeneration, just as it did in the egg: you'll need to light it on fire to prevent that. Fortunately, weapons work better than they do on the egg, but there's an extra complication: this spider has a very venomous bite!

Kella was sent in before you and nearly died. Don't underestimate this one.
quest_22616.Name: War Cache
quest_22616.PrefaceText: You're finally back. Been saving this one for you! I sent my second-best xedrite-finder in already, and she came back empty-handed and mostly-dead. So it's time to show 'em why you're the best! There's xedrite in there, plus some big bug the Sand Seer wants killed. Go talk to her first.
quest_22616.SuccessText: You killed the big scary bug? Ha! See, I told her it'd be easy! The Sand Seer kept saying I should send in a "team"... but you're way more cost-effective. Here's your pay. I'll go tell her.

quest_22617.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache M-1'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "I hope you're not afraid of mummies. I need you to go into a mummy-infested hole and get some xedrite. My other finders have chickened out, but you're better than them! You've got this! Here's the map! Oh, better have the Sand Seer brief you on mummies first. It's good to refresh the brain!"
quest_22617.MidwayText:
He wants me to brief you on MUMMIES? I'm not a mummy expert! But I can repeat what I've read in books, I guess.

Mummies are nasty undead that are supposedly not being created anymore... although I'm pretty sure that's untrue. Anyway, the mummies you'll be facing are very old, and they have old diseases that your body has few protections against. So try not to inhale near them.

Their organs are removed during the creation process, so don't bother trying to poison them, bludgeon them, or make them bleed. Their thick bandages give them protection against blades and arrows, too. Fire is the classic weapon of choice, but acid and lightning also work well, and I've heard they're even susceptible to psychic blasts, which is unusual for undead.

That's about all I can remember about mummies, aside from historical info. Good luck.
quest_22617.Name: War Cache
quest_22617.PrefaceText:
I hope you're not afraid of mummies. I need you to go into a mummy-infested hole and get some xedrite. My other finders have chickened out, but you're better than them! You've got this! Here's the map!

Oh, better have the Sand Seer brief you on mummies first. It's good to refresh the brain!
quest_22617.SuccessText: You made it back alive! Here: I requisitioned some curatives when I learned we've got mummy problems. You should use this before consortin' with anybody.

quest_22618.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache M-2'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "Got a big ole' mummy-infested deathtrap for ya. Lots of xedrite though! I've already sent someone into this one and she came back empty-handed, sayin' it was too dangerous. So I tell ya what, I'll throw in a little something extra if you can get all three pieces. Just don't die over it!"
quest_22618.Name: War Cache
quest_22618.PrefaceText: Got a big ole' mummy-infested deathtrap for ya. Lots of xedrite though! I've already sent someone into this one and she came back empty-handed, sayin' it was too dangerous. So I tell ya what, I'll throw in a little something extra if you can get all three pieces. Just don't die over it!
quest_22618.SuccessText: Hah! I really didn't think you'd manage to pull it off! Remind me never to bet against you. Here's an extra ticket.

quest_22619.Description: [For bug-reporting and feedback purposes, you can refer to this quest as 'War Cache M-3'.] Sir Johnson in Amulna said, "This hole's near the other mummy-pits, so be on your guard. Could be mummies or other nasty undead."
quest_22619.Name: War Cache
quest_22619.PrefaceText: This hole's near the other mummy-pits, so be on your guard. Could be mummies or other nasty undead.
quest_22619.SuccessText: You're back. Ready for debriefing? ... You saw a 'visage of demise'? Wait, you mean you fought an actual Face of Death?! Those things are old as shit! How the hell did the Crone Hegemony have those? They can militarize Faces of Death?! That's... well, I'd better send this little nugget of info up the chain of command. Here's your reward; dismissed.

quest_227.Description: The Male symbol's jagged angulars require a deep understanding of the subject acquired through careful study.
quest_227.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Male"
quest_227.PrefaceText: The Male symbol's jagged angulars require a deep understanding of the subject acquired through careful study.
quest_227.SuccessText: You've glared at enough males that you feel you have mastered the Male symbol!

quest_23.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on a total of 12 different candles inside the nearby crypt. I may not be able to reach all the candles right away, it's too dangerous... but I should keep it in mind for later.
quest_23.Name: Fiery Secrets, Round 2
quest_23.PrefaceText: I need more data. Can you go touch some more candles in the crypt? Say, a dozen. But you can count the ones you've already touched toward the total.
quest_23.SuccessText:
Damn it! Still not enough candles!

Well, let me teach you a bit about hammering out dents. [You gain Armor Patching XP]

quest_230.Description: Today you had a breakthrough: the jagged nature of the Lightning emoji will be easily mastered via repetitive application to the face. Relatively easy!
quest_230.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Lightning"
quest_230.PrefaceText: Today you had a breakthrough: the jagged nature of the Lightning emoji will be easily mastered via repetitive application to the face. Relatively easy!
quest_230.SuccessText: You've been shocked enough to control the potent Lightning symbol!

quest_23001.Description: Yagreet at the fairy tree asked you for some Master First Aid Kits.
quest_23001.Name: Making Do With Crap Kits
quest_23001.PrefaceText: The first aid kits that seem common in this country are kind of underwhelming, even the so-called "Master" kits. But I can combine multiple kits to get the stuff I need. Unfortunately the druids don't bother with first aid kits, so I could really use a supply!
quest_23001.SuccessText: Thanks! I'll take the delicate surgical tape from each of these, and let's see, I can reinforce the little scalpel. Hmm, yeah, I can work with this. Here's something for your trouble. Mortals really like these silly documents!

quest_23002.Description: Yagreet at the fairy tree asked for some rubbery tongues, most commonly found on dead Ranalans.
quest_23002.Name: Tongues of The Ranalan
quest_23002.PrefaceText: I've been experimenting with the local fauna. The creatures here have interesting healing properties! I think I can use the tongues of those horrid little frog people as super-strong binding material for broken wings. I don't condone violence, but if you happen upon a dead frog man, you could maybe collect its tongue...
quest_23002.SuccessText: Oh, wow, I didn't realize the tongues were so long! I probably could have done with fewer of them. But thanks! Hmm, here! I brought a lot of these with me from the fae realm for their medicinal value, but mortals seem to like them because they're shiny.

quest_23101.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to hack down any animated vines that pop up out of the ground.
quest_23101.Name: Blasted Vines
quest_23101.PrefaceText: There are plants out there that pop out of the ground to eat people. They followed us here from the Spring Court of the Fae, and they don't even belong in this world! We've told the druids all about them, but they just laugh and say they're harmless. Harmless enough to have killed Pyrale last week! Mow them down, if you see them!
quest_23101.SuccessText: Thank you. Maybe my people can forage in safety now! Take this as a gift.

quest_23102.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to murder the Winter Court soldiers at the various encampments in Sun Vale.
quest_23102.Name: Encroaching Winter Camps

Objectives.Description: Kill Winter Court Fae Near Their Portals And Bases

quest_23102.PrefaceText: I've seen the Winter Court's outposts. They're staying in tiny dimensional pockets where they think they're safe. But they have to come out some time. Show them that their safety is an illusion.
quest_23102.SuccessText: They aren't really dead, you know. Not like mortals die. They'll be back within a week. But they'll not soon forget the pain you caused them! Thank you.

quest_23103.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to kill elite Winter Court soldiers called The Boreal Fist. They are probably much too dangerous to take on alone.
quest_23103.Name: The Boreal Fist

Objectives.Description: Kill Boreal Fist troops or leaders

quest_23103.PrefaceText: We've done much to dissuade the Winter Court from attacking us directly. But there is a team of elite warriors that fear nothing. They are The Boreal Fist. If you can find allies to stand with you, can you strike them down? Be careful. Even I could not kill one of them alone.
quest_23103.SuccessText: You... really?! Amazing! Mortals are far more powerful than we were taught. That's... kind of scary, actually. I mean, thanks, but... you just, like, killed them? Huh. Here, take this, not that you need it. Here's a bunch of this Council money, too.

quest_23201.Description: Hiral at the fairy tree has asked for apple juice.
quest_23201.Name: Apple Juice
quest_23201.PrefaceText: I heard you have apples in this dimension! They don't seem to grow around here though. I wanted to taste the apple juice made from them to see if it's like home.
quest_23201.SuccessText: Thanks! Hiral drinks the juice. Huh. It is exactly the same, except it doesn't have the emotional tones that fairy foods have. That's a good thing in this case. Fae apple juice tastes like resignation and patience. Which is not really that thirst quenching. Hey, as trade, want this weird drug somebody gave me? He said it makes you able to 'multitask', which sounds tiresome, but maybe that's your thing?

quest_23202.Description: Hiral at the fairy tree has asked for some camembert cheese.
quest_23202.Name: Camembert
quest_23202.PrefaceText: We don't really get much cheese in the fae realm. I mean, the troll-dogs are technically milkable, but... ugh. This world's cheeses are amazing! I had a bite of one that I'd love to try again. It was called 'camembert'. Do you have any?
quest_23202.SuccessText: Thanks! I'm going to save this and share it with Yagreet later. She works so hard, you know? But hey, here. I brought it with me from the fae realm.

quest_23301.Description: Preta at the fairy tree asked you for a Gem Crusher, some sort of small tool.
quest_23301.Name: Preta Wants a Gem Crusher
quest_23301.PrefaceText: I'm experimenting with colored inks! I have some gems with me, but I didn't bring a gem crusher. Surely those exist on this plane of existence, right? Do you have a spare?
quest_23301.SuccessText: Oh, it's large! Well, I guess it's small for you. It's kind of unwieldy for a fairy. But I'll manage! Thank you so much!

quest_23302.Description: Preta in Sun Vale said, "Working with physical paper is interesting. I've been reading some books about creatures in this realm. Could you bring me some spider legs to study?"
quest_23302.Name: Analyzing Chitin
quest_23302.PrefaceText: Working with physical paper is interesting. I've been reading some books about creatures in this realm. Could you bring me some spider legs to study?
quest_23302.SuccessText: Excellent! I can study these all day!

quest_23303.Description: Preta in Sun Vale said, "The spider legs you brought me were a lot of fun to study! Will you bring me some antlers from the local deer population? Be careful - some of them are rabid."
quest_23303.Name: Analyzing Antler
quest_23303.PrefaceText: The spider legs you brought me were a lot of fun to study! Will you bring me some antlers from the local deer population? Be careful - some of them are rabid.
quest_23303.SuccessText: Hmm. These are just bone. I guess it's interesting that deer grow massive bones from their skulls, but it's still just bone. Oh, well. Thanks anyway!

quest_234.Description: You've got the jingle. You've got the drape. The only thing you're missing is the subject itself. A bit of hands-on craftwork should illuminate the final aspect of the Necklace symbol.
quest_234.Name: Graffiti: Mastering "Necklace"
quest_234.PrefaceText: You've got the jingle. You've got the drape. The only thing you're missing is the subject itself. A bit of hands-on craftwork should illuminate the final aspect of the Necklace symbol.
quest_234.SuccessText: You've mastered the Necklace symbol, and hence, your heart.

quest_23401.Description: Agrashab the troll wants powdered dust that can sometimes be found inside animated plants.
quest_23401.Name: Powdered Mammal
quest_23401.SuccessText: Good. Will use dust for psychedelic drugs. Here.

quest_23501.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants you to make him a bunch of simple skinning knives.
quest_23501.Name: Simple Knives
quest_23501.PrefaceText: Get started! Make simple skinning knives! I'll sell you the recipe. Then make me a bunch. Show your work. I'll grade you on quality and enthusiasm.
quest_23501.SuccessText: Hm. Quality is okay. Enthusiasm is not high enough! Be more enthusiastic!

quest_23502.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants you to make him a bunch of basic skinning knives.
quest_23502.Name: Fancier Knives
quest_23502.PrefaceText: Practice makes perfect! Practice practice practice! When you think you're ready, make me some basic skinning knives.
quest_23502.SuccessText: Good! You're faking enthusiasm a bit better now! Keep it up.

quest_23503.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants evidence of snail armor. He believes an innkeeper in Eltibule can teach the technique. A simple pair of snail-shell boots should suffice.
quest_23503.Name: Snail Armor
quest_23503.PrefaceText:
Some random wanderer told me that in a far off land, they make armor out of snail shells using the same techniques I use to make tools. Ridiculous, isn't it?

Go find out if it's true. Search far and wide! Leave no stone unturned!

Well, if you want a hint, sure... I heard that some inn keeper in Eltibule is an expert at using snail bits.
quest_23503.SuccessText: These boots are hideous! But I like them! You are industrious. Let me show you some clever toolcrafting techniques usually only taught to goblins.

quest_23504.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants a bunch of Good Metal Slabs.
quest_23504.Name: Slabs for Yogzi
quest_23504.PrefaceText: I need to make fancy tools, but it's hard to find good metal on this island. Can you head to the mainland and survey some good metal slabs for me?
quest_23504.SuccessText: Perfect, perfect. This is good! Hmm, let me see what I can give you in return. Oh, I have a bunch of useless firewood. Here. Take it! Oh, sure, I can teach you a few toolcrafting tricks too, if you like.

quest_23521.Description: Squidlips in Sun Vale said, "I can make some really good crab gumbo, but I need some crabs! Can you bring me 5 of the suckers?"
quest_23521.Name: Crab Soup
quest_23521.PrefaceText: I can make some really good crab gumbo, but I need some crabs! Can you bring me 5 of the suckers?
quest_23521.SuccessText: Thanks! These are perfect. Now the gumbo is going to take a long time simmering, so don't get impatient!

quest_23522.Description: Squidlips in Sun Vale said, "The ocean perch tend to stay away from this area. They know I'll catch 'em! But I don't really want to get up right now. Sitting on the beach just relaxing feels so good. Anyway, can you bring me a passel of perch? The freshest ones are the ones you catch yourself!"
quest_23522.Name: Tasty Perch
quest_23522.PrefaceText: The ocean perch tend to stay away from this area. They know I'll catch 'em! But I don't really want to get up right now. Sitting on the beach just relaxing feels so good. Anyway, can you bring me a passel of perch? The freshest ones are the ones you catch yourself!
quest_23522.SuccessText: Oh, these are good looking fish. Thank you!

quest_23541.Description: Silvia in Sun Vale said, "We can't have these fae creatures running all over our land! You fairies aren't too bad, but the biting vines are ruining the native ecology! Help me cull them, would you?"
quest_23541.Name: Cleanse Sun Vale
quest_23541.PrefaceText: We can't have these fae creatures running all over our land! You fairies aren't too bad, but the biting vines are ruining the native ecology! Help me cull them, would you?
quest_23541.SuccessText: Good job. That's some of those nasty creatures run out of our world. Even if they're immortal, at least they aren't here!

quest_23542.Description: Silvia in Sun Vale said, "Alien fae creatures are all over Sun Vale! I don't blame you, but you should do your part to help clean this up. Kill fey panthers and bring me their tails as proof!"
quest_23542.Name: More Cleansing
quest_23542.PrefaceText: Alien fae creatures are all over Sun Vale! I don't blame you, but you should do your part to help clean this up. Kill fey panthers and bring me their tails as proof!
quest_23542.SuccessText: Thank you for your hard work!

quest_23543.Description: Silvia in Sun Vale said, "Most of the deer around here are healthy, but a number are rabid. Do me a favor and take care of that problem, would you?"
quest_23543.Name: Rabid Deer
quest_23543.PrefaceText: Most of the deer around here are healthy, but a number are rabid. Do me a favor and take care of that problem, would you?
quest_23543.SuccessText: Excellent work. The fewer rabid deer, the less we have to worry about it spreading to other creatures.

quest_23544.Description: Silvia in Sun Vale said, "I'm getting reports that some of the spiders near here are developing some sort of spinneret-related disease. If that's true, I may be able to identify the problem if I can study enough of their spiderwebs."
quest_23544.Name: Sick Spiders
quest_23544.PrefaceText: I'm getting reports that some of the spiders near here are developing some sort of spinneret-related disease. If that's true, I may be able to identify the problem if I can study enough of their spiderwebs.
quest_23544.SuccessText: Good, good. Hmm ... These look pretty normal to me. We'll have to keep an eye on the situation, but right now I don't think we need to take action.

quest_23545.Description: Silvia in Sun Vale said, "My scrying has shown me the locations of an invasive species of oyster. Please destroy them. Their contents are irrelevant to me, as long as the oysters are killed! Here are my notes on their locations; if you have some skill in objective orienteering I'm sure you'll find them easily enough. You know how to pry oysters open, I hope?"
quest_23545.Name: Giant Oyster Invasion

Objectives.Description: Collect Oyster (in some ruins northwest of main island)
Collect Oyster (southern ocean between two islands)
Collect Oyster (shell pile in northern ocean between two islands)

quest_23545.PrefaceText: My scrying has shown me the locations of an invasive species of oyster. Please destroy them. Their contents are irrelevant to me, as long as the oysters are killed! Here are my notes on their locations; if you have some skill in objective orienteering I'm sure you'll find them easily enough. You know how to pry oysters open, I hope?
quest_23545.SuccessText:
Very good. Those oysters are part of a vile ranalon plot. They're an invasive species that would soon kill off regular oysters, which would soon kill our islands' delicate food chains.

You've done well.

quest_23562.Description: Lisi in Sun Vale said, "There are many seashells on the beaches here. I like the pointy ones, and the round shiny ones ... But I really like the shell fragments. I can use them to make little mosaics. It gives me something to do while my wing heals."
quest_23562.Name: Shell Fragments
quest_23562.PrefaceText: There are many seashells on the beaches here. I like the pointy ones, and the round shiny ones ... But I really like the shell fragments. I can use them to make little mosaics. It gives me something to do while my wing heals.
quest_23562.SuccessText: These are shattered just right! Thank you!

quest_23581.Description:
Rohina in Sun Vale said, "I may not be the best druid, but I still know how to appreciate nature! In fact, I'm pretty good at growing flowers! Just not trees, I guess.

You can find a lot of seeds on the creatures around here - I guess maybe because of our influence? No idea where they get the seeds from, but if you bring me some I'll teach you how to properly appreciate nature."
quest_23581.Name: The Beauty in Seeds
quest_23581.PrefaceText:
I may not be the best druid, but I still know how to appreciate nature! In fact, I'm pretty good at growing flowers! Just not trees, I guess.

You can find a lot of seeds on the creatures around here - I guess maybe because of our influence? No idea where they get the seeds from, but if you bring me some I'll teach you how to properly appreciate nature.
quest_23581.SuccessText: I bet I can grow these! Here, let me show you how wonderful nature can be!

quest_23582.Description: Rohina in Sun Vale said, "Druids aren't just tree-lovers. We're deeply invested in the balance of nature, and that's not always pretty. Not to non-druids, anyway. I'll show you - the spiders near here sometimes feed on small shore birds. Bring me some of the prey feathers."
quest_23582.Name: The Beauty in Predation
quest_23582.PrefaceText: Druids aren't just tree-lovers. We're deeply invested in the balance of nature, and that's not always pretty. Not to non-druids, anyway. I'll show you - the spiders near here sometimes feed on small shore birds. Bring me some of the prey feathers.
quest_23582.SuccessText: These are perfect. Now look here ... No, come over here. I won't bite! See how the feather has these little spines that lock together? And even though the bird is dead, the feather stays intact and even waterproof! Isn't that wonderful?

quest_23601.Description: Shirogin in Rahu asked you to confront Ichin the Ice-Master. Ichin has an invitation to the formal execution, and Shirogin wants to know why he didn't get one.
quest_23601.MidwayText: What? Shirogin sent you? Hahaha! This is exactly why he wasn't invited! He skulks! He has others do his dirty work. He connives. He worries. He pleads. Shirogin is something between a master schemer and a desperate fawning kitten. And I say that as Shirogin's closest friend! Tell him what I told you. There was an incident at a previous execution which got him banned... he'll know which one. Tell him that I care for him, and that as his friend, I am telling him that he needs to drop this.
quest_23601.Name: Answers for Shirogin

Objectives.Description: Talk to Ichin the Ice Master

quest_23601.PrefaceText:
The formal execution is a very important social event for the upper crust of Rahu. I used to go every time... but this is the third time in a row that I didn't get invited.

I need to know what I did. Ask my friend Ichin why I'm not invited. I know Ichin plans to go to the execution... he must know what's going on! I would confront him myself, but... I'm not really the confrontational type.
quest_23601.SuccessText: Ichin called me a schemer AND a desperate fawning kitten? At the same time? Faschinating! Ichin normally calls me a schemer, occasionally calls me a kitten, but never calls me a scheming kitten! I know Ichin well, and this means he's trying to throw me off the trail of the truth. I will have to figure out why. Oh, here. This is for your trouble.

quest_23602.Description:
Shirogin in Rahu said, "I was afraid of this. Yes, I know why I'm blacklisted. At the last formal execution, I complimented General Tremal on her tail. General Tremal was born here, unlike the oldest generals. Drawing attention to her tail was an insult and an embarrassment to her.

Hm? Oh, no, it wasn't a mistake. General Tremal had given me a backhanded compliment about my clothes, and I was reciprocating. I just didn't realize how far out of my league Tremal is. I'm blacklisted from executions!

I need your help to make amends. I'm going to create the most wondrous gown for the general! I just need to know her favorite color. See if that beggar Three-Eye knows. He's in the dangerous part of town. Once you pass Sergeant Ultaka and are over the bridge, keep left. You'll see him on the porch, most likely."
quest_23602.MidwayText: Well hello! Yes, I know all about General Tremal. I've heard many things. What? Tremal's favorite color? Shirogin can't be serious! Everyone knows that General Tremal's favorite color is aquamarine! Not cyan, she HATES cyan. It has to be exactly aquamarine. Tell Shirogin I'll come collect my fee for this valuable insight later.
quest_23602.Name: Questions for Shirogin

Objectives.Description: Talk to Three Eyes the Beggar

quest_23602.PrefaceText:
I was afraid of this. Yes, I know why I'm blacklisted. At the last formal execution, I complimented General Tremal on her tail. General Tremal was born here, unlike the oldest generals. Drawing attention to her tail was an insult and an embarrassment to her.

Hm? Oh, no, it wasn't a mistake. General Tremal had given me a backhanded compliment about my clothes, and I was reciprocating. I just didn't realize how far out of my league Tremal is. I'm blacklisted from executions!

I need your help to make amends. I'm going to create the most wondrous gown for the general! I just need to know her favorite color. See if that beggar Three-Eye knows. He's in the dangerous part of town. Once you pass Sergeant Ultaka and are over the bridge, keep left. You'll see him on the porch, most likely.
quest_23602.SuccessText: General Tremal's favorite color is aquamarine? Well, I don't have that, but I do have some cyan... oh. She hates cyan? Well, that's awkward. But you've performed admirably. Good show.

quest_23603.Description:
Shirogin in Rahu said, "This is so frustrating! Where am I going to get aquamarine dye for General Tremal's gown? I checked with my supplier, but she sold all of it to a human named Charles Thompson, who used it all for research! And to make matters worse, this human left weeks ago on a ship bound to Serbule! If you ever find yourself in that backwoods town, maybe you can locate him and get the dye recipe.

I just need three doses of aquamarine dye. This shouldn't be hard!"
quest_23603.Name: Aquamarine Dye for Shirogin
quest_23603.PrefaceText:
This is so frustrating! Where am I going to get aquamarine dye for General Tremal's gown? I checked with my supplier, but she sold all of it to a human named Charles Thompson, who used it all for research! And to make matters worse, this human left weeks ago on a ship bound to Serbule! If you ever find yourself in that backwoods town, maybe you can locate him and get the dye recipe.

I just need three doses of aquamarine dye. This shouldn't be hard!
quest_23603.SuccessText: That's it, lovely aquamarine dye! This will make a wondrous gown. Thank you for delivering it! You may go now.

quest_23604.Description: Shirogin in Rahu said, "While you were taking your time finding the dye I needed, I completed a test-run of General Tremal's gown. It's perfect! Except for the color. So now I need to make another gown in aquamarine... and I've run out of the secret ingredient needed for its protective elements: cockatrice beaks. Can you buy some, or murder some cockatrices and de-beak them? Thank you. Go do it now. This is important!"
quest_23604.Name: The Missing Gown Ingredient
quest_23604.PrefaceText: While you were taking your time finding the dye I needed, I completed a test-run of General Tremal's gown. It's perfect! Except for the color. So now I need to make another gown in aquamarine... and I've run out of the secret ingredient needed for its protective elements: cockatrice beaks. Can you buy some, or murder some cockatrices and de-beak them? Thank you. Go do it now. This is important!
quest_23604.SuccessText:
The beaks! Don't touch them with your bare hands, you'll waste their magic! Yes, yes, these will do nicely. I'm sure Tremal will forgive me when she tries on this masterpiece of a gown!

Oh, you're still here? I have work to do, so go! And take this practice gown with you. It's the wrong color.

quest_23701.Description: Ashk the Answerer in Rahu said, "I like to keep a handful of stock ingredients on hand, and I am almost out of giant rat tails. Fortunately the sewer beneath our feet is teeming with them! I will pay a very reasonable sum if you bring me some. Oh, they needn't be from the Rahu sewers. Any rat tails will do."
quest_23701.Name: Rat Tails for Ashk
quest_23701.PrefaceText: I like to keep a handful of stock ingredients on hand, and I am almost out of giant rat tails. Fortunately the sewer beneath our feet is teeming with them! I will pay a very reasonable sum if you bring me some. Oh, they needn't be from the Rahu sewers. Any rat tails will do.
quest_23701.SuccessText: Oh yes, the rat tails I wanted. Very good, very good.

quest_23702.Description: Ashk the Answerer in Rahu said, "Oh, drat it, now I'm out of rabbit's feet! I'll have to import some more... unless you happen to know where to get some?"
quest_23702.Name: Rabbit's Feet for Ashk
quest_23702.PrefaceText: Oh, drat it, now I'm out of rabbit's feet! I'll have to import some more... unless you happen to know where to get some?
quest_23702.SuccessText: Wow, you found rabbit's feet! You're quite resourceful. Here, perhaps this will further improve your resourcefulness.

quest_23703.Description: Ashk the Answerer in Rahu said, "I used up my last bear gallbladder this morning. Now what will I do if someone comes asking about their chances for inheritance? Or what if someone asks me the sex of their unborn?! I need more bear gallbladders right away! And we're out of stock!"
quest_23703.Name: Bear Gallbladders for Ashk
quest_23703.PrefaceText: I used up my last bear gallbladder this morning. Now what will I do if someone comes asking about their chances for inheritance? Or what if someone asks me the sex of their unborn?! I need more bear gallbladders right away! And we're out of stock!
quest_23703.SuccessText: Bear gallbladders! Good! I've only had to turn away one customer because I was out of these. Thank you so much for the timely delivery!

quest_23801.Description: Tavilak in Red Wing Casino said, "Very few guests are participating in the Natural Food Experience. Many claim that it is boring or too similar to manual labor to be entertaining. I must increase guest satisfaction before this attraction is closed! Perhaps you would like to participate? Simply grow some onions in the garden and exclaim that you are enjoying yourself."
quest_23801.Name: The Natural Food Experience

Objectives.Description: Say aloud 'Growing vegetables is a lot of fun!'
Objectives.Target: Growing vegetables is a lot of fun!

quest_23801.PrefaceText: Very few guests are participating in the Natural Food Experience. Many claim that it is boring or too similar to manual labor to be entertaining. I must increase guest satisfaction before this attraction is closed! Perhaps you would like to participate? Simply grow some onions in the garden and exclaim that you are enjoying yourself.
quest_23801.SuccessText: Thank you for experiencing the wonders of nature, right here at the Red Wing Casino! Please enjoy these guest tokens.

quest_23802.Description: Tavilak in Red Wing Casino said, "Thank you for aiding me. If you have time to continue the Natural Food Experience, please grow several beets and mention that it is a joy to do so."
quest_23802.Name: The Natural Food Experience, pt 2

Objectives.Description: Say aloud 'Growing beets is my favorite casino activity!'
Objectives.Target: Growing beets is my favorite casino activity!

quest_23802.PrefaceText: Thank you for aiding me. If you have time to continue the Natural Food Experience, please grow several beets and mention that it is a joy to do so.
quest_23802.SuccessText: Thank you for experiencing the wonders of nature, right here at the Red Wing Casino! Please enjoy these guest tokens.

quest_23803.Description: Tavilak in Red Wing Casino said, "The Natural Food Experience ends with a difficult task: growing carrots. This is not a task that the average guest can complete during their stay. As a result, reported guest satisfaction is extraordinarily low. Please grow some carrots and exclaim that you are not perturbed by the slow growing speed of organic matter."
quest_23803.Name: The Natural Food Experience, pt 3

Objectives.Description: Say aloud 'These carrots grew slowly, and I wouldn't have it any other way. Thanks Red Wing Casino!'
Objectives.Target: These carrots grew slowly, and I wouldn't have it any other way. Thanks Red Wing Casino!

quest_23803.PrefaceText: The Natural Food Experience ends with a difficult task: growing carrots. This is not a task that the average guest can complete during their stay. As a result, reported guest satisfaction is extraordinarily low. Please grow some carrots and exclaim that you are not perturbed by the slow growing speed of organic matter.
quest_23803.SuccessText: Thank you for experiencing the wonders of nature, right here at the Red Wing Casino! Please enjoy these guest tokens. (I've included some extra as thanks!)

quest_23804.Description: Tavilak in Red Wing Casino said, "A guest told me that moss agates have magical properties that enhance the growth speed of a garden. She was unable to explain the exact nature of this magic, however. If I had a number of moss agates, perhaps I could find the secret!"
quest_23804.Name: Moss Agates for the Garden
quest_23804.PrefaceText: A guest told me that moss agates have magical properties that enhance the growth speed of a garden. She was unable to explain the exact nature of this magic, however. If I had a number of moss agates, perhaps I could find the secret!
quest_23804.SuccessText: Thank you for the moss agates! I shall begin by making inquiries here at the casino to see if others understand the secret to making these work in a garden. In the short term, however, I will probably continue to rely on 'green thumb potions'. Would you like some?

quest_23901.Description: Mandibles in Red Wing Casino said, "Assistance? No, no, I am here to help you! ... Well, if you insist on aiding staff members, the meat storage receptacle could be kept at a slightly colder temperature to reduce spoilage. A few more Ice Cores would work."
quest_23901.Name: Keeping Meat Cold
quest_23901.PrefaceText: Assistance? No, no, I am here to help you! ... Well, if you insist on aiding staff members, the meat storage receptacle could be kept at a slightly colder temperature to reduce spoilage. A few more Ice Cores would work.
quest_23901.SuccessText: They have exquisite magic, don't you agree? These Ice Cores never get warm enough to melt... ever! I've thrown them into fires and they still retain this property. This is a phenomenal level of power, in some ways... anyway, I appreciate your efforts. Thank you!

quest_23902.Description: Mandibles in Red Wing Casino said, "I miss my time in Sedgewick Forest, when I worked with my brethren to keep goblin populations in check. Would you kill goblins in my name? As they perish, make sure to state, 'This is for Mandibles.'"
quest_23902.Name: Killing Goblins in Mandibles' Name
quest_23902.PrefaceText: I miss my time in Sedgewick Forest, when I worked with my brethren to keep goblin populations in check. Would you kill goblins in my name? As they perish, make sure to state, 'This is for Mandibles.'
quest_23902.SuccessText: You bloodthirsty creature! I appreciate your efforts to keep my name in every evil goblin's heart. By the way please do not mention my anti-goblin comments to our resident goblin population. It has been a source of ... disagreement in the past. But we know the truth, do we not? Yes. We are kindred.

quest_23903.Description: Mandibles in Red Wing Casino said, "My Sausage Swirlers are a hit with many varieties of mammalian guests. However, I believe I could improve on their flavor if they were made of bear meat -- or a similar beast -- instead of goblin meat. Would you procure some for me?"
quest_23903.Name: Bear Meat Swirlers
quest_23903.PrefaceText: My Sausage Swirlers are a hit with many varieties of mammalian guests. However, I believe I could improve on their flavor if they were made of bear meat -- or a similar beast -- instead of goblin meat. Would you procure some for me?
quest_23903.SuccessText: Perfect. It smells delicious! ... But I do understand that civilized creatures find raw meat disgusting. I shall put it on ice immediately!

quest_23904.Description: Mandibles in Red Wing Casino said, "One of our VIP guests has requested a special variety of bread, and I do not know how to make it! Another guest told me that a human somewhere in Kur can teach the recipe, but of course that helps me very little. I am in dire need of this 'vegan nut barley bread', so if you manage to bake some, please bring it to me!"
quest_23904.Name: Specialty Bread Order
quest_23904.PrefaceText: One of our VIP guests has requested a special variety of bread, and I do not know how to make it! Another guest told me that a human somewhere in Kur can teach the recipe, but of course that helps me very little. I am in dire need of this 'vegan nut barley bread', so if you manage to bake some, please bring it to me!
quest_23904.SuccessText: This is the bread? It smells... like bread. But my sensory organs are perhaps not as attuned to bread smells. Thank you, friend. Here is money for your trouble.

quest_24.Description: Marna wants me to collect a ton of spider legs for her medicinal recipes. In exchange, she'll teach me one of her secret recipes.
quest_24.Name: Their Hairy Legs

quest_24001.Description: Corey the Croaker in the Winter Nexus asked you for fairy wings.
quest_24001.Name: Corey Wants Wings
quest_24001.PrefaceText: I know it's taboo to carry around fairy wings. But that's why they're so great! Nothing can rile up an Autumn or Summer like a big old bed full of ripped-off wings. Get me some, I'm gonna do something gross.
quest_24001.SuccessText: Hahaha okay this is gonna be great. You'll see. For now, here's a thing I found. Neat, huh?

quest_24002.Description: Corey the Croaker in the Winter Nexus asked you for ogre stomachs.
quest_24002.Name: Corey Wants Ogre Stomachs
quest_24002.PrefaceText: If you're gonna be murdering harmless ogres, can you collect their stomachs for me? I need 'em for fart bladders and other joke toys.
quest_24002.SuccessText: Hm, not bad. Here! This is for your trouble!

quest_24101.Description: Fazzi in the Winter Nexus asked you to kill an Ogre named Gorgos.
quest_24101.Name: Murdering Gorgos
quest_24101.PrefaceText: Ogres are all dumb as hell and mean to boot, but Gorgos is the biggest and dumbest one around here. He chased us back here! If he were to die suddenly... that'd be really convenient.
quest_24101.SuccessText: He's dead? Great! Now we can begin planning phase 2. Real soon. Here's mortal money for your task. What do you mortals call it? "Blood money?"

quest_24102.Description: Fazzi in the Winter Nexus asked you for some garnets.
quest_24102.Name: Garnets
quest_24102.PrefaceText: I'm surrounded by these stupid Winterprize gems in this nexus! So ugly! I wish I had some pretty gems. Garnets are my favorite!
quest_24102.SuccessText: Wow! Where'd you find garnets around here? I hope you didn't go to a lot of trouble for me! Here are some of my prettier gems in exchange!

quest_24201.Description: Furlak in Rahu asked you to kill some orcs in his name. The closest ones, however, are in the Kur Mountains.
quest_24201.Name: Killing Orcs For Old Times' Sake
quest_24201.PrefaceText: I'm getting too old to travel comfortably. I can still fight, but riding for hours? That leaves me too sore! That's why I need your help. Each year I kill a bunch of orcs for the glory of Rahu, but we've pushed the orcs out of the desert now, so the nearest ones are in Kur. Can you travel there and kill some orcs in my name?
quest_24201.SuccessText: Tell me again how it went! Oh I miss the thrill of battle. The freezing cold, though... I don't miss that.

quest_24202.Description: Furlak in Rahu asked you to bring him some Dwarven N Cores. He claims they can be found in ruins deep in the Ilmari desert.
quest_24202.Name: Powering The Back-Scratcher
quest_24202.PrefaceText:
When I was an active general, I was given a gift by a visiting dwarven emissary. It's a mechanical back-scratching arm. It was my prized possession for years, until it broke.

Ufkar says it's not really broken, though, just out of magic. I need something called an 'N Core'. Two of them, actually. I've heard of adventurers finding them in the desert. Usually in those ruins from the war.
quest_24202.SuccessText: Just looking at these, I can almost feel the back scratcher running up and down my back... ahh, this is going to feel so good. Excuse me, please.

quest_24203.Description: Furlak in Rahu asked you to find a perfume called Telka's Tail. He suggested rakshasa bandits might have it.
quest_24203.Name: Telka's Tail for Furlak
quest_24203.PrefaceText: I have been invited to the execution party this month, but I'm not feeling my old confident self. What I need is something to bolster my righteousness. Telka's Tail! It's a perfume. Could you find a bottle? Rakshasa bandits might have it.
quest_24203.SuccessText: Ah, smell that? Yes. Yes! How dare that General Tremal think she can make me obsolete? I will show them! All of them! Let them tremble at my claws! ... Hmm, this is much more potent than I remembered. I'll have to dilute it down a bit or I might make an ass of myself. But I will make it work. Thank you.

quest_24204.Description: Furlak in Rahu asked you to kill a large rhino in the desert named The Perforator.
quest_24204.Name: Furlak's Fury
quest_24204.PrefaceText:
One thing I was known for before being ousted from the army was my ability to seek out and destroy creatures that should not be here. I may no longer possess the ability to destroy them, but I can still seek them out...

That's why you must believe me when I say there is a non-native abomination within our midst. I've heard some folks calling it 'The Perforator', but whatever its name is it must be destroyed lest it open the way for more of its kind to infiltrate the desert.
quest_24204.SuccessText: [Furlak sniffs the air] Wonderful! The stench of that foul creature is already lessened. You have done well today. I hope this will be a lesson to other potential invaders that we will not tolerate their kind here.

quest_24205.Description: Furlak in Rahu asked you to kill a rhino in the Fae Realm named The Puncturer.
quest_24205.Name: Furlak's Follow-up
quest_24205.PrefaceText:
Come to think of it, the area that The Perforator inhabited used to belong to a native rhino that folks affectionately called The Puncturer. It is possible that The Puncturer and The Perforator switched places, and by slaying both of them it will un-transpose them.

There is only one way to find out for sure. You must journey to the Fae Realm, locate The Puncturer, and kill it. Only then will we know if it returns to this realm.
quest_24205.SuccessText: Hm, so the two rhinos did not switch places, and now both of them are simply dead? [Furlak shrugs.] At least we tried.

quest_24301.Description: Selaxi in Amulna asked for some carrots. She mentioned that there's a small garden lot in Amulna where you could grow them.
quest_24301.Name: Fresh Carrots
quest_24301.PrefaceText:
Can you run over to Kelim's little garden -- it's over in the corner of town -- and see if he's going to have more carrots any time in the next year? He just keeps growing peppers!

You know what, don't bother talking to the lout. Just get me carrots!
quest_24301.SuccessText: Yes! Carrots! Kelim keeps saying they're super difficult to grow, but that doesn't make any sense, does it? They can't be any harder to grow than, say, a potato. Anyway, thanks! Here, take these. A dozen potatoes for a half-dozen carrots seems like a good trade, right?

quest_24302.Description: Selaxi in Amulna has asked you to obtain giant hairballs. The most common source is grimalkin in the desert.
quest_24302.Name: Hairballs Are Edible?!
quest_24302.PrefaceText: Hmm, can I trust you? Well, I guess I have no choice. One of the secret ingredients in my signature dish is ground up grimalkin hair. But not just ordinary hair -- it's got to be covered in their spit! If you find some of those giant hairballs, bring them to me, okay?
quest_24302.SuccessText:
Ugh, they stink! Just... put them over there. Now, what do I owe you? Oh, right, you were doing me a favor! So I owe you nothing but my thanks. Thanks!

Fine, fine, here, take this money also.

quest_24401.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for a Nice Meditation Stool.
quest_24401.Name: A Nice Stool
quest_24401.PrefaceText: Rakshasa make furniture that's too uncomfortable! Can you get me a decent stool? One of those nice meditation stools should do. I need something I can sit on for hours at a time.
quest_24401.SuccessText: Hmm... not as nice as I expected. If I wear my kilt I'll get splinters! But thanks, I'll try using it with my robes. Here, you can have my old kilt if you like.

quest_24402.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for Carnelians.
quest_24402.Name: Carnelians for Urzab
quest_24402.PrefaceText: I have family back in Sedgewick Forest: my lovely wife, our bear, and three gobs. But the clan infighting is too dangerous there. I need to make it big here so I can bring my family over. In the short term, though, I need to send back resources that my wife can turn into weapons. Have you come across any carnelians? They're perfect for making magic swords. Say, a half-dozen of them?
quest_24402.SuccessText: Carnelians! Give them to me! Hahaha! Here, take this trinket. We're even! No debts!

quest_24403.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for Manticore tail spikes.
quest_24403.Name: Manticore Tails Needed!
quest_24403.PrefaceText: This is a perfect spot for a jewelry shop because those hideous manticores love jewelry! If you kill them, bring their jewelry here to sell. And if you really want to get on my good side, bring me their tail spikes. I'm shipping them home for my wife to turn into powerful poison knives!
quest_24403.SuccessText: Thank you. Pashub will turn these into horrific stilettos! Here, this is one of her earlier works.

quest_24501.Description: Makara in the Ilmari Desert asked you to find an odd crystal. She said it could be found in yeti caves deep beneath the Kur Mountains.
quest_24501.Name: The Weird Prism
quest_24501.PrefaceText:
Prisms are useful for a few special crafting tasks. I can make ordinary prisms, but I've heard of a strange prism made by an ancient yeti master. I wish to study it! Find it for me?

It would be in some cave in the Kur Mountains, I presume. I doubt it would be easy to find, since I've only heard vague rumors of it. It's probably in some sack deep down in a hole somewhere.
quest_24501.SuccessText: This is it! Hm. These sigils attune it to a specific species. That's not supposed to be possible! I will have to study this more. Oh, here. These are boring old regular prisms in exchange.

quest_24601.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to grow some fresh vegetables. He wasn't particular about the type -- just that you grow them yourself.
quest_24601.Name: Entertain Me: Growing Vegetables
quest_24601.PrefaceText: Why don't you go grow some vegetables for me? Yes. Grow a dozen fresh vegetables. How bored am I? I'm bored enough to watch plants grow -- THAT'S how bored!
quest_24601.SuccessText: Well, I am sorry to report that watching plants grow is not exciting. I guess I figured since farmers do it all day, it must have had some fascination, but no. Sigh.

quest_24602.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to go out and skin a bunch of animals. You'll need a Skinning Knife or similar tool in your inventory.
quest_24602.Name: Entertain Me: Skinning
quest_24602.PrefaceText: Skin carcasses for me! Take a skinning knife and just... yeah, skin them! So gross! But don't do it in town -- I don't want to watch you do it, I just want to be amused by the knowledge that you're out there doing it.
quest_24602.SuccessText: Did you really skin all those animals? Gross! Ha ha! Well. That was amusing for about two seconds. Bored again!

quest_24603.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to go out and butcher a bunch of animals. You'll need a Butcher Knife or similar tool in your inventory.
quest_24603.Name: Entertain Me: Butchering
quest_24603.PrefaceText: Butcher some dead beasts for my amusement! Take a butcher knife and just... yeah, cut out their meat! Ugh, so gross, just thinking about it! Ha ha! That's why you're doing it and not me.
quest_24603.SuccessText: You butchered all that meat? Wow. You're kind of a monster, aren't you? Ha ha, just kidding! Just kidding! Don't get angry! Here. Take this and settle down.

quest_24604.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to tip a bunch of other players with the /tip command. You should tip players at least 10 coins.
quest_24604.Name: Entertain Me: Tipping Strangers
quest_24604.PrefaceText: What we need to cure boredom is culture! And culture demands patrons. So help me foster some culture -- go tip people! Give them at least 10 Councils apiece -- nobody likes a cheapskate. [ Use the /tip command in the chat window to tip players. For instance, if a player was named Bob, you could type "/tip Bob 10" ]
quest_24604.SuccessText: Good, good. Here, I'll reimburse your expenses. Now let's see if we get some better musicians showing up soon!

quest_24605.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to milk five different cows.
quest_24605.Name: Entertain Me: Milking Cows
quest_24605.PrefaceText: Go milk the cows! All five of them! ... what do you mean there's only four cows? I saw a fifth one wander by recently. A talking cow. Get her milk, too!
quest_24605.SuccessText: Good! See, doesn't working with your hands cure boredom? Not for me, obviously. But for you! I care about you. Not really. Here's some money.

quest_24606.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to play some music.
quest_24606.Name: Entertain Me: Playing Music
quest_24606.PrefaceText: Go grab a lute -- I think Marna sells some. And play! Don't bother playing near me, though -- I can't stand beginner lute music. I just want you to get some practice time in so that you'll be more entertaining later.
quest_24606.SuccessText: Play till your fingers bled? Wonderful! Elves are patient, you know. I'm investing in you to cure my far-future boredom.

quest_24607.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to pick some mushrooms.
quest_24607.Name: Entertain Me: Picking Mushrooms
quest_24607.PrefaceText: Go dig up some mushrooms. Tell me if you hear any weird whispering in your head when you do it.
quest_24607.SuccessText: Did you hear anything when you picked the mushrooms? See a weird vision? ... no, no, don't tell me! I'm positive I was just imagining it, and your evidence would just cause me to doubt myself further. I have to believe in myself! And I believe my brain was lying to me! Case closed.

quest_24608.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to kill some animals. Not monsters: just animals.
quest_24608.Name: Entertain Me: Kill Animals
quest_24608.PrefaceText: Go and kill some animals! Pigs, deer, sheep, whatever. But don't do it in town, you'll upset everybody. And don't kill monsters -- just animals! I don't want you getting hurt on my behalf.
quest_24608.SuccessText: You really went out and killed animals on my behalf? Gruesome! I am like unto a god! Sorry, sorry. I meant like unto a rich person. Here's money.

quest_24609.Description: Pennoc in Serbule commanded you to dance. (You can learn to dance from Lana Songtree in Serbule Hills. Remain dancing to music continuously for 20 seconds to advance the quest.)
quest_24609.Name: Entertain Me: Dance!
quest_24609.PrefaceText: Dance for me, peasant! Err, I mean... dance for me, pleasant. ly. Pleasantly. Just dance, okay?
quest_24609.SuccessText: That was some terrible dancing. But vaguely entertaining in its terribleness, so good job.

quest_24610.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to give presents to the townsfolk of Serbule. (Use the 'Give Gift' option when talking to an NPC.) The gifts need to be something the townsfolk like -- use 'Small Talk' to find that out.
quest_24610.Name: Entertain Me: Thoughtful Gifts
quest_24610.PrefaceText: The people in this town are boring. Aside from the great sex, there's nothing to really recommend this place. I think the problem lies in morale. Go boost morale! Give the townsfolk thoughtful gifts. And don't be a cheapskate -- spend at least 50 Councils on each.
quest_24610.SuccessText: Now we just wait a few years and then bask in the pleasantness that ensues from enhanced morale. It's a good thing elves are patient, eh?

quest_24611.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to give presents to the townsfolk of Serbule -- but they have to be presents they hate. (Use 'Small Talk' to find what NPCs dislike. Not every NPC has strong dislikes, but many of them are just quiet about it -- they won't share their dislikes with you until you reach Friends favor level. Others are quite vocal about their dislikes, so check around.)
quest_24611.Name: Entertain Me: Bad Gifts

Objectives.Description: Give Bad Gifts To Different Townsfolk

quest_24611.PrefaceText: Everybody always gives thoughtful gifts. It's stupid. Go and give people terrible gifts! Ha ha! Find out what they hate and give them that. Hilarious! [ Tip: use 'Small Talk' to find what NPCs dislike. Not every NPC has strong dislikes, but many of them are just quiet about it -- they won't share their dislikes with you until you reach Friends favor level. ]
quest_24611.SuccessText: Well, it was hilarious to me. Sorry that it didn't go as well for you. Here's some cash to help you smooth everything over.

quest_24612.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to hurt yourself by falling off of tall things.
quest_24612.Name: Entertain Me: Falling Down
quest_24612.PrefaceText: You know what's funny? Falling down is funny! But is it funny if the person hurts themselves? I need to experiment. Fall off of things repeatedly -- make sure you hurt yourself each time.
quest_24612.SuccessText: So, was it funny? ... Well, you're biased. I'm sure it was great fun. Stop being such a whiner.

quest_24613.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to go cut some lumber. (Therese in Serbule sells a handsaw.)
quest_24613.Name: Entertain Me: Cutting Wood
quest_24613.PrefaceText: Go chop lumber. I don't know why I think that will entertain me, but I'm willing to try anything at this point.
quest_24613.SuccessText: You what? You chopped lumber on my behalf? Why would that be entertaining?! Who asked you to... oh, I guess I did. Well, that was dumb, but good job.

quest_24614.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to commit murder against another player. [ There's a "PvP cellar" in Serbule where players can attack each other. See if you can kill someone in there. ]
quest_24614.Name: Entertain Me: Killing a Person
quest_24614.PrefaceText: Nothing works! Nothing is entertaining! I guess I am just too jaded to be amused by simple things. But there's still the ultimate prey: other people! Go kill another adventurer! Mwahahaha! [ There's a "PvP cellar" in Serbule where players can attack each other. See if you can kill someone in there. ]
quest_24614.SuccessText: It's done?! ... Wait, I saw that guy run by just a minute ago. You didn't kill anybody! But I like your chutzpah, you really sold that lie with your body language.

quest_24615.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to go get hurt by a monster or wild animal. (You must take 500 points of health damage to complete the task.)
quest_24615.Name: Entertain Me: Getting Hurt In Combat
quest_24615.PrefaceText: I hate how hunters always talk about their big game, but they don't have scars. How dangerous could it be if you don't even get maimed? So go get hurt. That'll give you a much more authentic hunting story to tell me.
quest_24615.SuccessText: Nice wounds! So, tell me the epic story of your battle! ... ... That's it? You should have embellished it some more. But I guess it's a start of a decent story.

quest_24616.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to survey for crystals.
quest_24616.Name: Entertain Me: Digging Up Gems
quest_24616.PrefaceText: I hear hard work keeps your mind off of things, so why don't you do some hard work for me? Go survey for minerals and dig them up! I think there's a lady in Serbule Hills that can teach you the basics -- she's in that little inn down there.
quest_24616.SuccessText:
So you calculated the location of semiprecious stones and then dug them up out of the ground? Nice! And see? Not boring at all, right? Hard work is its own reward!

No but really, here's a real reward.

quest_24617.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to pick flowers.
quest_24617.Name: Entertain Me: Growing Flowers
quest_24617.PrefaceText: You know why you aren't entertaining? It's because you don't smell like flowers. I think. So go grow some flowers!
quest_24617.SuccessText:
Nope, that wasn't it: you're still not entertaining. You do smell different, though: flowery but with a slight musk of sweat... strangely nice, in fact...

In fact... I was thinking maybe you and I could go and... wait! No!

Sorry about that: I accidentally lowered my standards for a second there. All better now!

quest_24618.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to catch fish.
quest_24618.Name: Entertain Me: Fishing
quest_24618.PrefaceText: Go into the lake and catch some fish with your bare hands! That's sure to entertain me briefly!
quest_24618.SuccessText: Well, I have no idea if that was entertaining or not. You were pretty far away and I couldn't see you. I guess I didn't think that through too well.

quest_24619.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to say words of power. (You can research words of power when you have several levels of the Lore skill, which you can obtain by examining lore items in the world.)
quest_24619.Name: Entertain Me: Words of Power
quest_24619.PrefaceText: Once I heard a wizard say a weird word -- just some gibberish -- and then they disappeared! Do you know any magic words? Say some for me! [ You can research words of power when you have several levels of the Lore skill, which you can obtain by examining lore items in the world. ]
quest_24619.SuccessText: Fairly entertaining! But you used up the words -- I tried saying them myself but they do nothing. Why did you break them?!

quest_24620.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to eat lots of prepared foods.
quest_24620.Name: Entertain Me: Gorging on Food
quest_24620.PrefaceText: Hmm, go and, and... eat! Eat a ton of cooked food all at once!
quest_24620.SuccessText: You aren't nearly as incapacitated as I'd have expected from someone who just ate 12 meals. Boring. But I guess you tried.

quest_24621.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to make some things with Carpentry.
quest_24621.Name: Entertain Me: Woodworking
quest_24621.PrefaceText: Go whittle me something. A table or something, anything! Any old carpentry item will do. Jara's good with wood -- if you know what I mean -- and she lives nearby, in the farm outside of town. Maybe you could get her to teach you.
quest_24621.SuccessText:
You made these? Huh. Well, good job. I didn't think you'd really do it!

Hmm, now I feel guilty. Here, take some extra cash. Money fixes all guilt!

quest_24622.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to open chests in the Serbule Crypt.
quest_24622.Name: Entertain Me: Serbule Crypt Chests
quest_24622.PrefaceText: You need better stories of adventure. And for that, you need more adventure. I hear there's some old storage chests full of treasure in the Serbule Crypt outside of town... go open 'em up. And remember to make it exciting!
quest_24622.SuccessText: And then what happened? Nice! See, that's a mediocre story! Which is much better than your earlier sub-mediocre stories. We're making progress. Elves take the long view. Just a few more decades and you'll be a storyteller!

quest_24623.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to trade with another player. (Use the Trade option when examining another player. You don't have to actually trade items -- just so long as one or the other of you gets at least one item, that'll count.)
quest_24623.Name: Entertain Me: Player Trade
quest_24623.PrefaceText: Serbule desperately needs more traveling circuses to show up. But we're too small. So we need to facilitate trade! Go: go trade! Trade with other adventurers like yourself, so that the word starts to spread.
quest_24623.SuccessText: Great trading! After a few thousand more trades, I'm sure the news will reach the circuses! I hope it doesn't take more than a few years...

quest_24624.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to drink poison for his amusement.
quest_24624.Name: Entertain Me: Drink Poison
quest_24624.PrefaceText: Nothing is entertaining enough! Hmm... perhaps... why don't you drink some poison? Not enough to kill you, necessarily -- just enough to make you quite ill.
quest_24624.SuccessText:
Nope. You are especially un-fun while you're being violently ill. Not entertaining!

Oh, stop the moaning. Here. Here's some extra coin for your trouble.

quest_24625.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to teleport a bunch. (Use teleportation recipes like Recall Circle.)
quest_24625.Name: Entertain Me: Teleportation
quest_24625.PrefaceText: You know that blue-glowy pedestal near the entrance to town? That's a teleportation platform! So ugly, right? The platforms in Verta are so pretty, but these... well, anyway, go use it. Go and teleport! Amuse me with your teleporty antics!
quest_24625.SuccessText: Poof, one second you're there, and then you're gone. I'd say that never ceases to entertain me, but that'd be a lie. It's super boring. But thanks for trying.

quest_24626.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to cook some fish dishes.
quest_24626.Name: Entertain Me: Cooking Fish
quest_24626.PrefaceText:
I hate the smell of raw fish, but I sometimes like the smell of fried fish. Weird, right?

Hmm, go and cook some fish. Maybe the smell will waft towards me.
quest_24626.SuccessText: Well... the smell of fried fish isn't as pleasant as I remembered.

quest_24627.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to concoct some alchemical potions.
quest_24627.Name: Entertain Me: Alchemy
quest_24627.PrefaceText: You need to be more learned. It'll make you more interesting to talk to. Go and brew some alchemical substances -- alchemists are learned!
quest_24627.SuccessText: You brewed the potions? Okay, good. Yes, okay. ... Okay, stop telling me about the potions you brewed. It didn't work: you're still boring to talk to!

quest_24628.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to kill pigs. The killing blow must be a kick.
quest_24628.Name: Entertain Me: Pig Kicking
quest_24628.PrefaceText: Death can be entertaining. Not mine, though. Nor yours! Well, maybe yours... but that's short-term thinking. I need you to stick around and alleviate my boredom for a long time to come. Hmm, you should kill something though. And do it in an entertaining way. Kick some pigs to death. [ The killing blow must be a kick. ]
quest_24628.SuccessText:
You kicked pigs to death? Well, aren't you the brave hero. What an ass!

Ha ha yes, I had you do that just so I could call you names. I was briefly amused, though.

quest_24629.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to kill deer with the Archery skill.
quest_24629.Name: Entertain Me: Deer Hunting
quest_24629.PrefaceText: What we need is more brave hunters. Be a brave hunter. Go kill some harmless deer! But do it the hunter way: with a bow and arrow. None of that magical crap!
quest_24629.SuccessText: Well, it turns out that watching a hunter skulk around is intrinsically boring. Who knew?

quest_24630.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to kill creatures using explosive blasts.
quest_24630.Name: Entertain Me: Bursts of Death
quest_24630.PrefaceText: Explosions are entertaining! Go explode some animals! Or monsters! Or whatever! [ The killing blow must be made with a burst attack, such as a bomb or explosion. ]
quest_24630.SuccessText: That was kind of entertaining -- the bits I could see, anyway...

quest_24631.Description: Pennoc in Serbule told you to kill Elite or Boss creatures. These are often found deep in dungeons.
quest_24631.Name: Entertain Me: Boss Fights
quest_24631.PrefaceText: You're so boring! Go kill some deadly boss monsters! There's always boss monsters in epic tales!
quest_24631.SuccessText: Mmm. Well, I'm sure the boss fight was dramatic, but your storytelling skill is ... terrible. I need to feel like I was there!

quest_24801.Description: Lakrea told you to catch cavefish. They can be found deep in certain caves, including the caves of Kur Mountains.
quest_24801.Name: Holistic Wellness: Cave Fishing
quest_24801.PrefaceText:
