You know what you need? Fish oil. But not just any fish oil -- you need the oil from cave fish. Just holding the fish is enough, but they have to be fresh -- like, super fresh. I recommend catching them yourself.

I hear there's some fish growing in the caves of the Kur Mountains! That's a pretty far trek, but the fresh air will do you good, too.
quest_24801.SuccessText: Did you catch the cave fish? Hmm, yes, your complexion does look a little better. Good job.

quest_24802.Description: Lakrea suggested that you "battle" a shark.
quest_24802.Name: Holistic Wellness: Shark Wrestling
quest_24802.PrefaceText: I can tell your spirits are low. Your spirit needs to do battle with the spirit of the predator. The shark predator! Defeat a shark in an epic struggle, and I guarantee you'll feel better.
quest_24802.SuccessText: Your spirits still seem low, but they're slightly higher than before. Hmm, I bet the shark you used wasn't very predatory. But every little step to wellness helps!

quest_24803.Description: Lakrea directed you to stand in a sandstorm. There are sandstorms in the Ilmari Desert. (You must be within 65 meters of the center of the storm to advance the quest.)
quest_24803.Name: Holistic Wellness: Spirit of the Wind
quest_24803.PrefaceText: Your mind will never fly free while your thoughts stay so firmly planted on the ground. You need to start thinking like the wind! Hmm, I know -- why don't you go think in the wind? In a sandstorm! Now don't get crazy -- just stay in the sand storm for a few seconds at a time, or you might get hurt!
quest_24803.SuccessText: You look ... sandy. It's not a good look for you. We should work on your complexion next!

quest_24804.Description: Lakrea gave you a recipe for a Raw Egg Blend and instructed you to drink one.
quest_24804.Name: Holistic Wellness: Raw Egg Blend
quest_24804.PrefaceText: Hmm... there's something that you need... let me see if I can figure it out. Ah! You need to consume the unborn offspring of a smallish bird! I have the recipe right here.
quest_24804.SuccessText: You drank it! I can tell: you look a little green. But don't worry, green is the color of nature.

quest_24805.Description: Lakrea gave you a recipe for a Bacon Basket and instructed you to cook one. Eating it is optional.
quest_24805.Name: Holistic Wellness: Bacon Basket
quest_24805.PrefaceText: Eating meat is often bad for your holistic health, but cooking with meat definitely isn't! As you weave the guts of fallen animals into a delicious meal, you'll find your mind soaring to new heights.
quest_24805.SuccessText: How did the pig guts feel? Gross? Fatty? You see!? You're finally interacting with the real world, not the fake world that you usually live in. You'll get healthy in no time.

quest_24806.Description: Lakrea told you to build two meditation stools. (Meditation stools are made with Carpentry.)
quest_24806.Name: Holistic Wellness: Meditative Stool
quest_24806.PrefaceText: You should meditate more! But not on the ground. True meditation requires a meditation stool that you built yourself. Go and assemble a meditation stool. Then make a backup. Damned stools break all the time!
quest_24806.SuccessText: Good, good. Now you should go meditate with one of the stools! I bet you'll find it very deeply fulfilling. And you'll wish you'd done a better job on the stool, too! That's how we push ourselves to improve.

quest_24807.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'beleaguered' into your next conversation. Beleaguered: adjective: beset with difficulties. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24807.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Beleaguered'
quest_24807.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'beleaguered'. [ Beleaguered: adjective: beset with difficulties. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24807.SuccessText: Good! With that out of the way, your poor beleaguered brain has one less thing to worry about now.

quest_24808.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'maladaptive' into your next conversation. Maladaptive: adjective: not providing adequate or appropriate adjustment to the environment or situation. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24808.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Maladaptive'
quest_24808.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'maladaptive'. [ Maladaptive: adjective: not providing adequate or appropriate adjustment to the environment or situation. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't just throw it out there! Use it in a conversation!
quest_24808.SuccessText: Good! Now, did you use the word maladaptively, or productively? ... See what I did there? It doesn't look so weird and out of place anymore, does it?

quest_24809.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'obsequious' into your next conversation. Obsequious: adjective: too eager to help or obey someone. Fawning. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24809.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Obsequious'
quest_24809.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'obsequious'. [ Obsequious: adjective: too eager to help or obey someone. Fawning. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24809.SuccessText: Good! Your vocabulary is growing! ... I'd use 'obsequious' in a sentence here, but half of knowing vocabulary is knowing when not to force it into a conversation.

quest_24810.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'susurrus' into your next conversation. Susurrus: noun: a soft whispering or rustling sound. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24810.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Susurrus'
quest_24810.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'susurrus'. [ Susurrus: noun: a soft whispering or rustling sound. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24810.SuccessText: I heard a susurrus and I suspected you were the cause! Good job.

quest_24811.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'vacillate' into your next conversation. Vacillate: verb: to waver back and forth indecisively. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24811.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Vacillate'
quest_24811.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'vacillate'. [ Vacillate: verb: to waver back and forth indecisively. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24811.SuccessText: Good work. Next time you're vacillating between two good choices, just pick the choice on the left. And if you think 'Ew, no, the one on the left is terrible!', then you've solved the problem, because in your heart you already picked the one on the right. Free life advice for ya there.

quest_24812.Description: Lakrea told you to go get attacked by nine different dinosaurs, or at least creatures in the dinosaur family. (Many things are in the dinosaur family, including dragons and birds.)
quest_24812.Name: Holistic Wellness: Bitten By a Dinosaur
quest_24812.PrefaceText: I was talking to a sailor earlier who gave me the most insightful advice! He said that in the west, their holy women allow themselves to be attacked by at least ten different dinosaurs. This gives them the real-world experience they need to help people with many different problems. Why don't you try that? But you don't need to get hit by ten different dinosaurs, though -- you aren't some holy woman! Ha ha! No, nine different dinosaurs will do for you. And I guess really, anything in the dinosaur family would work.
quest_24812.SuccessText: Oo, that scar looks bad. But see? Now you have real-life advice! And you finally got up off your butt and did something with your life! Woo! Go you! Here's some extra stuff!

quest_24813.Description: Lakrea told you to go get attacked by nine different ruminants. (Ruminants are animals like cows, sheep, deer, or camels.)
quest_24813.Name: Holistic Wellness: Bitten By a Ruminant
quest_24813.PrefaceText:
Remember when you were bitten by those dinosaurs? Yeah, it didn't really seem to make you wiser in the long run. I mean, you're still ... um, ... still seeking answers.

I think the problem is that dinosaurs are dramatic and scary. Real life isn't always dramatic and scary -- but you have to take it just as seriously. So go get attacked by nine different ruminants. That should be less scary, but just as important!
quest_24813.SuccessText: Hm, you look kinda beaten up! I guess I thought ruminants were pretty laid back. Sorry about that.

quest_24814.Description: Lakrea told you to bury canines to build up your sense of compassion.
quest_24814.Name: Holistic Wellness: Bury Dogs
quest_24814.PrefaceText: You need to work on your compassion. Grab a shovel and bury some unfortunate deceased dogs. Or wolves, or whatever. I hate the thought of dogs dying and not even getting a proper burial!
quest_24814.SuccessText: You buried 12 dogs? Great job! Hmm, you don't look that sad. I would have been bawling my eyes out at those poor dead animals. ... Weird.

quest_24815.Description: Lakrea suggested that you drink 20 bottles of water.
quest_24815.Name: Holistic Wellness: Drink Water
quest_24815.PrefaceText: A travelling monk told me the most interesting thing! She said that if you drink at least 20 glasses of water a day, your entire system will be flushed and you'll feel amazing. Give it a shot!
quest_24815.SuccessText: You look, uh, kind of bloated, actually. Maybe you should have drunk diet water. Keep that in mind for next time.

quest_24816.Description: Lakrea suggested that you activate an explosive runestone.
quest_24816.Name: Holistic Wellness: Explosive Runestones
quest_24816.PrefaceText: My mother always said, "If you trip an explosive runestone in the morning, nothing worse will happen to you all day." And she was right! Go ahead and try it -- you'll see what I mean.
quest_24816.SuccessText: See? It's all uphill from here! Sorry about the scarring and hair loss, though...

quest_24817.Description: Lakrea told you to bomb things. (Use bomb abilities, such as Spore Bomb.)
quest_24817.Name: Holistic Wellness: Bombs
quest_24817.PrefaceText: You seem antsy. Do you know how to make any bombs? I'm sure you do, you look like the type. Why don't you set off some bombs out in the desert or somewhere? It'll cheer you up.
quest_24817.SuccessText: Now, the tinnitus you're experiencing is probably mostly temporary. But that feeling of elation you feel? ... also temporary. Enjoy it while it lasts.

quest_24818.Description: Lakrea told you to mine some iridium. Iridium can be found in the Kur Mountains and in caves beneath the mountains.
quest_24818.Name: Holistic Wellness: Mine Iridium
quest_24818.PrefaceText: Well, your diet is fine, but your magical aura is a bit off. I think some iridium will do the trick! Mine some iridium -- I hear you can find some in Kur -- and you'll be feeling different in no time.
quest_24818.SuccessText: Hmm, your aura seems the same so far. Let's give it a little while to see if it helps or if you need to mine more.

quest_24819.Description: Lakrea told you to grow some carrots.
quest_24819.Name: Holistic Wellness: Growing Carrots
quest_24819.PrefaceText: You're so cerebral all the time! You need to work with your hands more. Try growing some carrots. Gardening will really help you see the world around you in a different way.
quest_24819.SuccessText: Now that you've grown carrots, nothing can stop you! Look out, demons, monsters, and ghosts, because here you come!

quest_24820.Description: Lakrea told you to smith some hoops. She didn't seem to care what kind of hoops you smithed. (Blacksmithing is the skill used to make hoops for barrels and casks.)
quest_24820.Name: Holistic Wellness: Forge Hoops
quest_24820.PrefaceText: You need to work with metal more. Why don't you hit the forge and make some hoops?
quest_24820.SuccessText: Those blisters on your hands will help keep you down-to-earth, so your ideas don't get too far away from your abilities.

quest_24822.Description: Lakrea directed you to make yarn. There are Textiles recipes for creating yarn; complete yarn recipes twelve times (for a total of 24 balls of yarn).
quest_24822.Name: Holistic Wellness: Yarn
quest_24822.PrefaceText: Have you ever made your own yarn? It's a great feeling! Well, the first time, anyway. After that it gets pretty dull. That's why I want you to make at least twenty-four balls of yarn. You have to learn to push through the boredom and come out the other side to liveliness!
quest_24822.SuccessText: Did you do it? Did you push through the boredom and find the fun in making yarn? ... You did? Already? Wow! Wait... you'd say anything to get out of having to make more yarn, wouldn't you? Hmph.

quest_24823.Description: Lakrea told you to dye suits of armor.
quest_24823.Name: Holistic Wellness: Dyed Armor
quest_24823.PrefaceText: You need a new look! And you need to make that look happen all on your own. You'll feel so much more confident! Just pick a color -- any color -- and then dye your clothes that color. Easy as cake.
quest_24823.SuccessText: You look... colorblind. Wow. Well, you're helping me look beyond my innate sense of fashion, and for that I thank you.

quest_24824.Description: Lakrea told you to use treasure maps to find buried treasure.
quest_24824.Name: Holistic Wellness: Treasure Hunting
quest_24824.PrefaceText: You should be more adventurous. And what's more adventurous than treasure maps? Nothing! Find or make a treasure map and then follow it to the buried treasure.
quest_24824.SuccessText: Was the treasure good? Doesn't really matter: what matters is the searching itself.

quest_24825.Description: Lakrea told you to put 40 pieces of equipment in your inventory and then talk to her.
quest_24825.Name: Holistic Wellness: Hold Gear
quest_24825.PrefaceText: You love equipment, right? All adventurers do! But you never want to carry around excess equipment: too heavy, not enough space, blah blah blah. You need to push through that perceived boundary. Go get... I don't know, say 40 pieces of equipment. Carry them all over here at once and let me see you.
quest_24825.SuccessText: That's... that's a lot of equipment. Okay, you look like you're about to herniate something. Go put that stuff down!

quest_24826.Description: Lakrea told you to get 100 crystals and show her your collection. You don't have to mine them yourself -- you just need 100 of them.
quest_24826.Name: Holistic Wellness: Gem Appreciation
quest_24826.PrefaceText: You need a hobby. Why not crystal collection? It's a great hobby and very practical for adventurers and crafters alike. Build up a collection until you have, say, 100 different crystals. Then show me!
quest_24826.SuccessText: Lovely! Those are very pretty. Thank you for sharing your hobby with me.

quest_24827.Description: Lakrea told you to make your own cheese. She suggested avoiding the fancier cheese recipes that require aging.
quest_24827.Name: Holistic Wellness: Cheesemaking
quest_24827.PrefaceText: You need a hobby. Why not cheese making? It's delicious and might even make you some money. Of course, the fanciest kinds have to be aged in a cave for a long time, but you should start with one of the easy cheeses that don't take so long.
quest_24827.SuccessText: So, have you caught Cheese Fever yet? Me too! I'm glad you like the hobby.

quest_24828.Description: Lakrea told you to skin a flawless animal skin of some kind. (If you have high anatomy knowledge of a creature that you skin, you have a chance of obtaining a flawless skin instead of the usual skin.)
quest_24828.Name: Holistic Wellness: Flawless Skinning
quest_24828.PrefaceText: We could all work on improving our patience. Do you know how to skin animals? Well, if you're going to desecrate a corpse like that, the least you could do is to perform your job flawlessly! Go practice until you get a flawless skin.
quest_24828.SuccessText: I think that probably improved your patience by 2 or 3 percent. Good job!

quest_24829.Description: Lakrea told you to practice your conversation skills. (Use the 'small talk' option when talking to different NPCs.)
quest_24829.Name: Holistic Wellness: Small Talk
quest_24829.PrefaceText: You should improve your communication skills. Practice makes perfect! Engage in small talk with a whole bunch of people.
quest_24829.SuccessText: Good job! You seem all talked out, so I'll just shut up and give you a reward.

quest_24830.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'jocular' into your next conversation. Jocular: adjective: given to jesting, habitually jolly or playful. e.g. 'He was in a jocular mood yesterday.' (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24830.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Jocular'
quest_24830.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'jocular'. [ Jocular: adjective: given to jesting, habitually jolly or playful. e.g. 'He was in a jocular mood yesterday.' ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24830.SuccessText: Excellent. Using fancy words always puts me in a jocular frame of mind so that it's easier to see the levity of any situation. It's one of the many holistic benefits of vocabulary!

quest_24831.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'impetus' into your next conversation. Impetus: the force that makes something happen. e.g. 'A vicious goblin attack was the impetus for the new anti-goblin law.' (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24831.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Impetus'
quest_24831.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'impetus'. [ Impetus: the force that makes something happen. e.g. 'A vicious goblin attack was the impetus for the new anti-goblin law.' ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24831.SuccessText: I'm honored to be the impetus for your personal growth. Stick with me and you'll be competent in no time!

quest_24832.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'vociferous' into your next conversation. Vociferous: adjective: expressed in a loud or forceful way. e.g. 'I was a vociferous critic of the new curfew, but my efforts were in vain.' (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24832.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Vociferous'
quest_24832.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'vociferous'. [ Vociferous: adjective: expressed in a loud or forceful way. e.g. 'I was a vociferous critic of the new curfew, but my efforts were in vain.' ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24832.SuccessText: Good work. And a piece of advice: the trick to being vociferous is to pick your battles. If you have to be vociferous more than once a day, you should reevaluate your priorities!

quest_24833.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'cajole' into your next conversation. Cajole: verb: to persuade someone to do something with flattery or promises. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24833.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Cajole'
quest_24833.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'cajole'. [ Cajole: verb: to persuade someone to do something with flattery or promises. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24833.SuccessText: Well, I'm glad I cajoled you into practicing your vocabulary. Not all cajoling is bad! Sometimes people need to be pushed a little for their own good.

quest_24834.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'confidant' into your next conversation. Confidant: noun: a person entrusted with secrets, such as a friend or co-conspirator. Note: do not confuse with the word 'confident', which is totally different. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24834.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Confidant'
quest_24834.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'confidant'. [ Confidant: noun: a person entrusted with secrets, such as a friend or co-conspirator. Note: do not confuse with the word 'confident', which is totally different. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24834.SuccessText: Wonderful! I know we aren't close enough to be confidants yet, but if you stick with my lessons I'm sure we'll get there. I have many secrets to tell, and I'm sure you do, too!

quest_24835.Description: Lakrea told you to work the word 'truculent' into your next conversation. Truculent: adjective: eager to argue or quick to start a fight. Similar to 'belligerent' but with an implication of cruelty or savagery. (Note: if you use the word out of context, the game won't know, but you'll know that you lost 10,000 Roleplay Points.)
quest_24835.Name: Holistic Wellness: 'Truculent'
quest_24835.PrefaceText: You need to expand your useful vocabulary. Not your total vocabulary, your useful vocabulary. You know thousands of words that you never think to use in daily life. Am I right? Of course I'm right. Here's a word to use: 'truculent'. [ Truculent: adjective: eager to argue or quick to start a fight. Similar to 'belligerent' but with an implication of cruelty or savagery. ] Just find a place to work that into your next conversation. But don't use it out of context! Use it right!
quest_24835.SuccessText: I hope you didn't act truculent when you used the word! Warm and friendly conversations are so much more effective than getting angry and shouting.

quest_24901.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "Go and pluck the wings from shimmerwings. Listen to their final dying words and then you will know what I know."
quest_24901.Name: Pixie's Whim: Shimmerwings
quest_24901.PrefaceText: Go and pluck the wings from shimmerwings. Listen to their final dying words and then you will know what I know.
quest_24901.SuccessText: Did you hear their words? ... How could you not hear anything?! Is it possible that I alone can hear... [Uriana seems lost in thought. She absentmindedly hands you an item from her hoard.]

quest_24902.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "At night, go south of here until you find the fiery birds, which are immortal like me, and seek the crimsonfelt moths, which are not immortal. Steal these moths' lives. Let the phoenices see you do it! That is the only way to make them understand what I understand."
quest_24902.Name: Pixie's Whim: Crimsonfelt Moths
quest_24902.PrefaceText: At night, go south of here until you find the fiery birds, which are immortal like me, and seek the crimsonfelt moths, which are not immortal. Steal these moths' lives. Let the phoenices see you do it! That is the only way to make them understand what I understand.
quest_24902.SuccessText: Now the phoenices surely know the truth! It is carved into their immortal souls... [Uriana seems lost in thought. She absentmindedly hands you an item from her hoard.]

quest_24903.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "Listen for the buzz of bees at night. You will see that it is not bees who dwell in the night, it is wasps! Wasps who bask in the power the Winter Queen! They sting all who oppose her. You know what to do."
quest_24903.Name: Pixie's Whim: Dark Buzzing
quest_24903.PrefaceText: Listen for the buzz of bees at night. You will see that it is not bees who dwell in the night, it is wasps! Wasps who bask in the power the Winter Queen! They sting all who oppose her. You know what to do.
quest_24903.SuccessText: For the bees' crimes, only death would suffice. It is justice. But I pity you, executioner. For you are now as corrupt as any wasp. [Uriana silently hands you an item from her hoard, then seems to forget about you.]

quest_24904.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "My horn hurts! It burns with righteousness! I need a new horn, a horn of dark! Fetch it fresh from the most despicable pixie you can. Go!"
quest_24904.Name: Pixie's Whim: Antler Replacement

Objectives.Description: Kill a Pixie and loot its Antler

quest_24904.PrefaceText: My horn hurts! It burns with righteousness! I need a new horn, a horn of dark! Fetch it fresh from the most despicable pixie you can. Go!
quest_24904.SuccessText: Yes! This horn screams with despair. It will silence my righteous horn and be a partner to my hateful horn. This item... take it. Go so that I may begin the weaving!

quest_24905.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "Pixies hunt; fairies hunt; panthers hunt! But one is not worthy! NOT WORTHY! They are not like us! They seethe with mortality! Can you not smell the mortality of the panthers?! Show them their mortality! SHOW THEM!"
quest_24905.Name: Pixie's Whim: Fae Panthers

Objectives.Description: Kill Panthers in the Fae Realm

quest_24905.PrefaceText: Pixies hunt; fairies hunt; panthers hunt! But one is not worthy! NOT WORTHY! They are not like us! They seethe with mortality! Can you not smell the mortality of the panthers?! Show them their mortality! SHOW THEM!
quest_24905.SuccessText: [Uriana looks shocked at what you've done and begins to weep.] You slew panthers at my bequest?! You lie! I love panthers! No... I hate them! I love AND hate them! ... Well, you do not lie. [Uriana silently hands you an item from her hoard, then becomes lost in thought.]

quest_24906.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "I have been to the ancient ruins and I have meditated there. You, too, must go. Touch them. Feel their bones. Hear their words."
quest_24906.Name: Pixie's Whim: Meditation Spots

Objectives.Description: Touch Meditation Spots in the Fae Realm

quest_24906.PrefaceText: I have been to the ancient ruins and I have meditated there. You, too, must go. Touch them. Feel their bones. Hear their words.
quest_24906.SuccessText: I see that you have been to the places of meditation. You look more honest now. [Uriana silently hands you an item from her hoard, then turns away.]

quest_24907.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "There is only one way to overcome the bees: let them sting you. Yes! Tell them to inject their hatred into you. INTO YOU, and yet you survive! Show them. Show them their hatred is unworthy."
quest_24907.Name: Pixie's Whim: Overcoming Bees
quest_24907.PrefaceText: There is only one way to overcome the bees: let them sting you. Yes! Tell them to inject their hatred into you. INTO YOU, and yet you survive! Show them. Show them their hatred is unworthy.
quest_24907.SuccessText: Now you are awakened to the bees! Tell them what you have learned and they will never trouble you again. This item will be your badge of accomplishment. Now go!

quest_24908.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "I remember a thing! It is called a Pixie Pocket. So named by cruel mortals! Or... perhaps named by cruel fairies... I do not remember. But I think I remember the formula! Here: my notes. Make the Pixie Pocket. Tell me if my formula works."
quest_24908.Name: Pixie's Whim: Pixie Pocket
quest_24908.PrefaceText: I remember a thing! It is called a Pixie Pocket. So named by cruel mortals! Or... perhaps named by cruel fairies... I do not remember. But I think I remember the formula! Here: my notes. Make the Pixie Pocket. Tell me if my formula works.
quest_24908.SuccessText: It worked! So the Pixie Pocket is as I remembered: a slurry of peaches and coagulated goat emissions. ... Well, this was definitely named by mortals, then. Take it away before its stench angers me.

quest_24909.Description: Uriana in the fae realm said, "It is difficult to remember what beast is a true immortal and what is not. But I have invented something in the human tongue to help! Bury bears. Because they are mortal, you see? "Bury bears"? Go and practice until this trick is burned into your mind."
quest_24909.Name: Pixie's Whim: Bear Burial
quest_24909.PrefaceText: It is difficult to remember what beast is a true immortal and what is not. But I have invented something in the human tongue to help! Bury bears. Because they are mortal, you see? "Bury bears"? Go and practice until this trick is burned into your mind.
quest_24909.SuccessText:
You are finally back! ... I realized that I have misled you. For you see, one can bury pixies also! We are reborn in a new body; the old one means little... burying creatures proves nothing!

And I made you burn my lie into your mind! ... WHY?! WHY DID I PUNISH YOU WITH MY FOLLY! I AM SO SORRY! Please take this as an apology.

quest_24910.Description:
Uriana in the fae realm said, "Yesterday I experienced fear. Why should I suffer fear?! I am immortal! Yet I did fear. I was hunted by another immortal: a true barghest, and I was afraid! I slew it, but I knew it would return, and so my fear only grew!

I do not like fear. I do not like it! Go and find the barghest's new body and vanquish my fear with your actions!"
quest_24910.Name: Pixie's Whim: Fear of Barghests
quest_24910.PrefaceText:
Yesterday I experienced fear. Why should I suffer fear?! I am immortal! Yet I did fear. I was hunted by another immortal: a true barghest, and I was afraid! I slew it, but I knew it would return, and so my fear only grew!

I do not like fear. I do not like it! Go and find the barghest's new body and vanquish my fear with your actions!
quest_24910.SuccessText: You slew the barghest and yet I still fear! Violence cannot help me! ARGH! I will have to try parlaying with the beast. Go now. I must think. [Uriana silently hands you an item from her hoard, then becomes lost in thought.]

quest_25.Description: Jara's barn has been coopted by a huge grizzly bear. She'd be grateful if I could kill it, but she doesn't really think I'm capable of doing so.
quest_25.Name: The Bear in There

quest_25001.Description: Kill the Scion of Norala, a huge wolf deep within the wolf cave in Kur Mountains.
quest_25001.Name: Wolf: Kill the Scion of Norala
quest_25001.PrefaceText: Norala believes in the rule of might. If you can kill the Scion of Norala, then you should do so. If you die, then you were too weak to live.
quest_25001.SuccessText:
Confirmed: the Scion of Norala is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25002.Description: Prove that even mighty orcs are no match for Norala's chosen. Killing fifty of them should demonstrate this well.
quest_25002.Name: Wolf: Orcish Genocide
quest_25002.PrefaceText: Prove that even mighty orcs are no match for Norala's chosen. Killing fifty of them should demonstrate this well.
quest_25002.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 orcs slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25003.Description: Show that you are a top predator. Mercilessly hunt down deer.
quest_25003.Name: Wolf: Hunt Deer
quest_25003.PrefaceText: Show that you are a top predator. Mercilessly hunt down deer.
quest_25003.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 25 deer slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25004.Description: Humans, Elves, and Rakshasa deem themselves "civilized", and they shun Norala. Teach them the folly of their ways.
quest_25004.Name: Wolf: Civilized Races
quest_25004.PrefaceText: Humans, Elves, and Rakshasa deem themselves "civilized", and they shun Norala. Teach them the folly of their ways.
quest_25004.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 humans, elves, rakshasa dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25005.Description: The fae believe they are superior to mortals. Norala rewards those who punish the unjustly arrogant.
quest_25005.Name: Wolf: Fae Destruction
quest_25005.PrefaceText: The fae believe they are superior to mortals. Norala rewards those who punish the unjustly arrogant.
quest_25005.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 fae creatures dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25006.Description: In a dungeon beneath Eltibule there is a mighty avatar shackled into servitude. This is unacceptable. Slay Ciervos The Shadow to relieve his humiliation.
quest_25006.Name: Wolf: Ciervos Must Die
quest_25006.PrefaceText: In a dungeon beneath Eltibule there is a mighty avatar shackled into servitude. This is unacceptable. Slay Ciervos The Shadow to relieve his humiliation.
quest_25006.SuccessText:
Confirmed: Ciervos the Shadow is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25007.Description: Goblins are weak and deserve destruction. Make it happen.
quest_25007.Name: Wolf: Goblin Killing
quest_25007.PrefaceText: Goblins are weak and deserve destruction. Make it happen.
quest_25007.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 goblins slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25008.Description: Kill the Scion of Discord, a warrior deep within a hidden cave in the Eltibule region.
quest_25008.Name: Wolf: Kill the Scion of Gulagra
quest_25008.PrefaceText: The chosen of Gulagra has been found! Norala tells us he is deep beneath the earth in Eltibule. Calling himself the Scion of Discord, he believes he is the fiercest warrior alive. This cannot be. Prove it.
quest_25008.SuccessText:
Confirmed: the Scion of Discord is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25009.Description: The freakish half-dragon creatures are weak. They hide behind the might of their dragon ancestors. They should be rooted out.
quest_25009.Name: Wolf: Dragon-Kin
quest_25009.PrefaceText: The freakish half-dragon creatures are weak. They hide behind the might of their dragon ancestors. They should be rooted out.
quest_25009.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 10 dragon-kin slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25010.Description: It is poison to our kind, but we can overcome it and grow even mightier. Collect wolfsbane and bring it here as an offering.
quest_25010.Name: Wolf: Wolfsbane
quest_25010.PrefaceText: It is poison to our kind, but we can overcome it and grow even mightier. Collect wolfsbane and bring it here as an offering.
quest_25010.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 10 wolfsbane delivered.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25011.Description: Orcs are still too prevalent! This angers Norala! Murder them!
quest_25011.Name: Wolf: Orcish Genocide 2
quest_25011.PrefaceText: Orcs are still too prevalent! This angers Norala! Murder them!
quest_25011.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 100 orcs slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25012.Description: Show that your hunger is insatiable. Hunt more deer.
quest_25012.Name: Wolf: Hunt Deer 2
quest_25012.PrefaceText: Show that your hunger is insatiable. Hunt more deer.
quest_25012.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 deer slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25104.Description: Agrashab in the Fae Realm said, "I've tried indirect methods of dealing with the phoenix issue, but the threat grows ever hotter. My subjects have even given a name to the birds' stolen home: 'firebird mountain.' It is not a comforting name to fire-averse trolls. Please resolve this issue by removing the phoenices."
quest_25104.Name: Agrashab's Bounty: Phoenices
quest_25104.PrefaceText: I've tried indirect methods of dealing with the phoenix issue, but the threat grows ever hotter. My subjects have even given a name to the birds' stolen home: 'firebird mountain.' It is not a comforting name to fire-averse trolls. Please resolve this issue by removing the phoenices.
quest_25104.SuccessText: You did well, but the phoenices are already beginning to reappear! They must somehow be bound here, to my domain! That is entirely unacceptable! Hmm. Begone now, please. I am uncertain as to where to direct my wrath.

quest_25105.Description: Agrashab in the Fae Realm said, "The so-called 'firebird mountain' south of here is home to an irritating phoenix population, which terrify my subjects, but at least they don't typically hunt trolls for food! Droaches, unfortunately, do. Please head to 'Firebird Mountain' and eliminate the fire droach threat."
quest_25105.Name: Agrashab's Bounty: Fire Droaches
quest_25105.PrefaceText: The so-called 'firebird mountain' south of here is home to an irritating phoenix population, which terrify my subjects, but at least they don't typically hunt trolls for food! Droaches, unfortunately, do. Please head to 'Firebird Mountain' and eliminate the fire droach threat.
quest_25105.SuccessText: Excellent work. Of course, more droach eggs will hatch in time, but we cannot expect to win the war in a day. You have won a battle and that will suffice.

quest_25106.Description: Agrashab in the Fae Realm said, "There has been a recent influx of pixies, and along with them come many typical creatures. The worst of these is the so-called shocking droach, a cowardly creature that roams in packs causing chaos. We have enough chaos right now; please remove this excess."
quest_25106.Name: Agrashab's Bounty: Shocking Droaches
quest_25106.PrefaceText: There has been a recent influx of pixies, and along with them come many typical creatures. The worst of these is the so-called shocking droach, a cowardly creature that roams in packs causing chaos. We have enough chaos right now; please remove this excess.
quest_25106.SuccessText: The sparking droaches are neutralized? Very good! The next wave of my children will arrive in less than a year, and they would have been easy prey to these foul ambushers. You have served trollkind well.

quest_25107.Description: Agrashab in the Fae Realm said, "Basilisks are mortals, and yet some of their number have partnered with the Winter Queen -- a queen who has vowed to freeze all mortal life to death. In exchange for their treachery, these basilisks are given resistance to cold and increased strength. Show them that their strength is not limitless."
quest_25107.Name: Agrashab's Bounty: Basilisk Controllers
quest_25107.PrefaceText: Basilisks are mortals, and yet some of their number have partnered with the Winter Queen -- a queen who has vowed to freeze all mortal life to death. In exchange for their treachery, these basilisks are given resistance to cold and increased strength. Show them that their strength is not limitless.
quest_25107.SuccessText: It is unfortunate when mortals become pawns in fairy politics. Unfortunate for the pawns, of course, but also for us. Mortals' behavior is hard for us to predict. It appears the best approach may be to use other mortals.

quest_25108.Description: Agrashab in the Fae Realm said, "I do not give commandments to my children. Trolls can form alliances with anyone they want! But that doesn't mean I will stand idly by when a pack of potent war-trolls comes here and starts wreaking havoc! These winter trolls are extremely powerful and need to be stopped. Remember: I only want you to kill the giant blue trolls, not the green ones."
quest_25108.Name: Agrashab's Bounty: Winter War-Trolls
quest_25108.PrefaceText: I do not give commandments to my children. Trolls can form alliances with anyone they want! But that doesn't mean I will stand idly by when a pack of potent war-trolls comes here and starts wreaking havoc! These winter trolls are extremely powerful and need to be stopped. Remember: I only want you to kill the giant blue trolls, not the green ones.
quest_25108.SuccessText: It is never a happy day when I must order trolls killed. But... well, they WILL come back in a few years. It's still cruel, though. But you did as requested, and I am sufficiently pleased!

quest_25201.Description: You're killing pigs in Serbule Hills.
quest_25201.Name: Hunting: Pigs
quest_25201.PrefaceText: Hunting: Pigs These feral pigs once must have been tended by ranchers, but they have been living in the wild for too many generations: there's no taming these delicious beasts.

quest_25202.Name: Hunting: Deer
quest_25202.PrefaceText: Hunting: Deer Deer are found in most every healthy forest ecosystem. They breed quickly and eat voraciously, so nobody is upset when deer are hunted.

quest_25203.Description: You're killing tigers in Serbule Hills.
quest_25203.Name: Hunting: Tigers
quest_25203.PrefaceText: Hunting: Tigers There are more tigers here than could possibly be natural. Moreover, many of the tigers are sickly and unwell. Wherever they came from, they apparently can't go home again.

quest_25204.Description: You're killing rats in Serbule Hills.
quest_25204.Name: Hunting: Rats
quest_25204.PrefaceText: Hunting: Rats Generally considered harmless, some rats do carry diseases. But for the most part even the gigantic varieties are non-hostile. In rural areas they are either treated as pests or as pets, depending on how big of an impact they have on local agriculture.

quest_25205.Description: You're killing sheep in Serbule Hills.
quest_25205.Name: Hunting: Sheep
quest_25205.PrefaceText: Hunting: Sheep Although their distant grandparents were domestic sheep, these feral sheep will not tolerate being sheared. They are aggressive toward anyone that gets too close.

quest_25206.Description: You're killing spiders in Serbule Hills.
quest_25206.Name: Hunting: Black Widow Spiders
quest_25206.PrefaceText: Hunting: Black Widow Spiders These highly venomous spiders eat many dangerous pests. However, they also like to eat people, and they especially love sneaking up on campers and caravans in the night.

quest_25207.Description: You're killing wild pigs in Serbule Hills.
quest_25207.Name: Hunting: Wild Pigs
quest_25207.PrefaceText: Hunting: Wild Pigs These pigs were never tame; they tolerate their feral brethren, but they attack most other creatures without fear. Wild pigs are not prey animals: they're ominvorous, intelligent, and vicious.

quest_25208.Description: You're killing worgs in Serbule Hills.
quest_25208.Name: Hunting: Worgs
quest_25208.PrefaceText: Hunting: Worgs When humans domesticated the wolf, they made dogs. When orcs domesticated the wolf, they made worgs. Orcs win this one. When hungry enough, packs of feral worgs are known to kill entire caravans.

quest_25209.Description: You're killing fire sheep in Serbule Hills.
quest_25209.Name: Hunting: Fire Sheep
quest_25209.PrefaceText: Hunting: Fire Sheep Fire sheep were not created by a deranged wizard, as is often suggested. Instead, they are an exciting step forward in the natural evolution of the sheep. These creatures are very fragile but are much safer than their non-igniting brethren because local predators have learned to run away from the smell of smouldering wool.

quest_25210.Description: You're slaying goblins that hinder the road to Sedgewick Forest.
quest_25210.Name: Hunting: Goblins
quest_25210.PrefaceText: Hunting: Goblins While the goblins sent to patrol the roads here are not nearly as dangerous as the ones in Sedgewick Forest, they are still very deadly. If trade is ever to return to normal, their blockade must be destroyed.

quest_25211.Name: Hunting: Panthers
quest_25211.PrefaceText: Hunting: Panthers The panthers here are native -- unlike the tigers -- but these panthers seem more vicious than one would expect. They act distracted, roused by an unknown energy.

quest_25212.Description: You're killing fire spiders in Eltibule.
quest_25212.Name: Hunting: Fire Spiders
quest_25212.PrefaceText: Hunting: Fire Spiders Fire spiders are a distinct species that breeds true, even though they were genetically engineered by crone witches centuries ago. Their innate fire protection is a marvel that Biology Sages are still desperate to unravel.

quest_25213.Name: Hunting: Gnashers
quest_25213.PrefaceText: Hunting: Gnashers The so-called Gnasher is a dinosaur from a distant land, imported by the Council to counter the uncontrolled spread of Uraks and other problem pests. However, gnashers are now as big a threat as any of the other invasive species. They are able to cut through armor with incredible ease.

quest_25214.Description: You're killing giant snails in Eltibule.
quest_25214.Name: Hunting: Snails
quest_25214.PrefaceText: Hunting: Snails Snails seem especially adept at consuming the ambient magic of their surroundings. Many varieties grow to incomprehensible size and if left unhindered, they can become so large that only an army of druids can take them down.

quest_25215.Description: You're killing giant mantises in Eltibule.
quest_25215.Name: Hunting: Mantises
quest_25215.PrefaceText: Hunting: Mantises The giant mantises in Eltibule are not intelligent, but that doesn't make them easy to kill. They like to prey upon the distracted, hiding in tall grass until their victims come too close.

quest_25216.Name: Hunting: Eltibule Bears
quest_25216.PrefaceText: Hunting: Eltibule Bears The bears in Eltibule are odd. First, some of them are green. Second, they don't seem to act like bears should. They tend to gather in large aimless groups. It's not clear why they do this, but it's clearly not good.

quest_25217.Description: You're killing ferocious boars in Eltibule.
quest_25217.Name: Hunting: Ferocious Boars
quest_25217.PrefaceText: Hunting: Ferocious Boars These boars are huge, deadly, and very aggressive. They are able to hold their own against enchanted cats, man-sized mantises, and house-sized snails. They are not afraid of people.

quest_25218.Description: You're killing cunning wolves in Eltibule.
quest_25218.Name: Hunting: Cunning Wolves
quest_25218.PrefaceText: Hunting: Cunning Wolves Wolves are most dangerous when they attack as a group. The wise hunter separates them to avoid their dreaded pack attack.

quest_25219.Description: You're killing poison slugs in the lakes of Eltibule.
quest_25219.Name: Hunting: Poison Slugs
quest_25219.PrefaceText: Hunting: Poison Slugs The lakes of Eltibule are infested with these gigantic venomous slugs. With no natural predators, their growth is unchecked.

quest_25220.Description: You're killing fey panthers in Eltibule.
quest_25220.Name: Hunting: Fey Panthers
quest_25220.PrefaceText: Hunting: Fey Panthers These big green panthers come from the fairy realm. Semi-intelligent, they seek to cause mischief and destruction. Regular panthers seem to instinctively treat them as royalty, following their lead and protecting their flank.

quest_25221.Description: You're killing wild chickens in Serbule Hills.
quest_25221.Name: Hunting: Wild Chickens
quest_25221.PrefaceText: Hunting: Wild Chickens All the "wild" chickens in Serbule Hills descend from a chicken farm that was overrun by goblins. The smartest chickens escaped capture, and they have since spread throughout the hills. They lay far fewer eggs than domestic chickens, but they're still delicious when fried.

quest_25222.Description: You're killing guard scrays in Serbule Hills.
quest_25222.Name: Hunting: Guard Scrays
quest_25222.PrefaceText: Hunting: Guard Scrays Scrays act as faithful companions to the ranalon, much like dogs do for humans. They are equally at home in water or land, and their stingers inject acid deep inside their victims, causing horrible delayed death. They are most dangerous in packs.

quest_25223.Description: You're killing ranalon gardeners in Serbule Hills.
quest_25223.Name: Hunting: Ranalon Gardeners
quest_25223.PrefaceText: Hunting: Ranalon Gardeners Perhaps the weakest caste of ranalon, but also the most numerous, are the gardeners. They scavenge the land for resources and can also be found deep in lakes, tending to their underwater gardens. They are fast -- VERY fast -- and can chase their prey long distances.

quest_25224.Description: You're killing ranalon stoneshapers in Serbule Hills.
quest_25224.Name: Hunting: Ranalon Stone Shapers
quest_25224.PrefaceText: Hunting: Ranalon Stone Shapers Stoneshapers can pull stone from deep beneath the earth, and use these stones to create most Ranalon buildings. They also serve on the battlefield where they hamper enemy movement. When cornered, they can pull stones from the ground to protect themselves, creating a dense shield that absorbs most attacks.

quest_25225.Name: Hunting: Hexapuses
quest_25225.PrefaceText: Hunting: Hexapuses Local stories say that the hexapus comes from the Rakshasa home-world -- although their original name is lost. They lay their eggs on the underside of vessels, and supposedly the original rakshasa ships were coated in eggs that eventually hatched and tried to kill everyone. Hexapuses are unnervingly intelligent and are happy both on land and water -- although they prefer to be immersed when they sleep. They are a menace that can't be allowed to proliferate.

quest_25226.Name: Hunting: Tentakillers
quest_25226.PrefaceText: Hunting: Tentakillers Rakshasa settlers brought fierce creatures called dwvon to act as guards and hunting companions, but they went feral after the War of Rahu. Their descendants were dubbed "tentakillers" by famous Povus settler "Fangy" Lim because they use their tentacles to shock and disorient their prey. And everything is prey: big or small, the tentakiller does not discriminate.

quest_25227.Name: Hunting: Kuvou
quest_25227.PrefaceText: Hunting: Kuvou Kuvou -- supposedly named after the sound they make while belching -- came with the first rakshasa settlers, who even today use them as a food source. Their vomit is also prized. Unfortunately they lack the docility of other herbivores and must be trained from birth in order to be kept as livestock.

quest_25228.Description: You're killing Burnspittle Frogs in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25228.Name: Hunting: Burnspittle Frogs
quest_25228.PrefaceText: Hunting: Burnspittle Frogs These frogs destroy ecosystems and breed rapidly. Few creatures can withstand their acidic touch for long.

quest_25229.Description: You're killing spiders in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25229.Name: Hunting: Venom Spiders
quest_25229.PrefaceText: Hunting: Venom Spiders While not as deadly as some spiders, they are still quite deadly. They seek warmth at night and are a terror to find in campsites.

quest_25230.Description: You're killing vipers in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25230.Name: Hunting: Vipers
quest_25230.PrefaceText: Hunting: Vipers A constant danger in the desert, these vipers don't hesitate to attack creatures many times their size.

quest_25231.Description: You're killing blood beaks in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25231.Name: Hunting: Blood Beaks
quest_25231.PrefaceText: Hunting: Blood Beaks Originating from domestic chickens that were fed cursed grain, these now-feral beasts roam the desert, fearing nothing, pecking all.

quest_25232.Description: You're killing skeletal frogs in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25232.Name: Hunting: Skeletal Frogs
quest_25232.PrefaceText: Hunting: Skeletal Frogs These once-ordinary frogs were slain in some particularly heinous way, causing their souls to seek vengeance. They are pure malice.

quest_25233.Description: You're killing tornado spiders in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25233.Name: Hunting: Tornado Spiders
quest_25233.PrefaceText: Hunting: Tornado Spiders These spiders happened to eat a newly-formed air elemental -- which admittedly look like a large fly at first -- and have become entangled with air magic. They are not victims, though: they are able to use the wind to their advantage and are extremely hard to hit!

quest_25234.Description: You're killing donkeys in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25234.Name: Hunting: Donkeys
quest_25234.PrefaceText: Hunting: Donkeys Ordinary donkeys aren't particularly dangerous. But these dream donkeys attack anything they see!

quest_25235.Description: You're killing skeleton mages in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25235.Name: Hunting: Skeleton Mages
quest_25235.PrefaceText: Hunting: Skeleton Mages Raised by a necromancer and then set free to cause chaos, these skeletons do their job with glee, burning anything that lives.

quest_25236.Description: You're killing skeleton swordsmen in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25236.Name: Hunting: Skeleton Swordsmen
quest_25236.PrefaceText: Hunting: Skeleton Swordsmen Created by a necromancer and given a sword, these creatures can only feel hate, and only killing the living brings any amount of comfort to their wretched souls.

quest_25237.Description: You're killing skeleton archers in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25237.Name: Hunting: Skeleton Archers
quest_25237.PrefaceText: Hunting: Skeleton Archers These craven resurrected menaces love to hurt people from afar. They run in fear when approached.

quest_25238.Description: You're killing giant scorpions in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25238.Name: Hunting: Giant Scorpions
quest_25238.PrefaceText: Hunting: Giant Scorpions Massive beasts that usually require a team to take down, these scorpions rule the desert. Few can survive their attacks -- though they stay well clear of manticores.

quest_25239.Description: You're killing giant scorpions in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25239.Name: Hunting: Fear Breathers
quest_25239.PrefaceText: Hunting: Fear Breathers Created by Kajich, the god of Fear, to bring terror into the world. Kajich's not the best at creating monsters, but he tries. These lungs may not be super terrifying, but they are very dangerous and usually require allies to kill.

quest_25240.Description: You're killing deinonychus in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25240.Name: Hunting: Deinonychus
quest_25240.PrefaceText: Hunting: Deinonychus These dinosaurs are native to plains lands but have learned that they can survive here in the desert, where they wreak the delicate ecology by eating everything.

quest_25241.Description: You're killing manticores in the dream version of the Ilmari Desert.
quest_25241.Name: Hunting: Manticores
quest_25241.PrefaceText: Hunting: Manticores Monstrosities with beast bodies and human faces, these creatures were -- and still are -- adherants of Strekios, god of Self-Improvement. They are destined to be reborn in this form until they gain the wisdom to be born into a new form. This batch of manticores are total jerks so you should kill them and let them be reborn to try again.

quest_25401.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Head into the legling training area and find the area where gardeners practice their craft -- it's one of the first areas you'll come across in there. Kill everyone there."
quest_25401.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Legling Gardeners
quest_25401.PrefaceText: Head into the legling training area and find the area where gardeners practice their craft -- it's one of the first areas you'll come across in there. Kill everyone there.
quest_25401.SuccessText: Good! Those gardeners were almost ready to take their job to the surface. There are more gardeners, but now the den will have to spend more resources protecting them, keeping them safe. It's a step. Here: this is your reward.

quest_25402.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Head into the legling training area. Go past the gardening practice area. When the path forks, go left to find the clubbers. They're born knowing how to fight, but they need to build up their muscle mass and train their coordination. So now is the time to strike, while they're weak!"
quest_25402.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Legling Warriors
quest_25402.PrefaceText: Head into the legling training area. Go past the gardening practice area. When the path forks, go left to find the clubbers. They're born knowing how to fight, but they need to build up their muscle mass and train their coordination. So now is the time to strike, while they're weak!
quest_25402.SuccessText: Impressive. I knew I picked the right team! More eggs hatch every day, but it will take time before new ones are ready to take to the surface.

quest_25403.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "You need to focus on the adults that oversee the leglings! Strike them down to weaken the den. Head into the legling training area. Go past the gardening practice area. When the path forks, go left to find the clubbers. A few adults are there. Strike them down!"
quest_25403.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Martial Supervisors
quest_25403.PrefaceText: You need to focus on the adults that oversee the leglings! Strike them down to weaken the den. Head into the legling training area. Go past the gardening practice area. When the path forks, go left to find the clubbers. A few adults are there. Strike them down!
quest_25403.SuccessText:
You killed the supervisors? Did you kill Girrrna? I hate her so much, she's so mean! Well, even if you didn't find her, you killed her close friends, and that's something...

... you know, sometimes I have weird regretful feelings about the things I ask you to do. But I'm four years old! Surely my moral compass is fully formed. So I need to put my qualms aside and press on with this genocide. This depressing, depressing genocide.

quest_25404.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Have you seen the emergency moisturizing shells? They're super ugly, right? That's all Gulllia's fault, she thinks they look... anyway, it doesn't matter! When a ranalon gets super dried out, they use the healing water in those shells to stay moist. And you are going to poison that water. Here's the poison. Go!"
quest_25404.Name: Ranalon Den: Poison the Shells
quest_25404.PrefaceText: Have you seen the emergency moisturizing shells? They're super ugly, right? That's all Gulllia's fault, she thinks they look... anyway, it doesn't matter! When a ranalon gets super dried out, they use the healing water in those shells to stay moist. And you are going to poison that water. Here's the poison. Go!
quest_25404.SuccessText: Perfect. Now watch for itchy ranalons. They'll be extra distracted while you murder them.

quest_25405.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Deep in the legling training area is the mage training section. Right now they're mostly doing stone-shaping, so look for the poorly-worked stones. You definitely want to take these mages out before they fully master their abilities!"
quest_25405.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Legling Stone-Shapers
quest_25405.PrefaceText: Deep in the legling training area is the mage training section. Right now they're mostly doing stone-shaping, so look for the poorly-worked stones. You definitely want to take these mages out before they fully master their abilities!
quest_25405.SuccessText: You killed legling mages. At my request. I guess it's really sinking in how evil I've become. I... need a minute. Here, take this and let me think about what I've done.

quest_25406.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Some of the most talented stone-shapers in the whole den are back working with the leglings today. Strike now! The mage supervisors are deep in the legling wing. Go past the legling gardeners, then keep right at the fork."
quest_25406.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Mage Supervisors
quest_25406.PrefaceText: Some of the most talented stone-shapers in the whole den are back working with the leglings today. Strike now! The mage supervisors are deep in the legling wing. Go past the legling gardeners, then keep right at the fork.
quest_25406.SuccessText: With fewer expert stone-shapers on our front lines, the goblins may finally be able to overrun the den! And that will mean a swift death for me. Hmm. I kind of hate what I've become, so maybe that's not a big deal. Anyway, here's your reward.

quest_25407.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Why don't you assassinate the ranalon that are off duty? They'll be in the lounge and resting areas. And they definitely won't be expecting you!"
quest_25407.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Relaxed Ranalon
quest_25407.PrefaceText: Why don't you assassinate the ranalon that are off duty? They'll be in the lounge and resting areas. And they definitely won't be expecting you!
quest_25407.SuccessText: Did you manage to kill them in their sleep? No? Oh. I'd kind of hoped... well, anyway, good job. Here's your reward!

quest_25408.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Take out the scray resting in pools around the den. Those scray are precious to our front-line assault against the goblins! You can find them in any pool in the den... oh, except the pools in the legling area, I suppose."
quest_25408.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Scray
quest_25408.PrefaceText: Take out the scray resting in pools around the den. Those scray are precious to our front-line assault against the goblins! You can find them in any pool in the den... oh, except the pools in the legling area, I suppose.
quest_25408.SuccessText: I sort of hate having to see the scray die. They're good pets. They don't really understand... no, stop! No time for sentiment! We have murders to scheme! Here's your reward. Let me figure out the next scheme -- give me a minute.

quest_25409.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "There's food plants everywhere in here -- look for some watercress, and bring it to me. I need a lot of it; I have an idea."
quest_25409.Name: Ranalon Den: Collect Watercress
quest_25409.PrefaceText: There's food plants everywhere in here -- look for some watercress, and bring it to me. I need a lot of it; I have an idea.
quest_25409.SuccessText: Thank you. I'm going to try soaking this watercress in something vile and see what happens when ranalons eat it. I think I'm getting the hang of this 'being an evil fiend' thing, huh? Here: this is your reward. Now give me a few minutes to work.

quest_25410.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Hmm, fetch me some of the boletus mushrooms. Oh, and can you chop them for me? I'm more of a mage than a laborer, you understand... then bring me the boletus flakes."
quest_25410.MidwayText: Flaked mushrooms, just as I asked!
quest_25410.Name: Ranalon Den: Collect Boletus Mushrooms
quest_25410.PrefaceText: Hmm, fetch me some of the boletus mushrooms. Oh, and can you chop them for me? I'm more of a mage than a laborer, you understand... then bring me the boletus flakes.
quest_25410.SuccessText: Well flaked! You could have been a food-preparer! Instead of... what, an assassin, I guess. But I'm happy you're an assassin. So let's move on. Here's your reward and I'll have a new scheme for you momentarily.

quest_25411.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Steal lungfish from the pools throughout the den. I have a scheme in mind for them!"
quest_25411.Name: Ranalon Den: Collect Lungfish
quest_25411.PrefaceText: Steal lungfish from the pools throughout the den. I have a scheme in mind for them!
quest_25411.SuccessText:
These lungfish are native to our homeland of Fosulf, and the den guards them well because they hold a precious secret: the oil in these fish has regenerative properties! Also they're delicious.

I'm going to sneak these fish into the lake outside. And then... hm... I'm not exactly sure how destroying the local fish ecosystem helps our cause, but since the den doesn't want that to happen, I do want it to happen!

And here's your reward.

quest_25412.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "The least-competent farmers are sent topside to farm the lakes up there, but farmers who can cast a few spells are kept down here in safety. They're a crucial part of the den's food supply. Which means they're precious... which means you should kill them! Go!"
quest_25412.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Farm-Casters
quest_25412.PrefaceText: The least-competent farmers are sent topside to farm the lakes up there, but farmers who can cast a few spells are kept down here in safety. They're a crucial part of the den's food supply. Which means they're precious... which means you should kill them! Go!
quest_25412.SuccessText: Good work! While the topside farmers grow the bulk of our food, the farm-casters are responsible for the delicate plants that make food delicious. Now the den will have to survive on bland, boring food... they'll be demoralized for sure! Here's your reward.

quest_25413.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Deep in the farming area are a bunch of Guardians. You know, the thuggish-looking ones? Glowball on their head? Yeah. The ones in this den are pretty dumb, but they're mean in a fight. If you kill them, it'll demoralize everyone. And that's good."
quest_25413.Name: Ranalon Den: Kill Guardians
quest_25413.PrefaceText: Deep in the farming area are a bunch of Guardians. You know, the thuggish-looking ones? Glowball on their head? Yeah. The ones in this den are pretty dumb, but they're mean in a fight. If you kill them, it'll demoralize everyone. And that's good.
quest_25413.SuccessText: You killed the guardians, just like that?! Wow. ... even I'm demoralized, so I'm sure the rest of the den will be too. Good work!

quest_25414.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Another mission already? Um... just go kill some ranalons! Whichever. Bring me some of their tacky jewelry to prove you've done your job."
quest_25414.Name: Ranalon Den: Trophy Bracelets
quest_25414.PrefaceText: Another mission already? Um... just go kill some ranalons! Whichever. Bring me some of their tacky jewelry to prove you've done your job.
quest_25414.SuccessText: Wow. You are really good at killing ranalons. Terrifyingly good. Have you considered killing goblins instead? ... No, gotta stay on focus! We're 'slaying the ranalon menace'!

quest_25415.Description: Chirrra in the Serbule Hills Ranalon Den said, "Look around for some bottles of Errrgorabog. The moistening cream? Almost everyone down here uses it, so I'm sure you can find some easily enough. I need a bunch of it."
quest_25415.Name: Ranalon Den: Moistening Cream
quest_25415.PrefaceText: Look around for some bottles of Errrgorabog. The moistening cream? Almost everyone down here uses it, so I'm sure you can find some easily enough. I need a bunch of it.
quest_25415.SuccessText: Thanks. Actually these aren't part of a scheme: I'm keeping them. Somebody keeps stealing mine as a cruel prank, and my skin is getting all dry. Here's your reward!

quest_25501.Description: Qatik in Red Wing Casino said, "Recently while tuning up our portal system, we accidentally connected to a series of caves beneath Eltibule. These oddly-dark caves are inaccessible except via teleportation, yet there are numerous bipedal denizens! I believe there is significant magical power hidden in the caves, but the Queen won't allow me to send a mantis assault team in, fearing they'd just be outnumbered and killed. That's why we need you! Since you and your friends are roughly bipedal, perhaps you can blend in with the other bipeds and scout out the place. Barring that, of course, you should fight desperately for your lives, because the bipeds seem to be mentally ill and quite homicidal. I have located a few potential sources of magical energy in the caves, so go retrieve them! The teleportation attendant can send you into these caves if you ask him early enough today. [A group of 4+ level 40+ players recommended.]"
quest_25501.Name: Casino Excursion: Dark Chapel
quest_25501.PrefaceText: Recently while tuning up our portal system, we accidentally connected to a series of caves beneath Eltibule. These oddly-dark caves are inaccessible except via teleportation, yet there are numerous bipedal denizens! I believe there is significant magical power hidden in the caves, but the Queen won't allow me to send a mantis assault team in, fearing they'd just be outnumbered and killed. That's why we need you! Since you and your friends are roughly bipedal, perhaps you can blend in with the other bipeds and scout out the place. Barring that, of course, you should fight desperately for your lives, because the bipeds seem to be mentally ill and quite homicidal. I have located a few potential sources of magical energy in the caves, so go retrieve them! The teleportation attendant can send you into these caves if you ask him early enough today. [A group of 4+ level 40+ players recommended.]
quest_25501.SuccessText: Wonderful work. You are a truly adequate biped. Please accept this as payment.

quest_25502.Description: Qatik in Red Wing Casino said, "I've had Irkima study the available lore on the fae realm and he found an interesting detail. Some of the leaders of the Winter Queen's forces are granted the title of 'Puck', along with associated powers. And to prove their puckhood they are given a badge made of ice. Or crystal. Or icy crystal. Anyway, we need some of those badges. They may hold the secret to infinite power! It has taken much influence on my part, but I've convinced the teleportation attendant to send you to the Winter Nexus itself. But go quickly before he tires of maintaining the link to such a distant place! [A group of 4+ level 40+ players recommended.]"
quest_25502.Name: Casino Excursion: Winter Nexus
quest_25502.PrefaceText: I've had Irkima study the available lore on the fae realm and he found an interesting detail. Some of the leaders of the Winter Queen's forces are granted the title of 'Puck', along with associated powers. And to prove their puckhood they are given a badge made of ice. Or crystal. Or icy crystal. Anyway, we need some of those badges. They may hold the secret to infinite power! It has taken much influence on my part, but I've convinced the teleportation attendant to send you to the Winter Nexus itself. But go quickly before he tires of maintaining the link to such a distant place! [A group of 4+ level 40+ players recommended.]
quest_25502.SuccessText: This is it? Hmm. They are not ice. They're just strangely chilly. This is disappointing. But I do not blame the messenger for the message; here is an appropriate reward.

quest_25503.Description: Qatik in Red Wing Casino said, "As you know, the land of Kur hides tremendous secrets, and we yearn to have the powers rumored to hide in the caves there. We've recently managed to teleport directly into a certain underground cave in Kur, but even though it's underground, it is still too cold for mantises to function optimally. Since you and your friends are generally mammalian, we expect you will have a much easier time. Ignore the woolly bipeds in the upper caverns and seek out the lowest levels of the caves. Certain creatures there may hold the secrets of Kur. You should recognize these secrets when you see them! The teleportation attendant can send you to the cave if you ask today. [A group of 3+ level 40+ players recommended.]"
quest_25503.Name: Casino Excursion: Ice Caves
quest_25503.PrefaceText: As you know, the land of Kur hides tremendous secrets, and we yearn to have the powers rumored to hide in the caves there. We've recently managed to teleport directly into a certain underground cave in Kur, but even though it's underground, it is still too cold for mantises to function optimally. Since you and your friends are generally mammalian, we expect you will have a much easier time. Ignore the woolly bipeds in the upper caverns and seek out the lowest levels of the caves. Certain creatures there may hold the secrets of Kur. You should recognize these secrets when you see them! The teleportation attendant can send you to the cave if you ask today. [A group of 3+ level 40+ players recommended.]
quest_25503.SuccessText: This is an interesting assortment of artifacts you've brought me. I will send these off for study but for now I shall take your word for it that they are magical, and compensate you accordingly.

quest_25504.Description: Qatik in Red Wing Casino said, "The first major success *and* failure of our Teleportation Technology department came two years ago when we reached a warm cave complex beneath Kur. Kur has always been a land of mystery to us, for it is too cold to support true life -- mantis life. But this cave was warmer! And so we sent in two squads of servant mantises to subdue the caves. Instead... they took up residence among the other creatures. They rebelled! This was a huge setback to teleportation magic, and even today I dare not send more mantises into that cave. But you and your friends will not be tricked by whatever wonders lie in there! You can complete the original mission from years ago! I have bribed the teleportation technician to send you there, so long as you ask quickly. [A group of 3+ level 40+ players is recommended.]"
quest_25504.Name: Casino Excursion: Wolf Caves

Objectives.Description: Retrieve Scion of Norala's Power Source

quest_25504.PrefaceText: The first major success *and* failure of our Teleportation Technology department came two years ago when we reached a warm cave complex beneath Kur. Kur has always been a land of mystery to us, for it is too cold to support true life -- mantis life. But this cave was warmer! And so we sent in two squads of servant mantises to subdue the caves. Instead... they took up residence among the other creatures. They rebelled! This was a huge setback to teleportation magic, and even today I dare not send more mantises into that cave. But you and your friends will not be tricked by whatever wonders lie in there! You can complete the original mission from years ago! I have bribed the teleportation technician to send you there, so long as you ask quickly. [A group of 3+ level 40+ players is recommended.]
quest_25504.SuccessText: These are the 'power sources' the original team was sent for? Hm... I have doubts about these items' potency. But in any case you have accomplished the task well! And I hope that you didn't mind my little addition to the task-list. Those turnwing mantises deserved death! I have added some additional compensation for dispatching justice.

quest_25521.Description:
Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "Head to the Ilmari desert and seek out the giant yellow crystals where the manticores live... and kill them! Manticores often have Hegemonic Storage Keys, which you'll need. Just keep killing manticores until you have at least five keys.

Next you must find the entrance to a massive bunker under the sand. It's southwest of the manticores. There are rakshasa bandits nearby, so torture them for information if you're lost.

Once inside, use the keys on the chests you'll find. Take careful note of what you find -- I need that intelligence for my report.

Along the way you'll meet a certain Striga who will prevent you from going downstairs. Definitely kill him. On the next floor, look for a minotaur named Asterion and kill him, too. He has something I need; bring it to me.

Remember not to go too far down -- once you go past the steward, you'll be on the correct floor to find Asterion.

Oh, and don't underestimate him. Asterion is FAR more dangerous than typical minotaurs."
quest_25521.Name: Aurest Mission: Labyrinth Chests

Objectives.Description: Loot Hegemonic Storage Keys from Manticores

quest_25521.PrefaceText:
Head to the Ilmari desert and seek out the giant yellow crystals where the manticores live... and kill them! Manticores often have Hegemonic Storage Keys, which you'll need. Just keep killing manticores until you have at least five keys.

Next you must find the entrance to a massive bunker under the sand. It's southwest of the manticores. There are rakshasa bandits nearby, so torture them for information if you're lost.

Once inside, use the keys on the chests you'll find. Take careful note of what you find -- I need that intelligence for my report.

Along the way you'll meet a certain Striga who will prevent you from going downstairs. Definitely kill him. On the next floor, look for a minotaur named Asterion and kill him, too. He has something I need; bring it to me.

Remember not to go too far down -- once you go past the steward, you'll be on the correct floor to find Asterion.

Oh, and don't underestimate him. Asterion is FAR more dangerous than typical minotaurs.
quest_25521.SuccessText:
How many pemphredo eyes did you find? Hmm. That's too few. If they were actively listening for orders from their homeland, there would be hundreds everywhere. And it seems Asterion's personal eye was only used for close-range communication! But...

But... but they MUST be communicating with the Hegemony military somehow. Right?! There's an entire platoon buried in the sand, waiting to spring some sort of trap. I just can't figure out what signal they're waiting for!

Argh! Damn your failure! Damn it all! I have nothing to go on!

Yes, yes, of course: you did as requested and here is your payment.

quest_25522.Description:
Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "I have a new lead on the secret military force buried in the Ilmari desert! You're going to help me crack this once and for all. Head to the desert and find the bunker the locals call "the labyrinth." It's south of Amulna, and rakshasa bandits are standing right near the entrance. Once you're underground, go down a few floors to the minotaur halls, then down again, and yet again. At the lowest floor of this place is a hag named Claudia. Kill her! Bring friends -- hags are no joke.

Claudia is said to have a vast treasure trove, which you can keep! All I need are the important documents that should be inside.

I understand there's some sort of mechanism that protects her treasure. Just figure it out and get it done."
quest_25522.Name: Aurest Mission: Claudia's Hoard
quest_25522.PrefaceText:
