I have a new lead on the secret military force buried in the Ilmari desert! You're going to help me crack this once and for all. Head to the desert and find the bunker the locals call "the labyrinth." It's south of Amulna, and rakshasa bandits are standing right near the entrance. Once you're underground, go down a few floors to the minotaur halls, then down again, and yet again. At the lowest floor of this place is a hag named Claudia. Kill her! Bring friends -- hags are no joke.

Claudia is said to have a vast treasure trove, which you can keep! All I need are the important documents that should be inside.

I understand there's some sort of mechanism that protects her treasure. Just figure it out and get it done.
quest_25522.SuccessText: These are the documents? Hmm, I'll see if I can get these decoded. You've done well!

quest_25523.Description: Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "Far from here, on a freezing plateau in Gazluk, there is a city of orcs. Find this place and sneak into their keep. I need you to assassinate some important people... and creatures... for political reasons. This will be dangerous; bring allies that you trust. Here's a list of those who must die. Remember, all of these are on the top floor of the keep. You don't need to go into the lower level."
quest_25523.Name: Aurest Mission: Gazluk Assassination
quest_25523.PrefaceText: Far from here, on a freezing plateau in Gazluk, there is a city of orcs. Find this place and sneak into their keep. I need you to assassinate some important people... and creatures... for political reasons. This will be dangerous; bring allies that you trust. Here's a list of those who must die. Remember, all of these are on the top floor of the keep. You don't need to go into the lower level.
quest_25523.SuccessText: You slew them all? Very well done! I am impressed. The orcs of Gazluk will now be much more responsive when I... oh, hrm, I'm so sorry to prattle on about things that aren't relevant to you! Here is your blood money. Cheers.

quest_25524.Description:
Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "I have heard terrifying tales of creatures deep beneath Gazluk Keep. I need you to investigate and correct these problems before they become severe. Bring allies! You'll need to trek deep into the lower level of the keep.

First, there is a 'productivity expert' that apparently achieves excellent results. We don't want them being productive, so fix that. Next, they have a massive urak pumping out eggs daily. That's got to stop!

Last, and most troubling, there is supposedly a demon hidden down there, summoned by foolish mages. They call it a 'gargoyle'. They do not understand how powerful it is. Slay it before it can open a portal and invade this world!"
quest_25524.Name: Aurest Mission: Gazluk's Dark Basement
quest_25524.PrefaceText:
I have heard terrifying tales of creatures deep beneath Gazluk Keep. I need you to investigate and correct these problems before they become severe. Bring allies! You'll need to trek deep into the lower level of the keep.

First, there is a 'productivity expert' that apparently achieves excellent results. We don't want them being productive, so fix that. Next, they have a massive urak pumping out eggs daily. That's got to stop!

Last, and most troubling, there is supposedly a demon hidden down there, summoned by foolish mages. They call it a 'gargoyle'. They do not understand how powerful it is. Slay it before it can open a portal and invade this world!
quest_25524.SuccessText:
Zukelmux The Intransigent?! I have indeed heard of him... and I am most impressed that you were able to slay him. ...

... Actually, that's outright terrifying. It's hard to believe that a handful of mortals could slay THE Zukelmux...

Actually, I bet it was an imposter! Someone claiming to be Zukelmux! Yes, that must be it.

Even so, good work. Here is your payment for services rendered.

quest_25525.Description:
Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "Head to Rahu and find a way into their sewer system. There is a problematic black-market poison merchant in the upper levels of the sewer; put an end to his evil schemes! Next, you'll need to figure out how to reach the lower levels of the place. I understand that there's a massive slime somewhere in the pipes and it's beginning to contaminate the city's water supply. If their water becomes unsafe, Rahu will be devastated and the area will become a warzone again. So go fix that. Finally, there is some sort of militant group of rat-people down there somewhere whose political alignment is problematic; depose their king and that should leave them in disarray.

The sewers are relatively safe, so you can scout things out on your own... but you're going to need friends to kill these targets! They're tougher than the rest of the stuff down there."
quest_25525.Name: Aurest Mission: Rahu Sewers
quest_25525.PrefaceText:
Head to Rahu and find a way into their sewer system. There is a problematic black-market poison merchant in the upper levels of the sewer; put an end to his evil schemes! Next, you'll need to figure out how to reach the lower levels of the place. I understand that there's a massive slime somewhere in the pipes and it's beginning to contaminate the city's water supply. If their water becomes unsafe, Rahu will be devastated and the area will become a warzone again. So go fix that. Finally, there is some sort of militant group of rat-people down there somewhere whose political alignment is problematic; depose their king and that should leave them in disarray.

The sewers are relatively safe, so you can scout things out on your own... but you're going to need friends to kill these targets! They're tougher than the rest of the stuff down there.
quest_25525.SuccessText:
The water supply is safe? Excellent. That's one more lever of control that the Hegemony can't use. And you've hopefully prevented a ratkin uprising for at least a few more months. Mortal politics are every bit as messy as fae politics!

You appear to have applied your skills well; here is your payment.

quest_25526.Description: Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "I have an extremely difficult task today. You need to enter the fae realm near Sun Vale. There's a Winter ship in orbit there. Sneak aboard and take out some problems."
quest_25526.Name: Aurest Mission: Wintertide Assault
quest_25526.PrefaceText: I have an extremely difficult task today. You need to enter the fae realm near Sun Vale. There's a Winter ship in orbit there. Sneak aboard and take out some problems.
quest_25526.SuccessText: I've already heard the transmissions -- you've done well. The next stage of my plan is beginning, but your part is done. Here is your money. Remember: tell no-one of what you've done.

quest_25527.Description:
Lady Alethina in Red Wing Casino said, "I hope you're as good as you think you are, because this one is tricky. Enter the fae realm near Sun Vale. There's a Winter planeship there; sneak aboard. Then find some bird-creature named... Hmm, my notes say "Coldfeather" but there's also something called "Hotfeather" aboard. Kill them both, to be safe.

I also need you to open some of their storage chests and take note of the contents. You should be able to find keys aboard the ship. Good luck. Bring friends."
quest_25527.Name: Aurest Mission: Wintertide Sabotage

Objectives.Description: Unlock Loot Containers (Total from Any Deck)
Unlock Loot Containers (At least 1 from Engineering Deck)

quest_25527.PrefaceText:
I hope you're as good as you think you are, because this one is tricky. Enter the fae realm near Sun Vale. There's a Winter planeship there; sneak aboard. Then find some bird-creature named... Hmm, my notes say "Coldfeather" but there's also something called "Hotfeather" aboard. Kill them both, to be safe.

I also need you to open some of their storage chests and take note of the contents. You should be able to find keys aboard the ship. Good luck. Bring friends.
quest_25527.SuccessText:
So, how much mortal contraband did you find in the chests? Hmm, not much? That's another theory busted. We had hoped perhaps they were just plundering this world, but I think not. Their plans must be more problematic than that!

But that's an issue for another day. Here is your payment. Spend it well.

quest_25601.Description: Pickles in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "The whole Warden Alert system is down. The main crystal's been down for months, but now both backup crystals are down, too! I don't know how any of this works, so I'm just going to try taking everything apart, cleaning it, and putting it back together. Unfortunately Cassie spilled my last jar of cleaning acid, which then melted most of my cleaning supplies. Can you get us some new stuff?"
quest_25601.Name: Getting Warden Alerts Working
quest_25601.PrefaceText: The whole Warden Alert system is down. The main crystal's been down for months, but now both backup crystals are down, too! I don't know how any of this works, so I'm just going to try taking everything apart, cleaning it, and putting it back together. Unfortunately Cassie spilled my last jar of cleaning acid, which then melted most of my cleaning supplies. Can you get us some new stuff?
quest_25601.SuccessText: Oh good, you're back. Now I get to clean delicate machinery while holding an acid-soaked rag in my mouth! Have I mentioned how irritating it is that I can't just bring in an expert? I know some very discreet elves who could get everything working again within a day! But noooo, we can't have elves in our sacred grotto... even if it means animals die! Milton seriously said that to me, if you can believe it. Sorry, I'm just talking while I work. Ignore me... hand me that spring? Okay. Look, it's already blinking! One of the backups is on! Let's see if we have a signal... it's working! Here, I'm going to stick this crystal in your ear for a second. It won't hurt. Okay, you're attuned. Now you should be able to listen to the Warden Alerts! Give it a try. [This recipe can be found under the 'Lore' skill in the recipe window.]

quest_25602.Description:
Pickles in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "We've got one backup crystal emitting alerts, but it won't last forever. We really need to get the main crystal working again! But there's nobody left alive who knows how this stuff works.

Before the massacre, there was a group of foxes that maintained the system. They taught each other the secrets of how it worked. Did they write the secrets down? No, of course they didn't. And then they ALL had to go get massacred, and now here we are.

Milton won't let me bring in outside help, but I needed some expert advice, so I've been quietly using a sending-stone to chat with my old master.

Don't look at me like that: my master's a great wizard! I wasn't his slave! I was his partner! Anyway, I haven't told him the specifics, so he can't be too helpful, but he thinks he has a book that'll help. And he shipped it overseas to me! It should be waiting for pickup in Rahu. I'm not sure where, exactly, but talk to the dock manager."
quest_25602.MidwayText:
Special-order book? Oh. I know what you're talking about. It was hand-delivered by the captain of the last ship. He said an animal would come to claim it.

Whoever sent this book paid a fortune to get it here fast. I hope it's a good read.
quest_25602.Name: A Little Guidance Goes A Long Way
quest_25602.PrefaceText:
We've got one backup crystal emitting alerts, but it won't last forever. We really need to get the main crystal working again! But there's nobody left alive who knows how this stuff works.

Before the massacre, there was a group of foxes that maintained the system. They taught each other the secrets of how it worked. Did they write the secrets down? No, of course they didn't. And then they ALL had to go get massacred, and now here we are.

Milton won't let me bring in outside help, but I needed some expert advice, so I've been quietly using a sending-stone to chat with my old master.

Don't look at me like that: my master's a great wizard! I wasn't his slave! I was his partner! Anyway, I haven't told him the specifics, so he can't be too helpful, but he thinks he has a book that'll help. And he shipped it overseas to me! It should be waiting for pickup in Rahu. I'm not sure where, exactly, but talk to the dock manager.
quest_25602.SuccessText:
This is the book? It's older than I expected. Look, it's signed by the author! "To Exelpan, the dirty elf with the brilliant mind." That's my former master's name. He sent me his signed copy! Great, now I have to make sure it doesn't get peed on by anybody so I can return it.

Anyway, now I have to read this book and see if it helps. Thanks for picking it up.

quest_25603.Description:
Pickles in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "I'm still reading the book you brought me, but I have good news: the big crystal inside this machine isn't broken! Because if it was broken, the magic would have leaked out and killed us all months ago.

The main crystal isn't working because the little connector gear is broken. I think some gears and parts fell out while we were fleeing our old headquarters. But these parts don't seem all that exotic... maybe we can find replacements.

Let me show you what I need: a gear that looks like this, some springs, and some of these weird twist-nails. Good luck!"
quest_25603.Name: Gears and Screws For Warden Alerts
quest_25603.PrefaceText:
I'm still reading the book you brought me, but I have good news: the big crystal inside this machine isn't broken! Because if it was broken, the magic would have leaked out and killed us all months ago.

The main crystal isn't working because the little connector gear is broken. I think some gears and parts fell out while we were fleeing our old headquarters. But these parts don't seem all that exotic... maybe we can find replacements.

Let me show you what I need: a gear that looks like this, some springs, and some of these weird twist-nails. Good luck!
quest_25603.SuccessText: I appreciate the hard work! But... I have bad news. I've been reading this book some more, and I don't think replacing the gear is enough. It's missing the pendulum weight mechanism, too! But these parts are a start. Thanks!

quest_25604.Description:
Pickles in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "The gear you found fits perfectly! These gears must be mass-produced by the dwarves! That's pretty amazing, right?

But that repair didn't make it go. I think I found the problem: the primary timing system is just... gone! It must have gotten lost or stolen. I've studied the similar ones in the auxiliary system, and I think if I had a dwarven weight like this one, I could rig something up with some string. Maybe? Worth a try."
quest_25604.Name: A Weighty Repair
quest_25604.PrefaceText:
The gear you found fits perfectly! These gears must be mass-produced by the dwarves! That's pretty amazing, right?

But that repair didn't make it go. I think I found the problem: the primary timing system is just... gone! It must have gotten lost or stolen. I've studied the similar ones in the auxiliary system, and I think if I had a dwarven weight like this one, I could rig something up with some string. Maybe? Worth a try.
quest_25604.SuccessText:
This is it! Very nice work. Let me see if this fixes it...

Hmm, nothing. Can you smack that box over there? There! The main system is on! ... Damn. It shut off again. Well, we almost had it!

quest_25605.Description:
Pickles in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "Look, I know you're annoyed that I need even more parts to repair the Warden Alert system. I'm annoyed about it too! I'm just a cat, and I'm doing my best! We can't give up on this. It's too important to the Wardens.

It looks like the glass we used in the earlier repair isn't strong enough: it actually melted inside the machine, and the mess took me hours to remove. Instead of glass, let's try diamonds. Those are super strong, right?

And this part here is supposed to be sparkling. Or sparking. Something like fire should be happening. See how it's coated in powder? I know this stuff! My master used a lot of it. It's a mix of sulfur and saltpeter. Get me some of both, maybe I can make it go again."
quest_25605.Name: Even More Parts?!
quest_25605.PrefaceText:
Look, I know you're annoyed that I need even more parts to repair the Warden Alert system. I'm annoyed about it too! I'm just a cat, and I'm doing my best! We can't give up on this. It's too important to the Wardens.

It looks like the glass we used in the earlier repair isn't strong enough: it actually melted inside the machine, and the mess took me hours to remove. Instead of glass, let's try diamonds. Those are super strong, right?

And this part here is supposed to be sparkling. Or sparking. Something like fire should be happening. See how it's coated in powder? I know this stuff! My master used a lot of it. It's a mix of sulfur and saltpeter. Get me some of both, maybe I can make it go again.
quest_25605.SuccessText:
Good work! Okay, the diamonds fit in pretty easily. Now this powder is a little trickier... you might want to step back. And protect your eyes... here we go! ...

Hey, it worked! IT WORKED! HA! We got the main crystal working! I knew we could do it!

I'm actually pretty surprised that this worked... and that nothing exploded. But don't tell Milton that, okay?

quest_25701.Description: Barnaby in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "I've been teaching the foxes how to read by sounding out the Human language symbols. I don't think they're ready for writing yet -- truth be told I have a hard time with writing myself! But it's time they became familiar with paper and ink. We'll need a LOT of both."
quest_25701.Name: Fox Drawing Lessons
quest_25701.PrefaceText: I've been teaching the foxes how to read by sounding out the Human language symbols. I don't think they're ready for writing yet -- truth be told I have a hard time with writing myself! But it's time they became familiar with paper and ink. We'll need a LOT of both.
quest_25701.SuccessText:
Wonderful, thank you!

As I'm sure you know, it's very hard to write as an animal. It takes a lot of practice! And the first lesson is getting used to having ink on your paws, because it always happens no matter how careful you are. We'll make paw-print paintings first, then eventually move on to drawing with the mouth-brush technique.

quest_25702.Description: Barnaby in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "We're having some trouble with the "drawing with ink" lessons: Rubi refuses to get her paws inked up. I think I need something less messy to help them build paw-mouth dexterity. Help me get the raw materials for a little sewing project."
quest_25702.Name: Fox Sewing Lessons
quest_25702.PrefaceText: We're having some trouble with the "drawing with ink" lessons: Rubi refuses to get her paws inked up. I think I need something less messy to help them build paw-mouth dexterity. Help me get the raw materials for a little sewing project.
quest_25702.SuccessText: Very good work. This will take a while, I expect! And I'll have bandages ready, because somebody's lip is going to get pierced by a needle, I just know it. But they'll learn incredibly fast, you'll see.

quest_25703.Description: Barnaby in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "Young foxes love colorful gems! I could use a selection of nice colors to use as teaching props."
quest_25703.Name: Prop Gems
quest_25703.PrefaceText: Young foxes love colorful gems! I could use a selection of nice colors to use as teaching props.
quest_25703.SuccessText: You've found a good selection of gems! I hope they aren't valuable... ? Because they'll inevitably be lost all through this cave in a week! But they'll be very useful in the mean time. Thank you!

quest_25704.Description:
Barnaby in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "The foxes love the gems you got! I explained to Rubi that she's named after a gem called a Ruby. She insists upon seeing some of these gems right away! And that got me to thinking: if I had a LOT of them, I could use them in tomorrow's math lesson. Do you know where to find a lot of rubies?

Of course, we shouldn't leave Cassie out. Find some nice stones for her too, okay?"
quest_25704.Name: Rubies for Rubi
quest_25704.PrefaceText:
The foxes love the gems you got! I explained to Rubi that she's named after a gem called a Ruby. She insists upon seeing some of these gems right away! And that got me to thinking: if I had a LOT of them, I could use them in tomorrow's math lesson. Do you know where to find a lot of rubies?

Of course, we shouldn't leave Cassie out. Find some nice stones for her too, okay?
quest_25704.SuccessText: Thanks so much. They pay a lot more attention when I use these gems in the lessons!

quest_25801.Description:
Tangle in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "We need to check in on some of our spy network members. These are animals in distant lands that work with us. They aren't all members of the Wardens, but they're entrusted with our secret communication ritual.

Start by checking in with a cow in Eltibule. I don't know her name... she's never given us one. But she says she's the only talking cow in her herd, so... see what you can do. Take this care package to her. It's some stuff she asked for a while back."
quest_25801.MidwayText:
Oh, you're doing deliveries for the Wardens? Hey, that's the stuff I asked for! ... What is this? This is a milking device for goats! Not cows! How can you mix these up? Our udder shape isn't even similar!

Tell him thanks for the clover and salt, but I still need a milk storage device FOR COWS.

And more clover than this!
quest_25801.Name: Checking In On The Suspicious Cow

Objectives.Description: Deliver Care Package to Suspicious Cow

quest_25801.PrefaceText:
We need to check in on some of our spy network members. These are animals in distant lands that work with us. They aren't all members of the Wardens, but they're entrusted with our secret communication ritual.

Start by checking in with a cow in Eltibule. I don't know her name... she's never given us one. But she says she's the only talking cow in her herd, so... see what you can do. Take this care package to her. It's some stuff she asked for a while back.
quest_25801.SuccessText: She's still alive? Great. Did she like the stuff? Oh. Well, I got it third-hand from a wolf in the desert, so... I did my best. Thanks for doing the delivery.

quest_25802.Description: Tangle in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "Check in on Norbert for me, will you? I know you've met him already in Sun Vale. He's a good pig. Used to run missions with us, but some of his friends died in the big massacre, and he's been a lot more distant since then. Take this stuff to show we still care, that sort of thing."
quest_25802.MidwayText:
So you're all settled in with the Wardens now, huh? I knew you'd like being a Warden! I mean, the perks are pretty great. Bounceweed doesn't do much for pigs, but my Warden powers let me FLY! Very briefly. By the way, make sure to land safely before the spell wears off.

Hmm? Oh, yeah, I'm still active! I'm just... focusing on Sun Vale right now. There's lots of talking animals right here, you know!
quest_25802.Name: Checking In On Norbert
quest_25802.PrefaceText: Check in on Norbert for me, will you? I know you've met him already in Sun Vale. He's a good pig. Used to run missions with us, but some of his friends died in the big massacre, and he's been a lot more distant since then. Take this stuff to show we still care, that sort of thing.
quest_25802.SuccessText:
Norbert used to make the trip out here every week! It's a long journey, but he came out here hundreds of times. And after the massacre... he's come over maybe twice.

I think this is his way of mourning. So we'll give the pig time to mourn his dead friends. I mean, it's not like I need time to mourn too. No. I only LOST MY SON in the massacre! I could use a helping hoof too! ... 

Sorry. You don't need to hear this. Me and Norbert go way back, and I'm a little upset. Just... give me time to mourn, too. I'll be fine.

quest_25803.Description: Tangle in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "Ever been to the Ilmari Desert? Well, there's a town in the desert called Amulna. In this town is a wolf. Well, more specifically, he's a werewolf. But he's one of the good ones. He has some great merchant contacts and gets us a lot of supplies. This care package includes some money we owe him."
quest_25803.MidwayText: So that weasely fox finally decides to pay me, huh? Hold it... I can tell by the weight that there's not enough money here! This is only half the money! And Tangle has the balls to include a new list of stuff he needs?! Tell that deadbeat dog that I'm not buying him anything more until I get my cash. I already give the Wardens a 50% discount. That means I already lose money on every sale! Does he want to ruin me? I mean fuck me, I'm a businesswolf, not a charity!
quest_25803.Name: Checking In On Lumpfuzz
quest_25803.PrefaceText: Ever been to the Ilmari Desert? Well, there's a town in the desert called Amulna. In this town is a wolf. Well, more specifically, he's a werewolf. But he's one of the good ones. He has some great merchant contacts and gets us a lot of supplies. This care package includes some money we owe him.
quest_25803.SuccessText: Yeah, I knew Lumpfuzz wouldn't be happy. That's all the cash I had right now! But don't worry about what he said: he'll buy the stuff we need with his own money. He's a good wolf.

quest_25804.Description: Tangle in the Sacred Warden Grotto said, "This one's hard. Ever heard of the Gazluk Plateau? Well, Trekker the pig is in the northeast-ish part of the mountains. You'll have to climb up from the valley into the mountains to find him. Bring warm clothes."
quest_25804.MidwayText:
(Shh, keep your voice down. Fluffikins over there has good ears!

Tell Tangle I'm working a mission right now. I met a gigantic talking mushroom man, and he has some very useful magic to teach! Tell Tangle I'm gonna need eight or ten more recall stones. And thanks for these mushrooms!)
quest_25804.Name: Checking In On Trekker
quest_25804.PrefaceText: This one's hard. Ever heard of the Gazluk Plateau? Well, Trekker the pig is in the northeast-ish part of the mountains. You'll have to climb up from the valley into the mountains to find him. Bring warm clothes.
quest_25804.SuccessText:
He met a "talking mushroom man"? What?! Trekker always gets into the weirdest adventures. But he's a badass pig, even by Warden standards. Not a lot of us can survive in Gazluk!

I'll get the recall stones he needs. Thanks for making the delivery.

quest_26.Description: Hogan the staff fighter has requested some items as payment for teaching you staff combat.
quest_26.Name: Hogan's Request

Objectives.Description: Get two giant snail shells (any quality)
Find a nice piece of poetry

quest_26001.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Well if you're going to assault the ship and create mayhem, you should start with the trolls! Most of these trolls were supposed to go down to the surface already, but they're lazy oafs who just hang around down here."
quest_26001.Name: Troll Troopers
quest_26001.PrefaceText: Well if you're going to assault the ship and create mayhem, you should start with the trolls! Most of these trolls were supposed to go down to the surface already, but they're lazy oafs who just hang around down here.
quest_26001.SuccessText:
Great! Fewer trolls stinking up the place! Of course, new squads of trolls arrive almost constantly, so you're really wasting your time. But that's okay! Please... waste more time!

Here's some precious cargo.

quest_26002.Description:
Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Let me think. How would you assault a ship? I guess you could just attack the crew! Try attacking the ensigns! Heehee!

Oh, uh, be aware they have death rays. Just a heads up."
quest_26002.Name: Ensigns
quest_26002.PrefaceText:
Let me think. How would you assault a ship? I guess you could just attack the crew! Try attacking the ensigns! Heehee!

Oh, uh, be aware they have death rays. Just a heads up.
quest_26002.SuccessText:
You sent those ensigns back to their lifestones! It'll take them a few days to recover and catch a ride back here! So you're totally winning! This is very impressive!

Here, keep this. I'm going to tell everyone that you tortured me for it!

quest_26003.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "The best way to assault a ship is to kill the captain! Go kill Captain Evergloam!"
quest_26003.Name: Captain Evergloam
quest_26003.PrefaceText: The best way to assault a ship is to kill the captain! Go kill Captain Evergloam!
quest_26003.SuccessText:
You crazy bastard! You killed Captain Evergloam! Hahaha! Here, take this bounty of useless supplies as spoils of war!

Of course, now the ship just has to sit here waiting for the captain to get back. BORRRINNNG. But maybe she'll get demoted! Oooh, or maybe you'll blow up the ship before she gets back! I'm excited to see what you do next!

quest_26004.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "While you're invading, would you mind exterminating those pesky birds on the main deck? Lieutenant Frostglimmer insists they're trained alarm birds that will prevent intruders from sneaking around. But they make so much noise that most of us just ignore them..."
quest_26004.Name: Accursed Frost Pigeons
quest_26004.PrefaceText: While you're invading, would you mind exterminating those pesky birds on the main deck? Lieutenant Frostglimmer insists they're trained alarm birds that will prevent intruders from sneaking around. But they make so much noise that most of us just ignore them...
quest_26004.SuccessText:
The cocks are gone? Maybe we can get some peace and quiet now... Or maybe the hippogriffs will just get louder without competition. We'll see!

Hey, want to know something new? Stand still. Did it take? You didn't die, so I think it must have worked! Haha! You've stolen our technology now! Some day you may even have use for that knowledge.

quest_26005.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "The loudest things aboard are definitely the hippogriffs. At first it was neat hearing them shriek all night, but it's gotten a little repetitive. I think any official invasion party would really need to kill those! Thanks!"
quest_26005.Name: Noisy Arcta Hippogriffs
quest_26005.PrefaceText: The loudest things aboard are definitely the hippogriffs. At first it was neat hearing them shriek all night, but it's gotten a little repetitive. I think any official invasion party would really need to kill those! Thanks!
quest_26005.SuccessText: Nice. I really hated cleaning up after those birds! Thanks! Here's some precious loot. Tell people that I gave it to you under great duress.

quest_26006.Description:
Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Hippogriffs aren't immortal. Did you know that? Yeah, they hatch out of eggs! We have a hatchery on board, too. You should go kill the brood mother!

You'll know you're in the right place when the temperature drops. They keep Coldfeather's quarters very cold!"
quest_26006.Name: The Big Boss Birdie
quest_26006.PrefaceText:
Hippogriffs aren't immortal. Did you know that? Yeah, they hatch out of eggs! We have a hatchery on board, too. You should go kill the brood mother!

You'll know you're in the right place when the temperature drops. They keep Coldfeather's quarters very cold!
quest_26006.SuccessText:
Coldfeather is dead? Huh. I guess I expected to feel better about that, since cleaning frozen bird poop is extremely unfun. But actually I'm kind of sad.

Well, there's more brood hippogriffs, and I'm sure we'll get a new one soon. Unless you blow up the ship first! Here's hoping!

Hey, what's that up there?! Hah, made you look! Hmm? Oh, no, it's just a memory injector. Do you feel the memory? Then it worked! This 'coffee' thing isn't a fairy invention, though. Actually, we found it on the mortal realm! But it's pretty good. Maybe some day you'll be able to make some. Or not. Who cares.

quest_26007.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Hey, while you're assaulting the ship and all, why not kill some of the pests on the engine deck? We've got a nasty infestation of droaches down there. Apparently they get along great with the phoenixes, so everybody's afraid to get rid of 'em. But not you!"
quest_26007.Name: Engine Pests
quest_26007.PrefaceText: Hey, while you're assaulting the ship and all, why not kill some of the pests on the engine deck? We've got a nasty infestation of droaches down there. Apparently they get along great with the phoenixes, so everybody's afraid to get rid of 'em. But not you!
quest_26007.SuccessText:
Thanks for stamping out some droaches. I'm sure there's hundreds more in the walls and floors, but if we can at least terrorize them into staying out of the way, that's a big win.

Hey, stand still. This may hurt. There! Did it hurt? Perfect! You've stolen more of our technology! That will outrage the captain even more!

Those blueprints are probably useless to you right now, but I'm sure some day you'll be glad I burned them into your mind!

quest_26008.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Any invasion force would be dumb not to take out the phoenixes on the engine deck. We don't use them in day-to-day operations, but if we have to cold-start an engine, we use their superheated breath."
quest_26008.Name: Phoenix Firestarters
quest_26008.PrefaceText: Any invasion force would be dumb not to take out the phoenixes on the engine deck. We don't use them in day-to-day operations, but if we have to cold-start an engine, we use their superheated breath.
quest_26008.SuccessText:
The phoenixes are gone? Well, that's an important part of the ship's backup system taken out!

Nobody will notice at first. But in a few months when we need to restart an engine, people will be SO PISSED!

quest_26009.Description:
Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "The lowest deck is mostly empty and just used for storage. We've stored a bunch of mortal specimens down there for later analysis.

The mortal realm near here is full of really beautiful things. Beautiful flowers! Talking trees! 'Elves'! Real dragons! But what's in the hold? ... cow-men.

They're going to try to breed them into an army, so you should totally go stop them."
quest_26009.Name: Gross Mortal Bull Men
quest_26009.PrefaceText:
The lowest deck is mostly empty and just used for storage. We've stored a bunch of mortal specimens down there for later analysis.

The mortal realm near here is full of really beautiful things. Beautiful flowers! Talking trees! 'Elves'! Real dragons! But what's in the hold? ... cow-men.

They're going to try to breed them into an army, so you should totally go stop them.
quest_26009.SuccessText: Thanks for taking out the cow-men. Although to be honest, I don't think our breeding program was ever going to work. For one thing, they're actually sentient, and they don't like us. Second, all our specimens were male. But who knows what Winter's genetic engineers could do with them, so ... good work!

quest_26010.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "There's a bunch of bears on the storage deck because of... reasons. You should clear those out, if you're going that way!"
quest_26010.Name: Fae Bears In The Hold
quest_26010.PrefaceText: There's a bunch of bears on the storage deck because of... reasons. You should clear those out, if you're going that way!
quest_26010.SuccessText: The bears are gone? Great! I was about to get in trouble for that one. See, the cow-men were sentient, but the bears weren't. So as a little prank, I  swapped their intelligence reports in our system. For weeks, ensigns have been trying to tame the cow-men and parlay with the bears. It's been very, VERY funny to watch, but the joke's run its course. Thanks to you!

quest_26011.Description: Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "Okay, I'll cut the act: I know why you're really here. You're after the wizard! Well, he isn't here. Not physically, anyway. But his creations are! Go up to the science deck and you'll see what I mean. By all means, feel free to dispose of our new 'army'!"
quest_26011.Name: Science Deck Sadness
quest_26011.PrefaceText: Okay, I'll cut the act: I know why you're really here. You're after the wizard! Well, he isn't here. Not physically, anyway. But his creations are! Go up to the science deck and you'll see what I mean. By all means, feel free to dispose of our new 'army'!
quest_26011.SuccessText:
You got the abominations out of the science deck? That's great news, because they freak me OUT! UGH!

Oh, but FYI: we've already sent thousands of them off to other worlds, along with their horrible brain-dog pets. So it's much too late for you to stop the army. They're invading a distant world even as we speak!

Sorry... I honestly didn't mean to mislead you that time. Here's a make-up present. Tell people you tore it from my broken fingers after beating me almost to death!

quest_26012.Description:
Ensign Cricket aboard the Wintertide said, "The science deck has been given over to the mad wizard that made those... monstrosities. And he's not even here! He just astrally projects himself here from the mortal realm.

Sustained astral projection requires an impressive amount of magical fortitude, I'll admit. But its so gauche!

You should just pull his plug."
quest_26012.Name: The Mad Wizard
quest_26012.PrefaceText:
The science deck has been given over to the mad wizard that made those... monstrosities. And he's not even here! He just astrally projects himself here from the mortal realm.

Sustained astral projection requires an impressive amount of magical fortitude, I'll admit. But its so gauche!

You should just pull his plug.
quest_26012.SuccessText: Did you disconnect him? Hah! I'm sure he'll just call back in a bit. But he'll be extra pissed off now. That might be fun! Good work!

quest_26101.Description:
Wintria Irasce in Rahu said, "I left my brother running our book store back in Statehelm. I need him to think I'm happy here! Otherwise he won't understand why I'm not ready to go home.

I want to send Michael a package of treats and wonders from Rahu to show how amazing this place is. I have a list here... could you help me? If you get these items, I'll teach you a special organizational cantrip that we use in the book-sellers' trade."
quest_26101.Name: Care Package from Rahu
quest_26101.PrefaceText:
I left my brother running our book store back in Statehelm. I need him to think I'm happy here! Otherwise he won't understand why I'm not ready to go home.

I want to send Michael a package of treats and wonders from Rahu to show how amazing this place is. I have a list here... could you help me? If you get these items, I'll teach you a special organizational cantrip that we use in the book-sellers' trade.
quest_26101.SuccessText: Perfect! I'll also include some foods I've bought from Selaxi, and I'll get this package onto the next courier ship. Let me teach you a little spell we bookmasters use to keep bookshelves organized without having to walk everywhere! [There is a new button on the Storage UI window, "Stow Items in Nearby Storages". Pressing this button will move items from your inventory into any nearby storage, provided there's at least one of that item in the storage already.]

quest_26201.Description:
Monsters are invading Povus under cover of darkness. Light the town's lamps to regain control.

(To receive a personal reward, make sure you personally light at least one lamp.)
quest_26201.Name: Povus Safety: Light the Lamps
quest_26201.PrefaceText:
Monsters are invading Povus under cover of darkness. Light the town's lamps to regain control.

(To receive a personal reward, make sure you personally light at least one lamp.)
quest_26201.SuccessText: You lit all the lamps! Visit the Town Status Board for a reward.

quest_26211.Description:
The Annex district, along with the whole area south of town, is being flooded by Ranalon interlopers! Destroy their water portals and push back their assault force!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally defeat at least one enemy.)

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26211.Name: Povus Safety: Ranalon Flooding
quest_26211.PrefaceText:
The Annex district, along with the whole area south of town, is being flooded by Ranalon interlopers! Destroy their water portals and push back their assault force!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally defeat at least one enemy.)

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26211.SuccessText: The flooding is contained! Visit the Town Status Board for a reward.

quest_26212.Description:
Ratkin have invaded from the east and have already taken New Town. They're spreading a poison that only rats can survive. Stop them!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26212.Name: Povus Safety: Ratkin Fumigators
quest_26212.PrefaceText:
Ratkin have invaded from the east and have already taken New Town. They're spreading a poison that only rats can survive. Stop them!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26212.SuccessText: The air is becoming breathable. The ratkin are repelled! Visit the Town Status Board for a reward.

quest_26213.Description:
Scores of screaming orcs are invading from the river. They're taking over Old Town! Stop them!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26213.Name: Povus Safety: Orc Invaders
quest_26213.PrefaceText:
Scores of screaming orcs are invading from the river. They're taking over Old Town! Stop them!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26213.SuccessText: You've routed the orcs! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26214.Description:
Ratkin have infiltrated Old Town and the Sprawl and have claimed ownership of the town! Dispute their claim with prejudice!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26214.Name: Povus Safety: Ratkin Squatters
quest_26214.PrefaceText:
Ratkin have infiltrated Old Town and the Sprawl and have claimed ownership of the town! Dispute their claim with prejudice!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one enemy.)
quest_26214.SuccessText: You've defeated the ratkin! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26215.Description:
Evil paleontologists are sieging town! Their extraordinary skeleton troops will require teamwork to defeat.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26215.Name: Povus Safety: Paleontologist Siege
quest_26215.PrefaceText:
Evil paleontologists are sieging town! Their extraordinary skeleton troops will require teamwork to defeat.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26215.SuccessText: You've broken the paleontologists' siege! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26216.Description:
Ranalon-controlled megafauna are invading town! It will take concerted effort to thwart them.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26216.Name: Povus Safety: Ranalon Assault
quest_26216.PrefaceText:
Ranalon-controlled megafauna are invading town! It will take concerted effort to thwart them.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26216.SuccessText: You've halted the ranalon assault! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26217.Description:
Undead are being summoned into town! Defeat the undead ogres in New Town and find the death-faces and Shaman Lords in the Sprawl!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Visage of Demise or Elite enemy.)
quest_26217.Name: Povus Safety: Undead Surprise!
quest_26217.PrefaceText:
Undead are being summoned into town! Defeat the undead ogres in New Town and find the death-faces and Shaman Lords in the Sprawl!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Visage of Demise or Elite enemy.)
quest_26217.SuccessText: You've halted the undead invasion! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26218.Description:
Winter Court scouts think the town is weak, and they're attacking! They've invaded every neighborhood! Do something before they freeze and/or burn the place down!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26218.Name: Povus Safety: Winter Court Scouts
quest_26218.PrefaceText:
Winter Court scouts think the town is weak, and they're attacking! They've invaded every neighborhood! Do something before they freeze and/or burn the place down!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite enemy.)
quest_26218.SuccessText: You've chased off the Winter Court! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26219.Description:
The local orcish warlord himself is attacking from the east, along with his best-equipped troops! Defend Povus!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26219.Name: Povus Safety: Warmaster Brukal
quest_26219.PrefaceText:
The local orcish warlord himself is attacking from the east, along with his best-equipped troops! Defend Povus!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26219.SuccessText: You've defeated Brukal's assault team! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26220.Description:
The dread lich Urg-Ak Faqu has come to claim Povus! His minions are empowered by spells that nullify most attacks. The town's only hope is to enable the protective pagodas! Bring monsters near activated pagodas to strip them of their defenses.

The monsters are invading from all sides, but it seems they're congregating on the north side of town.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26220.Name: Povus Safety: Bone War!
quest_26220.PrefaceText:
The dread lich Urg-Ak Faqu has come to claim Povus! His minions are empowered by spells that nullify most attacks. The town's only hope is to enable the protective pagodas! Bring monsters near activated pagodas to strip them of their defenses.

The monsters are invading from all sides, but it seems they're congregating on the north side of town.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26220.SuccessText: You've defeated Urg-Ak Faq! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26221.Description:
The mercenary Evil Carnivore Gang is trying to steal Povus's priceless protective pagodas! They've placed explosive spells on them and are planning to cart off the enchanted rubble.

Without the pagodas, Povus will soon be overrun with undead. Cleans the pagodas! You'll also need to defeat the raid leader, Asila the Spark, to convince the gang to back down.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally activate a pagoda or defeat the gang leader.)
quest_26221.Name: Povus Safety: Pagoda Thieves!
quest_26221.PrefaceText:
The mercenary Evil Carnivore Gang is trying to steal Povus's priceless protective pagodas! They've placed explosive spells on them and are planning to cart off the enchanted rubble.

Without the pagodas, Povus will soon be overrun with undead. Cleans the pagodas! You'll also need to defeat the raid leader, Asila the Spark, to convince the gang to back down.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally activate a pagoda or defeat the gang leader.)
quest_26221.SuccessText: You've thwarted the pagoda thieves! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26222.Description:
A roving band of flapskulls and other undead have found their way to town. They have no necromantic master, but they are led by the hideous Chuckleflap. You can activate the pagodas in town if you need some fresh air.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26222.Name: Povus Safety: Flapskulls!
quest_26222.PrefaceText:
A roving band of flapskulls and other undead have found their way to town. They have no necromantic master, but they are led by the hideous Chuckleflap. You can activate the pagodas in town if you need some fresh air.

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat at least one Elite or Boss enemy.)
quest_26222.SuccessText: You've repelled the flapskulls! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26223.Description:
The river-ranalon have brought a horrible beast to town! Kill it before it destroys us all!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat the Boss enemy.)
quest_26223.Name: Povus Safety: River Terror!
quest_26223.PrefaceText:
The river-ranalon have brought a horrible beast to town! Kill it before it destroys us all!

(To receive a reward, make sure that you personally help defeat the Boss enemy.)
quest_26223.SuccessText: You've defeated Zotras the River Guardian! Visit the town Status board for a reward.

quest_26301.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "The orcs destroyed all my beautiful furniture when they attacked Povus. I miss my meditation stool so badly! It was amazing! I would love to have a new one, but the furniture sold in Rahu is made by goblin slave-labor. Many in Rahu turn a blind eye to slavery, but I won't! My furniture has to be made by a crafter I know!"
quest_26301.MidwayText: I wish I had an amazing meditation stool...
quest_26301.Name: An amazing new stool
quest_26301.PrefaceText: The orcs destroyed all my beautiful furniture when they attacked Povus. I miss my meditation stool so badly! It was amazing! I would love to have a new one, but the furniture sold in Rahu is made by goblin slave-labor. Many in Rahu turn a blind eye to slavery, but I won't! My furniture has to be made by a crafter I know!
quest_26301.SuccessText: This is wonderful! And I see you've left your crafter's mark on it. I am delighted!

quest_26302.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "I used to have a great little meditation stool which I used while working in my garden. The orcs stole it, of course. I would pay well for a replacement... but only if I know the crafter. I don't want to accidentally support slave labor!"
quest_26302.MidwayText: I wish I had a great meditation stool...
quest_26302.Name: A great new stool
quest_26302.PrefaceText: I used to have a great little meditation stool which I used while working in my garden. The orcs stole it, of course. I would pay well for a replacement... but only if I know the crafter. I don't want to accidentally support slave labor!
quest_26302.SuccessText: Thank you for making it to my specifications, this is great!

quest_26303.Description:
Lincha in Povus said, "I'm not a huge calligraphy nut, but I used to practice every now and then. If I still had my amazing calligraphy bench, I might start again!

However, I have to personally meet the craftsman to ensure that I'm not buying furniture made by slaves. Goblin slavers have flooded the market with that stuff, and I will have no part of it!"
quest_26303.MidwayText: I wish I had an amazing calligraphy bench...
quest_26303.Name: An amazing new calligraphy bench
quest_26303.PrefaceText:
I'm not a huge calligraphy nut, but I used to practice every now and then. If I still had my amazing calligraphy bench, I might start again!

However, I have to personally meet the craftsman to ensure that I'm not buying furniture made by slaves. Goblin slavers have flooded the market with that stuff, and I will have no part of it!
quest_26303.SuccessText: Ah, this is amazing quality! And you made it yourself? Can I see your maker's mark? Yes. You are my hero!

quest_26304.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "I used to have a beautiful little table where I could leave my paintings to dry. Do you want to know a secret? It was actually a repurposed calligraphy table! I would buy a replacement in an instant, as long as I was confident it wasn't made by goblin slave-labor."
quest_26304.MidwayText: I wish I had a great calligraphy bench...
quest_26304.Name: A great new calligraphy bench
quest_26304.PrefaceText: I used to have a beautiful little table where I could leave my paintings to dry. Do you want to know a secret? It was actually a repurposed calligraphy table! I would buy a replacement in an instant, as long as I was confident it wasn't made by goblin slave-labor.
quest_26304.SuccessText: This will fit my needs perfectly! And it's locally crafted! Perfect!

quest_26305.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "All my beautiful furniture was destroyed by invaders. Perhaps the most tragic was the loss of my amazing chair. It was hand-crafted by my favorite carpenter! Some day I hope to have a new one that's just as good."
quest_26305.MidwayText: I wish I had an amazing new chair...
quest_26305.Name: An amazing new chair
quest_26305.PrefaceText: All my beautiful furniture was destroyed by invaders. Perhaps the most tragic was the loss of my amazing chair. It was hand-crafted by my favorite carpenter! Some day I hope to have a new one that's just as good.
quest_26305.SuccessText: Wow, amazing! And you made this? Yourself? Oh, that's perfect, I'll take it!

quest_26306.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "The orcs even stole my guest chair. It was pretty great, too. I wish I could find a replacement! The trouble is that I must know the chair's provenance. I won't support goblin slave labor!"
quest_26306.MidwayText: I wish I had a great new chair...
quest_26306.Name: A great guest chair
quest_26306.PrefaceText: The orcs even stole my guest chair. It was pretty great, too. I wish I could find a replacement! The trouble is that I must know the chair's provenance. I won't support goblin slave labor!
quest_26306.SuccessText: This looks quite comfortable. It should be perfect for my guest chair! And I can tell by your hands that you made this yourself. Thank you.

quest_26307.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "Back before the orc attacks, my home was beautiful. Even my storage chests were beautiful pieces of art! They sell similar chests in Rahu, but I know those are made by goblin-owned slaves. I need to know my furniture is made by someone free!"
quest_26307.MidwayText: I wish I had a great new storage crate...
quest_26307.Name: A great new storage solution
quest_26307.PrefaceText: Back before the orc attacks, my home was beautiful. Even my storage chests were beautiful pieces of art! They sell similar chests in Rahu, but I know those are made by goblin-owned slaves. I need to know my furniture is made by someone free!
quest_26307.SuccessText: This is perhaps even better than my old storage system! Thank you for making this for me!

quest_26308.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "The orc invaders stole all my wine! Most of it wasn't even ready for drinking yet! And now I must start all over. But the hogsheads for sale in Rahu may have been made by goblin-owned slaves. Nobody keeps track of that stuff in Rahu, but it matters to me! I need all my hogsheads to be made by free folk."
quest_26308.MidwayText: I wish I had a great new storage crate...
quest_26308.Name: Artisanal hogsheads
quest_26308.PrefaceText: The orc invaders stole all my wine! Most of it wasn't even ready for drinking yet! And now I must start all over. But the hogsheads for sale in Rahu may have been made by goblin-owned slaves. Nobody keeps track of that stuff in Rahu, but it matters to me! I need all my hogsheads to be made by free folk.
quest_26308.SuccessText: These are good quality. And I see you've left your mark on them. I trust you, so I trust your wares. Thank you.

quest_26309.Description: Lincha in Povus said, "All of my cleaning tools were stolen by the orcs. Even my trusty cleaning stick! I used to use it to get items off of the roof, disgorge gutters and drains, and poke seeds into the dirt! It was an amazingly versatile stick. I saw a perfect replacement in Rahu, but they couldn't guarantee that it wasn't made by slave labor. So I had to keep searching..."
quest_26309.MidwayText: I wish I had an amazing cleaning staff...
quest_26309.Name: An amazing new cleaning stick
quest_26309.PrefaceText: All of my cleaning tools were stolen by the orcs. Even my trusty cleaning stick! I used to use it to get items off of the roof, disgorge gutters and drains, and poke seeds into the dirt! It was an amazingly versatile stick. I saw a perfect replacement in Rahu, but they couldn't guarantee that it wasn't made by slave labor. So I had to keep searching...
quest_26309.SuccessText: These are good quality. And I see you've left your mark on them. I trust you, so I trust your wares. Thank you.

quest_26351.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of basic hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26351.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new basic hammers from you.
quest_26351.Name: Basic Hammers
quest_26351.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of basic hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

quest_26352.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of tack hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26352.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new tack hammers from you.
quest_26352.Name: Tack Hammers
quest_26352.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of tack hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

quest_26353.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of fancy hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26353.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new fancy hammers from you.
quest_26353.Name: Fancy Hammers
quest_26353.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of fancy hammers. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

quest_26354.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of primitive armor stakes. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"

quest_26355.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of good armor stakes. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26355.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new good armor stakes from you.
quest_26355.Name: Good Armor Stakes
quest_26355.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of good armor stakes. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"

My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"

quest_26357.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of amazing armor patch kits. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26358.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new astounding armor patch kits from you.

quest_26358.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of astounding armor patch kits. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

quest_26359.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of astounding metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!"
quest_26359.MidwayText: If you're a miner, I'd love to purchase some astounding metal slabs from you.
quest_26359.Name: Astounding Metal Slabs
quest_26359.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of astounding metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!

quest_26360.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of superb metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!"
quest_26360.MidwayText: If you're a miner, I'd love to purchase some superb metal slabs from you.
quest_26360.Name: Superb Metal Slabs
quest_26360.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of superb metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!

quest_26361.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of marvelous metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!"
quest_26361.MidwayText: If you're a miner, I'd love to purchase some marvelous metal slabs from you.
quest_26361.Name: Marvelous Metal Slabs
quest_26361.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of marvelous metal slabs. Can you mine some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept ore that you didn't mine yourself!

quest_26362.Description: Stephie Blackhammer in Povus said, "It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of bilge hoops. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!"
quest_26362.MidwayText: If you're a tool artisan, I'd love to purchase some new bilge hoops from you.
quest_26362.Name: Bilge Hoops
quest_26362.PrefaceText: It's my job to keep uncle Tremmond working at top capacity, and he's almost out of bilge hoops. Can you make some for me? My uncle follows dwarven crafting-guild rules strictly. That means I can't accept tools that you didn't make yourself!

quest_26401.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "Are you finally ready to take my order? I've been waiting for hours! Yes, I'd like the shroom feast, please. And please try to keep it as ungreasy as possible."
quest_26401.MidwayText: Where is my shroom feast? I'm starving!
quest_26401.Name: Shroom Feast Time
quest_26401.PrefaceText: Are you finally ready to take my order? I've been waiting for hours! Yes, I'd like the shroom feast, please. And please try to keep it as ungreasy as possible.
quest_26401.SuccessText: Well, there's a bit too much salt, but it's not too greasy! My thanks to the chef.

quest_26402.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "There you are! I've been waiting so long! Let me have the orcish onion soup. And it had better be fresh!"
quest_26402.MidwayText: Where is my orcish onion soup?
quest_26402.Name: Fresh Orcish Onion Soup
quest_26402.PrefaceText: There you are! I've been waiting so long! Let me have the orcish onion soup. And it had better be fresh!
quest_26402.SuccessText: Hmm, something's not quite right. Are you sure you used fresh onions?! Well, it's pretty good. Thank you.

quest_26403.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "Well, you've made me wait so long for my food that I'm not even that hungry. I'll take the appetizers to go, please. Oh, don't tell me you lost my appetizer order?! It was spicy porcini bites! I need two servings. And not too greasy!"
quest_26403.MidwayText: Where are my porcini bites? Remember, I ordered two!
quest_26403.Name: Porcini Bites
quest_26403.PrefaceText: Well, you've made me wait so long for my food that I'm not even that hungry. I'll take the appetizers to go, please. Oh, don't tell me you lost my appetizer order?! It was spicy porcini bites! I need two servings. And not too greasy!
quest_26403.SuccessText: Well, these look edible. Thank you.

quest_26404.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "I see your menu has a selection of goblin food, including ruktagh. How are you getting fresh dill out here?! Well, I'm sure the dill isn't fresh. But the meal had better be!"
quest_26404.Name: Ruktagh
quest_26404.PrefaceText: I see your menu has a selection of goblin food, including ruktagh. How are you getting fresh dill out here?! Well, I'm sure the dill isn't fresh. But the meal had better be!
quest_26404.SuccessText:
Aaahhh, smell that aroma.

...Well, the smell is better than the taste, but it's not bad. Not bad.

quest_26405.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "I'm in the mood for something simple. Please bring me a cavefish supper. A FRESH cavefish supper, mind you! I'm eating simply, not poorly!"
quest_26405.MidwayText: When will my cavefish supper be ready? Don't tell me you're catching the cavefish now!
quest_26405.Name: Cavefish Supper
quest_26405.PrefaceText: I'm in the mood for something simple. Please bring me a cavefish supper. A FRESH cavefish supper, mind you! I'm eating simply, not poorly!
quest_26405.SuccessText: Well... It's not bad. Definitely fresh. Better than I expected from a place like this!

quest_26406.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "Finally, the help has arrived. Yes, I'm ready to order. Please bring me a chicken casserole. Yes, a complete casserole. I'm FAMISHED. From WAITING. For HOURS!"
quest_26406.MidwayText: I'm STILL waiting for my chicken casserole!
quest_26406.Name: Chicken Casserole
quest_26406.PrefaceText: Finally, the help has arrived. Yes, I'm ready to order. Please bring me a chicken casserole. Yes, a complete casserole. I'm FAMISHED. From WAITING. For HOURS!
quest_26406.SuccessText: Ahh. Well, I can't say this was worth the wait, but it is definitely worth eating. My compliments to the chef.

quest_26407.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "What took you so long?! I've been waiting for more than an hour! Nevermind. I don't care about your excuses. Please prepare a stuffed bell pepper for me."
quest_26407.MidwayText: Yes, remember my order? The stuffed bell pepper? I'm still waiting...
quest_26407.Name: A Delicious Stuffed Bell Pepper
quest_26407.PrefaceText: What took you so long?! I've been waiting for more than an hour! Nevermind. I don't care about your excuses. Please prepare a stuffed bell pepper for me.
quest_26407.SuccessText: I see that you didn't make the mistake of undersalting the dish. And this steak is ... Hm. Actually, it's pretty good. I'll eat it. Thank you.

quest_26408.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "The service here is truly awful. Do you know how long I've been waiting?! And I had to seat myself! But nevermind. Nevermind all that! I heard that this place makes a great swamp salad. I would like to try this dish."
quest_26408.MidwayText: Hello again! I ordered the swamp salad. Is there any chance I could receive my food TODAY?!
quest_26408.Name: Swamp Salad
quest_26408.PrefaceText: The service here is truly awful. Do you know how long I've been waiting?! And I had to seat myself! But nevermind. Nevermind all that! I heard that this place makes a great swamp salad. I would like to try this dish.
quest_26408.SuccessText:
Um... Is... Is this a swamp salad? It's... I expected crispy. This is kind of slimy...

Hm. No, it's not my favorite. But it's not that bad. An interesting dining experience, at least!

quest_26409.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "I've had a VERY long time to look at the menu, so yes, I'm ready to place my food order! I saw that you have fresh amberjack on the fish list. How is that even possible?! I guess amberjack is native to here? Well, I simply must try this dish."
quest_26409.MidwayText: Where's my grilled amberjack? And can I get a refill on my water?
quest_26409.Name: Grilled Amberjack
quest_26409.PrefaceText: I've had a VERY long time to look at the menu, so yes, I'm ready to place my food order! I saw that you have fresh amberjack on the fish list. How is that even possible?! I guess amberjack is native to here? Well, I simply must try this dish.
quest_26409.SuccessText: A little fishy. I think it could have used another minute on the grill. No, no, it's fine, I'll eat it. It's not bad!

quest_26410.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "Oh, waiter, finally! Yes, I want to know what makes your beetle skewer a "Deluxe" bettle skewer? Oh, don't tell me, I want to be surprised!"
quest_26410.Name: Deluxe Beetle Skewer
quest_26410.PrefaceText: Oh, waiter, finally! Yes, I want to know what makes your beetle skewer a "Deluxe" bettle skewer? Oh, don't tell me, I want to be surprised!
quest_26410.SuccessText:
Is this... zombified meat?! Are you certain this is safe to eat? Well...

Hm...

No, this one isn't for me. I can tell it's well prepared, but the fact that the meat is still squirming is just... Anyway, thank you for the experience.

quest_26411.Description: Ailred in Povus said, "Where the heck were you all this time?! No matter. How are your vexfish lettuce wraps? Fresh, I hope? I'll take that! And please make it snappy. I'm famished from waiting!"
quest_26411.MidwayText: Yes, I ordered the vexfish lettuce wraps? What's the hold up?
quest_26411.Name: Vexfish Lettuce Wraps
quest_26411.PrefaceText: Where the heck were you all this time?! No matter. How are your vexfish lettuce wraps? Fresh, I hope? I'll take that! And please make it snappy. I'm famished from waiting!
quest_26411.SuccessText: Well. These are quite good! I am a little embarrassed to admit that this is some of the best vexfish I've eaten! Wonderful!

quest_26412.Description:
Ailred in Povus said, "I'm terribly sorry if I offended you by seating myself. But you didn't have to keep me waiting so long! I guess you weren't open yet?

Well, let's put that behind us. I would like your maple carrots please. And not too sweet."
quest_26412.MidwayText: Can I have the maple carrots, please? I ordered them a while ago...
quest_26412.Name: Maple Carrots
quest_26412.PrefaceText:
I'm terribly sorry if I offended you by seating myself. But you didn't have to keep me waiting so long! I guess you weren't open yet?

Well, let's put that behind us. I would like your maple carrots please. And not too sweet.
quest_26412.SuccessText: Perfectly cooked carrots! My compliments to the chef.

quest_26501.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "All our supplies are gone, so I've had lots of trouble feeding Tryaka and myself. We're making due, but I really miss having an orange for breakfast each morning. And our gums are starting to bleed... I fear that's somehow related."
quest_26501.MidwayText: I wish oranges grew around here...
quest_26501.Name: A Crate of Oranges
quest_26501.PrefaceText: All our supplies are gone, so I've had lots of trouble feeding Tryaka and myself. We're making due, but I really miss having an orange for breakfast each morning. And our gums are starting to bleed... I fear that's somehow related.
quest_26501.SuccessText: Oranges! Thank you! They're like liquid sunshine on a cloudy day. And hopefully my gums will stop bleeding!

quest_26502.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "My stash of cooking herbs wasn't found by the orc invaders! But sadly I am now out of basil, and I need that for many of the meals I prepare. I can tell Tryaka is less happy with my cooking, but what can I do?!"
quest_26502.MidwayText: I wish I had fresh basil...
quest_26502.Name: Fresh Basil
quest_26502.PrefaceText: My stash of cooking herbs wasn't found by the orc invaders! But sadly I am now out of basil, and I need that for many of the meals I prepare. I can tell Tryaka is less happy with my cooking, but what can I do?!
quest_26502.SuccessText: Oh! Fresh basil! You found some!! Here. You are too kind!

quest_26503.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "My mate Tryaka used to love cantaloupe for breakfast. But we can't get it here anymore. Sigh..."
quest_26503.MidwayText: I wish I had some fresh cantaloupe...
quest_26503.Name: Cantaloupe for Breakfast
quest_26503.PrefaceText: My mate Tryaka used to love cantaloupe for breakfast. But we can't get it here anymore. Sigh...
quest_26503.SuccessText: You found fresh cantaloupe?! You're amazing!

quest_26504.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "I want to make my mate's favorite cheese for her, but it requires extremely pungent rennet. And, of course, I have nothing to make that with!"
quest_26504.MidwayText: If I had some pungent rennet, I could make my favorite cheese again!
quest_26504.Name: Pungent Rennet
quest_26504.PrefaceText: I want to make my mate's favorite cheese for her, but it requires extremely pungent rennet. And, of course, I have nothing to make that with!
quest_26504.SuccessText: This rennet stinks horrifically. I guess that's a compliment! You're amazing!

quest_26505.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "It'll soon be time for outdoor grilling again! And my grill was destroyed by orcs. But I can fix it! What I can't fix is the lack of fuel. How can I make perfect food without perfect fuel? It's impossible! I need spruce wood chips!"
quest_26505.MidwayText: I sure could use a huge pile of spruce wood chips.
quest_26505.Name: Spruce Wood Chips
quest_26505.PrefaceText: It'll soon be time for outdoor grilling again! And my grill was destroyed by orcs. But I can fix it! What I can't fix is the lack of fuel. How can I make perfect food without perfect fuel? It's impossible! I need spruce wood chips!
quest_26505.SuccessText: A bushel of wood chips, and I can smell their spruciness! You've made me very happy.

quest_26506.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "The orc invaders stole everything. Even our blankets! I've made a thin blanket from old rags, but as it gets colder, we'll need something warmer. If only sheep grew around here, I could get some wool!"
quest_26506.MidwayText: If I had a lot of wool, I could prepare for winter. Without blankets, we'll freeze!
quest_26506.Name: Wool!
quest_26506.PrefaceText: The orc invaders stole everything. Even our blankets! I've made a thin blanket from old rags, but as it gets colder, we'll need something warmer. If only sheep grew around here, I could get some wool!
quest_26506.SuccessText: So much wool! And so warm! You are a kind soul to part with this.

quest_26507.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "My mate is not doing well since the invasion. She used to make jewelry, and I'm hoping I can convince her to take up the trade again. It will make her happier. I just need some cinnabar!"
quest_26507.MidwayText: Tryaka used to make necklaces of cinnabar. If we still had some, perhaps she'd take up the trade again.
quest_26507.Name: Cinnabar for Jewelry
quest_26507.PrefaceText: My mate is not doing well since the invasion. She used to make jewelry, and I'm hoping I can convince her to take up the trade again. It will make her happier. I just need some cinnabar!
quest_26507.SuccessText: This cinnabar will make some excellent necklaces. Many thanks, my friend.

quest_26508.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "I wish I could help Tryaka recover from the invasion. She has seemed distant. Even... I don't dare say it to her face... a bit afraid. I need to bring her mind back to practical matters! If I had some agates, I could convince her to return to jewelrycrafting."
quest_26508.MidwayText: If I had some agates, I think I could convince Tryaka to making jewelry again. It would be a good distraction for her.
quest_26508.Name: Agates for Jewelry
quest_26508.PrefaceText: I wish I could help Tryaka recover from the invasion. She has seemed distant. Even... I don't dare say it to her face... a bit afraid. I need to bring her mind back to practical matters! If I had some agates, I could convince her to return to jewelrycrafting.
quest_26508.SuccessText: These agates are lovely. Did you mine these yourself? I hope that Tryaka likes them!

quest_26509.Description: Umarak in Povus said, "Tryaka's favorite snack was peaches. They always cheered her up! Pity they only grow far from here..."
quest_26509.MidwayText: I wish I had some peaches to give to Tryaka.
quest_26509.Name: Peaches, fresh ripe peaches
quest_26509.PrefaceText: Tryaka's favorite snack was peaches. They always cheered her up! Pity they only grow far from here...
quest_26509.SuccessText: How did you get peaches?! Thank you so much! Tryaka will love these!

quest_26601.Description: Gerrux in Povus has asked you to find his deceased sister's key, which she threw into the river before her death. He heard there's a ranalon who trades in river treasures who might be able to help.
quest_26601.Name: Kimeta's Key
quest_26601.PrefaceText: Like I said when you gave me that ghostly key... If you ever find my sister's real key, I could use it to open her precious-items box! I heard that somewhere out there is a ranalon who deals in river treasures. Maybe you can find this frog and beat the secret out of him!
quest_26601.SuccessText: You found it?! This is Kimeta's key! I can open the chest she left behind! Wait just a minute. [Gerrux opens a small chest and sighs.] Well, I'm glad to know what was inside. But it's just more of the weird gizmos she was making. And some technical notes. Here, you can have this junk, maybe it'll make more sense to you. Thanks for helping me figure out what was inside! Even though it's disappointing.

quest_26602.Description:
Gerrux in Povus said, "In my spare time I dabble in artistic weapon improvements, and I'm working on a dazzling khopesh. But I need more raw materials!

I'm not a smith, but if I had enough old broken blades, I could probably fulfill my artistic vision."
quest_26602.Name: Khopesh Parts
quest_26602.PrefaceText:
In my spare time I dabble in artistic weapon improvements, and I'm working on a dazzling khopesh. But I need more raw materials!
