I'm not a smith, but if I had enough old broken blades, I could probably fulfill my artistic vision.
quest_26602.SuccessText: Thank you for gathering these! I am honored by your thoughtfulness. Here: this is an earlier blade I worked on. I hope you like it.

quest_26603.Description: Gerrux in Povus said, "In my spare time I work to artistically enhance weapons, and I'm working on a hammer that needs a new wrap. I know just the material! Kuvou tongue! Can you get me some?"
quest_26603.Name: Better Hammer Wraps
quest_26603.PrefaceText: In my spare time I work to artistically enhance weapons, and I'm working on a hammer that needs a new wrap. I know just the material! Kuvou tongue! Can you get me some?
quest_26603.SuccessText:
Are these the kuvou tongues? Oh, by the four, that stinks... I didn't think my plan through very well. How do I tan these?!

No, no, you've already done enough. Let me repay you for your effort with another customized hammer.

quest_26604.Description: Gerrux in Povus said, "I like to refine weapons by giving them an artistic touch. I'm working on a combat beaker -- I haven't done one of these since my sister died! It seems I'm out of blue glass, though. Do you have any? Oh, I need a bit of pyrite too."
quest_26604.Name: Beautiful Beaker Bits
quest_26604.PrefaceText: I like to refine weapons by giving them an artistic touch. I'm working on a combat beaker -- I haven't done one of these since my sister died! It seems I'm out of blue glass, though. Do you have any? Oh, I need a bit of pyrite too.
quest_26604.SuccessText: Thank you! I'll have to melt the pyrite, but fortunately even a non-expert can do that. Well... I might ask for some help on that, too. Anyway, here is a gift for you in return. I made it years ago and it reminds me of my sister. Use it well.

quest_26605.Description: Gerrux in Povus said, "I'm working on artistically improving a dagger right now, but I need something very special: blue glass. But not any old blue glass. Only the glass from a pair of ratkin goggles will do! I also need several sets of hexapus teeth. I'm afraid this dagger will not be subtle."
quest_26605.Name: Prettier Knife Coatings
quest_26605.PrefaceText: I'm working on artistically improving a dagger right now, but I need something very special: blue glass. But not any old blue glass. Only the glass from a pair of ratkin goggles will do! I also need several sets of hexapus teeth. I'm afraid this dagger will not be subtle.
quest_26605.SuccessText: You found the goggles! Oh, I don't need those teeth anymore, I decided on a new direction. But I'll save them for some other project! Here: this is a knife I improved last year. I hope you fight well with it.

quest_26701.Description: Brugo in Povus said, "If I'm to quickly become a master of paleontology, I need a constant supply of bones to study! But I can't go collect the bones, since that would require me to stop studying. Perhaps you're for hire? I will pay you for 10 good old fossils."
quest_26701.Name: Bones For Inspection
quest_26701.PrefaceText: If I'm to quickly become a master of paleontology, I need a constant supply of bones to study! But I can't go collect the bones, since that would require me to stop studying. Perhaps you're for hire? I will pay you for 10 good old fossils.
quest_26701.SuccessText: You should have been more careful excavating these! If in doubt, leave some of the dirt behind. But these are still usable, so here: I understand this is your currency?

quest_26702.Description: Brugo in Povus said, "I still need more bones! I will pay you the same amount for another ten."
quest_26702.Name: More Bones For Inspection
quest_26702.PrefaceText: I still need more bones! I will pay you the same amount for another ten.
quest_26702.SuccessText: Nicely excavated. Here is your pay! Come back tomorrow, I'm sure I'll need more.

quest_26703.Description: Brugo in Povus said, "Perhaps a smoke-break would help me focus. The 'horta here is very mellow. Do you happen to have any? Oh, and I lost my pipe in a recent skirmish with a fish man. I need a new one!"
quest_26703.Name: Time For a Smoke Break
quest_26703.PrefaceText: Perhaps a smoke-break would help me focus. The 'horta here is very mellow. Do you happen to have any? Oh, and I lost my pipe in a recent skirmish with a fish man. I need a new one!
quest_26703.SuccessText: You are strangely obsequious to bring me a pipe full of gur-horta! But that concerns me not! Here: fair pay for your effort.

quest_26801.Description: Dachak in Povus said, "The ratkin used to be friendly. When I was younger, they would come into town and I'd sell 'em vegetables! But after the fall of Povus they attack on sight. I had to give up mining because of them. I wish somebody would teach 'em a lesson for me! Hint, hint."
quest_26801.Name: A Kick In The Whiskers
quest_26801.PrefaceText: The ratkin used to be friendly. When I was younger, they would come into town and I'd sell 'em vegetables! But after the fall of Povus they attack on sight. I had to give up mining because of them. I wish somebody would teach 'em a lesson for me! Hint, hint.
quest_26801.SuccessText: Well that's a few less treacherous ratkin to worry about! You're not so bad after all! Here.

quest_26802.Description: Dachak in Povus said, "See the giant mushrooms off in the distance? Yeah, those are new. Not even a year old, in fact, and whatever it means, it's definitely bad. But you look like the sort who will wander over there anyway. If you do, can you pick some false agaric for me? You can find false agaric all around Povus, so if you aren't brave, just look elsewhere."
quest_26802.Name: Fresh-Picked Death
quest_26802.PrefaceText: See the giant mushrooms off in the distance? Yeah, those are new. Not even a year old, in fact, and whatever it means, it's definitely bad. But you look like the sort who will wander over there anyway. If you do, can you pick some false agaric for me? You can find false agaric all around Povus, so if you aren't brave, just look elsewhere.
quest_26802.SuccessText: These are fresh and deadly! Perfect, thank you! I need these for my mushroom farming.

quest_26901.Description: Ferand Deftwhisper in Povus said, "If I'm going to run an armor shop again I'll need more grizlark, and Leah's kuvou are dead. But there's still feral kuvou! If you just let them spit on you and collect that into a bottle, I'll pay you."
quest_26901.Name: Only the Freshest Grizlark
quest_26901.PrefaceText: If I'm going to run an armor shop again I'll need more grizlark, and Leah's kuvou are dead. But there's still feral kuvou! If you just let them spit on you and collect that into a bottle, I'll pay you.
quest_26901.SuccessText: Smell that grizlark! Oh, I didn't explain what it's for. It's a trademark touch around here: we clean and etch armor with diluted grizlark. This will last me for a little while. Thanks.

quest_26902.Description: Ferand Deftwhisper in Povus said, "I'm using grizlark faster than I expected! Can you get me some more? I'll pay like before."
quest_26902.Name: More Grizlark!
quest_26902.PrefaceText: I'm using grizlark faster than I expected! Can you get me some more? I'll pay like before.
quest_26902.SuccessText: Thank you! This will keep me stocked up for a bit, but check back soon in case I need more.

quest_27.Description:
Velkort has told me the frequency for the giant red crystal. All I have to do is touch it while thinking the right word.

Once I'm past the crystal, I should try to figure out who's behind this and why.
quest_27.Name: Beneath the Red Crystal

Objectives.Description: Enter the cave beneath the crystal
Get to the bottom of this

quest_27001.Description: Grakelsput in Povus said, "When we reanimate a creature through Paleontology, we can't control it. Most of my associates are skilled at aggression deterrance, so there aren't too many accidents. But I have to admit the number of skeletal beasts in the area is becoming somewhat ... problematic. Hey, maybe you could clean some of them up for us? Start with the lanky ones. They're comparatively docile."
quest_27001.Name: Cleanup Duty: Gallimimuses
quest_27001.PrefaceText: When we reanimate a creature through Paleontology, we can't control it. Most of my associates are skilled at aggression deterrance, so there aren't too many accidents. But I have to admit the number of skeletal beasts in the area is becoming somewhat ... problematic. Hey, maybe you could clean some of them up for us? Start with the lanky ones. They're comparatively docile.
quest_27001.SuccessText: Good work! Here's some Councils. Sorry, I don't have any xogrite. I could pay you in xedrite, but wouldn't you rather have these shiny coins? Of course you would!

quest_27002.Description: Grakelsput in Povus said, "Do you think you can take out the pointy-faced dinosaurs? Those were called triceratops, and they lived a very long time ago. Try not to get knocked off a cliff!"
quest_27002.Name: Cleanup Duty: Triceratops
quest_27002.PrefaceText: Do you think you can take out the pointy-faced dinosaurs? Those were called triceratops, and they lived a very long time ago. Try not to get knocked off a cliff!
quest_27002.SuccessText: Excellent work. Come back later; I'm sure we'll need your services again.

quest_27003.Description: Grakelsput in Povus said, "Once, long ago, giant cats roamed Povus. But we've only managed to resurrect a few specimens! We're so early in our research of this creature that we don't even want to study their behavior yet: I just need bones to study! If you find giant cat bones, please bring them to me."
quest_27003.Name: Mysterious Cat Remains
quest_27003.PrefaceText: Once, long ago, giant cats roamed Povus. But we've only managed to resurrect a few specimens! We're so early in our research of this creature that we don't even want to study their behavior yet: I just need bones to study! If you find giant cat bones, please bring them to me.
quest_27003.SuccessText:
Where... How... Nevermind! These are priceless, thank you!

Wait, did I say priceless? I meant they're worth exactly 2500 Councils. But I'll give you double that because you're a friend.

quest_27101.Description: Leah Bowman in Povus said, "I used to walk the riverbank and collect old fishing nets. I use them for all sorts of crafts! But it's too dangerous to do that these days. If you find some nets, though, I'd like them! I can't pay much, but I'll pay a bit."
quest_27101.Name: Repurposing Old Fishing Nets
quest_27101.PrefaceText: I used to walk the riverbank and collect old fishing nets. I use them for all sorts of crafts! But it's too dangerous to do that these days. If you find some nets, though, I'd like them! I can't pay much, but I'll pay a bit.
quest_27101.SuccessText: Three big nets, still reeking of swamp water! Yep, that's what I needed! Here: I wish I could offer more.

quest_27102.Description: Leah Bowman in Povus said, "I don't get much work in animal husbandry any more, but I got an order from an old customer, and I would love to fill it! But what he needs is an aphrodesiac for his pet bees! Of all the weird pets, bees are way up there. I do know how to make what he needs... I just need some high-quality tallow. Could I ask you to render some for me?"
quest_27102.Name: Fresh Tallow For The Bees
quest_27102.PrefaceText: I don't get much work in animal husbandry any more, but I got an order from an old customer, and I would love to fill it! But what he needs is an aphrodesiac for his pet bees! Of all the weird pets, bees are way up there. I do know how to make what he needs... I just need some high-quality tallow. Could I ask you to render some for me?
quest_27102.SuccessText: Thank you so much! I'm so happy I can fulfill Elwynel's order. If you see him in Statehelm, ask about his bees!

quest_27103.Description:
Leah Bowman in Povus said, "Mom always told me to forgive and forget my father. But I don't think she ever really did. And I sure as hell haven't! It gnaws at me, even now.

I guess it's my orcish side, but I just think I'd be so much happier if he were dead!"
quest_27103.Name: Brukal Must Die
quest_27103.PrefaceText:
Mom always told me to forgive and forget my father. But I don't think she ever really did. And I sure as hell haven't! It gnaws at me, even now.

I guess it's my orcish side, but I just think I'd be so much happier if he were dead!
quest_27103.SuccessText: He's dead? For real? You killed him for me? I... I don't know what to say. Here. [Leah turns away to hide a tear.]

quest_27104.Description:
Leah Bowman in Povus said, "Thank you for killing Brukal for me. I... I want our relationship to be honest, so let me tell you bluntly: that was a little out of line. I wanted him dead, but I didn't mean you should just... and the worst part is that It's made me feel nervous to be around you! But I do thank you. I know you did it out of kindness for a friend.

I've decided to set up a little monument to my parents -- both of them -- outside of town. Could you gather some flowers for me? Poppies were always mom's favorite. Mine too."
quest_27104.Name: In Memoriam
quest_27104.PrefaceText:
Thank you for killing Brukal for me. I... I want our relationship to be honest, so let me tell you bluntly: that was a little out of line. I wanted him dead, but I didn't mean you should just... and the worst part is that It's made me feel nervous to be around you! But I do thank you. I know you did it out of kindness for a friend.

I've decided to set up a little monument to my parents -- both of them -- outside of town. Could you gather some flowers for me? Poppies were always mom's favorite. Mine too.
quest_27104.SuccessText:
Thank you, these are lovely.

I was thinking about what you did, killing someone just to make me feel better. Is that... look, are you in love with me? That's what it seems like. And I'm flattered, but I don't know how I feel about that.

Right now I'm mourning. But I'll think of you when I place these flowers on mother's stone.

quest_27201.Description: Mope in Povus said, "You wish to aid me? Then exterminate the ratkin root-tenders that constantly try to unearth my fungus!"
quest_27201.Name: Tending To the Root-Tenders
quest_27201.PrefaceText: You wish to aid me? Then exterminate the ratkin root-tenders that constantly try to unearth my fungus!
quest_27201.SuccessText: I acknowledge your deeds, but still the ratkin attack! You have merely stunted their progress. But your efforts are noble nonetheless. Should you have the stomach to continue killing them, I would be grateful.

quest_27202.Description: Mope in Povus said, "If you were to exterminate more ratkin root-tenders, I would be in your debt."
quest_27202.Name: Tending To the Root-Tenders
quest_27202.PrefaceText: If you were to exterminate more ratkin root-tenders, I would be in your debt.
quest_27202.SuccessText: You have frightened off the ratkin for today, but they will return soon! Please rest and recover your health now, for you may be needed again.

quest_27203.Description: Mope in Povus said, "I need new types of fungus to improve my fungal forest. These species do not grow natively here, so I must ask for assistance."
quest_27203.Name: Exotic Varieties of Fungus
quest_27203.PrefaceText: I need new types of fungus to improve my fungal forest. These species do not grow natively here, so I must ask for assistance.
quest_27203.SuccessText: Your specimens are acceptable, and my gratitude is significant.

quest_27204.Description: Mope in Povus said, "Six days prior, a band of fortified orcs attempted to cross my fungal fields and chop down my tall mushrooms. They were killed and their bodies are now fertilizer. Yet I fear retaliation, for orcs are not prone to abandoning their schemes. It would be prudent to remove that threat immediately."
quest_27204.Name: Counter-Exterminate the Orcs
quest_27204.PrefaceText: Six days prior, a band of fortified orcs attempted to cross my fungal fields and chop down my tall mushrooms. They were killed and their bodies are now fertilizer. Yet I fear retaliation, for orcs are not prone to abandoning their schemes. It would be prudent to remove that threat immediately.
quest_27204.SuccessText: Your deeds are noble. Remember that fungus helps enliven the land! So you are saving your homeland, too, in a way.

quest_27205.Description: Mope in Povus said, "Some of my fly amanita has spread beyond my locus of control. They are mine and I desire to have them."
quest_27205.Name: Recover Lost Fly Amanita
quest_27205.PrefaceText: Some of my fly amanita has spread beyond my locus of control. They are mine and I desire to have them.
quest_27205.SuccessText: These are not my lost fly amanita! But they will be useful nonetheless.

quest_27301.Description:
Tremmond Blackhammer in Povus said, "I'm making some armor as a gift for my niece Stephie. It's a new neck-guard for the suit I made her.

I need some parts, and I can't ask Stephie to get them for me or she'd know my plan. Can you do it? I'll give you some xogrite."
quest_27301.Name: Stephie's Gorget
quest_27301.PrefaceText:
I'm making some armor as a gift for my niece Stephie. It's a new neck-guard for the suit I made her.

I need some parts, and I can't ask Stephie to get them for me or she'd know my plan. Can you do it? I'll give you some xogrite.
quest_27301.SuccessText: Hmm, these agates are shit. But they'll do, they'll do. I'm in a hurry. Here's your pay. And if it seems paltry, remember my gratitude is part of your payment!

quest_27302.Description:
Tremmond Blackhammer in Povus said, "I'm no gadgeteer or trinket-smith, but I was thinking about building a simple automated holder-arm. Nothin' fancy, just something a little smarter than a C-clamp!

I don't want to ask Stephie for the parts, though, because that would go on our ledger. This isn't business, it's just an old dwarf messin' around! ... Say, maybe you could help me out? Here's some of the stuff I need. There's more, but this is the hard stuff."
quest_27302.Name: Parts For An Auto-Clamp
quest_27302.PrefaceText:
I'm no gadgeteer or trinket-smith, but I was thinking about building a simple automated holder-arm. Nothin' fancy, just something a little smarter than a C-clamp!

I don't want to ask Stephie for the parts, though, because that would go on our ledger. This isn't business, it's just an old dwarf messin' around! ... Say, maybe you could help me out? Here's some of the stuff I need. There's more, but this is the hard stuff.
quest_27302.SuccessText:
So I see you've delivered an N core, still chargable; a size 4 golem claw, used; and what about the... oh, there it is, the programmable counterweight! You've done well. Here is your payment.

I could use help with one other bit of this little project, though. Whenever you next have time to do me a favor.

quest_27303.Description: Tremmond Blackhammer in Povus said, "I have the parts I need for my auto-clamp, but... Well, it's been a few decades since I made anything like this. I'm trying to remember how it's done. I think I just need a T crystal, which I have on-hand... But what if I actually need an L crystal? In that case, we're looking at a pretty dangerous explosion when I plug in the wrong part. I'm not really prepared for that sort of chemical fire here, because... oh, nevermind, trying to explain myself to you is worse than talkin' to a child. Here's what I need: a nice fae blanket. Like the fairies in Statehelm sell sometimes. Or just make one. You know how to make one, right? You just sew up the edges of some fae silk. Simple as that!"
quest_27303.Name: Auto-Clamp Safety Blanket
quest_27303.PrefaceText: I have the parts I need for my auto-clamp, but... Well, it's been a few decades since I made anything like this. I'm trying to remember how it's done. I think I just need a T crystal, which I have on-hand... But what if I actually need an L crystal? In that case, we're looking at a pretty dangerous explosion when I plug in the wrong part. I'm not really prepared for that sort of chemical fire here, because... oh, nevermind, trying to explain myself to you is worse than talkin' to a child. Here's what I need: a nice fae blanket. Like the fairies in Statehelm sell sometimes. Or just make one. You know how to make one, right? You just sew up the edges of some fae silk. Simple as that!
quest_27303.SuccessText: Is this the first fae silk blanket you ever made? Hah! I don't care, it's just to smother a fire. You did good.

quest_27304.Description:
Tremmond Blackhammer in Povus said, "The orcs have special armor techniques that even I don't know... and I deserve to know them!

That greenskin girl can forge. I've seen her making parts for her cages: she handles a hammer like a pro. So why won't she tell me how to make orcish armor?!

Why don't you try? See if she'll tell you anything."
quest_27304.MidwayText:
Did Tremmond put you up to this? That ass!

Yes, I know how to shoe horses and make rivets and lattices and other basic items. I even know how to bard a horse. But I learned everything by apprenticing with Yenshi the Animal Guru, right here in Povus... not from orcs! And the only reason I have to touch a forge at all is because Tremmond and his cronies are too stuck up to work on animals!

I despise my father and I would never willingly communicate with him. Now go away, because you're pissing me off!
quest_27304.Name: Secrets of Orcish Armor (part 1)
quest_27304.PrefaceText:
The orcs have special armor techniques that even I don't know... and I deserve to know them!

That greenskin girl can forge. I've seen her making parts for her cages: she handles a hammer like a pro. So why won't she tell me how to make orcish armor?!

Why don't you try? See if she'll tell you anything.
quest_27304.SuccessText: Bah! I know the rakkies love her, but who can trust a half-human? She wants us to believe it was a coincidence that she survived the orc attack? The one perpetrated by her own father?! And now we're supposed to believe she has NO contact with him? Lies! Hmm. Well, I have another approach. How's your Orcish? [Another favor will be available if/when you have level 25 in Orcish.]

quest_27305.Description: Tremmond Blackhammer in Povus said, "Back when Povus was growing, we had good relations with certain individual orcs. There is one orc who might help me learn the secrets of orcish armorsmithing: Brugo. He calls himself Brugo The Wise. I understand he's still in the area, although not in the orc camp. See if you can find him. See if he'll teach his secrets."
quest_27305.MidwayText:
You want to learn to make orcish armor? Hahaha! Wait, you seriously expect me to teach you an orcish secret? I'm no traitor! Tell Tremmond to fuck off.

Although... Our armor isn't "orcish". It's Tast's armor. As in the god of war. If you want to know how to make it, just ask one of his avatars! It's easy: just go to a forge consecrated to Tast, and say "Gurkah, Tast!" Every orcish blacksmith learns this way.
quest_27305.Name: Secrets of Orcish Armor (part 2)
quest_27305.PrefaceText: Back when Povus was growing, we had good relations with certain individual orcs. There is one orc who might help me learn the secrets of orcish armorsmithing: Brugo. He calls himself Brugo The Wise. I understand he's still in the area, although not in the orc camp. See if you can find him. See if he'll teach his secrets.
quest_27305.SuccessText:
He said what? "Gurkah, Tast" would translate to... "Tast, fight me." Hah! Fuck that!

I'd assume Brugo was lying, but I never knew him to lie. I guess that's a dead-end, though. I'm not gonna go challenge a god to a fight! Although... he said every orcish blacksmith learns that way. So the fight couldn't be THAT bad, right? Haha, I'm kidding! I'm too old for that sort of shit. But my thanks for the information.

quest_27401.Description: An avatar of Tast in Povus said, Since you are no ordinary warsmith, you deserve a challenge worthy of you! Slay 100 sentient creatures in the name of war. Then I shall teach you the secrets you seek."
quest_27401.Name: No Ordinary Blacksmith's Challenge

Objectives.Description: Talk to Tast, God of War

quest_27401.PrefaceText: Since you are no ordinary warsmith, you deserve a challenge worthy of you! Slay 100 sentient creatures in the name of war. Then I shall teach you the secrets you seek.
quest_27401.SuccessText: You are cruel and deadly. Make sure that your armor is, as well.

quest_27402.Description: An avatar of Tast in Povus said, You would seek even greater knowledge? Then show your worth. I demand an even greater offering of blood!"
quest_27402.Name: Forging Armor from Blood

Objectives.Description: Talk to Tast, God of War

quest_27402.PrefaceText: You would seek even greater knowledge? Then show your worth. I demand an even greater offering of blood!
quest_27402.SuccessText: Yes! Perhaps you are fit to become my scion! Perhaps.

quest_27403.Description: An avatar of Tast in Povus said, Kill in my name and you shall have the knowledge that you seek: schematics for armor that is strong enough even for you!"
quest_27403.Name: Hammer Steel, Hammer Brain

Objectives.Description: Talk to Tast, God of War

quest_27403.PrefaceText: Kill in my name and you shall have the knowledge that you seek: schematics for armor that is strong enough even for you!
quest_27403.SuccessText: Your prowess in battle is great, but watch that it does not eclipse your armorsmithing.

quest_27404.Description: An avatar of Tast in Povus said, You have slain so many foes that one might easily mistake you for an army. You are worthy, of that much I am certain. Make an offering to me."
quest_27404.Name: Way of the Warsmith

Objectives.Description: Talk to Tast, God of War

quest_27404.PrefaceText: You have slain so many foes that one might easily mistake you for an army. You are worthy, of that much I am certain. Make an offering to me.
quest_27404.SuccessText: I bequeath to you the title of Warsmith. Among orcs, few reach this height. And yet I suspect you have even greater feats ahead. I shall be watching.

quest_27405.Description:
An avatar of Tast in Povus said, I can teach you to craft wolf armor of astounding quality, blessed by my consort Norala. For while her wolves are strong, her smiths are weak! And weakness is not tolerated long in war. You will aid them to be war-worthy.

But Norala's boon requires the death of the largest, most horrific creatures. No ordinary orc or human shall do!"
quest_27405.Name: Norala's Armor

Objectives.Description: Talk to Tast, God of War

quest_27405.PrefaceText:
I can teach you to craft wolf armor of astounding quality, blessed by my consort Norala. For while her wolves are strong, her smiths are weak! And weakness is not tolerated long in war. You will aid them to be war-worthy.

But Norala's boon requires the death of the largest, most horrific creatures. No ordinary orc or human shall do!
quest_27405.SuccessText: Norala blesses you thus. And both of us shall be watching you.

quest_27501.Description: Dog Ear in Povus said, "Could you tell your Warden friends about me? I've been keeping a log of dangers in the area, but I can't really act on them alone. Maybe we could team up! Or something. Just tell the head of your Warden enclave about me. I'm here and ready to help however I can!"
quest_27501.MidwayText: You found a lost Warden from the Povus region? That's good news. I thought they died out years ago! Well, tell your new friend to report here for debriefing, and we'll get him relocated to somewhere that really needs a Warden!
quest_27501.Name: Povus Chapter, Reporting In

Objectives.Description: Speak with Milton about Dog Ear

quest_27501.PrefaceText: Could you tell your Warden friends about me? I've been keeping a log of dangers in the area, but I can't really act on them alone. Maybe we could team up! Or something. Just tell the head of your Warden enclave about me. I'm here and ready to help however I can!
quest_27501.SuccessText: Thank you for telling your Warden friends about me, but if their plan is to relocate me out of Povus, I'm not interested. This is the land I've sworn to defend! But I guess I'll go and explain this to your sheep friend myself. You've done enough for me!

quest_27502.Description: Dog Ear in Povus said, "Since you're a Warden, maybe you can help me fix an imbalance. Ever since the rakshasa fishermen stopped coming to the river, the squid-beasts are getting out of control. They're even climbing out onto land now. They attack anything that comes near! It's making it hard for animals to get water. Can you remove some of the squids?"
quest_27502.Name: Squid-Beasts In the River
quest_27502.PrefaceText: Since you're a Warden, maybe you can help me fix an imbalance. Ever since the rakshasa fishermen stopped coming to the river, the squid-beasts are getting out of control. They're even climbing out onto land now. They attack anything that comes near! It's making it hard for animals to get water. Can you remove some of the squids?
quest_27502.SuccessText: I appreciate the help with the squid beasts! Now maybe I can catch a fish in peace!

quest_27601.Description:
Cleo Conyer in Serbule Hills said, "When the ranalon ran my cart off the road, I just fled in a panic. I should have grabbed my papers! I'm kicking myself for leaving them behind. Those books are key to my business!

I'm sure the ranalon have stolen all the valuable stuff from my cart, but the books don't look valuable. Could you go look for them?

Follow the road south until you reach a crossroads, then head east into Ranalon territory. The road will go along a strip of land separating two lakes. My cart was run off the road right near there! It rolled down toward the southern lake. It didn't go into the water, though, so maybe my papers are still intact! You've gotta check. Please?"
quest_27601.Name: Cleo's Lost Books
quest_27601.PrefaceText:
When the ranalon ran my cart off the road, I just fled in a panic. I should have grabbed my papers! I'm kicking myself for leaving them behind. Those books are key to my business!

I'm sure the ranalon have stolen all the valuable stuff from my cart, but the books don't look valuable. Could you go look for them?

Follow the road south until you reach a crossroads, then head east into Ranalon territory. The road will go along a strip of land separating two lakes. My cart was run off the road right near there! It rolled down toward the southern lake. It didn't go into the water, though, so maybe my papers are still intact! You've gotta check. Please?
quest_27601.SuccessText: You found them! Oh, no, they got wet... Well, still, better than nothing, right? I'll start blotting each page dry. I bet I can salvage most of it! Thank you so much! In exchange, let me teach you some useful goblinese words and phrases. Goblins may not seem like they're better than the frog-people, but they are. Goblins honor trade agreements! So here's what you say if you meet a goblin trader. [You receive a short language lesson from Cleo.]

quest_27701.Description:
Trasen in Serbule Hills said, "We don't have many ranalon in Verta so I've been very interested to learn more about the ones that live here! Unfortunately they aren't friendly.

I've noticed many of them carry bits of glass around and I can't imagine why. Could you find me some samples? The pretty violet ones."
quest_27701.Name: Why Violet Glass?
quest_27701.PrefaceText:
We don't have many ranalon in Verta so I've been very interested to learn more about the ones that live here! Unfortunately they aren't friendly.

I've noticed many of them carry bits of glass around and I can't imagine why. Could you find me some samples? The pretty violet ones.
quest_27701.SuccessText: These are lovely! But ... [Trasen studies the glass] these are just ordinary worthless glass. Why do they carry these around?! How strange. Oh, I should pay you for your service! I don't have much of the local coin, but here: this powder is prized among weather witches.

quest_27702.Description: Trasen in Serbule Hills said, "There are several types of ranalon around here. The large ones with the dangling orb on their heads are my favorite. I would love to see how their glow balls work. Well, if you happen to find any, please show them to me!"
quest_27702.Name: Guardian Lures
quest_27702.PrefaceText: There are several types of ranalon around here. The large ones with the dangling orb on their heads are my favorite. I would love to see how their glow balls work. Well, if you happen to find any, please show them to me!
quest_27702.SuccessText: Uh, are these fresh? I didn't mean you should go out and kill... Wait... [Trasen studies the lures] These are very unusual indeed. I need to examine these more closely. Here: these powders should be fair trade.

quest_27703.Description:
Trasen in Serbule Hills said, "If you listen very carefully, you might hear the friendly tornadoes around here making an oscillating noise approximately five notes higher than normal. They're obviously in significant distress!

I think it's those ghastly exploding sheep. If an explosion gets sucked up into a tornado, that can really upset it. Could you clear the area of those fiery abominations?"
quest_27703.Name: Scary Sheep
quest_27703.PrefaceText:
If you listen very carefully, you might hear the friendly tornadoes around here making an oscillating noise approximately five notes higher than normal. They're obviously in significant distress!

I think it's those ghastly exploding sheep. If an explosion gets sucked up into a tornado, that can really upset it. Could you clear the area of those fiery abominations?
quest_27703.SuccessText: Thank you. It will probably take a bit before the tornadoes calm down, but I'm sure they'll be a bit calmer now. Here, this is for your trouble.

quest_27704.Description:
Trasen in Serbule Hills said, "It wasn't the sheep upsetting our tornado friends. It's the tigers! Tigers can't hurt tornadoes, but our tornadoes are juveniles and don't really understand that.

The whirlwinds say there's a huge tiger on the hill east of here, near the lookout tower. They call her Windbiter because she viciously attacks them! Completely harmlessly, of course, but it's still not polite. Can you get rid of this big cat and her entourage?"
quest_27704.Name: Windbiter!
quest_27704.PrefaceText:
It wasn't the sheep upsetting our tornado friends. It's the tigers! Tigers can't hurt tornadoes, but our tornadoes are juveniles and don't really understand that.

The whirlwinds say there's a huge tiger on the hill east of here, near the lookout tower. They call her Windbiter because she viciously attacks them! Completely harmlessly, of course, but it's still not polite. Can you get rid of this big cat and her entourage?
quest_27704.SuccessText: Finally! The whirlwinds are quieting down a little bit. Thank you!

quest_27801.Description:
Merriana in Serbule Hills said, "You want to help? Hmph. Very well: perhaps you know this area better than we do.

Some time ago we heard there was a group of bandits with something I want. These bandits live in a cave somewhere here in Serbule Hills. They called it the 'spider cave'.

I have pre-paid for the device, but if the bandits make you pay more, get a receipt and I will reimburse you in precious reagents."
quest_27801.Name: Merriana's Strange Request
quest_27801.PrefaceText:
You want to help? Hmph. Very well: perhaps you know this area better than we do.

Some time ago we heard there was a group of bandits with something I want. These bandits live in a cave somewhere here in Serbule Hills. They called it the 'spider cave'.

I have pre-paid for the device, but if the bandits make you pay more, get a receipt and I will reimburse you in precious reagents.
quest_27801.SuccessText:
This orb is cracked! Wait. This is a fake! A cracked fake! How much did you pay for this?!

Oh. The bandits are dead? Well, I suppose that's what comes of bandits. No great loss, I can assure you! Here: I don't want you to become hostile, so let me reward you for your meager effort.

quest_27802.Description:
Merriana in Serbule Hills said, "The orb you found for me was a fake, but I know it's somewhere in Serbule Hills! I must find it.

The vortices have overheard the ranalon speak of a seer or wise-person called a 'doctrine keeper' -- if the ranalon have my orb, I bet their seer would have it.

I understand they live under the water or somesuch thing. Finding it would be worthwhile."
quest_27802.Name: Merriana's Second Request

Objectives.Description: Obtain Crystal Ball From a Ranalon Doctrine Keeper

quest_27802.PrefaceText:
The orb you found for me was a fake, but I know it's somewhere in Serbule Hills! I must find it.

The vortices have overheard the ranalon speak of a seer or wise-person called a 'doctrine keeper' -- if the ranalon have my orb, I bet their seer would have it.

I understand they live under the water or somesuch thing. Finding it would be worthwhile.
quest_27802.SuccessText:
You got this from a ranalon 'doctrine keeper'? This is not the orb I need. Moreover, this is not even a magic orb. It's some stupid cultural artifact. Augh! Where is it?!

Yes, yes. You are right: I sent you on an errand that I knew might be impossible. I owe you a reward for your 'work'. Sigh.

quest_27803.Description: Merriana in Serbule Hills said, "I have expanded my search and have come into stone-contact with a human engineer near here who claims to know what I need. However, he won't tell me over the aether. Please locate this man and retrieve his letter. He is to be found "In the Serbule Sewers." His name is Arif."
quest_27803.MidwayText:
Aww! Merriana sent you?! No offense to you. I just wanted to meet this chick. Did you know she was the head of the weather witches in Dwyndarre? She was the Grand Stormmaster.

Well, I've written down what I know. Take this to her, and put in a good word for me, okay?
quest_27803.Name: The Sewer Man

Objectives.Description: Talk to Sir Arif in Serbule Sewer

quest_27803.PrefaceText: I have expanded my search and have come into stone-contact with a human engineer near here who claims to know what I need. However, he won't tell me over the aether. Please locate this man and retrieve his letter. He is to be found "In the Serbule Sewers." His name is Arif.
quest_27803.SuccessText:
Thank you for your couirier services.

Hmm. This is intriguing. I may have more work for you, but I need to do some research first.

quest_27804.Description:
Merriana in Serbule Hills said, "My new ally, the human Arif, has given me two excellent leads on where to find the sphere. I know you have questions about this sphere, but I dare not speak of it. Simply find it and return it to me!

It should be quite simple to find. Arif says that he discovered a tunnel underneath a giant stone hand. Inside were letters and notes, which he left untouched. In a box, he said there was a magical crystal.

Go! I shall reward you for it!"
quest_27804.Name: Under The Hand Is An Orb
quest_27804.PrefaceText:
My new ally, the human Arif, has given me two excellent leads on where to find the sphere. I know you have questions about this sphere, but I dare not speak of it. Simply find it and return it to me!

It should be quite simple to find. Arif says that he discovered a tunnel underneath a giant stone hand. Inside were letters and notes, which he left untouched. In a box, he said there was a magical crystal.

Go! I shall reward you for it!
quest_27804.SuccessText: Well, this orb is definitely intended to be a Naturesphere! The runes are right. But it's just a frost orb, it doesn't... Hmm. [Merriana studies the orb.] Whoever made this didn't fully know how to make a Naturesphere -- but they've figured out the first part! We must not let a Naturesphere fall into the wrong hands. The wizard who made this is going to be a problem. But first I have another lead from Arif, when you're ready. He claims a fully-working Naturesphere can be found near Serbule.

quest_27805.Description:
Merriana in Serbule Hills said, "Somewhere north of here, nearish Serbule Keep, is a massive door. This traditional showy dwarf door leads to the long-dead city of Borghild. No dwarves live there, but it's infested with undead.

You will ... How do I put this politely? You are quite formidable, but you would be wise to bring some allies with you into Borghild. It is full of traps.

Do this for me and I shall bequeath upon you one of my grandest weather wands."
quest_27805.Name: The Borghild Lead
quest_27805.PrefaceText:
Somewhere north of here, nearish Serbule Keep, is a massive door. This traditional showy dwarf door leads to the long-dead city of Borghild. No dwarves live there, but it's infested with undead.

You will ... How do I put this politely? You are quite formidable, but you would be wise to bring some allies with you into Borghild. It is full of traps.

Do this for me and I shall bequeath upon you one of my grandest weather wands.
quest_27805.SuccessText:
I am impressed with your effort! Less so with the results, for while this was perhaps once a Naturesphere, it is now inert. I wonder what its story was. Typically when a Naturesphere is used, it becomes part of the area's history, for it always leads to terrible cataclysms. Perhaps that is why there are no more dwarves in Borghild... or perhaps this was something else entirely.

I am somewhat satisfied that no active Naturesphere is lying around in a cave near here. You have helped put my mind at ease, and for that I grant you this. It is quite dangerous. Maybe don't use it at first... wait until your skill increases a bit.

quest_27901.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you came across a weird magical globe that seemed to be missing some parts.
quest_27901.Name: Broken Globe Thing
quest_27901.PrefaceText: This magical globe seems to be missing something. It responds to your touch, but doesn't seem to do anything useful. Perhaps if you had the missing parts.
quest_27901.SuccessText: You are relieved to see that the globe pieces magically snap into place, revealing a console inside!

quest_27902.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you came across a wizard's stargazing apparatus. The view was too muddled to make out, though, due to damaged lenses.
quest_27902.Name: Stargazer Alignment
quest_27902.PrefaceText: Looking through the viewer, you think you see a figure waving and trying to get your attention. Unfortunately, it's too fuzzy to make out -- the lenses on the stargazer have been scratched badly.
quest_27902.SuccessText: You swap out the stargazer's lenses like an old pro. Now you should be able to get a better view.

quest_27903.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you found a ship in a bottle. The bottle was locked, suggesting that there was some reason one might unlock it.
quest_27903.Name: Locked Bottled Ship
quest_27903.PrefaceText: The bottle is surprisingly heavy -- you can't even lift it! You notice a keyhole in the cork, which makes no sense at all, but it is there nonetheless. You are unable to pry the cork out -- apparently you need a key.
quest_27903.SuccessText: You unlock the cork, and pop it out...

quest_27904.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you found a giant lute-like instrument with missing enchanted strings. Looks like it'd need some pretty big ones.
quest_27904.Name: Stringless Lute
quest_27904.PrefaceText: You can feel a surge of energy when you touch the instrument -- a clear sign of magical intent. The instrument makes a pitiful note and then is silent. It seems to be missing most of its strings! Enchanted strings of that length won't come cheap; perhaps there are some around here.
quest_27904.SuccessText: You expertly restring the giant lute. As you finish up, you spot a huge pile of Councils hidden in the bottom of the instrument. That's going to affect the sound quality negatively, so you clean it out.

quest_27905.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you found a sculpture that reminded you of a play area for dwarven children. It was missing a large piece, though.
quest_27905.Name: Broken Playset
quest_27905.PrefaceText: This reminds you of a playset that dwarven youth use when playing their "tactical war games". A large piece has been torn off.
quest_27905.SuccessText: As you reattach the skull to the playset, a key falls out of the skull!

quest_27906.Description: In a cave deep beneath Povus, you found a weird stuffed rabbit toy which talked to you. When you moved some dice, it seemed happy and gave you a temporary buff. It mentioned some siblings... perhaps making all the siblings happy would be a kind thing to do.
quest_27906.Name: Dice Bunnies
quest_27906.SuccessText: After helping all three toy rabbits, you find yourself holding a bag of gems and a key. "We stole these to pay our gambling debts. We're sorry!" says a voice in your head. Then it's gone.

quest_27907.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you met a ghostly orc that ranted about accidentally killing his friends with an explosive device. He swears the device was supposed to be fake!
quest_27907.MidwayText: I swear upon Tast's mighty throbbing cock that the bombs were fake! This can't have been my fault!
quest_27907.Name: Fake Bombs
quest_27907.PrefaceText:
I was guarding the switch when it happened. I wasn't even there!

I know what she said. I know! But those weren't REAL! It was a prank! I took it from a goblin. It only looked like... what? No, just to scare Frek and Jule! They were my... no, that's not true!

They had to be fake...
quest_27907.SuccessText:
See? See! They ARE prank bombs! I didn't kill them! It was those bastard Snowbloods!

Wait. There are my friends! Can you see them? You can see them too, right?

quest_27908.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you came upon a chest that had been kicked in, leaving it unopenable. But you believe that with a large spoon, you could pry the chest open.
quest_27908.MidwayText: This chest isn't locked, but it's jammed shut. If you had a spoon of some sort, you could pop it open.
quest_27908.Name: Jammed Chest
quest_27908.PrefaceText: Someone has tried to open this chest by kicking it in. It's now unopenable. But it seems like you could pop it open if you had just the right leverage. A large-ish spoon should do the trick.
quest_27908.SuccessText: You pop the chest open to reveal the contents.

quest_27909.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you came upon a terrifying horde of aktaari seemingly bent on overtaking the continent! You only have a few minutes to find and destroy the Royal Eggs. Cheb has promised to give you a reward every time you kill three aktaari and squish three eggs.
quest_27909.Name: Stop the Aktaari! (Repeating)
quest_27909.SuccessText: You received a reward for your hard work in fighting back the aktaari threat.

quest_27910.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you found a strange device that seemed like it could be activated if some grickling eyeballs were inserted into it. What do you have to lose?
quest_27910.MidwayText: It's still out of power. If you plopped some disgusting grickling eyes in, it should activate.
quest_27910.Name: Insert Grickling Eyes
quest_27910.PrefaceText: When you touch this cold device, you see a flurry of confusing visual images. After thinking for a moment, you believe it is out of fuel. It showed many types of fuel that could be used, but the only fuel you recognized was the last one: the glowing eyes of gricklings. Apparently you could just stick them into this hollow here...
quest_27910.SuccessText: You plop the eyeballs in, and it hums to life! It should stay powered up for a few days. Now it seems like you just stick your hand in...

quest_27911.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you found a strange device that seemed like it could be activated if some osslar spikes were inserted into it. What do you have to lose?
quest_27911.MidwayText: It's still out of power. If you plopped some glowing osslar spikes in, it should activate.
quest_27911.Name: Insert Osslar Spikes
quest_27911.PrefaceText: When you touch this cold device, you see a flurry of confusing visual images. After thinking for a moment, you believe it is out of fuel. It showed many types of fuel that could be used, but most of them aren't recognizable. One of the last images seems less weird than the others, though: a glowy spike, taken from a creature. Apparently you could just stick several of them into this hollow spot...
quest_27911.SuccessText: You plop the spikes in, and it hums to life! It should stay powered up for a few days. Now it seems like you just stick your hand in...

quest_27912.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you found a strange device that seemed like it could be activated if some rubies were inserted into it. What do you have to lose? Besides some rubies?
quest_27912.MidwayText: It's still out of power. If you dropped in some rubies, it should activate.
quest_27912.Name: Insert Rubies
quest_27912.PrefaceText: When you touch this cold device, you see a flurry of confusing visual images. After thinking for a moment, you believe it is out of fuel. It showed many types of fuel that could be used, but most of them aren't recognizable. One of the last images is clearer: it's a pile of rubies. Apparently you can insert rubies into this thing. But there aren't likely to be rubies in this cave...
quest_27912.SuccessText: You drop the rubies in, and it hums to life! It should stay powered up for a few days. Now it seems like you just stick your hand in...

quest_27914.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you met a Forthragarian who told you not to go too far into the caves beyond him. But if you do go in, he asked you to look for a Spike of Autonomy.
quest_27914.Name: Spike of Autonomy
quest_27914.SuccessText:
This is it! The Spike of Autonomy! This is a toy I invented in my youth. It was lost long ago. How could it be here? This is surely a recreation, but it so perfectly matches my memory.

Thank you.

quest_27915.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you came upon a strange door that could only be opened if you find all the "lost penguins." Presumably they are near the door?
quest_27915.Name: Lost Penguins
quest_27915.PrefaceText: The door doesn't budge. A cloying voice says, "Where are my penguins?! I won't go anywhere without ALL of my penguins!"
quest_27915.SuccessText: The door exudes a satisfied air. "My penguins! You saved them!"

quest_27916.Description: In a pseudo-pocket dimension beneath Povus, you met a fairy named Rixie who asked you to collect some rings.
quest_27916.Name: Rixie's Ring Challenge
quest_27916.PrefaceText: Well, there is one thing I could use your help with. James keeps bragging about his dumb ring game, and how nobody could catch 6 of them in under a minute. Which is obviously untrue because I myself have done it! But he says that's because I created this dimension so I have special powers here. Why don't you collect six in under a minute? Ready, set, go!
quest_27916.SuccessText: You hear Rixie shout, "See, James? I told you it was easy! Now let's try a REAL challenge! Come on back and we'll try afresh."

quest_27917.Description: In a pseudo-pocket dimension beneath Povus, you met a fairy named Rixie who asked you to collect some rings.
quest_27917.Name: Rixie's Ring Challenge 2
quest_27917.PrefaceText: You did great showing James how easy his course is. But now I'm curious if we can make the course harder just by increasing the numbers. Can you catch 12 rings in under 60 seconds? That'd be a little bit impressive.
quest_27917.SuccessText: You hear Rixie shout, "Woo! Nice going! Now let's take it to the extreme!"

quest_27918.Description: In a pseudo-pocket dimension beneath Povus, you met a fairy named Rixie who asked you to collect some rings.
quest_27918.Name: Rixie's Ring Challenge 3
quest_27918.PrefaceText: Okay for real this time. Can you collect 20 rings in 60 seconds? Go go go go go go!
quest_27918.SuccessText: You hear Rixie shout, "Incredible! Did you see, James? DID YOU SEE THAT?!"

quest_27919.Description: In a pseudo-pocket dimension beneath Povus, you encountered a larger-than-normal butterfly which begged you to knock over some jars of nectar elsewhere.
quest_27919.Name: Rancid Nectar Jars
quest_27919.PrefaceText:
I used to get really thirsty -- and because of my size, I had to drink a TON of nectar each day. But recently I've outgrown the need for sustenance by realizing that my physical form is illusory and my existence is meaningless. Saves me a lot of hassle!

But there's a problem. I used to stash pots of fairy nectar all over the place in case I got thirsty while travelling. But since I stopped drinking the stuff, it's gone bad! And there are real insects in the caves out there. I'm afraid someone's going to drink that nectar and die!

Can you find the nectar bottles and dump them out for me? Thanks, pal.
quest_27919.SuccessText: You dumped all the nectar out? That's a relief! I may not really exist, but that doesn't mean I'd will non-existence on others! You know? Anyway, thanks, bud!

quest_27920.Description: In a cave beneath Povus, you met a ghostly orc that wanted nothing but a sip of Remga's Raging Rum.
quest_27920.MidwayText: I just wish I could have one more taste of Remga's Raging Rum. Then maybe I could move on.
quest_27920.Name: Regma's Raging Rum
quest_27920.PrefaceText:
I was a brewmaster! Not a warrior! I mean, I could fight -- what brewmaster can't brawl? But I wasn't supposed to get blown up! I was drinking Remga's Raging Rum, and a toy bomb let off a spark... And then I guess my rum exploded.

I just wish I could have one last taste of Remga's.
quest_27920.SuccessText: This is my rum! You found it. Thank you, freakish ghost. I'm going to drink this and then head off to new places. If you want, I could teach you something about brewing before I go.

quest_28.Description: Jesina in Eltibule asked you to save her sister Sarina. Sarina is being held captive in a goblin-infested dungeon under Eltibule Keep.
quest_28.Name: Save Sarina

quest_28001.Description:
A person in a coffin in Vidaria said, "I have a... magical illness.

I need a rare substance known as Acur Blood. I know ...not... where one such as... yourself... would find this thing. Perhaps seek out sages or ...mystics. In any case, I grant you no hope. But if you succeed, I shall reward you handsomely.
Wait! Actually, make it two jars of Acur Blood."
quest_28001.Name: The Man In The Coffin
quest_28001.PrefaceText:
I have a... magical illness.

I need a rare substance known as Acur Blood. I know ...not... where one such as... yourself... would find this thing. Perhaps seek out sages or ...mystics. In any case, I grant you no hope. But if you succeed, I shall reward you handsomely.
Wait! Actually, make it two jars of Acur Blood.
quest_28001.SuccessText: A hand came out of the coffin and snatched the Acur Blood. A moment later, a pale human stepped out.

quest_28002.Description: Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I need to re-open this Blood Well ... right away. But a very rude... manticore...stole the lens while I was... resting. He is called Lythorax. You will need to kill him. He's sentient... but not very sentient. You will need...assistance... most likely."
quest_28002.Name: The Stolen Lens
quest_28002.PrefaceText: I need to re-open this Blood Well ... right away. But a very rude... manticore...stole the lens while I was... resting. He is called Lythorax. You will need to kill him. He's sentient... but not very sentient. You will need...assistance... most likely.
quest_28002.SuccessText: This is it! Now... Yes! The blood well is reopened!

quest_28003.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "Listen carefully.

Seek a lich named Khyrulek underneath a town called Serbule. The lich... isn't there. But there may be... guardians.

This lich had a planar guide which I need. It will be hidden in a trove of Tuvillus artifacts.

If I recall... you can find it in her sleeping quarters.

Look for a rune of Tuvillus -- a red sigil. It will be... on the wall.

Touch it to reveal the hoard. Bring me back Khyrulek's Planar Planner."
quest_28003.Name: Khyrulek's Planar Planner

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Khyrulek's Crypt

quest_28003.PrefaceText:
Listen carefully.

Seek a lich named Khyrulek underneath a town called Serbule. The lich... isn't there. But there may be... guardians.

This lich had a planar guide which I need. It will be hidden in a trove of Tuvillus artifacts.

If I recall... you can find it in her sleeping quarters.

Look for a rune of Tuvillus -- a red sigil. It will be... on the wall.

Touch it to reveal the hoard. Bring me back Khyrulek's Planar Planner.
quest_28003.SuccessText:
Yes! This is her precious book of...wait...it's in code. Can you read this?

Nor can I. We have more work to do. Let me... think.

quest_28004.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "Khyrulek's notes are precious. We must break the... code.

No matter, I'm sure that I can...trivially...decipher this script.

Go, bloodling. Find me the usual tools for...such a task."
quest_28004.Name: Deciphering the Planar Planner
quest_28004.PrefaceText:
Khyrulek's notes are precious. We must break the... code.

No matter, I'm sure that I can...trivially...decipher this script.

Go, bloodling. Find me the usual tools for...such a task.
quest_28004.SuccessText:
Finally! The time is nigh! First, we apply the sponge... and then... hmm...

Go for now. I need to... think. These readings don't make sense.

quest_28005.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "Khyrulek's journal is almost correct, but her calculations are outdated due to planar shift. They must be recalibrated by a... teleportation sage.

There was such a sage in Statehelm years ago named Elmetaph, but my spies say he lives now in a lighthouse on a desolate island.

Seek out this Elmetaph and force him to fix these calculations."
quest_28005.MidwayText:
Oh, hello again! Wait... You've changed. I'm so sorry. You've succumbed to darkness! ... 

What? Your master wants my help? Well, I love a puzzle, give me the notes. ... Yes, I can realign these coordinates. You probably could have done it yourself, in fact, if you'd happened to recognize this numbering system. It's made by a deceased species of lizard men who had 8 fingers instead of 10. Such a simple biological difference resulted in an entirely different numbering system, which we sages often find useful for coordinate magic...

Hm? Oh, my apologies for rambling. Here, I've brought the locations up to date. But the book is still cursed -- you did know about the curse, right? No? Well, that would have been awkward! The curse tricks you into misreading the coordinates. You would have died! Haha! No matter, no matter, you can uncurse it. Or your master can, at least. The ingredients are a bit exotic... let me write them down for you. There! Bring those to your master and you'll no doubt be bloodling of the week! Goodbye.
quest_28005.Name: Realigning the Planar Planner
quest_28005.PrefaceText:
Khyrulek's journal is almost correct, but her calculations are outdated due to planar shift. They must be recalibrated by a... teleportation sage.

There was such a sage in Statehelm years ago named Elmetaph, but my spies say he lives now in a lighthouse on a desolate island.

Seek out this Elmetaph and force him to fix these calculations.
quest_28005.SuccessText: You found Elmetaph? I am impressed! And I am not easily impressed. He said it was cursed? Ah, of course! The old coordinate mis-reading curse. We can break it. Next, you must bring me hexapus lips and ... wait, you already got the uncursing ingredients? That's almost too helpful. Do not overstep your place, bloodling! But let me work. Yes: yes, The curse is lifted. I have the coordinates! Finally! Are you ready for the next step?

quest_28006.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I've used Khyrulek's journal to map a way into one of the vampire safehouses beneath Statehelm. There's a working entrance in... Vidaria! It's in the old Woodburr Farm common building. Look for a... windmill... nearby. Once you find the Tuvillic Rune, you should be able to... defeat the guardian... and enter the safehouse.

Once inside, search for these items -- I will write them down for you. You may keep anything else you find."
quest_28006.Name: Accessing the Safehouse

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Woodburr Farmhouse, Vidaria

quest_28006.PrefaceText:
I've used Khyrulek's journal to map a way into one of the vampire safehouses beneath Statehelm. There's a working entrance in... Vidaria! It's in the old Woodburr Farm common building. Look for a... windmill... nearby. Once you find the Tuvillic Rune, you should be able to... defeat the guardian... and enter the safehouse.

Once inside, search for these items -- I will write them down for you. You may keep anything else you find.
quest_28006.SuccessText:
You snuck in without incident? Good. I can smell Shadowslip's rotten innards. I always hated him. Never had anything nice to say. There are many more safehouses underneath Statehelm, and I am working on finding ways into them. But for now, I have what I need!

As a reward, I shall teach you one of the... secrets... of the vampire. Be grateful, for it is quite... powerful.

quest_28008.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "While I am still... more powerful than you could ever dream to be, I... have been robbed of much of my... power. But do not worry. You shall help me recover.

Not too long ago I had a thrall hide supplies in an abandoned keep in Eltibule. Find a way into the walls and find a rune of Tuvillus.
Defeat the primitive guardian and... bring me the ointment it guards. Hurry."
quest_28008.Name: Lost Strength

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Eltibule Keep Walls

quest_28008.PrefaceText:
While I am still... more powerful than you could ever dream to be, I... have been robbed of much of my... power. But do not worry. You shall help me recover.

Not too long ago I had a thrall hide supplies in an abandoned keep in Eltibule. Find a way into the walls and find a rune of Tuvillus.
Defeat the primitive guardian and... bring me the ointment it guards. Hurry.
quest_28008.SuccessText:
This ointment is ruined!

No, it's not your fault. The idiot thrall created this, and he didn't... listen when I said to pack the nightshade... separately.

Let this be a lesson - never take shortcuts in alchemy.

I suppose we shall have to create a new...
batch.

quest_28009.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "We shall simply create a... new potion to help me restore my... power.

First, obtain the... simple organic ingredients."
quest_28009.Name: A New Strength Potion
quest_28009.PrefaceText:
We shall simply create a... new potion to help me restore my... power.

First, obtain the... simple organic ingredients.
quest_28009.SuccessText:
Good. Good! This will...
suffice. More difficult ingredients are needed...
next.

quest_28010.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "The secret ingredient in my potion is, of course... a secret. You are not worthy... to know it. Its creation would be beyond you anyway.

I have hid some of this ingredient in various realms... outside of ours. The easiest to reach is via Eltibule.

The winter fae have tunnels that travel through Eltibule. Look for green bears. Oh... you may need to find a key. Speak to humans in the area.

Once inside, look for a Tuvillic Rune. It's not too far... inside."
quest_28010.Name: The Strength Potion's Strength

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Animal Nexus

quest_28010.PrefaceText:
The secret ingredient in my potion is, of course... a secret. You are not worthy... to know it. Its creation would be beyond you anyway.

I have hid some of this ingredient in various realms... outside of ours. The easiest to reach is via Eltibule.

The winter fae have tunnels that travel through Eltibule. Look for green bears. Oh... you may need to find a key. Speak to humans in the area.

Once inside, look for a Tuvillic Rune. It's not too far... inside.
quest_28010.SuccessText:
Hmm... yes, still waxy.

You have done well. I shall prepare the potion.

quest_28011.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "The potion worked! I feel stronger. Healthier. More virile. I can feel my powers returning! I just need to unlock... them again.

Help me with the unlocking ritual, and I shall unlock the power of the bat for you, too!

I just need some supplies for the inscription ceremony.

Now where did I leave the ghostly guano? Ah, of course. On an island known as Sun Vale, look for a ruin. That should be enough to go on, right? Oh, yes: some of those grim little Winter Fae like to... frolic nearby.

For the other ingredients, I'm certain your... cosmopolitan upbringing will aid you in their procurance."
quest_28011.Name: The Power of the Bat

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Sun Vale

quest_28011.PrefaceText:
The potion worked! I feel stronger. Healthier. More virile. I can feel my powers returning! I just need to unlock... them again.

Help me with the unlocking ritual, and I shall unlock the power of the bat for you, too!

I just need some supplies for the inscription ceremony.

Now where did I leave the ghostly guano? Ah, of course. On an island known as Sun Vale, look for a ruin. That should be enough to go on, right? Oh, yes: some of those grim little Winter Fae like to... frolic nearby.

For the other ingredients, I'm certain your... cosmopolitan upbringing will aid you in their procurance.
quest_28011.SuccessText: I've prepared the paint for the inscription. Let's begin. [Truxartis inscribes a symbol into his palm. The symbol glows and vanishes. He then inscribes the same symbol into your palm.] Your master being so powerful has many... benefits. One is that you inherted many of my ancient... powers. And I have unlocked one of them for you. You can now become a giant bat! Use this power wisely. Or, more realistically, use this power amusingly.

quest_28012.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I need to reawaken my blood powers. If only I hadn't killed the First Thrall years ago and stashed his body parts beneath a ruined tower in the Kur Mountains! But alas, I did.

Go and find them for me. Try not to alert Lomas to your presence -- you shouldn't need to see him at all. If you do encounter Lomas, tell him that I'll get him the money soon."
quest_28012.Name: Remnants of the First Thrall

Objectives.Description: Touch Tuvillic Rune 1 in Lomas' Tower
Touch Tuvillic Rune 2 in Lomas' Tower
Touch Tuvillic Rune 3 in Lomas' Tower

quest_28012.PrefaceText:
I need to reawaken my blood powers. If only I hadn't killed the First Thrall years ago and stashed his body parts beneath a ruined tower in the Kur Mountains! But alas, I did.

Go and find them for me. Try not to alert Lomas to your presence -- you shouldn't need to see him at all. If you do encounter Lomas, tell him that I'll get him the money soon.
quest_28012.SuccessText:
Ah yes, these are the First Thrall's bones, all right.

Hmm. They seem... Inert. Blast that Lomas! He must have realized I hid them in his home. He's stolen the power from these old bones!

quest_28013.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "The bones of the First Thrall have been sucked dry, but they are still valuable. I just need... Refresh them! Yes. This could work.

I have located another entrance to a secret basement beneath Statehelm. I believe this to be a storehouse for vampiric thralls that are... too far gone to live on the street. "Lost thralls," they're called, but their blood is... potent. After years or even decades of vampiric feeding, they've become delectable and potent vessels. Not as delectable as my poor First Thrall, of course. ... But good enough to recharge these bones.

The entrance is in Rahu. I recall it being in a small house overlooking a lake.

Oh, while you are in there, I need a few other items."
quest_28013.Name: Blood of Lost Thralls

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune in Rahu near "a lake"

quest_28013.PrefaceText:
The bones of the First Thrall have been sucked dry, but they are still valuable. I just need... Refresh them! Yes. This could work.

I have located another entrance to a secret basement beneath Statehelm. I believe this to be a storehouse for vampiric thralls that are... too far gone to live on the street. "Lost thralls," they're called, but their blood is... potent. After years or even decades of vampiric feeding, they've become delectable and potent vessels. Not as delectable as my poor First Thrall, of course. ... But good enough to recharge these bones.

The entrance is in Rahu. I recall it being in a small house overlooking a lake.

Oh, while you are in there, I need a few other items.
quest_28013.SuccessText:
I'll soak the First Thrall's bones in this fresh blood. With luck ... Well, luck has nothing to do with it! We need but wait. And partake of some of this delicious blood ... while it's still drinkable.

For your service, I shall teach you a blood-related vampiric power. Relish it, for it is your bloodrite!

quest_28014.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "My mind is... Fuzzy. I need to realign it. Yes! I know what to do.

You should find a Tuvillic Rune in Povus, beneath a giant mushroom. Touch the rune and retrieve the Mnemonix Index. When you enter the caves, turn left and you should see it."
quest_28014.Name: Reinvigorating the Mind

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune beneath a Giant Mushroom in Povus

quest_28014.PrefaceText:
My mind is... Fuzzy. I need to realign it. Yes! I know what to do.

You should find a Tuvillic Rune in Povus, beneath a giant mushroom. Touch the rune and retrieve the Mnemonix Index. When you enter the caves, turn left and you should see it.
quest_28014.SuccessText: Ah, my Mnemonic Index. It is my own creation, you know. It allows me to... Well, I needn't explain myself to a bloodling. Suffice to say that... you have done well, but there is more to do before I... regain my powers of the mind.

quest_28015.Description: Truxartis in Vidaria said, "The Mnemonix Index has laid bare what other resources I will need. Here is a list. Take care of it."
quest_28015.Name: The Mind Made Anew
quest_28015.PrefaceText: The Mnemonix Index has laid bare what other resources I will need. Here is a list. Take care of it.
quest_28015.SuccessText: These mind gems... they're synthetic! Who would bother to ... nevermind. These will work. Everything seems to be here. There is but one more step!

quest_28016.Description: Truxartis in Vidaria said, "The final ingredient I need to recover my mental powers is... an ancient pineal gland. I know where you can find exactly... What I need. Search for a Tuvillic Rune in Povus. I believe it is somewhere along the outer wall."
quest_28016.Name: Droach Pineal Juice

Objectives.Description: Touch Vampire Rune on Wall of Povus

quest_28016.PrefaceText: The final ingredient I need to recover my mental powers is... an ancient pineal gland. I know where you can find exactly... What I need. Search for a Tuvillic Rune in Povus. I believe it is somewhere along the outer wall.
quest_28016.SuccessText:
Excellent! I am pleased! Wait while I prepare the salve.

Yes! I can feel my powers returning! And of course I shall reward you, too, my loyal bloodling.

There. I have unlocked a potent mind-power. Perhaps it is to your... liking.

quest_28017.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "First and foremost, you should find my... butler. He was once a ghoul. And I suppose he is still a ghoul, of a sort. But he is ... more. He can sense hatred in the air. It is MOST valuable.

Grasuul ran away when I was forced into repose. But I know where he would go: I spied a cursed lake near the ruby wall. He would no doubt be there, reveling in anguish. Grasuul is... not well.

Tell Grasuul that I have awoken. He will come back."
quest_28017.Name: Grasuul the Butler
quest_28017.PrefaceText:
First and foremost, you should find my... butler. He was once a ghoul. And I suppose he is still a ghoul, of a sort. But he is ... more. He can sense hatred in the air. It is MOST valuable.

Grasuul ran away when I was forced into repose. But I know where he would go: I spied a cursed lake near the ruby wall. He would no doubt be there, reveling in anguish. Grasuul is... not well.

Tell Grasuul that I have awoken. He will come back.
quest_28017.SuccessText: Grasuul has returned! Now we can find the best sources of blood. Excellent.

quest_28018.Description: Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I crave fresh lifeblood! But I am too... Busy to obtain it myself. Go and fetch it for me. Speak with Grasuul, he seems to... Know where to find the easiest lifeblood."
quest_28018.Name: Fresh Lifeblood
quest_28018.PrefaceText: I crave fresh lifeblood! But I am too... Busy to obtain it myself. Go and fetch it for me. Speak with Grasuul, he seems to... Know where to find the easiest lifeblood.
quest_28018.SuccessText: Give! [Truxartis drinks the lifeblood.] Ah. Now I can continue my work unhindered by thirst.

quest_28019.Description: Truxartis in Vidaria said, "My experiments require fresh hematic ichor. It can be hard to find, but just keep drinking people and... you'll find it eventually. Grasuul will know the best places to look today."
quest_28019.Name: Fresh Hematic Ichor
quest_28019.PrefaceText: My experiments require fresh hematic ichor. It can be hard to find, but just keep drinking people and... you'll find it eventually. Grasuul will know the best places to look today.
quest_28019.SuccessText: Good, it hasn't gotten too... crusty yet.

quest_28020.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I have need of small hate pearls. But they must be extraordinarily... fresh, and must come from a living creature. I can't use those worthless manufactured hate pearls!

Speak with Grasuul to learn what blood is fresh today. Hunt those creatures. But be warned -- some creatures are more hateful than others. I am content to wait a day or two if necessary."
quest_28020.Name: Small Hate Pearls
quest_28020.PrefaceText:
I have need of small hate pearls. But they must be extraordinarily... fresh, and must come from a living creature. I can't use those worthless manufactured hate pearls!

Speak with Grasuul to learn what blood is fresh today. Hunt those creatures. But be warned -- some creatures are more hateful than others. I am content to wait a day or two if necessary.
quest_28020.SuccessText: And these all came from the still-beating hearts of living, or at least un-living, creatures? Good... good. You may go.

quest_28021.Description:
Truxartis in Vidaria said, "I have need of large hate pearls. You can sometimes find them on the corpses of your victims. Speak with Grasuul to find the freshest blood today... that will also be your best chance for finding hate pearls.

For this particular purpose I do not... care how fresh they are. You may use store-bought hate pearls for all I care. Just make certain they are extremely... hateful. "
quest_28021.Name: Large Hate Pearls
quest_28021.PrefaceText:
I have need of large hate pearls. You can sometimes find them on the corpses of your victims. Speak with Grasuul to find the freshest blood today... that will also be your best chance for finding hate pearls.

For this particular purpose I do not... care how fresh they are. You may use store-bought hate pearls for all I care. Just make certain they are extremely... hateful.
quest_28021.SuccessText: Astute work. I shall make use of these.

quest_28101.Description: Sir Taggart in Vidaria said, "If you're handy with a weapon, we could use help with the incessant waves of ghouls. Be careful -- they can overwhelm you!"
quest_28101.Name: Ghouls from the Hole
quest_28101.PrefaceText: If you're handy with a weapon, we could use help with the incessant waves of ghouls. Be careful -- they can overwhelm you!
quest_28101.SuccessText: You have my thanks. A temporary reprieve is still a reprieve.

quest_28102.Description: Sir Taggart in Vidaria said, "There's also the issue of the so-called Invincible Bulwark skeletons. They're a huge problem. Be careful!"
quest_28102.Name: Hole Bulwarks

Objectives.Description: Kill Invincible Bulwarks near the Hole

quest_28102.PrefaceText: There's also the issue of the so-called Invincible Bulwark skeletons. They're a huge problem. Be careful!

quest_28103.Description: Sir Taggart in Vidaria said, "Back beyond the mass of ghouls you'll find even more dangerous undead: wizards! They wield fire and darkness alike."
quest_28103.Name: Fire and Darkness From the Hole
quest_28103.PrefaceText: Back beyond the mass of ghouls you'll find even more dangerous undead: wizards! They wield fire and darkness alike.
quest_28103.SuccessText: I must say I'm impressed. I expected you to come back, of course -- you're obviously not going to be killed by some dumb old undead. But taking out a pile of wizard skeletons is still very impressive!

quest_28201.Description:
Liamu the Watchful in Vidaria said, "This land is infested with problematic demons, and I cannot get close enough to the wall to achieve my goals. If you help me, I shall be very grateful.

The first thing I need is quite simple: just get a sample of every kind of gem or crystal that can be found when mining the crystals near the demons."
quest_28201.Name: Demonic Gems
quest_28201.PrefaceText:
This land is infested with problematic demons, and I cannot get close enough to the wall to achieve my goals. If you help me, I shall be very grateful.

The first thing I need is quite simple: just get a sample of every kind of gem or crystal that can be found when mining the crystals near the demons.
quest_28201.SuccessText:
You... succeeded? I'm ... ahem, I'm impressed! You are much more useful than you look!

I've done a cursory review of these crystals, and I have some follow-up requests, if you have time.

quest_28202.Description: Liamu the Watchful in Vidaria said, "A few of the crystals that you brought to me have interesting properties! I require further samples of these to better understand them."
quest_28202.Name: Spectracite
quest_28202.PrefaceText: A few of the crystals that you brought to me have interesting properties! I require further samples of these to better understand them.
quest_28202.SuccessText: Excellent geologizing. I'll examine these in further detail when I'm back home.

quest_28203.Description: Liamu the Watchful in Vidaria said, "A few of the crystals that you brought to me have interesting properties! I require further samples of these to better understand them."
quest_28203.Name: Forthragarian Aetherite
quest_28203.PrefaceText: A few of the crystals that you brought to me have interesting properties! I require further samples of these to better understand them.
quest_28203.SuccessText: Excellent geologizing. I'll examine these in further detail when I'm back home.

quest_28301.Description: Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "Well if you think you're a capable fighter, we can always use help dealing with the demonic swarmers. Be careful, or they'll overwhelm you!"
quest_28301.Name: Testing Your Demon-Killing Mettle
quest_28301.PrefaceText: Well if you think you're a capable fighter, we can always use help dealing with the demonic swarmers. Be careful, or they'll overwhelm you!

quest_28302.Description:
Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "I knew I forgot something! When I asked you to kill those swarmers, you were supposed to scoop up their brains and bring them back. The mages have a 'theory'.

I know this wasn't your fault, so I'm happy to overlook this incident if you can head back out into the field and get those brains."
quest_28302.Name: Swarmer Brains
quest_28302.PrefaceText:
I knew I forgot something! When I asked you to kill those swarmers, you were supposed to scoop up their brains and bring them back. The mages have a 'theory'.
