I know this wasn't your fault, so I'm happy to overlook this incident if you can head back out into the field and get those brains.
quest_28302.SuccessText: Excellent. I'll get these to brains to the 'Brains' who wanted them. And just to be clear, I was joking earlier when I said I'd 'overlook the incident'. I know this was my screw-up. I was just yanking your yodel. I'm almost sure you already knew that, but I think you might technically be my superior officer, so I just wanted to clarify. And I'm having Sir Porrins investigate what rank you actually have right now. Your records are a little confusing.

quest_28303.Description: Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "I guess you're ready to move up to tougher demons. The soldiers are next. They're tough, but the scariest part is their disease. Or maybe it's a curse, I dunno. I'm no sage! Anyway, they spread Hellfire sickness. I can give you some balm for afterwards, but... try your best not to get too much hellfire on you. It saps your life away. To me, it's the scariest thing on this battlefield. Fight smart."
quest_28303.Name: Demon Soldiers
quest_28303.PrefaceText: I guess you're ready to move up to tougher demons. The soldiers are next. They're tough, but the scariest part is their disease. Or maybe it's a curse, I dunno. I'm no sage! Anyway, they spread Hellfire sickness. I can give you some balm for afterwards, but... try your best not to get too much hellfire on you. It saps your life away. To me, it's the scariest thing on this battlefield. Fight smart.
quest_28303.SuccessText: Nice work! You brought the blaze of Arisetsu to those monsters! I have some hellfire curatives here. Take them.

quest_28304.Description:
Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "Thanks for getting those brains. They apparently confirmed Mr. Blueheart's theory. Have you met him? He's in camp here. Squirrely man, but his heart's in the right place. Anyway, I have another request from him. You know those skulls with wings near the walls? Yeah, kill those and get a sample of their blood.

I know, skulls don't have blood! But he says there's blood in the wings."
quest_28304.Name: Flapskull Blood
quest_28304.PrefaceText:
Thanks for getting those brains. They apparently confirmed Mr. Blueheart's theory. Have you met him? He's in camp here. Squirrely man, but his heart's in the right place. Anyway, I have another request from him. You know those skulls with wings near the walls? Yeah, kill those and get a sample of their blood.

I know, skulls don't have blood! But he says there's blood in the wings.
quest_28304.SuccessText: You got all this blood from the wings of those flapskulls? I guess Mr. Blueheart was right. Good work. You know what? I'm sure he has more follow-up requests, and there's really no reason for me to be the go-between. Can you speak with him about next steps? [New Favor Unlocked with Ferris Blueheart.]

quest_28401.Description:
Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "Some of the crystals near the wall move. They move! You'll understand when you see them.

Please see if you can destroy them."
quest_28401.Name: Crystal Mobility Analysis
quest_28401.PrefaceText:
Some of the crystals near the wall move. They move! You'll understand when you see them.

Please see if you can destroy them.
quest_28401.SuccessText:
You were able to destroy the crystals? Well, there goes that hypothesis. AND you survived the encounter, so there goes my other hypothesis.

Hm. Perhaps they are sentient! Hah, that would be a nightmare. They're probably just enchanted to flee harm. I'll work on a way to prove this one way or the other, but for now you have my thanks.

quest_28402.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "This one's quite simple: I need a bunch of fluxic quartz for some experiments. I don't care where you get it."
quest_28402.Name: Fluxic Quartz
quest_28402.PrefaceText: This one's quite simple: I need a bunch of fluxic quartz for some experiments. I don't care where you get it.
quest_28402.SuccessText: And no questions asked. You are a consumate professional. Thank you.

quest_28403.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "Ah, you were the one that got me the swarmer brains and the flapskull blood? Very good. I have need of you again: you must help me prove my hypothesis! I just need brains from demon soldiers so I can compare them with the swarmer brains."
quest_28403.Name: The Swarmer Hypothesis
quest_28403.PrefaceText: Ah, you were the one that got me the swarmer brains and the flapskull blood? Very good. I have need of you again: you must help me prove my hypothesis! I just need brains from demon soldiers so I can compare them with the swarmer brains.
quest_28403.SuccessText:
Hah! I don't even need to study these further to know the truth: these soldier brains are from the same species as the swarmer brains. Swarmers somehow evolve into Soldiers! I knew it, but I couldn't prove it.

You've done well. I need to make some observations and record my findings. I will have more requests of you soon.

quest_28404.Description:
Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "You've been incredibly helpful in my research thus far, but we've only been dealing with the minions. I still have many questions about the higher ranks of the demons.

We should start by examining the large ones. I've noticed that one of them seems more in-charge than the other, despite no obvious physical differences. The brains have been so helpful in the past, and you've proven that you're clearly capable of extracting them, so bring me some from each, if you don't mind."
quest_28404.Name: Lesser of Two Evils
quest_28404.PrefaceText:
You've been incredibly helpful in my research thus far, but we've only been dealing with the minions. I still have many questions about the higher ranks of the demons.

We should start by examining the large ones. I've noticed that one of them seems more in-charge than the other, despite no obvious physical differences. The brains have been so helpful in the past, and you've proven that you're clearly capable of extracting them, so bring me some from each, if you don't mind.
quest_28404.SuccessText: I knew it! One type of Behemoth evolves into the other, much the same as the Swarmers evolve into Soldiers. What could this mean? Why are there so many evolutions happening among their ranks, and what causes them? Like any good experiment, this seems to have provided more questions than answers. But at least it's something for us to ponder.

quest_28405.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "We've studied the minions and the Behemoths pretty exhaustively, but there's still a lot we don't know about the highest ranks: the Overseers and the Justiciars. I would love to observe their inner workings and see how they stack up to the others. You know what to do."
quest_28405.Name: Lonely at the Top
quest_28405.PrefaceText: We've studied the minions and the Behemoths pretty exhaustively, but there's still a lot we don't know about the highest ranks: the Overseers and the Justiciars. I would love to observe their inner workings and see how they stack up to the others. You know what to do.
quest_28405.SuccessText: Now this is unexpected. Not only are the highest ranks completely different from the lower ranks, but they're also completely different from each other! Considering their similar appearances, I would have assumed their brains would be identical. I must ponder what to do with all of this information. In the meantime, I may have other research you can assist with. [You've unlocked daily quests with Ferris]

quest_28406.Description:
Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "Have you seen the frostbelches in the area? Little blue frogs, very adorable, very deadly. Of course you have, but it seems the demons have as well. They've developed a particular interest in the little creature, and I don't have to know why to know that it's troubling.

Bring me back a few samples of frostbelch skin, and please let me remain ignorant of how you get them."
quest_28406.Name: Fancying the Frostbelches
quest_28406.PrefaceText:
Have you seen the frostbelches in the area? Little blue frogs, very adorable, very deadly. Of course you have, but it seems the demons have as well. They've developed a particular interest in the little creature, and I don't have to know why to know that it's troubling.

Bring me back a few samples of frostbelch skin, and please let me remain ignorant of how you get them.
quest_28406.SuccessText: Great! I hope you convinced the Frostbelches to simply give you a sliver of skin peacefully. [Ferris swallows nervously.] Let me perform some research on these to determine what our next step is.

quest_28407.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "Unfortunately, my tests on these Frostbelch skins were inconclusive. There's nothing out of the ordinary with them. Fortunately for us, however, an animal expert was recently stationed near here. Seek out Pitre Ferrence, he should be somewhere south of this area. Ask him, nay, tell him that we'd like his assistance in this matter. Take the skins with you as well, he may need them."
quest_28407.MidwayText:
What is that? Oh, Ferris needs assistance is it? Well, let me see the samples that you have, then.

[Pitre takes the skins from you, but then quickly returns them.]

On second thought, a genetic scan is quite unnecessary. The demons' plan is obvious. You see, frogs have permeable skin through which they absorb all manner of particulates. And if you look around this area, you are likely to see many ordinary animals overcome with demonic influence. If the passive presence of the demons has such an effect on these animals, I can only imagine the level of influence they could have on an animal that is designed to be influenced by its environment. Easy, deep influence, is the answer I would give to Ferris.
quest_28407.Name: Fancying the Frostbelches, part 2
quest_28407.PrefaceText: Unfortunately, my tests on these Frostbelch skins were inconclusive. There's nothing out of the ordinary with them. Fortunately for us, however, an animal expert was recently stationed near here. Seek out Pitre Ferrence, he should be somewhere south of this area. Ask him, nay, tell him that we'd like his assistance in this matter. Take the skins with you as well, he may need them.
quest_28407.SuccessText: "Easy, deep influence"? Well, I suppose that makes sense, but it still doesn't tell the full story. The demons can influence the frogs easily, but to what end? Why do they want to influence them in the first place is the main question. I will stew on Pitre's words. That is all for now, thank you.

quest_28408.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "I have a theory. I suspect that the demons specifically value some combination of the Frostbelches' protective properties with their own. But I don't know what combination, exactly. Do you still have those frog skins from before? I'll need those, and I'll need some demonic essences. Bring me both, so I can compare."
quest_28408.Name: Fancying the Frostbelches, part 3
quest_28408.PrefaceText: I have a theory. I suspect that the demons specifically value some combination of the Frostbelches' protective properties with their own. But I don't know what combination, exactly. Do you still have those frog skins from before? I'll need those, and I'll need some demonic essences. Bring me both, so I can compare.
quest_28408.SuccessText: No, not the Hellfire... No, the frost doesn't seem to affect the demonic energies, so it's not that either. There must be someth- [Ferris' eyes widen] No. No no no. This is very not good. It seems that when the demonic essence fuses with the Frostbelch skin, their defenses perfectly align to create an entity which is immune to all of the elements. All of them.

quest_28409.Description:
Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "We cannot let that happen. We cannot let the demons fuse with the Frostbelches. [Ferris looks around, clearly panicked.] I'm afraid we have no choice. We have to destroy the Frostbelches before it's too late. My heart goes out to the cute little creatures, but there really is no other way.

I hate to ask you to do this, but I need you to deal with as many Frostbelches as you can."
quest_28409.Name: Fancying the Frostbelches, part 4
quest_28409.PrefaceText:
We cannot let that happen. We cannot let the demons fuse with the Frostbelches. [Ferris looks around, clearly panicked.] I'm afraid we have no choice. We have to destroy the Frostbelches before it's too late. My heart goes out to the cute little creatures, but there really is no other way.

I hate to ask you to do this, but I need you to deal with as many Frostbelches as you can.
quest_28409.SuccessText: Thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you. I don't know how I can ever repay you for that. You prevented a disaster, of that we can be sure. Take this, in memory of the many fallen frogs.

quest_28451.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Swarmers. Can you help me out?"
quest_28451.Name: Demonic Field Research: Swarmer
quest_28451.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Swarmers. Can you help me out?
quest_28451.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28452.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Soldiers. Can you help me out?"
quest_28452.Name: Demonic Field Research: Soldier
quest_28452.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Soldiers. Can you help me out?
quest_28452.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28453.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Scouts. Can you help me out?"
quest_28453.Name: Demonic Field Research: Scout
quest_28453.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Scouts. Can you help me out?
quest_28453.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28454.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Lesser Behemoths. Can you help me out?"
quest_28454.Name: Demonic Field Research: Lesser Behemoth
quest_28454.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Lesser Behemoths. Can you help me out?
quest_28454.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28455.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Behemoths. Can you help me out?"
quest_28455.Name: Demonic Field Research: Behemoth
quest_28455.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Behemoths. Can you help me out?
quest_28455.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28456.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Overseers. Can you help me out?"
quest_28456.Name: Demonic Field Research: Overseer
quest_28456.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Overseers. Can you help me out?
quest_28456.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28457.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Justiciars. Can you help me out?"
quest_28457.Name: Demonic Field Research: Justiciar
quest_28457.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Justiciars. Can you help me out?
quest_28457.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28458.Description: Ferris Blueheart in Vidaria said, "My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Animals. Can you help me out?"
quest_28458.Name: Demonic Field Research: Animal
quest_28458.PrefaceText: My current research on the demonic threat is stalled. To continue it, I need to perform some biological sampling of the infernal Animals. Can you help me out?
quest_28458.SuccessText: Perfect! This is exactly what I needed. Let me share some of my findings with you.

quest_28501.Description: Orrrilund in the Ranalon Den said, "If you're set on getting past this door, you'll have to prove to me you won't die the moment you do. Go kill the Doctrine-Keeper, and when you've done that we'll talk."
quest_28501.Name: Kill the Doctrine-Keeper
quest_28501.PrefaceText: If you're set on getting past this door, you'll have to prove to me you won't die the moment you do. Go kill the Doctrine-Keeper, and when you've done that we'll talk.
quest_28501.SuccessText: Hmm. I guess you'll do. Use that lever behind me, it'll let you through.

quest_28502.Description: Orrrilund in the Ranalon Den said, "You found what? You mean they weren't torn completely to shreds? That's great! They were supposed to collect something for me. The next time you're in there, look for a sack that they had and grab it for me. "
quest_28502.Name: Recover Orrrilund's Sack
quest_28502.PrefaceText: You found what? You mean they weren't torn completely to shreds? That's great! They were supposed to collect something for me. The next time you're in there, look for a sack that they had and grab it for me.
quest_28502.SuccessText: You found it! How? It doesn't matter, give it here. [She grabs the bag from you and opens it up. After digging through it for a while, she looks disappointed.] They couldn't even finish one simple task. Whatever. Here, I don't need this.

quest_28503.Description: Orrrilund in the Ranalon Den said, "You know what'll really get them to change things up? Taking down the Den Mother. Yes, she'll be replaced by another, but it's about proving to them nothing is safe."
quest_28503.Name: Kill the Ranalon Den Mother
quest_28503.PrefaceText: You know what'll really get them to change things up? Taking down the Den Mother. Yes, she'll be replaced by another, but it's about proving to them nothing is safe.
quest_28503.SuccessText:
You actually did it? Hahahaha! I wish I could have seen the faces of the guardians when you did that.

Oh, you wanted something for that? Well, here, take this I guess.

quest_28504.Description: Orrrilund in the Ranalon Den said, "It looks like another Doctrine-Keeper took the last one's place. If you take care of that one, too, I'll give you something for your troubles."
quest_28504.Name: Kill the Doctrine-Keeper
quest_28504.PrefaceText: It looks like another Doctrine-Keeper took the last one's place. If you take care of that one, too, I'll give you something for your troubles.
quest_28504.SuccessText: Thanks. Come see me again tomorrow, by then another should have taken their place.

quest_28505.Description: Orrrilund in the Ranalon Den said, "As expected, a new Den Mother was born or burrowed in from somewhere. If you take care of this one, I'll give you some of these scrolls I found laying around. "
quest_28505.Name: Kill the Ranalon Den Mother
quest_28505.PrefaceText: As expected, a new Den Mother was born or burrowed in from somewhere. If you take care of this one, I'll give you some of these scrolls I found laying around.
quest_28505.SuccessText: Hahaha! You did it again! You're always full of surprises. Here, take this. [She moves some loose rocks aside to reveal a pile of scrolls, grabs some and hands them to you. Some of them seem useful.]

quest_28601.Description: Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "I've heard that some of the demonic rocks to the north have useful properties. There is one in particular that interests me, some kind of frozen magma. I would like to tinker with this one, and see if it has useful engineering applications. If you bring me a few, I will share any findings with you."
quest_28601.Name: Pocket Magma
quest_28601.PrefaceText: I've heard that some of the demonic rocks to the north have useful properties. There is one in particular that interests me, some kind of frozen magma. I would like to tinker with this one, and see if it has useful engineering applications. If you bring me a few, I will share any findings with you.
quest_28601.SuccessText: Interesting. It is cool to the touch, but it's clear that there is magma inside. I think with just the write current applied equally to the entire surface area, it can be turned back on... are you writing this down?

quest_28602.Description: Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "The frozen magma that you brought me is interesting, and I would like to perform some experiments with it. I suspect it can be used in place of the central core of a Dwar- you know what, I'll spare you the details. I need more info about the demons in general, and a bunch of N Cores to perform my testing with. Can you keep an eye out for those things?"
quest_28602.Name: Magma Testing
quest_28602.PrefaceText: The frozen magma that you brought me is interesting, and I would like to perform some experiments with it. I suspect it can be used in place of the central core of a Dwar- you know what, I'll spare you the details. I need more info about the demons in general, and a bunch of N Cores to perform my testing with. Can you keep an eye out for those things?
quest_28602.SuccessText:
You found some research notes? And a whole host of N Cores! Brilliant. Now all we have to do is pop these puppies open and get to work. It's a two-person job, so let me know when you have some free time.

[ You've unlocked a new hangout with Engineer Crall. ]

quest_28603.Description: Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "When I left the mining camp, I did so in a hurry. Rock-Wrecker and I got into... let's just say, we did not see eye-to-eye. At any rate, I left behind some valuable notes on a new mining device I was working on. I would hate for them to pick up the design where I left off, and use it for their nefarious goals. If you happen upon their camp, could you retrieve my notes while you're there? I wouldn't be surprised if Rock-Wrecker seized them for himself already."
quest_28603.Name: Recover Engineering Notes
quest_28603.PrefaceText: When I left the mining camp, I did so in a hurry. Rock-Wrecker and I got into... let's just say, we did not see eye-to-eye. At any rate, I left behind some valuable notes on a new mining device I was working on. I would hate for them to pick up the design where I left off, and use it for their nefarious goals. If you happen upon their camp, could you retrieve my notes while you're there? I wouldn't be surprised if Rock-Wrecker seized them for himself already.
quest_28603.SuccessText:
My notes! You found them! This is wonderful news.

Ah, it looks like one of the other engineers picked up where I left off, which is what I feared. I hope they didn't- hm, wait a minute. Oh, they swapped the gear ratios, and moved the crystal to there.. that just might work!

quest_28604.Description:
Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "The notes you brought back from Rock-Wrecker's camp are pretty clever - I wish those other engineers worked this hard when I was still around. At any rate, there's a few missing pieces of information.

For security purposes, many orcish engineers write their notes as a cipher, and they carry the key on their person. Obtain a few of these keys and bring them back, hopefully one of them is the key that I need."
quest_28604.Name: A New Mining Pick

Objectives.Description: Obtain Orcish Cipher Keys from Engineers

quest_28604.PrefaceText:
The notes you brought back from Rock-Wrecker's camp are pretty clever - I wish those other engineers worked this hard when I was still around. At any rate, there's a few missing pieces of information.

For security purposes, many orcish engineers write their notes as a cipher, and they carry the key on their person. Obtain a few of these keys and bring them back, hopefully one of them is the key that I need.
quest_28604.SuccessText: Hmm, not this one... this one isn't lining up either... a-ha, this is it! Now let's see, what exactly did they mean by... ohh, that makes so much sense! I think I've got it now. [You've unlocked new training options with Engineer Crall.]

quest_28605.Description: Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "When I first left camp, I wandered a bit before settling here. I stumbled upon a dwarven man near the swamp to the north, but we lacked communication because he did not speak Orcish... or perhaps he did, and simply did not want to chat. Regardless, dwarves are often clever inventors, so would you inquire about a collaboration between us?"
quest_28605.MidwayText: Excuse me? An orc wants to collaborate on technology? What, just because I'm stout and have a big bushy beard, that automatically makes me an inventor, does it? Well, tell your orc friend that I'll happily invent new things with them as soon as they get done rampaging across the country, killing everything in sight. In other words: piss off. Hrmph.
quest_28605.Name: A Dwarf in the Swamp

Objectives.Description: Ask Drummond Stonecurl if he'll collaborate with Crall

quest_28605.PrefaceText: When I first left camp, I wandered a bit before settling here. I stumbled upon a dwarven man near the swamp to the north, but we lacked communication because he did not speak Orcish... or perhaps he did, and simply did not want to chat. Regardless, dwarves are often clever inventors, so would you inquire about a collaboration between us?
quest_28605.SuccessText: He said no? And accused you of being racist for assuming he would know about technology? My apologies, that must have been awkward. Please take this as a token of my apology.

quest_28606.Description: Engineer Crall in Vidaria said, "I have prepared the collaboration notes I would like you to deliver to the dwarf. If you would be so kind, please translate them and deliver them. I eagerly await his response."
quest_28606.MidwayText:
Hm.

Hmmmm.

Hm.

I see. Tell your orcish friend that the fish will escape easily with this current design. If you introduce a high-pitched noise mechanism, perhaps that of a bell, she can then tune the gears to react to it properly and clamp down harder on the caught fish.
quest_28606.Name: Collaborative Ice Fishing

Objectives.Description: Deliver the translated notes to Drummond Stonecurl

quest_28606.PrefaceText: I have prepared the collaboration notes I would like you to deliver to the dwarf. If you would be so kind, please translate them and deliver them. I eagerly await his response.
quest_28606.SuccessText: Add a be- of course! Wow, is his knowledge innate or is he classically trained? No matter. With his suggestion, I think I've finally figured it out! I can show you, if you'd like. [You've unlocked new training options with Engineer Crall.]

quest_28641.Description:
Korbok in Vidaria said, "De Cancel haz mi heer tahelp at, bit dey din sey eye hafta only tek wakordas. Im gunna kollect alde poyzens ye ken git ta... keepit offa de streetz. Yeh, dats it. Help me cleen up te streetz, wontcha?

(You're pretty sure Korbok wants you to collect poison, to "Clean up the streets")"
quest_28641.Name: Cleen Up Te Streetz
quest_28641.PrefaceText:
De Cancel haz mi heer tahelp at, bit dey din sey eye hafta only tek wakordas. Im gunna kollect alde poyzens ye ken git ta... keepit offa de streetz. Yeh, dats it. Help me cleen up te streetz, wontcha?

(You're pretty sure Korbok wants you to collect poison, to "Clean up the streets")
quest_28641.SuccessText: Amazen! Disiz de gud stuff... I meen, itsa shame it hazta bee destroyed. [Korbok winks at you]

quest_28642.Description: Korbok in Vidaria said, "Well, ifyer offerin den acurse immasai yiss. Gogit de tuffest poisonz yecan find."
quest_28642.Name: Undercover Poison Collection
quest_28642.PrefaceText: Well, ifyer offerin den acurse immasai yiss. Gogit de tuffest poisonz yecan find.
quest_28642.SuccessText: Yedun gud. Yedun reel gud. Leevittoo me ta git dis stuff takin carov.

quest_28671.Description: Pitre Ferrence in Vidaria said, "I was stationed here to keep an eye on Korbok, so to hear that you collected various poisons for him is troubling. Doubly so, that he winked at you when you gave them to him. Bring me a sampling of all of the poisons that you gave him, so I can try to suss out what he's working on without confronting him directly."
quest_28671.Name: Investigate Korbok's Poisons
quest_28671.PrefaceText: I was stationed here to keep an eye on Korbok, so to hear that you collected various poisons for him is troubling. Doubly so, that he winked at you when you gave them to him. Bring me a sampling of all of the poisons that you gave him, so I can try to suss out what he's working on without confronting him directly.
quest_28671.SuccessText: So far as I can tell, these are all standard and unrelated poisons. I am by no means an alchemical expert, so I will send these back to Statehelm for further analysis. Thank you for your assistance in this investigation.

quest_28672.Description:
Pitre Ferrence in Vidaria said, "My alchemist contact in Statehelm insists there are no commonalities in the poisons that Korbok had you retrieve. Mr. Farblood himself even took a look, to no avail. There must be something deeper going on here.

Take this journal, and keep as detailed notes in it as you can. Get in close with Korbok, see if there's any more poison-related missions he can send you on, and just try to gather more info in general. While I do find him and his kind fascinating, I cannot let that get in the way of my primary assignment."
quest_28672.Name: The Korbok Investigation

Objectives.Description: Perform more poison-related tasks for Korbok
Hang out with Korbok for deeper investigation

quest_28672.PrefaceText:
My alchemist contact in Statehelm insists there are no commonalities in the poisons that Korbok had you retrieve. Mr. Farblood himself even took a look, to no avail. There must be something deeper going on here.

Take this journal, and keep as detailed notes in it as you can. Get in close with Korbok, see if there's any more poison-related missions he can send you on, and just try to gather more info in general. While I do find him and his kind fascinating, I cannot let that get in the way of my primary assignment.
quest_28672.SuccessText: [Pitre flips through the pages in your notebook] I can hardly believe it. Nothing incriminating, and clearly not for lack of trying. I have learned a lot about goblin culture these last few weeks, but covering their trail this well is something I did not expect. I've an idea to put this to bed once and for all. We shall set up a stake-out and keep an eye on Korbok together. With both of us working simultaneously, are sure to catch him in the act of whatever he is performing. [New hangout with Pitre unlocked]

quest_28701.Description: In Vidaria, you stumbled upon an Undead creature that's been dead for so long, it doesn't even remember its own name. Perhaps you can find some items to jog its memory.
quest_28701.Name: Undead Memories

Objectives.Description: Find and identify an Ancient Vase
Find and identify an Ancient Painting
Find and identify an Ancient Crest
Return to The Floriculturist and tell him what you learned

quest_28801.Description: Drummond Stonecurl in Vidaria said, "I owe you an apology. When you asked if I would collaborate with that orc on technology, I lost my temper. Hrmph. I actually do quite enjoy tinkering, and mining, and all the other stereotypical dwarven activities. I just hate when others presume that about me. Please, return to your orcish friend and tell them I am willing to collaborate."
quest_28801.MidwayText: Oh. Oh! That dwarf! This is wonderful news. I will prepare some collaboration materials immediately. You wouldn't mind translating them for me, would you? Well nevermind, we can cross that bridge when we arrive at it, so to speak.
quest_28801.Name: An Orc in the Mountains

Objectives.Description: Tell Crall that Drummond will collaborate with her

quest_28801.PrefaceText: I owe you an apology. When you asked if I would collaborate with that orc on technology, I lost my temper. Hrmph. I actually do quite enjoy tinkering, and mining, and all the other stereotypical dwarven activities. I just hate when others presume that about me. Please, return to your orcish friend and tell them I am willing to collaborate.
quest_28801.SuccessText: Great. I will take a look at whatever they send over. It's the least I can do after my outburst.

quest_28802.Description: Drummond Stonecurl in Vidaria said, "We don't have a wide variety of ingredients in this area, but we do have one thing that's unique: a bunch of infernal creatures. I've heard, mostly from Denton, that there are non-demons nearby that are studying the demons. Their research may prove useful in the culinary world. Or at least, in my culinary world. Bring me some of this demonic research so I can see if any of it is useful."
quest_28802.Name: Infernal Recipes
quest_28802.PrefaceText: We don't have a wide variety of ingredients in this area, but we do have one thing that's unique: a bunch of infernal creatures. I've heard, mostly from Denton, that there are non-demons nearby that are studying the demons. Their research may prove useful in the culinary world. Or at least, in my culinary world. Bring me some of this demonic research so I can see if any of it is useful.
quest_28802.SuccessText: Hrm. It says right here that their flavor profile is best described as "a combination of spicy and sour." I don't know who exactly performed this taste test, but bless their heart.

quest_28803.Description: Drummond Stonecurl in Vidaria said, "I wonder if there's any new discoveries about the demons. If you could bring me some more demonic research, I'd be grateful."
quest_28803.Name: Staying Informed about Infernal Recipes
quest_28803.PrefaceText: I wonder if there's any new discoveries about the demons. If you could bring me some more demonic research, I'd be grateful.
quest_28803.SuccessText: Interesting. Nothing too groundbreaking, but there might be something in here I can use for a dish.

quest_28804.Description: Drummond Stonecurl in Vidaria said, "I haven't been entirely honest with you, and ever since my outburst about the orc I've been thinking that I should be more open. So, here it goes... I am related to Gloria Stonecurl. She is my sister. I have not seen her in an age, mostly because... well, I don't want to get into it right now. But if you happen upon her in your travels, would you tell her that her wee old brother sends his regards?"
quest_28804.MidwayText: Get out of town, Drummond?! You've seen him?! And even talked to him?! By Arisetsu, I never thought I'd see the day. Well, while you're playing messenger, would you mind telling that old fart that the past is the past, and he should come say hi for himself sometime. We've a lot of catching up to do, surely.
quest_28804.Name: The Stonecurl Clan

Objectives.Description: Tell Gloria Stonecurl that Drummond sends his regards

quest_28804.PrefaceText: I haven't been entirely honest with you, and ever since my outburst about the orc I've been thinking that I should be more open. So, here it goes... I am related to Gloria Stonecurl. She is my sister. I have not seen her in an age, mostly because... well, I don't want to get into it right now. But if you happen upon her in your travels, would you tell her that her wee old brother sends his regards?
quest_28804.SuccessText: Hmph. The past is the past, eh? That doesn't sound like Gloria, but maybe she's changed since I last saw her. I'll consider her words. Thank you for delivering the message, please take this as a token of my appreciation. And please also don't ask how I got it.

quest_28901.Description: Zazzamath in The Rubywall in Vidaria said, "I am so bored here, stuck in this giant red ice cube. I was sent here for one purpose and one purpose only, to destroy as much life as possible on this stupid rock. But there's no chance that's happening now. But maybe the outcome can still be achieved... I tell you what. Go out and end lives in my name, and I will tell you whatever you want to know about the invading demon force. Deal?"
quest_28901.Name: Pain and Suffering
quest_28901.PrefaceText: I am so bored here, stuck in this giant red ice cube. I was sent here for one purpose and one purpose only, to destroy as much life as possible on this stupid rock. But there's no chance that's happening now. But maybe the outcome can still be achieved... I tell you what. Go out and end lives in my name, and I will tell you whatever you want to know about the invading demon force. Deal?
quest_28901.SuccessText: Yes. Yes! YES! So much death, so much suffering. It makes me feel alive!

quest_28902.Description: Zazzamath in The Rubywall in Vidaria said, "You got a little taste of destroying life, and now you're back for more, are you? Maybe you have some demon in you, have you ever considered that? Heh heh heh heh... Well then go! Kill more things! MANY more things! When we're through, this whole rock will be barren!"
quest_28902.Name: Death and Destruction
quest_28902.PrefaceText: You got a little taste of destroying life, and now you're back for more, are you? Maybe you have some demon in you, have you ever considered that? Heh heh heh heh... Well then go! Kill more things! MANY more things! When we're through, this whole rock will be barren!
quest_28902.SuccessText: [Zazzamath licks his lips] Beautiful. BEAUTIFUL! I'm starting to think getting stuck here was a GOOD thing. I didn't have the kind of free reign that you have... You can go anywhere! You can kill anything! It's wonderful!

quest_28903.Description: Zazzamath in The Rubywall in Vidaria said, "You've already drained SO MUCH life from this world, it's glorious. But now let's get more targeted... sentient creatures feel more suffering than the others, so focus on them!"
quest_28903.Name: Sentience Slaughter
quest_28903.PrefaceText: You've already drained SO MUCH life from this world, it's glorious. But now let's get more targeted... sentient creatures feel more suffering than the others, so focus on them!
quest_28903.SuccessText: I wish I got to hear their pained cries and see the life drain from their eyes... you're so lucky!

quest_28904.Description: Zazzamath in The Rubywall in Vidaria said, "You are positively itching to snuff more lifes, aren't you?! I knew it. And I love it! Get out there and do what you do best, fleshbag!"
quest_28904.Name: Mindful Massacre
quest_28904.PrefaceText: You are positively itching to snuff more lifes, aren't you?! I knew it. And I love it! Get out there and do what you do best, fleshbag!
quest_28904.SuccessText: When I first saw you, I thought you were only a worthless fleshbag. But now I see that you're truly a RUTHLESS KILLER. Hahahaha!

quest_28905.Description: Zazzamath in The Rubywall in Vidaria said, "The thing about life is, it somehow keeps coming back! But now while you're around to say anything about it! Go out, end as many lives as you can, then come back. Then do it again next week!"
quest_28905.Name: Continuous Culling
quest_28905.PrefaceText: The thing about life is, it somehow keeps coming back! But now while you're around to say anything about it! Go out, end as many lives as you can, then come back. Then do it again next week!
quest_28905.SuccessText: I knew I could count on you. I KNEW I could count on you! Hahahaha! See you next week!

quest_29.Description: Hulon won't let you use the Council Vault while you're an animal... if his superiors found out, he'd be in trouble. But he hinted that a suitable bribe would get him to look the other way.
quest_29.Name: Hulon's Bribe

quest_29001.Description: It appears that the "entrance exam" to become a student of Statehelm's bard college requires you to slay some sort of creature.
quest_29001.Name: Tennenbrandt University Admission Test

Objectives.Description: Defeat the Musical Proficiency Analysis Golem

quest_29001.SuccessText: Rebeccah beams at you. She seems pleased, though perhaps a bit surprised. You did it! Rebeccah hands you a ceremonial badge. You're a student of Tennenbrandt University now!

quest_29002.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "Let's begin your study with a warm-up. Why don't you use your Song of Discord in combat with, hm, let's say... 50 enemies. You needn't slay them SOLELY via Song of Discord, though. That's a later lesson! Just use the ability on them prior to defeating them."
quest_29002.Name: The Deadliness of Discordance

Objectives.Description: Use Song of Discord on Enemies

quest_29002.PrefaceText: Let's begin your study with a warm-up. Why don't you use your Song of Discord in combat with, hm, let's say... 50 enemies. You needn't slay them SOLELY via Song of Discord, though. That's a later lesson! Just use the ability on them prior to defeating them.
quest_29002.SuccessText: You look warmed up! Warmed by the power of disharmony!

quest_29003.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "Another easy one: practice your Thunderous Note on 50 enemies and then kill them. Pay attention to the efficacy of the note on different types of enemies."
quest_29003.Name: The Power of Volume
quest_29003.PrefaceText: Another easy one: practice your Thunderous Note on 50 enemies and then kill them. Pay attention to the efficacy of the note on different types of enemies.
quest_29003.SuccessText: Good. What did you learn from all those loud notes? Write me a short essay. Actually, write that essay and then self-grade it; I'm quite busy.

quest_29004.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "Ballads performed at taverns are for the posers. Real bards can create ballads while fighting to the death. Good ballads, too! Keep practicing at it until you get the hang of it. [Use Virtuoso's Ballad while fighting level 80+ enemies.]"
quest_29004.Name: In-Field Ballads

Objectives.Description: Use Virtuoso's Ballad While Fighting Level 60+ Enemies

quest_29004.PrefaceText: Ballads performed at taverns are for the posers. Real bards can create ballads while fighting to the death. Good ballads, too! Keep practicing at it until you get the hang of it. [Use Virtuoso's Ballad while fighting level 80+ enemies.]
quest_29004.SuccessText: Throat parched? Sounds like you're finally getting the hang of it!

quest_29005.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "Of course, you must know how to revive the recently-incapacitated. Have you mastered the technique yet? Here: this practice lute may help. "
quest_29005.Name: Life-Giving Music

Objectives.Description: Use Hymn of Resurrection on Players

quest_29005.PrefaceText: Of course, you must know how to revive the recently-incapacitated. Have you mastered the technique yet? Here: this practice lute may help.
quest_29005.SuccessText: You've saved lives! How does that feel? Bardic? There's more where that came from!

quest_29006.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "I know your type: a book learner. You've read about how to muster up a Moment of Resolve and you think you're special. But let's see you create a Moment of Resolve under real danger conditions!"
quest_29006.Name: Being Steadfast in a Crisis

Objectives.Description: Use Moment of Resolve During Combat With Elites 50+

quest_29006.PrefaceText: I know your type: a book learner. You've read about how to muster up a Moment of Resolve and you think you're special. But let's see you create a Moment of Resolve under real danger conditions!
quest_29006.SuccessText: Hmm. Well, I guess you did pretty well.

quest_29007.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "It's crucial that you can push an opponent off-kilter with just an entrancing ditty. Go and practice on reasonably-dangerous opponents."
quest_29007.Name: Entrancement Practice

Objectives.Description: Use Entrancing Lullaby on Enemies Level 60+ and then Defeat Them

quest_29007.PrefaceText: It's crucial that you can push an opponent off-kilter with just an entrancing ditty. Go and practice on reasonably-dangerous opponents.
quest_29007.SuccessText: Did you learn a lot from that? Just busywork? Hmph.

quest_29008.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "You've got the basics. Let's get to specifics. You need to know how to blast apart a demon! So go do that. Do it for quite a while and take note of what works and what doesn't. I'll give you a quiz afterwards."
quest_29008.Name: Demon Blasting
quest_29008.PrefaceText: You've got the basics. Let's get to specifics. You need to know how to blast apart a demon! So go do that. Do it for quite a while and take note of what works and what doesn't. I'll give you a quiz afterwards.
quest_29008.SuccessText:
Really? You got all fifty demons? Huh. That was much faster than I expected. I haven't even written up your quiz yet!

We can skip it for now, but remember what you learned! I'll give you a pop quiz later.

quest_29009.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "Well you still haven't been forced to do ANY of the supremely difficult things we had to do when I was a student! You think you're so great, huh? Let's see you pull this off: kill enemies with Disharmony. And not harmless enemies either! Just be careful: this test is no joke. [Disharmony must be the killing blow to get credit. Dying will reset your progress.]"
quest_29009.Name: Unharmonious Antics

Objectives.Description: Kill Level 50+ Enemies with Disharmony. Don't die!

quest_29009.PrefaceText: Well you still haven't been forced to do ANY of the supremely difficult things we had to do when I was a student! You think you're so great, huh? Let's see you pull this off: kill enemies with Disharmony. And not harmless enemies either! Just be careful: this test is no joke. [Disharmony must be the killing blow to get credit. Dying will reset your progress.]
quest_29009.SuccessText: Oh come on! You seriously used Disharmony to kill 30 fiends? That's... Well, that's impressive. Good work.

quest_29010.Description:
Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "You can't be this good. I don't know what your game is, but nobody completes these courses this quickly!

I suppose you're ready for a REAL challenge, then! Um, finish enemies off with bardic blasts. But they have to be sentient enemies! And at night! And you can't wear a hat! And don't die!"
quest_29010.Name: Relentless Bardification

Objectives.Description: Hatless Nighttime Level 70+ Sentient Blast Kills. Don't die!

quest_29010.PrefaceText:
You can't be this good. I don't know what your game is, but nobody completes these courses this quickly!

I suppose you're ready for a REAL challenge, then! Um, finish enemies off with bardic blasts. But they have to be sentient enemies! And at night! And you can't wear a hat! And don't die!
quest_29010.SuccessText: Okay. I'll admit it. I'm out of coursework. I think you know nearly as much as me!

quest_29011.Description:
Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "My friend, I must reveal something. I am smitten by Anaberyl! At first I told myself that I was simply looking out for an incredible musician who was in a bad spot. But I haven't ever felt this way before about anyone! She's so... Perfect.

I need you to feel her out for me. I can't do it because she'll feel obligated toward me! That would break my heart -- I don't want to pressure her at all. So just ask if she'd ever be interested in dating a human, if the human was an incredible musician like her."
quest_29011.Name: The Beautiful Anaberyl
quest_29011.PrefaceText:
My friend, I must reveal something. I am smitten by Anaberyl! At first I told myself that I was simply looking out for an incredible musician who was in a bad spot. But I haven't ever felt this way before about anyone! She's so... Perfect.

I need you to feel her out for me. I can't do it because she'll feel obligated toward me! That would break my heart -- I don't want to pressure her at all. So just ask if she'd ever be interested in dating a human, if the human was an incredible musician like her.
quest_29011.SuccessText:
You talked to Anaberyl? What did she say?

You learned a way that I can date her? What does that mean? Why are you being so vague?

I trust you, my friend. I hope you know what you're doing.

quest_29012.Description: Ormond Neth in Statehelm said, "I need your discretion. I cannot be seen talking to my father right now. It would draw attention. Can you deliver this note to him for me? To find my father, follow the bread smell -- he works at the only remaining bakery in Statehelm."
quest_29012.MidwayText:
Sigh... Ormond and his damned codes! Let me see... ah. Tell him thanks for nothing, I already learned that earlier this morning.

And tell him his code system needs work: it's too obviously a code! I think the code message should read like a bakery order. Wouldn't that be clever? Why couldn't he have been clever like his sister Laura? Ask him that.
quest_29012.Name: Delivering Portents to the Baker
quest_29012.PrefaceText: I need your discretion. I cannot be seen talking to my father right now. It would draw attention. Can you deliver this note to him for me? To find my father, follow the bread smell -- he works at the only remaining bakery in Statehelm.
quest_29012.SuccessText:
A code system that reads as a bakery order? The worst part is that it's a good idea. But tell him that he should have had that idea to start with, because it's too late now! The code system is IN USE. Tell him discussions on... No, sorry, I'm getting side tracked. He always brings that out of me.

I can tell he's not taking the news well -- he's always an extra-big asshole when he's stressed out. I can't really do anything more for him from here. But if you wanted to help him, I'd appreciate it.

He's a mediocre father, but he does love his kids. And the bakery is everything to him.

quest_29021.Description:
Rebeccah the Whisperer in Statehelm gave you a note that said, "Congratulations! I knew you were an advanced student when I heard your song.

I can no longer sing, but in my dreams I still can. When I wake, my throat is quite sore. Can you fetch some bitter-mint tea for me?"
quest_29021.Name: Bitter-Mint Tea
quest_29021.PrefaceText: Rebeccah scribbles a note: Congratulations! I knew you were an advanced student when I heard your song. I can no longer sing, but in my dreams I still can. When I wake, my throat is quite sore. Can you fetch some bitter-mint tea for me?
quest_29021.SuccessText: Rebeccah takes the tea, sips, and grimaces at the bitterness. Then she smiles thanks.

quest_29041.Description:
Leon Dasterre in Statehelm said, "Ah, so you're an Advanced Student already! My, time flies. It seems only yesterday that you enrolled.

My next lecture will cover bardic surgery techniques. For my demonstration I need some supplies. Can you fetch them for me? Very good. Goodbye."
quest_29041.Name: The Healing Presentation
quest_29041.PrefaceText:
Ah, so you're an Advanced Student already! My, time flies. It seems only yesterday that you enrolled.

My next lecture will cover bardic surgery techniques. For my demonstration I need some supplies. Can you fetch them for me? Very good. Goodbye.

quest_29042.Description: Leon Dasterre in Statehelm said, "That ass! Guzor from the mage's guild has once again chosen to belittle our school in front of the Council Sub-Commander. I've given up on convincing that conceited fool of the power of song magic. I've wasted a year trying! I understand now that mere words are not up to this task. Ormond is good at mind work -- explain the situation to him and come up with a solution."
quest_29042.MidwayText: Leon wants to... what? To charm a grand-wizard? That would work for a day or two, and then someone there would realize he's under a charm. No, no. Tell Leon that mind-work isn't what he wants here. I mean, really! The only technique that might work would be the Geas of Mild Yet Unrelenting Affection, which is quite an intricate performance. And, I should remind both of you: EXTREMELY illegal, and VERY immoral. Abandon this idea. Use words! Bards are good at words!
quest_29042.Name: Mind Work, pt 1
quest_29042.PrefaceText: That ass! Guzor from the mage's guild has once again chosen to belittle our school in front of the Council Sub-Commander. I've given up on convincing that conceited fool of the power of song magic. I've wasted a year trying! I understand now that mere words are not up to this task. Ormond is good at mind work -- explain the situation to him and come up with a solution.
quest_29042.SuccessText: He said we need the Geas of ... Let me write this down. The Geas of Mild Yet Unrelenting Affection? Very well. I'll head to the basement and research the necessary performance.

quest_29043.Description:
Leon Dasterre in Statehelm said, "I've received word from my Unora. She's my eyes inside the mage's school, and she says that Guzor is pestering the Sub-Commander to remove me from the Sub-Council on City Defense. This goes beyond politics. This man so fears bardic magic that he would cut us out of the city. He knows that his magic cannot heal -- it can only destroy. And so he aims to destroy us. We, in turn, must heal! Heal the rift in the Sub-Council on City Defense!

Of course, I was hesitant to use charm magic. But the surgery we must perform requires it. We healers know that sometimes a patient calls for a difficult procedure. A dangerous one. So summon your courage: the city needs us!

Here is a list of necessities for the Geas that Ormond recommended."
quest_29043.Name: Mind Work, pt 2
quest_29043.PrefaceText:
I've received word from my Unora. She's my eyes inside the mage's school, and she says that Guzor is pestering the Sub-Commander to remove me from the Sub-Council on City Defense. This goes beyond politics. This man so fears bardic magic that he would cut us out of the city. He knows that his magic cannot heal -- it can only destroy. And so he aims to destroy us. We, in turn, must heal! Heal the rift in the Sub-Council on City Defense!

Of course, I was hesitant to use charm magic. But the surgery we must perform requires it. We healers know that sometimes a patient calls for a difficult procedure. A dangerous one. So summon your courage: the city needs us!

Here is a list of necessities for the Geas that Ormond recommended.
quest_29043.SuccessText: You've done well. As a reward I shall let you help me see this grim work to its conclusion.

quest_29044.Description: Leon Dasterre in Statehelm said, "I despise Malgath Croonswallow. Who is he, you ask? The long-dead ass who created this Geas of Mild Yet Unrelenting Affection! This has been quite a tedious and inane procedure. But it is done. Here: I've prepared the enchanted horn full of vindaloo. Now you need merely convince Alzaneth to eat it. Just a single bite will do!"
quest_29044.MidwayText: What is this? I don't remember ordering lunch. Is this a prank? No matter. I'll give it to Skitters. Go.
quest_29044.Name: Mind Work, pt 3
quest_29044.PrefaceText: I despise Malgath Croonswallow. Who is he, you ask? The long-dead ass who created this Geas of Mild Yet Unrelenting Affection! This has been quite a tedious and inane procedure. But it is done. Here: I've prepared the enchanted horn full of vindaloo. Now you need merely convince Alzaneth to eat it. Just a single bite will do!
quest_29044.SuccessText: He didn't eat it? Ah well, that was too much to hope for. But he did touch it. That's really all that's necessary. The next step will take some time, but we are well on our way. And not a word to anyone about this. Remember, you've done something very illegal here.

quest_29045.Description:
Leon Dasterre in Statehelm said, "The reason Ormond recommended this particular obscure bardic technique is that it can be performed without the victim being present. The vindaloo will connect you to him. Oh, yes, you'll be the one performing the Geas! It's quite an honor, really. This sort of technique is usually kept locked away, but you're getting hands-on experience with it!

Wait until the full moon. That's the only time this will work. Then eat the vindaloo -- oh, you will need more vindaloo for this -- and dance in such a way as to twist his mind toward affection. Don't worry about the particulars; let your hips do the thinking. Then simply shake his hand."
quest_29045.MidwayText: Why are you shaking my hand? Wait, is that vindaloo I smell on your breath? You're the creepy curry courier from the other day. What are you up to?
quest_29045.Name: Mind Work, pt 4

Objectives.Description: Eat Bland Mutton Vindaloo During Full Moon

quest_29045.PrefaceText:
The reason Ormond recommended this particular obscure bardic technique is that it can be performed without the victim being present. The vindaloo will connect you to him. Oh, yes, you'll be the one performing the Geas! It's quite an honor, really. This sort of technique is usually kept locked away, but you're getting hands-on experience with it!

Wait until the full moon. That's the only time this will work. Then eat the vindaloo -- oh, you will need more vindaloo for this -- and dance in such a way as to twist his mind toward affection. Don't worry about the particulars; let your hips do the thinking. Then simply shake his hand.
quest_29045.SuccessText: It's complete? Well well well. That should put an end to his incessant interference on the Sub-Council. You've done an admirable job.

quest_29061.Description: Anaberyl in Statehelm said, "My next class will cover natural percussive sounds. I just need a bit of help with the props!"
quest_29061.Name: Exotic Sounds
quest_29061.PrefaceText: My next class will cover natural percussive sounds. I just need a bit of help with the props!
quest_29061.SuccessText: Thank you so much! These mortal beast remains will make my talk so much more engaging!

quest_29062.Description: Anaberyl in Statehelm said, "Okay. So these are the ingredients I need for the genital transmogrification potion. Bring these to me and I'll brew it up!"
quest_29062.Name: Anaberyl's Scheme
quest_29062.PrefaceText: Okay. So these are the ingredients I need for the genital transmogrification potion. Bring these to me and I'll brew it up!
quest_29062.SuccessText:
Perfect! I'll brew it up right now.

And stop worrying! This is a good plan!

Just one sec...

quest_29063.Description: Anaberyl in Statehelm said, "Here! Take this dreadful-smelling potion and tell Ormond that it will restructure his genitals, and it's the only way to ever be with me. When he refuses, tell him that you understand. Then come back and tell me how it went!"
quest_29063.MidwayText: What's this? Oh, I see. Anaberyl put you up to this, didn't she? Give that to me. [Ormond snatches the potion and drinks it down.] It's working... It's... Wait, it's changing my... Oh my. I thought it would just shrink my... uh, I should have asked for the fine print on this potion, eh? Ha ha! Hah. Listen, tell Anaberyl i drank it down without hesitation, okay? I know fairies have their bizarre mating rituals, and... I think she's worth it. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to go freak out.
quest_29063.Name: Anaberyl's Scheme, Pt. 2
quest_29063.PrefaceText: Here! Take this dreadful-smelling potion and tell Ormond that it will restructure his genitals, and it's the only way to ever be with me. When he refuses, tell him that you understand. Then come back and tell me how it went!
quest_29063.SuccessText: He DRANK IT?! You were supposed to keep it out of his reach! What the fuck did you do?! You made this so much worse!

quest_29064.Description:
Anaberyl in Statehelm said, "I've underestimated Ormond. And I need to apologize to him for that. So when I talk to him, I'd like to offer a gift. Can you get it for me?

His favorite flower is the desert rose. A  bouquet of them would help show my feelings."
quest_29064.Name: Anaberyl's Scheme, Pt. 3
quest_29064.PrefaceText:
I've underestimated Ormond. And I need to apologize to him for that. So when I talk to him, I'd like to offer a gift. Can you get it for me?

His favorite flower is the desert rose. A  bouquet of them would help show my feelings.
quest_29064.SuccessText:
These are beautiful! Well, personally I've never loved the desert rose; they're a bit weedy for my taste. But these are very nice examples of the species!

I think Ormond will like it. He'll breathe in their aroma, and he'll smile.

Thank you. I'll present these to him tonight.

quest_29101.Description: Guzor Harrison in Statehelm said, "There are two requirements to join the Statehelm School of Magic. First, you'll also need to get recommendations from wizards that I trust. Here are some names. Get at least three to sign off on your competence. Oh, and don't bother trying to forge these letters. If they agree to recommend you, these good folks will know how to contact me directly. The following wizards can provide recommendations: The Sand Seer, Bendith the Banished, Velkort the Inferno, Ichin the Ice Master, Landri the Cold."
quest_29101.Name: Wizard School Recommendations
quest_29101.PrefaceText: There are two requirements to join the Statehelm School of Magic. First, you'll also need to get recommendations from wizards that I trust. Here are some names. Get at least three to sign off on your competence. Oh, and don't bother trying to forge these letters. If they agree to recommend you, these good folks will know how to contact me directly. The following wizards can provide recommendations: The Sand Seer, Bendith the Banished, Velkort the Inferno, Ichin the Ice Master, Landri the Cold.
quest_29101.SuccessText: I must say I'm surprised that you got the recommendations! They must see something in you that I can't. Well, that's half the entrance requirements done.

quest_29102.Description: Guzor Harrison in Statehelm said, "In addition to getting three recommendations, you'll also need to pass a simple trial. Scattered near the university are three statuettes. Find them, activate them, and defeat their guardians. Hopefully you can manage something as simple as that."
quest_29102.Name: Wizard School Hands-On Exam
quest_29102.PrefaceText: In addition to getting three recommendations, you'll also need to pass a simple trial. Scattered near the university are three statuettes. Find them, activate them, and defeat their guardians. Hopefully you can manage something as simple as that.
quest_29102.SuccessText: You've defeated the guardians. That's half of the entrance requirements done.

quest_29103.Description:
Guzor Harrison in Statehelm said, "I'm working on an extremely interesting new spell, and to further my research, I need special reagents.

What I need are bones that have been superheated while still in the body of a living creature. Don't worry, I've researched just the right spell to help you get these -- I'll teach you the spell, when you have the capacity to learn it.

Once you know the spell, use it on some humans, elves, or rakshasa to collect perfectly charred femurs. ... And make sure to only kill those deserving of death. Obviously."
quest_29103.Name: Charred Femurs
quest_29103.PrefaceText:
I'm working on an extremely interesting new spell, and to further my research, I need special reagents.

What I need are bones that have been superheated while still in the body of a living creature. Don't worry, I've researched just the right spell to help you get these -- I'll teach you the spell, when you have the capacity to learn it.

Once you know the spell, use it on some humans, elves, or rakshasa to collect perfectly charred femurs. ... And make sure to only kill those deserving of death. Obviously.
quest_29103.SuccessText: Black as soot and twice as sooty. These will help me find the perfect ratios for my new spell.

quest_29104.Description:
Guzor Harrison in Statehelm said, "Work on my new spell continues. I suppose I will share the premise with you: it is a new kind of sentient flame, much more suitable to certain types of work.

But there is much research left. You seem competent enough to help with that research. Here's what I need you to do. Go find some rakshasa bandits, or pirates, or other socially undesirables, and kill them with fire. This next bit is very important: they need to die from the impact of a Scintillating Flame.

As you bury them, note whether they have a startled expression on their face."
quest_29104.Name: Scintillated Rakshasa Skulls
quest_29104.PrefaceText:
Work on my new spell continues. I suppose I will share the premise with you: it is a new kind of sentient flame, much more suitable to certain types of work.

But there is much research left. You seem competent enough to help with that research. Here's what I need you to do. Go find some rakshasa bandits, or pirates, or other socially undesirables, and kill them with fire. This next bit is very important: they need to die from the impact of a Scintillating Flame.

As you bury them, note whether they have a startled expression on their face.
quest_29104.SuccessText:
These are your research notes? Terse... But sufficient. I see my hypothesis was correct: nobody expects to die from a Scintillating Flame. It's just too shiny to be scary. Perhaps we can use that.

I have more research for you when you're ready.

quest_29105.Description: Guzor Harrison in Statehelm said, "Next I need to better understand how demons are so resistant to fire. Go and kill some of the medium-sized ones. Oh, and wear this. It will automatically take detailed field notes. [To advance this quest you must be wearing the Fire Analysis Gem and using Fire Magic.]"
quest_29105.Name: Demon Resistance Analysis
quest_29105.PrefaceText: Next I need to better understand how demons are so resistant to fire. Go and kill some of the medium-sized ones. Oh, and wear this. It will automatically take detailed field notes. [To advance this quest you must be wearing the Fire Analysis Gem and using Fire Magic.]
quest_29105.SuccessText:
Let me see the gem. Hmm. Very good. Wait... You didn't enable the gem's aggressive protection mode. Did I not teach you the cantrip for that? Well, nevermind. Here: I've enabled it for you. Perhaps it'll be useful to you now that it's turned on.

I also have a new spell that I am willing to teach you.

quest_29121.Description: Sir Brooker in Statehelm said, "We've got two raw new recruits today. You think you're good with a sword, why not show them how it's done? Take apart one of these training dummies with a sword. [You must have the Sword skill active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29121.Name: Dummy Demonstration
quest_29121.PrefaceText: We've got two raw new recruits today. You think you're good with a sword, why not show them how it's done? Take apart one of these training dummies with a sword. [You must have the Sword skill active to advance this quest.]
quest_29121.SuccessText: That's precisely how it's done! But are you a one-trick goblin?

quest_29122.Description: Sir Brooker in Statehelm said, "That was impressive with the sword. But can you destroy a dummy WITHOUT a sword? Let's see your versatility! [You must NOT have the Sword skill active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29122.Name: Dummy Demonstration 2
quest_29122.PrefaceText: That was impressive with the sword. But can you destroy a dummy WITHOUT a sword? Let's see your versatility! [You must NOT have the Sword skill active to advance this quest.]
quest_29122.SuccessText: You're scarily effective. But it's the good kind of scary!

quest_29123.Description: Sir Brooker in Statehelm said, "Okay, I think you've proven yourself. But here's one more challenge that's just for fun. Can you take out a dummy with a shield and your fists? [You must have the Shield and Unarmed skills active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29123.Name: Dummy Demonstration 3
quest_29123.PrefaceText: Okay, I think you've proven yourself. But here's one more challenge that's just for fun. Can you take out a dummy with a shield and your fists? [You must have the Shield and Unarmed skills active to advance this quest.]
quest_29123.SuccessText: Hahaha! Nice work. Okay, you've done enough showing off for today.

quest_29124.Description: Sir Brooker in Statehelm said, "Are you headed back out to Vidaria soon? You should look into something for me. There used to be a battle polo team in the city. It's been gone for a long time. But there was a contest where you could find a ceremonial sword in Vidaria, called the Vanquisher's Blade, which would automatically get you on the team roster. I found some clues about it while I was stationed out there but never found the thing. I'd love to have one as a keepsake. I'll pay you well for it, if you find it! [Note: completing this quest will sell the blade to Sir Brooker. If you wish to keep the blade you should cancel this quest.]"
quest_29124.Name: The Vanquisher's Blade
quest_29124.PrefaceText: Are you headed back out to Vidaria soon? You should look into something for me. There used to be a battle polo team in the city. It's been gone for a long time. But there was a contest where you could find a ceremonial sword in Vidaria, called the Vanquisher's Blade, which would automatically get you on the team roster. I found some clues about it while I was stationed out there but never found the thing. I'd love to have one as a keepsake. I'll pay you well for it, if you find it! [Note: completing this quest will sell the blade to Sir Brooker. If you wish to keep the blade you should cancel this quest.]
quest_29124.SuccessText: Aha! You know, these swords are a piece of history. The Vanquishers had had three awful seasons and fans were leaving, so they set up this competition. But filling out your roster via a treasure hunt led to an impressively bad year, the wost in the league's history, ending the team. And with only four other teams, the entire sport sort of fell apart. I caught some games as a kid. I wish I'd been an adult for this contest. It would have been fun, even on a terrible team!

quest_29141.Description:
Unora Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "I'm much too busy to train you personally. But I've prepared something for you. Go and visit my old training ground in Gazluk. I've left training programs there, and I'll walk you through them via sending stone.

How would you find the camp? Let me think. It's on the plateau. There's a useless lookout tower somewhat nearby. From the camp you can look down over the cliff and see a lot of trees. Does that narrow it down? You'll know you're in the right place when you see iron dodecahedrons hammered into the cold earth. There'll be a building with a sending stone; contact me from there."
quest_29141.MidwayText: Head to Gazluk and find my old training grounds. Don't worry, it's can't be too hard to find: I sent a student there just a month ago. She abandoned her training quite quickly, but she DID find the training grounds first. If that dullard could find it, surely you can.
quest_29141.Name: The Training Camp

Objectives.Description: Find the Sending Stone in Gazluk

quest_29141.PrefaceText:
I'm much too busy to train you personally. But I've prepared something for you. Go and visit my old training ground in Gazluk. I've left training programs there, and I'll walk you through them via sending stone.

How would you find the camp? Let me think. It's on the plateau. There's a useless lookout tower somewhat nearby. From the camp you can look down over the cliff and see a lot of trees. Does that narrow it down? You'll know you're in the right place when you see iron dodecahedrons hammered into the cold earth. There'll be a building with a sending stone; contact me from there.
quest_29141.SuccessText: Hello? Yes, good. You found it.

quest_29142.Description: Unora's sending stone in Gazluk said, "Why don't we start with some target practice. When hitting multiple enemies, the ideal number to hit is three. But sometimes it's necessary to hit more. Try different densities and study the difference. There's a metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 1'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]"
quest_29142.MidwayText: Go on, get some target practice in.
quest_29142.Name: Burst Practice

Objectives.Description: Use Ice Magic on 3 Targets at Once
Use Ice Magic on 4 Targets at Once
Use Ice Magic on 5 Targets at Once
Use Ice Magic on 6 Targets at Once

quest_29142.PrefaceText: Why don't we start with some target practice. When hitting multiple enemies, the ideal number to hit is three. But sometimes it's necessary to hit more. Try different densities and study the difference. There's a metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 1'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]
quest_29142.SuccessText: Warmed up? Good. Let's try something challenging.

quest_29143.Description: Unora's sending stone in Gazluk said, "Ice Magic is well known for granting its users resilience. Let's make sure you understand this concept well. There's a metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 2'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]"
quest_29143.MidwayText: Go on, get some target practice in.
quest_29143.Name: Horde Resistance
quest_29143.PrefaceText: Ice Magic is well known for granting its users resilience. Let's make sure you understand this concept well. There's a metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 2'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]

quest_29144.Description: Unora's sending stone in Gazluk said, "Now let's focus on common Ice Magic deficiencies. Frostbite is an overlooked but very valuable tool in your aresenal. Use it on some tougher enemies. Return to the metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 3'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]"
quest_29144.Name: Frostbite Training

Objectives.Description: Use Frostbite on Fire Elementals, then kill them. Don't die!

quest_29144.PrefaceText: Now let's focus on common Ice Magic deficiencies. Frostbite is an overlooked but very valuable tool in your aresenal. Use it on some tougher enemies. Return to the metal dodecahedron outside. Stand in it and say 'Ossugazak 3'. This will activate a training program. Be prepared. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]
quest_29144.SuccessText: Your work is adequate. ... Honestly, it's quite a bit more than adequate, I'm forced to admit.

quest_29145.Description: Unora's sending stone in Gazluk said, "I have a syllabus that would keep you busy for months. I was told to make sure you "got your Councils' worth" from your tuition! But in your case, that would just be wasting both of our time. Don't you agree? Let's skip ahead to the end. Return to the metal dodecahedron outside, say 'Ossugazak 99', and kill them with Ice Magic. Don't die. This is your final exam. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]"
quest_29145.Name: Skipping to the End of Training
quest_29145.PrefaceText: I have a syllabus that would keep you busy for months. I was told to make sure you "got your Councils' worth" from your tuition! But in your case, that would just be wasting both of our time. Don't you agree? Let's skip ahead to the end. Return to the metal dodecahedron outside, say 'Ossugazak 99', and kill them with Ice Magic. Don't die. This is your final exam. [Must use Ice Magic to advance this quest.]
quest_29145.SuccessText: I'm not surprised anymore, but I'm impressed.

quest_29146.Description: Unora's sending stone in Gazluk said, "I think that about does it. Come see me in Statehelm."
quest_29146.Name: Returning Triumphant From Training
quest_29146.PrefaceText: I think that about does it. Come see me in Statehelm.
quest_29146.SuccessText: I have some notes on your performance. First, you were unfocused in your abjurations. And generally quite messy with your magic. Second... oh, who am I kidding, you did fine. I can make up some issues, but these are minor quibbles. Most students can't complete my course at all. And a not-insignificant number die. So when I grade you on that curve, your effort is extraordinary! Well done.

quest_29161.Description: Strom Farblood in Statehelm said, "I know you understand the basics of alchemy, but you'll need to understand more than just the basics before I can teach you with a clean conscience. I need to know that you can safely handle dangerous substances, can source exotic ingredients, and can make a palatable potion. I'll teach you an alchemical formula, you make it and bring it to me. I drink it. Easy as that."
quest_29161.MidwayText:
Make me a Latent Warmth Potion. If I like the results, I'll be willing to train you.

Not for cheap, mind -- my lessons are exorbitant by human standards. Which is not my concern.
quest_29161.Name: Alchemical Safety Test
quest_29161.PrefaceText: I know you understand the basics of alchemy, but you'll need to understand more than just the basics before I can teach you with a clean conscience. I need to know that you can safely handle dangerous substances, can source exotic ingredients, and can make a palatable potion. I'll teach you an alchemical formula, you make it and bring it to me. I drink it. Easy as that.
quest_29161.SuccessText:
This is your result? Well, it's chunkier than I would prefer... And perhaps a bit too warm. But I'll drink it.

...

Well, I can feel the heat in my innards, and I didn't die. So you pass.

quest_29181.Description: Alzaneth in Statehelm said, "You want me to train you in Weather Witching? Well... I'm flattered, but I'm hardly the most qualified instructor. Though I suppose if even MY meager skills are above yours, I should help you out of the doldrums of mediocrity. But it will take time, and I'm only visiting for a short while. Why don't you run an errand for me? That will free up some time to give you lessons. I've heard there's an old gale-chanting spot. I'm not sure where it is exactly, but it's on a hill overlooking a lake. There can't be that many lakes, right? You'll know you're in the right spot by the breeze you feel. I've heard that if you summon a sandstorm while standing there, it will attract a young breeze elemental right to you! Most aren't native to this realm, but something about the winds in the Ilmari allow them to be born. Quite unusual! So anyway, it will find you in seconds. Kill it and get its heart. Don't worry: most wind elementals that grow up here end up insane anyway, so you're doing it a favor, maybe. After you get that heart, you should definitely leave very quickly, though. Larger wind elementals will be attracted, too, and noone can fight a hurricane."
