quest_29181.MidwayText: Yes, as I said, if you bring me the heart of a young free-range sand elemental, I'll teach you what I can.
quest_29181.Name: The Heart of a Tiny Storm
quest_29181.PrefaceText: You want me to train you in Weather Witching? Well... I'm flattered, but I'm hardly the most qualified instructor. Though I suppose if even MY meager skills are above yours, I should help you out of the doldrums of mediocrity. But it will take time, and I'm only visiting for a short while. Why don't you run an errand for me? That will free up some time to give you lessons. I've heard there's an old gale-chanting spot. I'm not sure where it is exactly, but it's on a hill overlooking a lake. There can't be that many lakes, right? You'll know you're in the right spot by the breeze you feel. I've heard that if you summon a sandstorm while standing there, it will attract a young breeze elemental right to you! Most aren't native to this realm, but something about the winds in the Ilmari allow them to be born. Quite unusual! So anyway, it will find you in seconds. Kill it and get its heart. Don't worry: most wind elementals that grow up here end up insane anyway, so you're doing it a favor, maybe. After you get that heart, you should definitely leave very quickly, though. Larger wind elementals will be attracted, too, and noone can fight a hurricane.
quest_29181.SuccessText:
You killed it! Oh, now you've made me feel guilty.

I was told to get this heart for my instructor back home, but I couldn't bring myself to kill a wind spirit. So I made you do it! That was cruel of me, but kind of you. In return, I'll teach you what I can. Some of my lessons will be hands-on, though. I need to teach you the way I was taught.

quest_29182.Description:
Alzaneth in Statehelm said, "I found reference to another gale-chanting spot, and this one is right outside of Statehelm! Unfortunately, it's underwater. I suppose the waterline has moved since it was first made. So hold your breath and look for it past the docks. Summon a tornado there, and you should be able to access an unusual weather form. Kill it and get its heart.

And then you should run. It might have a guardian itself, and you wouldn't want to run into that."
quest_29182.MidwayText: Yes, as I said, if you bring me the heart of a young free-range sand elemental, I'll teach you what I can.
quest_29182.Name: The Heart of a Wet Twister
quest_29182.PrefaceText:
I found reference to another gale-chanting spot, and this one is right outside of Statehelm! Unfortunately, it's underwater. I suppose the waterline has moved since it was first made. So hold your breath and look for it past the docks. Summon a tornado there, and you should be able to access an unusual weather form. Kill it and get its heart.

And then you should run. It might have a guardian itself, and you wouldn't want to run into that.
quest_29182.SuccessText:
Siiigh... Once again I've used you to kill a creature that I wasn't able to kill. Am I weak? Perhaps. But delegating tasks you're unable to do yourself is top-tier delegation. And I'm a delegate. So I think I'm doing pretty well, actually.

... I'm sorry. And thanks.

quest_29183.Description: Alzaneth in Statehelm said, "I need you to collect one more unusual wind-heart for me. You'll find the gale-chanting spot in Povus, near water. Summon a tornado there, and you should find a swampy wind. I need its heart. After you kill it, run quickly. You know why by now."
quest_29183.MidwayText: Yes, as I said, if you bring me the heart of a young free-range sand elemental, I'll teach you what I can.
quest_29183.Name: The Heart of a Swampy Spout
quest_29183.PrefaceText: I need you to collect one more unusual wind-heart for me. You'll find the gale-chanting spot in Povus, near water. Summon a tornado there, and you should find a swampy wind. I need its heart. After you kill it, run quickly. You know why by now.
quest_29183.SuccessText: Thank you. I have asked something cruel of you, and I recognize that. In exchange, I will teach you the most secretive weather witching secrets I know.

quest_29191.Description:
Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "A soldier told me a very peculiar tale yesterday, and I think I know what's going on. But it's too dangerous for me to investigate! Can you do it?

The soldier said she was in Vidaria, fighting back demons, when she saw a big slab of steak lying in one of the demon craters. She said the meat was sentient, and that when she investigated, it attacked her and fended her off.

I bet that steak is still out there in one of those craters. Can you bring it to me?"
quest_29191.Name: Rumors of Sentient Beef

Objectives.Description: Kill the steak and take its gristle

quest_29191.PrefaceText:
A soldier told me a very peculiar tale yesterday, and I think I know what's going on. But it's too dangerous for me to investigate! Can you do it?

The soldier said she was in Vidaria, fighting back demons, when she saw a big slab of steak lying in one of the demon craters. She said the meat was sentient, and that when she investigated, it attacked her and fended her off.

I bet that steak is still out there in one of those craters. Can you bring it to me?
quest_29191.SuccessText: So it was true about the steak. I think I know what's going on. Thank you for your efforts! If you have more time, you could stop by this evening and help me investigate this gristle further. [New Hang Out Available.]

quest_29192.Description:
Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "Here's the story I was told: a traveler had stopped at the old inn in Vidaria. It's mostly abandoned, but it's still got a sturdy roof, and it was raining. While it rained, he cooked an incredible piece of beef on the stove.

Just as he was adding some unusual herbs he'd found, a bolt of lightning struck the chimney! The traveler avoided harm, but the piece of steak was blasted and blackened. And then... he says the steak got up and tried to kill him, so he ran out into the night rain.

I hadn't put too much faith in his story, but we should see if it's true.

Go to the inn in Vidaria and recreate the same situation by burning some high-quality beef. I'll give you precise instructions.

Oh and be prepared to defend yourself."
quest_29192.Name: Reenacting the Beef Incident

Objectives.Description: Burn Steak at Inn in Vidaria

quest_29192.PrefaceText:
Here's the story I was told: a traveler had stopped at the old inn in Vidaria. It's mostly abandoned, but it's still got a sturdy roof, and it was raining. While it rained, he cooked an incredible piece of beef on the stove.

Just as he was adding some unusual herbs he'd found, a bolt of lightning struck the chimney! The traveler avoided harm, but the piece of steak was blasted and blackened. And then... he says the steak got up and tried to kill him, so he ran out into the night rain.

I hadn't put too much faith in his story, but we should see if it's true.

Go to the inn in Vidaria and recreate the same situation by burning some high-quality beef. I'll give you precise instructions.

Oh and be prepared to defend yourself.
quest_29192.SuccessText: And then slabs of meat jumped out at you? It's as I feared. I heard a third anecdote recently. I probably should have led with this one. It's a complicated story, so stop by to see me tonight and I'll explain. [New Hang Out Available.]

quest_29193.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "Most of my customers are out-of-town orders. Quite expensive stuff. Say! You wouldn' t be interested in helping me fill some orders, would you? Like this one for skulls and brains?"
quest_29193.Name: A Bit of This, A Bit of That
quest_29193.PrefaceText: Most of my customers are out-of-town orders. Quite expensive stuff. Say! You wouldn' t be interested in helping me fill some orders, would you? Like this one for skulls and brains?
quest_29193.SuccessText: It looks like you know your way around an organ knife. I could use someone like you! On a contractual basis, of course. Here's the pay for this one. I have more requests if you have time.

quest_29194.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "Here's an order from a craniologist. I need skulls of a specific quality."
quest_29194.Name: Impressive!
quest_29194.PrefaceText: Here's an order from a craniologist. I need skulls of a specific quality.
quest_29194.SuccessText: Reasonably impressive work! See what I did there? Do you get it? Nevermind. Here.

quest_29195.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "The craniologist loved the skulls and ordered another batch! These need to be "astonishingly impressive" though."
quest_29195.Name: Astonishing!
quest_29195.PrefaceText: The craniologist loved the skulls and ordered another batch! These need to be "astonishingly impressive" though.
quest_29195.SuccessText: Hm. Truth be told, I'm not very astonished by a few of these skulls. Buuuuuut I think I can convince our customer that they're good stuff. I'm going to have to dock your pay a bit, but it's still a good payout!

quest_29196.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "This is a complicated bundle order from someone who's obsessed with dragonkin. The hassle is huge but the pay is good."
quest_29196.Name: Fascination with the Wyrm
quest_29196.PrefaceText: This is a complicated bundle order from someone who's obsessed with dragonkin. The hassle is huge but the pay is good.
quest_29196.SuccessText: This order was dragon me down so I'm glad you got fired up and did it for me. I thought I was gonna have to scale it back. Here's your hoard.

quest_29197.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "I know a lot of weird rituals, but even I don't know what they want this for. Some of these should be easy to find, and some... less so. "
quest_29197.Name: Catch a Monster by the Tail
quest_29197.PrefaceText: I know a lot of weird rituals, but even I don't know what they want this for. Some of these should be easy to find, and some... less so.
quest_29197.SuccessText:
This puts me in a tailspin!

Get it?

quest_29198.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "Here's an order for pieces of bugs. Wait, aren't aktaari those man-sized bugs? ... Good luck with this one."
quest_29198.Name: Deluxe Bug Bits
quest_29198.PrefaceText: Here's an order for pieces of bugs. Wait, aren't aktaari those man-sized bugs? ... Good luck with this one.
quest_29198.SuccessText: You weren't bugged by this assignment! I thought maybe you were a buginner but now I see that's humbug.

quest_29199.Description: Farsight Flemmings in Statehelm said, "Hmm. I know what THIS order's for. But that' s not our business. Just get the skin."
quest_29199.Name: Not For Lickin'
quest_29199.PrefaceText: Hmm. I know what THIS order's for. But that' s not our business. Just get the skin.
quest_29199.SuccessText: Fast work! I guess you were feeling froggy and decided to hop to it. I toadally appreciate the unfrogettable work you've done here.

quest_29206.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "You're a practicing brewer! Love to see it! Let me teach you how to make strawberry wine. Next time you catch me at a party, if you have a bottle of this for me, I'll teach you to make a trickier variety."
quest_29206.Name: The Secret of Wine
quest_29206.PrefaceText: You're a practicing brewer! Love to see it! Let me teach you how to make strawberry wine. Next time you catch me at a party, if you have a bottle of this for me, I'll teach you to make a trickier variety.
quest_29206.SuccessText:
Mm, the odor of clipped grass and overripe strawberries. Not mouthwatering, but it gets you drunk!

Let me teach you a classic wine. This one's much tastier.

quest_29207.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "Have you been practicing wine making? I'd love to try your grape wine!"
quest_29207.Name: Grape Wine
quest_29207.PrefaceText: Have you been practicing wine making? I'd love to try your grape wine!
quest_29207.SuccessText: Hm, it's a bit sour, but it's still better than no wine. Good! Let me teach you how to make a zesty wine. It's a little tricky, but worth the pain!

quest_29208.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "My mouth is watering in anticipation. Try making some of that citrus wine!"
quest_29208.Name: Orange Wine
quest_29208.PrefaceText: My mouth is watering in anticipation. Try making some of that citrus wine!
quest_29208.SuccessText: It may be because I'm already very drunk, but this is delicious! You're ready for a trickier wine!

quest_29209.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "Sometimes you need an earthy wine, and carrot does the trick! Have you made any?"
quest_29209.Name: Carrot Wine
quest_29209.PrefaceText: Sometimes you need an earthy wine, and carrot does the trick! Have you made any?
quest_29209.SuccessText: Wow! You can really smell the earth the carrots grew in! Definitely different, eh? ... Let's move on.

quest_29210.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "Banana wine is not for the faint of heart. It's too sweet for the likes of Fenna and too rich for the likes of Irhetsu. But it's perfect for the likes of me! Made any?"
quest_29210.Name: Banana Wine
quest_29210.PrefaceText: Banana wine is not for the faint of heart. It's too sweet for the likes of Fenna and too rich for the likes of Irhetsu. But it's perfect for the likes of me! Made any?
quest_29210.SuccessText:
Thick, rich, and kind of disgusting. Thank you!

This next one's got broader appeal, don't worry!

quest_29211.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "Hey, did you make that pear wine yet? It'd go great with this party!"
quest_29211.Name: Pear Wine
quest_29211.PrefaceText: Hey, did you make that pear wine yet? It'd go great with this party!
quest_29211.SuccessText: Not too sweet, but a delicious bouquet! Kind of wasted on me given how drunk I already am, but I still like it! Here's a wine recipe I only learned a few decades ago.

quest_29212.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "I know a lot of ways to turn rice into alcohol. Rice wine is the smoothest! Got any of that smoothness to share?"
quest_29212.Name: Rice Wine
quest_29212.PrefaceText: I know a lot of ways to turn rice into alcohol. Rice wine is the smoothest! Got any of that smoothness to share?
quest_29212.SuccessText:
Ah. That's a perfect nightcap wine! I commend you!

Next time, see if you can brew this one. It's tricky to get the taste right.

quest_29213.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "Try making some juniper wine. It's not easy, but it's worth it! Sometimes, anyway!"
quest_29213.Name: Juniper Wine
quest_29213.PrefaceText: Try making some juniper wine. It's not easy, but it's worth it! Sometimes, anyway!
quest_29213.SuccessText:
Ahhh, smell that pinecone goodness.

Hmm, that's an acquired taste, isn't it? Best get to acquiring!

Let me teach you a wine with a bit less of a learning curve.

quest_29214.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "See if you can make that mulberry wine. It's a good dessert wine. Probably good for parties!"
quest_29214.Name: Mulberry Wine
quest_29214.PrefaceText: See if you can make that mulberry wine. It's a good dessert wine. Probably good for parties!
quest_29214.SuccessText: This is the mulberry? Ah, yes. Lovely aroma. I'm sorry to report that it tastes like acid. But WOW it packs a punch! Good work.

quest_29215.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "I know how absurd it sounds! But cantaloupe wine is pretty good, if you follow my recipe exactly. See if you can master it."
quest_29215.Name: Cantaloupe Wine
quest_29215.PrefaceText: I know how absurd it sounds! But cantaloupe wine is pretty good, if you follow my recipe exactly. See if you can master it.
quest_29215.SuccessText: This is the cantaloupe wine? Cheers! You're a damned good alcoholer. And I should know! Here's a fruity recipe for you to try.

quest_29216.Description: Paullus in Statehelm said, "You might have to wait for cranberries to be in season for this one, but it's worth the wait. One cranberry wine, please!"
quest_29216.Name: Cranberry Wine
quest_29216.PrefaceText: You might have to wait for cranberries to be in season for this one, but it's worth the wait. One cranberry wine, please!
quest_29216.SuccessText:
You've outdone yourself! Why, I can't think of any other wines to teach you!

And hey, I can sense your presence. I mean, even when I'm not looking at you! By brewing all that wine in my name, you've gone and made yourself a Scion of me! Welcome aboard! Let's get hammered in celebration!

quest_29221.Description: Benjy in Statehelm said, "You don't want my treats?! Prove it! If you can freely give away the ultimate treat, I'll have to believe you. Bring me Steak and Cheese Wraps!"
quest_29221.Name: Benjy's Demands
quest_29221.PrefaceText: You don't want my treats?! Prove it! If you can freely give away the ultimate treat, I'll have to believe you. Bring me Steak and Cheese Wraps!
quest_29221.SuccessText:
Wow! Give it to me!

Okay. You  can hang out here. But don't beg for treats, got it?

quest_29231.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "The sewers use a magical solvent to clean and repurpose waste material, and they're supposed to be maintenance-free. Hah. I need you to go down there and clear out some of the clogs in the system. Can you do that? Here's a key to the sewer manholes. Don't get killed down there. [Manholes Unlocked!]"
quest_29231.Name: Sewer Clots!
quest_29231.PrefaceText: The sewers use a magical solvent to clean and repurpose waste material, and they're supposed to be maintenance-free. Hah. I need you to go down there and clear out some of the clogs in the system. Can you do that? Here's a key to the sewer manholes. Don't get killed down there. [Manholes Unlocked!]
quest_29231.SuccessText:
Excellent work. Unfortunately I'm sure we'll need more cleaning as soon as next week! The magical solvent doesn't seem to be able to remove certain pests and problems from the waterway.

I'd bother the Council about it, but... Well, it's good that we're able to be self-reliant about this.

Take this with my thanks. If you have time to do more sewer work, there are more specialized problems that need attention.

quest_29232.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "I've got reliable reports that there are dangerous winter fairies hiding out somewhere in the sewer. They apparantly hide out in two of the big sewage-sieve rooms. Better take care of both rooms."
quest_29232.Name: Sneaky Sewer Fae
quest_29232.PrefaceText: I've got reliable reports that there are dangerous winter fairies hiding out somewhere in the sewer. They apparantly hide out in two of the big sewage-sieve rooms. Better take care of both rooms.
quest_29232.SuccessText: Did they give you any trouble? Fairies can be dangerous! But you seem to have handled it well. I shouldn't have worried.

quest_29233.Description:
Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "If you're going to take care of the sneaky sewer fae, you might as well go a bit beyond that point and look for an outbreak of sentient mushroom people.

Look, that's what the report says. I haven't met any mushroom people personally, but magic can do a lot of terrible things. Remember not to breathe weird spores!"
quest_29233.Name: Sentient Mushrooms!
quest_29233.PrefaceText:
If you're going to take care of the sneaky sewer fae, you might as well go a bit beyond that point and look for an outbreak of sentient mushroom people.

Look, that's what the report says. I haven't met any mushroom people personally, but magic can do a lot of terrible things. Remember not to breathe weird spores!
quest_29233.SuccessText: Are you infected? No? Well, good! The idea of thinking fungus freaks me out. Better you than me!

quest_29234.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "Great job with the sewers, but right now we have another problem. Graffiti is getting out of control. If anyone on the Council notices, they'll take drastic, horrific, actions, like, I dunno, making the walls sentient so that they become easily enraged. Or perhaps making the town walls out of pure unlife. Whatever it is, it'll be much worse than what we have, which just requires a bit of good old fashioned hard work. By you. I can sell you the necessary graffiti cleaner. Don't worry, it's reimbursed by the payment for the job! I can sell you a bucket if you need one. Fill it with water, find graffiti, and scrub! [To remove graffiti, place the Scrub Graffiti ability on your sidebar. Obtain Graffiti Cleaner. Then stand near graffiti and use the ability.]"
quest_29234.Name: Graffiti Patrol
quest_29234.PrefaceText: Great job with the sewers, but right now we have another problem. Graffiti is getting out of control. If anyone on the Council notices, they'll take drastic, horrific, actions, like, I dunno, making the walls sentient so that they become easily enraged. Or perhaps making the town walls out of pure unlife. Whatever it is, it'll be much worse than what we have, which just requires a bit of good old fashioned hard work. By you. I can sell you the necessary graffiti cleaner. Don't worry, it's reimbursed by the payment for the job! I can sell you a bucket if you need one. Fill it with water, find graffiti, and scrub! [To remove graffiti, place the Scrub Graffiti ability on your sidebar. Obtain Graffiti Cleaner. Then stand near graffiti and use the ability.]
quest_29234.SuccessText: Thanks for helping maintain normalcy in town. I'm sure the town's vandals are already back at it, though. Come see me any day if you have time to do more scrubbing.

quest_29235.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "Ready for more scrubbing? Great! I'll pay you the same as before. You can buy graffiti cleaner from me, or trade with me if you have other cleaners."
quest_29235.Name: Graffiti Patrol (Repeatable)
quest_29235.PrefaceText: Ready for more scrubbing? Great! I'll pay you the same as before. You can buy graffiti cleaner from me, or trade with me if you have other cleaners.
quest_29235.SuccessText:
Thanks for keeping the streets clean. I know it seems unimportant right now, but it's not. I remember something Councilman Plaudius told me: if the town looks like shit, people will treat it like shit.

Which is to say that he would NOT be pleased if he saw any graffiti. And his last assistant was banished to the fairy tree. Eugh.

quest_29236.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "Two years ago the Council started a "green up the city" initiative, where anyone who wanted to grow plants in the city would get free maintenance from utility golems. Those utility golems have all been repurposed for the war effort -- I mean the demonic incident -- and now the city is overgrowing with weeds! I trust you can handle weeding a plant? Most of them are indoors, so you may have to poke around for them. Oh, also, take that opportunity to put a fertilizer stick in the soil. I have some for sale or trade -- don't worry, you'll make your money back! [To weed a plant, place the Weed Plants ability on your sidebar, obtain Fertilizer Sticks, then stand near a weedy potted plant and use the Weed Plants ability.]"
quest_29236.Name: Weed Patrol
quest_29236.PrefaceText: Two years ago the Council started a "green up the city" initiative, where anyone who wanted to grow plants in the city would get free maintenance from utility golems. Those utility golems have all been repurposed for the war effort -- I mean the demonic incident -- and now the city is overgrowing with weeds! I trust you can handle weeding a plant? Most of them are indoors, so you may have to poke around for them. Oh, also, take that opportunity to put a fertilizer stick in the soil. I have some for sale or trade -- don't worry, you'll make your money back! [To weed a plant, place the Weed Plants ability on your sidebar, obtain Fertilizer Sticks, then stand near a weedy potted plant and use the Weed Plants ability.]
quest_29236.SuccessText: I appreciate the effort. The longer we can keep up business as usual, the less frightened and problematic our citizenry will be. Let me know if you have time to do more weeding.

quest_29237.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "Ready for more weeding? Excellent. I'll pay you the same as before."
quest_29237.Name: Weed Patrol (Repeatable)
quest_29237.PrefaceText: Ready for more weeding? Excellent. I'll pay you the same as before.
quest_29237.SuccessText: Thanks. Overgrown plants may seem irrelevant but these sorts of things can snowball into major problems when they reach a certain level of saturation. We civil engineers must maintain the status quo!

quest_29238.Description:
Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "We've replaced every single oil lamp with a modern heating-crystal system that turns itself on at night and off in the morning. A true wonder of innovation! Except dwarves have already had these for centuries, but let's not go there. Anyway, the design is very new and we're still working out the kinks. Well, we WERE before the demons showed up. Right now we're just trying to keep things running as best we can. We lose lamps every night!

But I've become convinced it's less about a design flaw and more about... something else. See, when the lamps break they become overcharged. In this state they can also overcharge other nearby lamps! The darkness can spread, making whole areas unsafe. And, of course, vampires are always ready to take advantage of these outages to feed on the unsuspecting.

Take some replacement bulbs and fix broken lamps tonight. I'll reimburse you for the lamps."
quest_29238.Name: Lamp Patrol
quest_29238.PrefaceText:
We've replaced every single oil lamp with a modern heating-crystal system that turns itself on at night and off in the morning. A true wonder of innovation! Except dwarves have already had these for centuries, but let's not go there. Anyway, the design is very new and we're still working out the kinks. Well, we WERE before the demons showed up. Right now we're just trying to keep things running as best we can. We lose lamps every night!

But I've become convinced it's less about a design flaw and more about... something else. See, when the lamps break they become overcharged. In this state they can also overcharge other nearby lamps! The darkness can spread, making whole areas unsafe. And, of course, vampires are always ready to take advantage of these outages to feed on the unsuspecting.

Take some replacement bulbs and fix broken lamps tonight. I'll reimburse you for the lamps.
quest_29238.SuccessText: Good work. We need to keep up the appearance of being a safe city. We definitely DON'T want Sereel or even lady Irasce deciding to "just fix it with a spell." So the safer we can keep the city, the better!

quest_29239.Description: Ser Hackley in Statehelm said, "Ready to fix more malfunctioning lamps? Excellent. I'll pay you same as before."
quest_29239.Name: Lamp Patrol (Repeatable)
quest_29239.PrefaceText: Ready to fix more malfunctioning lamps? Excellent. I'll pay you same as before.
quest_29239.SuccessText: I appreciate you keeping the lamps lit. Those evil vampires are behind the outages -- I'm sure of it, I just don't have any proof! ... Or anything I could do about it anyway. But your continued efforts are thwarting whatever evil scheme is going on!

quest_29251.Description:
Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "I can't open my shop with these roaches here. If you had bug bombs, you could clear it out for me. I'd reward you!

I'd do it myself but my bug bombs were sabotaged. Yes, I know what that sounds like!

I think Ser Hackley in the Council building sells plans for bug bumbs, if you're into gadgeteering?"
quest_29251.Name: Ruined! RUINED!

Objectives.Description: Use Bug Bombs to Fumigate Deville's Bakery

quest_29251.PrefaceText:
I can't open my shop with these roaches here. If you had bug bombs, you could clear it out for me. I'd reward you!

I'd do it myself but my bug bombs were sabotaged. Yes, I know what that sounds like!

I think Ser Hackley in the Council building sells plans for bug bumbs, if you're into gadgeteering?
quest_29251.SuccessText: All clear! I'll sweep up and try to open shop. Chancellor Vexford's evil scheme has been foiled again!

quest_29252.Description: Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "I had some bug bombs in the back room, just in case roaches should show up again. But when I came in today, I found all my bug bombs had been punctured. But I think I can fix them! If I just had some some glue. And something to help reactivate it."
quest_29252.Name: Bug Bomb Sabotage
quest_29252.PrefaceText: I had some bug bombs in the back room, just in case roaches should show up again. But when I came in today, I found all my bug bombs had been punctured. But I think I can fix them! If I just had some some glue. And something to help reactivate it.
quest_29252.SuccessText: There! I know a thing or two about bombs, and these bug bombs are now safely activated. Please use them to kill the bugs!

quest_29253.Description: Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "Chancellor Vexford did this to my shop. And he's watching, waiting for me to retaliate in some dumb way. That's why I need YOU to retaliate in some dumb way on my behalf! No, I'm kidding! Of course this isn't about retaliation. It's a business venture at his expense. It won't hurt anybody. I promise. Just get me the following items and you'll see."
quest_29253.Name: Business Recovery Plan
quest_29253.PrefaceText: Chancellor Vexford did this to my shop. And he's watching, waiting for me to retaliate in some dumb way. That's why I need YOU to retaliate in some dumb way on my behalf! No, I'm kidding! Of course this isn't about retaliation. It's a business venture at his expense. It won't hurt anybody. I promise. Just get me the following items and you'll see.
quest_29253.SuccessText: He he he, this is going to work great! We'll thumb our noses at Vexford. Let me just get this ready for you.

quest_29254.Description:
Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "Here. This is what I made from the parts you made. I know a bit of the art of sabotage. Take this with you and go get "fed" from the Cornucopia. It will redirect the system's teleportation point down into the sewer somewhere.

Don't worry, they'll fix it soon enough. But for today, just today, there will be hungry people outside my shop.

I've got the bread smell going. This is going to be a good sales day! Go go go!"
quest_29254.Name: Business Recovery Plan, pt. 2
quest_29254.PrefaceText:
Here. This is what I made from the parts you made. I know a bit of the art of sabotage. Take this with you and go get "fed" from the Cornucopia. It will redirect the system's teleportation point down into the sewer somewhere.

Don't worry, they'll fix it soon enough. But for today, just today, there will be hungry people outside my shop.

I've got the bread smell going. This is going to be a good sales day! Go go go!
quest_29254.SuccessText: Great work! Now get out of town! If the constabulary catches you, you'll be imprisoned. Fly, fool! Go!

quest_29255.Description:
Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "That little plan went great! I sold a lot of bread, and reminded people how good fresh bread is. It's led to repeat customers!

But Vexford is embarrassed. And an embarrassed man is dangerous.

Take this to my daughter Laura. She's my oldest and smartest. She lives in Kur, in self-inflicted banishment. Tell her it's time to come home."
quest_29255.MidwayText: [Laura laughs bitterly.] He can't write a letter without saying something to intentionally piss me off. I know he loves me. And he's been there for me when I needed him, but it's never felt like ... well, like how a father should care about his daughter. When I was young and the bakery was flourishing, an orc gang kidnapped me for ransom. Do you know what my father did? He haggled. Successfully, mind you, but they're fucking ORCS. They could have killed me out of rage! I was so scared. When I was caught in bed with a woman, did he use his immense clout with the Council to get us off the hook? No. He bribed a guard. Marie and I had to sneak out of Statehelm and never return. I love the man, and to be truthful I don't bear him ill will. I think of him fondly sometimes. But I'm not coming to his rescue. Tell Dad I miss his walnut bread, but I'm never returning to Statehelm again. This is the second time he's asked, and if he asks again I'll cut off all communication with him forever.
quest_29255.Name: Inheriting the Bakery
quest_29255.PrefaceText:
That little plan went great! I sold a lot of bread, and reminded people how good fresh bread is. It's led to repeat customers!

But Vexford is embarrassed. And an embarrassed man is dangerous.

Take this to my daughter Laura. She's my oldest and smartest. She lives in Kur, in self-inflicted banishment. Tell her it's time to come home.
quest_29255.SuccessText:
Laura said no again? That's on me: I thought you were more charismatic than you are. I'll wait a few months and try again, and this time I'll send along some walnut bread.

Now that her missus is dead there's no reason she can't come home. She's just inherited the Neth stubbornness. But walnut bread can fix a lot of problems.

quest_29256.Description:
Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "I've got customers returning to the shop! But I've been selling my loaves at a loss, and I can't keep doing that for long. The problem is the taxes on delivered grains. They're just too high! So I was thinking... Maybe you could deliver them for me?

I can't pay you in Councils but I can do much better: I can pay you in exposure. I'll tell everyone who shops here about how great you are, and what a valuable addition to Statehelm you've become."
quest_29256.Name: Feeding the People, pt 1
quest_29256.PrefaceText:
I've got customers returning to the shop! But I've been selling my loaves at a loss, and I can't keep doing that for long. The problem is the taxes on delivered grains. They're just too high! So I was thinking... Maybe you could deliver them for me?

I can't pay you in Councils but I can do much better: I can pay you in exposure. I'll tell everyone who shops here about how great you are, and what a valuable addition to Statehelm you've become.
quest_29256.SuccessText:
You're a hero to the people, and I'll let them know it!

Come back in a week and I'll need more of this same.

quest_29257.Description: Deville Neth in Statehelm said, "Sales are going well and it's time to bring back some of my fancier recipes. I need these grains to do it! As before, I'll pay you in clout with the citizens of Statehelm!"
quest_29257.Name: Feeding the People, pt 2
quest_29257.PrefaceText: Sales are going well and it's time to bring back some of my fancier recipes. I need these grains to do it! As before, I'll pay you in clout with the citizens of Statehelm!
quest_29257.SuccessText:
I'm going to create culinary masterpieces, and you -- you made it possible. I'll make sure people know about it!

Come back in a week and I'll need more of this same.

quest_29271.Description:
Elune in Statehelm said, "I'm sorry. I can't open my store in this condition. I've been robbed! The store is a disgrace!

If you're inclined to help, can you speak to that Hackley woman with the Council? A few guards investigated days ago, but I've heard nothing since. Surely the thief is caught by now! Go check."
quest_29271.MidwayText:
Why do people think I'm responsible for investigating thefts? Ugh! But yes, I did report Elune's story to the constabulary. They made a perfunctory investigation and decided it was Denton Razor's gang. And that's the end of that! We don't tangle with Razor's gang if we can help it. She's out of luck.

No no, don't tell Elune that! Tell her we're still investigating and it's an intricate process and time will tell and there are multiple investigative vectors etcetera etcetera. Sheesh.
quest_29271.Name: Where Are the Police?!
quest_29271.PrefaceText:
I'm sorry. I can't open my store in this condition. I've been robbed! The store is a disgrace!

If you're inclined to help, can you speak to that Hackley woman with the Council? A few guards investigated days ago, but I've heard nothing since. Surely the thief is caught by now! Go check.
quest_29271.SuccessText: Denton Razor?! The famous thief? But that's absurd: he steals from the rich and gives to the poor! Oh no. Oh no! By Statehelm standards I am rich! I was just regular-wealthy back home. But now I'm poor. So Denton Razor should give to me! Maybe you could speak with him?

quest_29272.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "Why don't you speak with this Denton Razor fellow yourself? He's supposed to live in the hills of Vidaria. Just get him to give my jewelry back."
quest_29272.MidwayText:
Thank you!

So I looked around for that jewelry and I'm afraid it's quite gone. I remember that orc Crall might have taken posession of some of it. And some of it was sold to a fence in Statehelm itself! Maybe that will help.
quest_29272.Name: The Famous Denton Razor

Objectives.Description: Deliver Weak Hellfreeze Ointment to Denton Razor

quest_29272.PrefaceText: Why don't you speak with this Denton Razor fellow yourself? He's supposed to live in the hills of Vidaria. Just get him to give my jewelry back.
quest_29272.SuccessText: You found Denton Razor? ... Oh. I see. Well, he gave us two leads...

quest_29273.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "Denton Razor said that someone named 'Engineer Crall' in Vidaria bought some of my jewelry. Find this Crall and convince them to return the stolen goods!"
quest_29273.MidwayText: Ah, a lovely thermic rubyite! I will take possession of it. I need six in total.
quest_29273.Name: Engineer Crall vs. Jewelry

Objectives.Description: Deliver Thermic Rubyite to Engineer Crall

quest_29273.PrefaceText: Denton Razor said that someone named 'Engineer Crall' in Vidaria bought some of my jewelry. Find this Crall and convince them to return the stolen goods!
quest_29273.SuccessText: You found some of my jewelry! Not enough to open the shop, but enough to give me hope! Thank you!

quest_29274.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "Denton Razor said that some of my jewelry was sold to a fence in town. Everybody knows who the town fence is: that filthy human who runs the bar on the docks. Cynthia Rolfe! Go berate her until she relinquishes my jewelry!"
quest_29274.MidwayText:
Oh, his signet ring! He'll be so pleased!

I suppose I can part with those gaudy jewels... Where did I put them?
quest_29274.Name: The Jewelry Fence

Objectives.Description: Deliver Lost Signet Ring to Meghan Olliver
Deliver Lost Signet Ring to Meghan Olliver

quest_29274.PrefaceText: Denton Razor said that some of my jewelry was sold to a fence in town. Everybody knows who the town fence is: that filthy human who runs the bar on the docks. Cynthia Rolfe! Go berate her until she relinquishes my jewelry!
quest_29274.SuccessText: You found some more of my jewelry! Oh, if only it were enough. But it's NOT! I still can't open my shop. But I have another lead...

quest_29275.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "Since the constabulary is completely useless, I've been poking around for clues to my stolen jewelry. And I have a lead for you! ... You will help me, right? It's oh so important! So you see the jewelry was sold to an orc who trades such things amongst his kind. His name is Throgg and he lives in a camp in Povus. Can you go and retrieve my stolen jewelry before he gets a chance to resell it?"
quest_29275.MidwayText:
Oh, his signet ring! He'll be so pleased!

I suppose I can part with those gaudy jewels... Where did I put them?
quest_29275.Name: The Greedy Orc
quest_29275.PrefaceText: Since the constabulary is completely useless, I've been poking around for clues to my stolen jewelry. And I have a lead for you! ... You will help me, right? It's oh so important! So you see the jewelry was sold to an orc who trades such things amongst his kind. His name is Throgg and he lives in a camp in Povus. Can you go and retrieve my stolen jewelry before he gets a chance to resell it?
quest_29275.SuccessText: You found more of my jewelry! I suppose you've returned enough of my inventory that I could meaningfully reopen the shop. But I'm still missing such important pieces... [Shop Open] [New Favors Available.]

quest_29276.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "I have the worst news. The constabulary spotted a suspicious person yesterday, and as he fled he threw a huge clump of jewelry into the ocean. It's got to be some of my stolen jewelry! Can you fish it out for me? It was down on the docks."
quest_29276.Name: Fishing Stolen Treasure

Objectives.Description: Use Angling to Obtain Stolen Jewelry

quest_29276.PrefaceText: I have the worst news. The constabulary spotted a suspicious person yesterday, and as he fled he threw a huge clump of jewelry into the ocean. It's got to be some of my stolen jewelry! Can you fish it out for me? It was down on the docks.
quest_29276.SuccessText: Well it definitely wasn't this disgusting before it was stolen. I'm going to have to clean everything! But yes, that's some of my stolen jewelry. Thank you so much!

quest_29277.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "I heard a rumor that's just too stupid to NOT be true. Apparently a rabbit covered in jewelry was seen hopping into a sewer pipe outside of town. It seems to live down there. It's got to be one of those dreadful talking pets that wizards love so much. They never mind their pets at all, and now this one's taken to a life of crime! Take care of the matter for me, won't you?"
quest_29277.Name: Dashing Young Rabbit
quest_29277.PrefaceText: I heard a rumor that's just too stupid to NOT be true. Apparently a rabbit covered in jewelry was seen hopping into a sewer pipe outside of town. It seems to live down there. It's got to be one of those dreadful talking pets that wizards love so much. They never mind their pets at all, and now this one's taken to a life of crime! Take care of the matter for me, won't you?
quest_29277.SuccessText: Mm. It has animal hair on it. But this is definitely some of my stolen jewelry. Thank you so much for your hard work!

quest_29278.Description:
Elune in Statehelm said, "Of course, there's no chance I'll ever see my most recent masterpiece ever again. The thief no doubt valued that one over all the other trinkets in my store, and would never have parted with it. Well, I shouldn't give up hope; perhaps it will show up on the market in a few years.

But right now I need to create a NEW masterpiece. The old one was a riff on my famous rubywall crystal motif, but now I'm imagining something fresher: rubywall-like crystals, but with the darkest of aquamarines!

I should get started right away while the inspiration has hit me. Unfortunately, my gem supply is gone and what I need is no ordinary aquamarine. I need just the right one.

Why don't you simply get me 100 or so and I'll just pick the best one from the batch."
quest_29278.Name: A Masterpiece of Neckwear

Objectives.Description: Have more on hand for Elune to choose from

quest_29278.PrefaceText:
Of course, there's no chance I'll ever see my most recent masterpiece ever again. The thief no doubt valued that one over all the other trinkets in my store, and would never have parted with it. Well, I shouldn't give up hope; perhaps it will show up on the market in a few years.

But right now I need to create a NEW masterpiece. The old one was a riff on my famous rubywall crystal motif, but now I'm imagining something fresher: rubywall-like crystals, but with the darkest of aquamarines!

I should get started right away while the inspiration has hit me. Unfortunately, my gem supply is gone and what I need is no ordinary aquamarine. I need just the right one.

Why don't you simply get me 100 or so and I'll just pick the best one from the batch.
quest_29278.SuccessText:
Hmm. Well none of them are as good as my last masterpiece, but THIS one is... Yes, I can make this work. Thank you. Please take this other trash away.

I'll have my new masterpiece on display in no time!

quest_29279.Description: Elune in Statehelm said, "You've helped me get all my stock back. And my new masterpiece is perhaps even better than the old one! I can't thank you enough. But let me try. I have an idea for a masterpiece just for you. I only need a few special ingredients! When you come back with these things, be ready to tell me what combat skills I should enchant it with."
quest_29279.Name: A Masterpiece for YOU
quest_29279.PrefaceText: You've helped me get all my stock back. And my new masterpiece is perhaps even better than the old one! I can't thank you enough. But let me try. I have an idea for a masterpiece just for you. I only need a few special ingredients! When you come back with these things, be ready to tell me what combat skills I should enchant it with.
quest_29279.SuccessText: Here it is! I hope you like it. Yes, I'm an old hand at enchantment. And technically I'm an archmage. But please don't tell anyone! They already don't like me here, and I haven't practiced archmagery in a long time. I don't even like to let people know I enchant all the jewelry in my shop. They'll think my beautiful artwork is elf-cursed. Anyway, does it fit? Oh good! Thank you again for everything you've done for me. I'm indebted to you.

quest_29291.Description:
Fransesca Muradrake in Statehelm said, "Let's start with something easy that any novice should be able to manage. Fetch me fresh gravebloom. We're fortunate that it grows in the graveyard just outside of town.

Of course, you know that it only blooms at night."
quest_29291.Name: Gravebloom
quest_29291.PrefaceText:
Let's start with something easy that any novice should be able to manage. Fetch me fresh gravebloom. We're fortunate that it grows in the graveyard just outside of town.

Of course, you know that it only blooms at night.

quest_29292.Description: Fransesca Muradrake in Statehelm said, "You seem trustworthy enough. Here, this unlocks a very dangerous chamber inside the Statehelm Crypt. This area is off-limits to most. My husband's private laboratory lies past that point. But you needn't delve so far today. My husband loved unusual necromantic creations, and the crypt is full of his menagerie. I need some thrice-cursed beaks, and there are bird-creatures in there that contain one. Here is the most important detail: you must kill them with darkness damage. Otherwise it would only be a twice-cursed beak. [The killing blow must be Darkness damage.]"
quest_29292.Name: Thrice-Cursed Beaks
quest_29292.PrefaceText: You seem trustworthy enough. Here, this unlocks a very dangerous chamber inside the Statehelm Crypt. This area is off-limits to most. My husband's private laboratory lies past that point. But you needn't delve so far today. My husband loved unusual necromantic creations, and the crypt is full of his menagerie. I need some thrice-cursed beaks, and there are bird-creatures in there that contain one. Here is the most important detail: you must kill them with darkness damage. Otherwise it would only be a twice-cursed beak. [The killing blow must be Darkness damage.]
quest_29292.SuccessText: Yes, quite cursed. These will work. My experimental ritual requires unstable bones. It is quite dangerous. ... ... You may join me, if you wish. [New Hangout Available.]

quest_29293.Description: Fransesca Muradrake in Statehelm said, "As we -- well, as I learned during our ritual, my husband was murdered by a goblin sage named Grosark, who is trapped in Steven's laboratory deep inside the Statehelm Crypt. Here: the key to his lab. Go and take care of the issue. Grosark is in a largely incorporeal state, but the lab has a mechanism for dealing with this. Activate the lamps in the four corners of the lab, and he will be forced to apparate. You will need some tea lights for the lamps; don't forget to bring them with you!"
quest_29293.Name: My Fool of a Husband

Objectives.Description: Light the Braziers and Kill Grosark

quest_29293.PrefaceText: As we -- well, as I learned during our ritual, my husband was murdered by a goblin sage named Grosark, who is trapped in Steven's laboratory deep inside the Statehelm Crypt. Here: the key to his lab. Go and take care of the issue. Grosark is in a largely incorporeal state, but the lab has a mechanism for dealing with this. Activate the lamps in the four corners of the lab, and he will be forced to apparate. You will need some tea lights for the lamps; don't forget to bring them with you!
quest_29293.SuccessText: You destroyed Grosark? Could it be that easy? I must do some research.

quest_29294.Description:
Fransesca Muradrake in Statehelm said, "I do appreciate what you've done to stop Grosark. But I've bad news: what you slew was merely Grosark's bodily husk, a sort of meat puppet that he wore because he didn't realize that liches don't need them. But the good news is that he doesn't know enough about his powers to be particularly dangerous to our realm yet. Some of his soul is in Acur, and the rest of it is trapped here, bodiless, in what is called an astral state.

But the bad news is that he can escape this state easily if he only knew how, and he is researching furiously. I've detected his presence near the ivory library. He can't get in, of course, even in astral form, but it shows that he knows what he needs. It's only a matter of time.

But the good news is that long ago I researched the perfect ritual for this situation. The Statehelm graveyard may seem an ordinary one, but it was actually configured by the Council to support extreme necromantic rituals. You can use that place to pull Grosark into our realm now, while he is weak and confused. It's the only way. Aside from the myriad other ways, of course, but it's the only way I recommend.

Here are the notes. Follow them diligently. And bring a friend. No, bring an army! No, that would be chaos. Bring between five and fifteen friends.

Oh! You'll need a summoning candle. Can you make them? No, nevermind, let me teach you precisely how to make it safely. No sense getting you turned into an ectoplasmic pudding. It's a relatively simple candle... I trust you know your way around a candlemaking station? There's one conveniently located in the crypt."
quest_29294.Name: Grosark's True[ish] Form

Objectives.Description: Perform Ritual and Kill Grosark's Truish Form

quest_29294.PrefaceText:
I do appreciate what you've done to stop Grosark. But I've bad news: what you slew was merely Grosark's bodily husk, a sort of meat puppet that he wore because he didn't realize that liches don't need them. But the good news is that he doesn't know enough about his powers to be particularly dangerous to our realm yet. Some of his soul is in Acur, and the rest of it is trapped here, bodiless, in what is called an astral state.

But the bad news is that he can escape this state easily if he only knew how, and he is researching furiously. I've detected his presence near the ivory library. He can't get in, of course, even in astral form, but it shows that he knows what he needs. It's only a matter of time.

But the good news is that long ago I researched the perfect ritual for this situation. The Statehelm graveyard may seem an ordinary one, but it was actually configured by the Council to support extreme necromantic rituals. You can use that place to pull Grosark into our realm now, while he is weak and confused. It's the only way. Aside from the myriad other ways, of course, but it's the only way I recommend.

Here are the notes. Follow them diligently. And bring a friend. No, bring an army! No, that would be chaos. Bring between five and fifteen friends.

Oh! You'll need a summoning candle. Can you make them? No, nevermind, let me teach you precisely how to make it safely. No sense getting you turned into an ectoplasmic pudding. It's a relatively simple candle... I trust you know your way around a candlemaking station? There's one conveniently located in the crypt.
quest_29294.SuccessText:
You completed the ritual and destroyed Grosark? Hmm, it's true that his presence seems very small now, but I can still detect him. I'm not sure we've seen the last of Grosark. But the problem has at least been postponed. That will do for now. Thank you.

Sometimes being wise means being willing to say that you CAN'T do something. I don't think I could have stopped Grosark alone. Oh, I know you had assistance also, but... well, I'm used to working solo.

That's changing, though. I am starting to enjoy working in tandem with you. We make a strong pair.

quest_29311.Description: Pumza in Statehelm said, "The animals of this city are in great danger. A spider came to me for aid. I could not do much for him, but I did manage to have his exotic equipment shipped into Statehelm. Take this to him. If you can, give him whatever help he needs."
quest_29311.MidwayText: ... [Skitters considers you.] This is the wrong suit! This one is from my time as a druid. I wanted the fire suit. But no matter. This will do. [Skitters takes the suit and waves in thanks.]
quest_29311.Name: The Frightened Animals of Statehelm
quest_29311.PrefaceText: The animals of this city are in great danger. A spider came to me for aid. I could not do much for him, but I did manage to have his exotic equipment shipped into Statehelm. Take this to him. If you can, give him whatever help he needs.
quest_29311.SuccessText: Thank you. Perhaps this is the beginning of a tolerable relationship.

quest_29331.Description:
Skitters in Statehelm said, "Here is the problem: late at night, a creature is coming out of the sewers and attacking sentient animals. It focuses on the smart ones.

I have a contact in the sewer. His name is Hamilton and you can trust him. He's been doing some investigative work on this problem. Find a way into the sewer and locate him, and bring back his intel."
quest_29331.MidwayText: Skitters sent you? I was expecting... Something else. But that's fine! Here: Skitters will know how to read this. Good hunting. I hope you don't hate spiders.
quest_29331.Name: Understanding the Animal Menace
quest_29331.PrefaceText:
Here is the problem: late at night, a creature is coming out of the sewers and attacking sentient animals. It focuses on the smart ones.

I have a contact in the sewer. His name is Hamilton and you can trust him. He's been doing some investigative work on this problem. Find a way into the sewer and locate him, and bring back his intel.
quest_29331.SuccessText: He insists on using his strange code language. Give me a few minutes to translate them and then we can move forward.

quest_29332.Description:
Skitters in Statehelm said, "It's what I feared. Our friend Hamilton has spotted a gigantic spider climbing out of the sewer at night. He hasn't seen how the spider returns -- it probably uses a different entrance -- but we can surmise that this is what is killing the sentient animals in Statehelm.

Hamilton says that he heard a clicking sound of a door opening right before he saw the spider. Look for a lever or mechanism that opens a door. And be ready for a fight.

You will doubtless need to kill this spider. But I don't believe it is a simple unintelligent spider. It is too cunning. Figure out what it was up to!"
quest_29332.Name: The Animal Menace is a Spider
quest_29332.PrefaceText:
It's what I feared. Our friend Hamilton has spotted a gigantic spider climbing out of the sewer at night. He hasn't seen how the spider returns -- it probably uses a different entrance -- but we can surmise that this is what is killing the sentient animals in Statehelm.

Hamilton says that he heard a clicking sound of a door opening right before he saw the spider. Look for a lever or mechanism that opens a door. And be ready for a fight.

You will doubtless need to kill this spider. But I don't believe it is a simple unintelligent spider. It is too cunning. Figure out what it was up to!
quest_29332.SuccessText:
You have killed the spider? I didn't doubt you.

Hm... A golem that can think on its own? I'm not an expert alchemist, but I've heard someone speak of that quite recently...

quest_29341.Description:
Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "I have a special book request that I could use your help with. If I can sell this, it will make up for months of poor sales!

The book I need is "The Lost Travels of Romast." It didn't exactly have a large print run. There are probably only a few copies across all of Alharth. But I have a lead!

A certain... friend... with greenish skin... who lives in a cave in Povus has a copy hidden deep in her cave. But she says the deep cave is "too scary nowadays" and she can't retrieve it for me. She says it's hidden behind a gilded chest. I'm sure that should make it easy to find. Right?

This book is priceless, so I will give you priceless knowledge in exchange."
quest_29341.Name: The Lost Travels of Romast
quest_29341.PrefaceText:
I have a special book request that I could use your help with. If I can sell this, it will make up for months of poor sales!

The book I need is "The Lost Travels of Romast." It didn't exactly have a large print run. There are probably only a few copies across all of Alharth. But I have a lead!

A certain... friend... with greenish skin... who lives in a cave in Povus has a copy hidden deep in her cave. But she says the deep cave is "too scary nowadays" and she can't retrieve it for me. She says it's hidden behind a gilded chest. I'm sure that should make it easy to find. Right?

This book is priceless, so I will give you priceless knowledge in exchange.
quest_29341.SuccessText: You found the book! Well, it's more of a scroll, isn't it? Even after I split the money with Errr... with my friend, I'm still going to make a lot of money from this. It's only fair that I reward you with something equally valuable: my library science techniques! Take these organizational secrets to your grave! [There's a new button on your inventory window which lets you filter viewed items by Equipment, Consumable, Quest, or Other.] Hey, do you want to help me fill other book orders? I have a bunch that I've been unable to fulfill. I'll pay you a hefty cut!

quest_29342.Description:
Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "Here's another crazy order. How am I going to fill this?! I need "schematics and maintenance instructions for an Exetar-class ship." I understand some of those words...

Well, no pressure but see what you can do."
quest_29342.Name: Exotic Fae Books From SPACE
quest_29342.PrefaceText:
Here's another crazy order. How am I going to fill this?! I need "schematics and maintenance instructions for an Exetar-class ship." I understand some of those words...

Well, no pressure but see what you can do.
quest_29342.SuccessText: These are the books? They're... They have no pages. But okay! Okay, I don't care, so this is great! I'll deliver this order. You're really good at this, you know?

quest_29343.Description: Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "I have a special book order for alchemy tutorials. I have some of the needed books, but here are the ones I don't have copies of. Can you look for them? I'll pay well."
quest_29343.Name: Alchemy Bookload

Objectives.Description: Obtain "Alchemy: Overclock Your Heart and Mind"

quest_29343.PrefaceText: I have a special book order for alchemy tutorials. I have some of the needed books, but here are the ones I don't have copies of. Can you look for them? I'll pay well.
quest_29343.SuccessText: The alchemy books! These are decently legible copies, too. I'll ship these off right away. Here's your payment.

quest_29344.Description: Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "I've been trying to fill this book order for a long time! I have most of the requested titles but she only wants a 100% complete order. Here's the books I need."
quest_29344.Name: Some Pretty Weird Books
quest_29344.PrefaceText: I've been trying to fill this book order for a long time! I have most of the requested titles but she only wants a 100% complete order. Here's the books I need.
quest_29344.SuccessText: I'm pretty impressed. You must know your way around a used book store! Thank you so much. I'll give you your cut now, before the delivery is even made!

quest_29345.Description: Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "Here, can you fill this book order? I don't have any of these. They want... Hm what are these books, exactly? I guess they're instructions on sewing advanced bardic equipment. Oh, that makes sense given who the order is from. Are these rare? I assumed so, and I quoted her quite a high price. If you can find them, I'll give you half the pay."
quest_29345.Name: Bardic Badassery
quest_29345.PrefaceText: Here, can you fill this book order? I don't have any of these. They want... Hm what are these books, exactly? I guess they're instructions on sewing advanced bardic equipment. Oh, that makes sense given who the order is from. Are these rare? I assumed so, and I quoted her quite a high price. If you can find them, I'll give you half the pay.
quest_29345.SuccessText:
Oh, you found them all? Must not have been so hard to find after all, eh? Well, a deal's a deal: here's your half of the pay.

I desperately needed this sale to pay some debts. So... Thanks again!

quest_29346.Description: Michael Irasce in Statehelm said, "Here's another book order I'm stuck on. We just don't get many orcish traders so finding these books in Orcish has been tough!"
quest_29346.Name: Orcish Literature

Objectives.Description: Obtain Orcish Book About Weird Mages

quest_29346.PrefaceText: Here's another book order I'm stuck on. We just don't get many orcish traders so finding these books in Orcish has been tough!
quest_29346.SuccessText: Wow! Do you know Orcish? How did you find these?! No, no, don't tell me your scavenging secrets. I trust that you didn't steal them from anyone in Statehelm, and that's all I care about.

quest_29361.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "You want to help? Me?! Well... I had a request for a pristine goat hide. If you can help me find one, I'll give you half the payment."
quest_29361.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 1
quest_29361.PrefaceText: You want to help? Me?! Well... I had a request for a pristine goat hide. If you can help me find one, I'll give you half the payment.
quest_29361.SuccessText: Ugh, the stench! But this does look like a good hide. Thanks. Here.

quest_29362.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "I have another hard request. This one is for a shark skin. Can't make this up. I'm supposed to just have a shark skin lying around, right? Ugh. Customers. But hey, see what you can do."
quest_29362.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 2
quest_29362.PrefaceText: I have another hard request. This one is for a shark skin. Can't make this up. I'm supposed to just have a shark skin lying around, right? Ugh. Customers. But hey, see what you can do.
quest_29362.SuccessText: Yep, that's a shark skin. I'm going to trust your judgment on its quality; I know nothing about sharks. Here.

quest_29363.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "Here's another hide request: "the finest rabbit skin you can find. No damage." I have some rabbit skins, but they all have damage."
quest_29363.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 3
quest_29363.PrefaceText: Here's another hide request: "the finest rabbit skin you can find. No damage." I have some rabbit skins, but they all have damage.
quest_29363.SuccessText: Wow, pristine. Very nice skinning job.

quest_29364.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "Now we're starting to get repeat business! The same man who needed a goat skin now needs a hippo skin. Heh! Good luck with that one."
quest_29364.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 4
quest_29364.PrefaceText: Now we're starting to get repeat business! The same man who needed a goat skin now needs a hippo skin. Heh! Good luck with that one.
quest_29364.SuccessText: Where the hell did you even find a hippo, let alone learn how to skin one? And perfectly?! You're way too good at this.

quest_29365.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "I don't even know what this one is. A kuvou? I guess that's like a bison? Anyway, I need a perfect hide from one."
quest_29365.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 5
quest_29365.PrefaceText: I don't even know what this one is. A kuvou? I guess that's like a bison? Anyway, I need a perfect hide from one.
quest_29365.SuccessText: Remga's remnants, that's a disgusting beast! But you skinned it well. I'll cut you in like usual.

quest_29366.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "This one's not too weird... But the quantity is crazy. I need four trophy cat hides."
quest_29366.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 6
quest_29366.PrefaceText: This one's not too weird... But the quantity is crazy. I need four trophy cat hides.
quest_29366.SuccessText: Crazy. Crazy! Where do you find all these predators to skin?! No, you don't have to tell me. Here's your money.

quest_29367.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "Next I need perfect snake skins. That's a lot less weird of a request than usual. I sometimes even have these in stock! But not right now."
quest_29367.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 7
quest_29367.PrefaceText: Next I need perfect snake skins. That's a lot less weird of a request than usual. I sometimes even have these in stock! But not right now.

quest_29368.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "Another creepy beast request: I need the hide of a 'droach' as well as some scales. I guess... I guess the hide doesn't normally have scales on it? I'm no monsterologist. I hope you can figure this one out."
quest_29368.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 8
quest_29368.PrefaceText: Another creepy beast request: I need the hide of a 'droach' as well as some scales. I guess... I guess the hide doesn't normally have scales on it? I'm no monsterologist. I hope you can figure this one out.
quest_29368.SuccessText: Well, whatever this beast was, it was terrifying. Glad you're still alive.

quest_29369.Description: Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "This one's weird and sad. I need "idealized skins from a family of giant rats." I don't think the rats need to be related. Who will know?"
quest_29369.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 9
quest_29369.PrefaceText: This one's weird and sad. I need "idealized skins from a family of giant rats." I don't think the rats need to be related. Who will know?
quest_29369.SuccessText: You skinned all those rats to find perfect skins. I worry about your mental health. But I don't worry about your pocketbook. Here.

quest_29370.Description:
Grim Jim in Statehelm said, "I hope you're ready for a hard one. I need the perfect skin of a three-headed demon dog! You heard that right.

The pay's pretty good, though. Don't die."
quest_29370.Name: Unusual Hide Requests, pt. 10
quest_29370.PrefaceText:
I hope you're ready for a hard one. I need the perfect skin of a three-headed demon dog! You heard that right.

The pay's pretty good, though. Don't die.
quest_29370.SuccessText: I really didn't expect you to be able to do this one. I'm sorry I underestimated you.

quest_29381.Description: Justin Smoot in Statehelm said, "If you ever find yourself deep in Gazluk Keep, head to the bottom floor and poke around the southern barracks loop. That's where I used to bunk. They would have tossed my medals into one of the storage chests down there. See if you can find my box of medals."
quest_29381.Name: The Birthday Box
quest_29381.PrefaceText: If you ever find yourself deep in Gazluk Keep, head to the bottom floor and poke around the southern barracks loop. That's where I used to bunk. They would have tossed my medals into one of the storage chests down there. See if you can find my box of medals.
quest_29381.SuccessText: Oh hey. You found my medals. Hm, the nice ones are missing. But that's okay. It'll do for what I need.

quest_29382.Description: Justin Smoot in Statehelm said, "I was thinking about my friend Az. He's never experienced an orcish birthday. That's when your friends make you medals. Joke medals. Even I had friends in Gazluk. I want to give Azagrus a bit of that experience. Here: this one's perfect. Can you give it to him?"
quest_29382.MidwayText: What is this? A medal? [ Asparagus stares at it, turning it in his hand. He wipes away a tear. ] This is from Justin, isn't it? Tell him... Tell him thanks.
quest_29382.Name: A Gift of a Badge
quest_29382.PrefaceText: I was thinking about my friend Az. He's never experienced an orcish birthday. That's when your friends make you medals. Joke medals. Even I had friends in Gazluk. I want to give Azagrus a bit of that experience. Here: this one's perfect. Can you give it to him?
quest_29382.SuccessText: Thanks for the help with my birthday present. I hope Az liked it.

quest_29391.Description:
Asparagus in Statehelm said, "You want to do something for me? Pf.

Well, I always need more fluorite."
quest_29391.Name: Making Friends with Asparagus
quest_29391.PrefaceText:
You want to do something for me? Pf.

Well, I always need more fluorite.
quest_29391.SuccessText:
Hey, these are nice. Easy to cut into cubes, and relatively easy to hollow out. I'll buy 'em off of you. What, a gift? Hmm.

Suspicious. But okay.

quest_29392.Description: Asparagus in Statehelm said, "Well, your actions have incriminated you now, so you can see it through with me if you want to. I'm setting up a trade with a friend who lives out of town. Help me get the rest of this crap, and I'll let you in on the action."
quest_29392.Name: Setting Up a Trade
quest_29392.PrefaceText: Well, your actions have incriminated you now, so you can see it through with me if you want to. I'm setting up a trade with a friend who lives out of town. Help me get the rest of this crap, and I'll let you in on the action.
quest_29392.SuccessText: That's the whole checklist. Okay. Why don't you come with me to do the trade tonight. [ New Hangout Available. ]

quest_29393.Description: Asparagus in Statehelm said, "Let's put the past behind us for now. How about some dice games? If you beat me, say, 50 times, I'll teach you a secret technique to improve your cheating technique. Not that you should cheat me! Save that for the big stakes tables."
quest_29393.Name: Making Friends with Asparagus
quest_29393.PrefaceText: Let's put the past behind us for now. How about some dice games? If you beat me, say, 50 times, I'll teach you a secret technique to improve your cheating technique. Not that you should cheat me! Save that for the big stakes tables.
quest_29393.Rewards_Description: Loaded Dice Explode Less Often (from 4% to 3%)
quest_29393.SuccessText: Okay, okay. Thanks for playing. Here. See this? Loaded die. Highly explosive, as you know. But if you throw them like this, they don't explode as often. You're welcome. [Loaded Dice Explosion Rate -1%]

quest_29401.Description: Sagiso in Statehelm said, "A favor, huh? Well, you could get me some paint. It's for my hobby. Any color will do, I'm not picky. Just get me a LOT of it."
quest_29401.Name: The Elf's Hobby
quest_29401.PrefaceText: A favor, huh? Well, you could get me some paint. It's for my hobby. Any color will do, I'm not picky. Just get me a LOT of it.
quest_29401.SuccessText:
Very nice! Some of this is a disgusting color, but we can make it work.

You keep that. I just wanted to make sure you were the sort of person who knew their way around a paint bucket. Let me teach you a new way to use this stuff, what do you say?

quest_29402.Description: Sagiso in Statehelm said, "My hobby is... let's call it Urban Expression. It's a legitimate art form and an important one, especially here in Statehelm. Let's just jump right in, shall we? Take your dye and head to the barracks area. The walls all around there are good spots for your art. Pick a place and make your mark! [ Place the Graffiti ability on your sidebar. If you are in a valid graffiti area (and have dye on hand) the ability will stop being grayed out. There are graffiti spots all over, though they are a little denser near the barracks/jail area.]"
quest_29402.Name: The Power of Urban Expression
quest_29402.PrefaceText: My hobby is... let's call it Urban Expression. It's a legitimate art form and an important one, especially here in Statehelm. Let's just jump right in, shall we? Take your dye and head to the barracks area. The walls all around there are good spots for your art. Pick a place and make your mark! [ Place the Graffiti ability on your sidebar. If you are in a valid graffiti area (and have dye on hand) the ability will stop being grayed out. There are graffiti spots all over, though they are a little denser near the barracks/jail area.]
quest_29402.SuccessText: Great initiative. I'll check it out personally later. Keep at it: it's the only way to break the people out of their urban prison of the mind.

quest_29403.Description: Sagiso in Statehelm said, "You're getting the hang of this! Keep spreading your messages to the sheep of Statehelm!"
quest_29403.Name: Spread the Word (Repeating)
quest_29403.PrefaceText: You're getting the hang of this! Keep spreading your messages to the sheep of Statehelm!
quest_29403.SuccessText: Excellent work. I'm sure you've noticed that your skill in other areas of art are improving through this practice. Everything is connected.

quest_29411.Description:
Winston Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "Oh, are you for hire? Great! I need special metal for my next promotional sword. I spent quite a bit to learn where to find it. I may have ordered the information from... overseas. And you know how it is with information from... overseas: always with the mysterious language! But I'm hoping you can figure it out!

	"Within a mushroom tall as hills
	something something, wise preying mantises...
	something something minimum mining level of 50."

I should have written it down, but that's what I remember. Hope it helps."
quest_29411.Name: Preparing a New Veilmoor Promotion
quest_29411.PrefaceText:
Oh, are you for hire? Great! I need special metal for my next promotional sword. I spent quite a bit to learn where to find it. I may have ordered the information from... overseas. And you know how it is with information from... overseas: always with the mysterious language! But I'm hoping you can figure it out!

	"Within a mushroom tall as hills
	something something, wise preying mantises...
	something something minimum mining level of 50."

I should have written it down, but that's what I remember. Hope it helps.
quest_29411.SuccessText:
Is this it? Augh! It screamed into my brain! You should have warned me!

But good. Yes. Yesss... this is perfect!  Well done.

quest_29412.Description: Winston Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "Now, I won't be doing the enchantment on these upcoming promotional swords. We have quite a specialist for that task! But I do need to provide special foci. These will be worked into the weapon to strengthen and shape the magic in the weapon. I'm afraid I can accept no substitutes!"
quest_29412.Name: Preparing a New Veilmoor Promotion, pt. 2
quest_29412.PrefaceText: Now, I won't be doing the enchantment on these upcoming promotional swords. We have quite a specialist for that task! But I do need to provide special foci. These will be worked into the weapon to strengthen and shape the magic in the weapon. I'm afraid I can accept no substitutes!
quest_29412.SuccessText: This isn't the color of rhino hide I expected. But... we'll see if we can make it work.

quest_29413.Description: Winston Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "The rhino hide's miscoloration has thrown everything off kilter aesthetically! I need an entirely new accent color. And a different pommel crystal! Since you're basically responsible for this mess, can you help fix it? Don't worry. I'll pay."
quest_29413.Name: Preparing a New Veilmoor Promotion, pt 3
quest_29413.PrefaceText: The rhino hide's miscoloration has thrown everything off kilter aesthetically! I need an entirely new accent color. And a different pommel crystal! Since you're basically responsible for this mess, can you help fix it? Don't worry. I'll pay.
quest_29413.SuccessText: Hm. Gem's a bit small. But it'll work. Okay, I think she's ready for the world! Here. Try it out.

quest_29421.Description:
Sam Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "Oh, I'm fine! It's just that I've been worried. Worried sick, actually. I've heard my daughter's in trouble financially. She's... estranged. And her father has all but disowned her, and I understand why. Kind of agree with him.

But she's my daughter and I can't just watch as she ruins her life.

Maybe I'm overreacting. Could you check in on her? Her name is Helena Veilmoor and she moved far south to a fortress called Hogan's Keep. Apparently she's having trouble with a gang of sentient insects. Oh, my poor idiot daughter! Let me know she's okay!"
quest_29421.MidwayText:
You talked to mom?! And she sent you here? Come on! I feel stalked! I ran away from Statehelm for a good reason, you know. Did you ever consider...

... I'm sorry. I should really swallow my pride. Tell mom I owe a gang of giant mantises 1.3 million Concils or they'll kill me and lay eggs in my corpse. But tell her in a way that doesn't seem too desperate, okay? And then stop hanging out with my mom. It's weird.
quest_29421.Name: The Bad Veilmoor
quest_29421.PrefaceText:
Oh, I'm fine! It's just that I've been worried. Worried sick, actually. I've heard my daughter's in trouble financially. She's... estranged. And her father has all but disowned her, and I understand why. Kind of agree with him.

But she's my daughter and I can't just watch as she ruins her life.

Maybe I'm overreacting. Could you check in on her? Her name is Helena Veilmoor and she moved far south to a fortress called Hogan's Keep. Apparently she's having trouble with a gang of sentient insects. Oh, my poor idiot daughter! Let me know she's okay!
quest_29421.SuccessText:
Gambling again! And of course she needs money. And now I'm stuck in a terrible position: I can let her "learn her lesson" and get killed by angry insects, or I can rescue her and she learns nothing.

Don't tell Winston, but I know which one I pick. Remga crotch-grab me, I hate this, but she's my daughter.

quest_29422.Description: Sam Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "I need to pay off Helena's debt. But I can't entrust her with the money. Can I ask you to deliver it to the mantises? I've been communicating via letter with a mantis named Irkima. He... or she? Eh, whatever. It will take posession of the money. "
quest_29422.MidwayText:
I have been expecting this! The pass code was sent by pigeon ahead of you.

Yes, this amount is correct. I'll let our Queen know Helena's payment is finally made. The enforcers should stop hunting her in one to three days. She should be on her guard until then.
quest_29422.Name: Paying Helena's Debts
quest_29422.PrefaceText: I need to pay off Helena's debt. But I can't entrust her with the money. Can I ask you to deliver it to the mantises? I've been communicating via letter with a mantis named Irkima. He... or she? Eh, whatever. It will take posession of the money.
quest_29422.SuccessText:
It went off without a hitch, then? I was worried that they couldn't be trusted. I hope I was wrong.

Thank you for helping my daughter. I have another request of you, if you have time.

quest_29423.Description:
Sam Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "Helena is a degenerate. She's addicted to gambling, and worse: she's addicted to CHEATING at gambling. But still, she's a Veilmoor. If she should fall prey to a monster or a highwayman, it would tarnish the Veilmoor name. That's my excuse, anyway.

I want to send her an amulet of protection. This is a family recipe, handed down for three generations. Four, if I ever teach it to Helena. I have the basics, but I need some special foci."
quest_29423.Name: Ensuring Helena's Protection
quest_29423.PrefaceText:
