Helena is a degenerate. She's addicted to gambling, and worse: she's addicted to CHEATING at gambling. But still, she's a Veilmoor. If she should fall prey to a monster or a highwayman, it would tarnish the Veilmoor name. That's my excuse, anyway.

I want to send her an amulet of protection. This is a family recipe, handed down for three generations. Four, if I ever teach it to Helena. I have the basics, but I need some special foci.
quest_29423.SuccessText: I'll finish up the amulet now. Then you can take it to her, okay?

quest_29424.Description:
Sam Veilmoor in Statehelm said, "Here: it's finished. This amulet only works for those of Veilmoor blood. For us, it will protect against death itself! Once. Plus, I've altered this one so that I can track where it is, in case she gets kidnapped. That was quite an expensive ritual, too.

Tell her none of that. Just deliver it to her. Helena will know what it is and what it means."
quest_29424.MidwayText: You've been talking to my mom even after I told you to stop. That's pretty dick. And now you bring me a cursed amulet. I know what this is! It looks like a peace offering, but it's actually a collar. She can tell where I am when I wear this, can't she?! TELL ME! That's what I thought. It will protect me from death, but also tell my mother where I am at all times. Well, she obviously knows where I am already. So I guess I'm leashed. [Helena puts the amulet on.] And hey, fuck you.
quest_29424.Name: Delivering Helena's Safety
quest_29424.PrefaceText:
Here: it's finished. This amulet only works for those of Veilmoor blood. For us, it will protect against death itself! Once. Plus, I've altered this one so that I can track where it is, in case she gets kidnapped. That was quite an expensive ritual, too.

Tell her none of that. Just deliver it to her. Helena will know what it is and what it means.
quest_29424.SuccessText: You told her it could track her?! Now she'll have second thoughts of keeping it on when she does illicit things! Sigh. At least she'll wear it when she sleeps at home. I suppose that is something.

quest_29441.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "Hey, I have to stand around watching recruits during business hours, so I keep missing my chance to pick up a package from Pumza's weapons stall. Can you go get it for me?"
quest_29441.MidwayText: Ah, for Sir Hughes? Here it is. Special-ordered to his specifications. Remind him that the creator wishes to remain anonymous. Creating these weapons for non-rakshasa could be embarrassing.
quest_29441.Name: Package for Sir Hughes
quest_29441.PrefaceText: Hey, I have to stand around watching recruits during business hours, so I keep missing my chance to pick up a package from Pumza's weapons stall. Can you go get it for me?
quest_29441.SuccessText:
Thank you. I hope it wasn't out of your way!

This claw is just as I'd hoped! I'm expanding my horizons to encompass rakshasa claw techniques in my fighting.

quest_29442.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "You want to get better at hand-to-hand combat fast? I know just the thing. Wrestle giant snakes. It works! Of course, you need a certain level of skill beforehand. That's why we don't use this technique with raw recruits. But you're not raw, are you? Show me what you can do against the massive vipers in Povus. [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29442.Name: Wrestling Vipers
quest_29442.PrefaceText: You want to get better at hand-to-hand combat fast? I know just the thing. Wrestle giant snakes. It works! Of course, you need a certain level of skill beforehand. That's why we don't use this technique with raw recruits. But you're not raw, are you? Show me what you can do against the massive vipers in Povus. [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]
quest_29442.SuccessText: You wrestled snakes in the swamp? I bet you learned a lot, right? Right?! Of course you did. I was right.

quest_29443.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "If giant vipers were too easy, then you should move on to punching giant scorpions. There's mounds of scorpions in Vidaria. Go punch one up! You'll learn a lot. A lot about pain. But that's part of it! [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29443.Name: Wrestling Scorpions
quest_29443.PrefaceText: If giant vipers were too easy, then you should move on to punching giant scorpions. There's mounds of scorpions in Vidaria. Go punch one up! You'll learn a lot. A lot about pain. But that's part of it! [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]
quest_29443.SuccessText:
You seriously defeated a dozen scorpions barehanded?

Hmm. I misjudged you. That's my mistake.

quest_29444.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "Here is one I've struggled with myself: can you defeat demons barehanded? Not the wimpy ones -- the Behemoths! [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]"
quest_29444.Name: Wrestling Demons
quest_29444.PrefaceText: Here is one I've struggled with myself: can you defeat demons barehanded? Not the wimpy ones -- the Behemoths! [You must have the Unarmed skill active to advance this quest.]
quest_29444.SuccessText:
I'm impressed. Perhaps you could teach me a thing or two!

But I bet I can still find ways to help you improve your skill.

quest_29445.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "We've seen how you can punch. But now you need to really test your kicking power. Go and kick some of those demon dogs -- those Cerberi -- to death. Take off your shoes and any leg guards so you can feel the complete motion of your limbs. [You must have the empty Feet and Legs slots, and kill enemies with Kick abilities, to advance this quest.]"
quest_29445.Name: Kicking Cerberi

Objectives.Description: Kick Cerberi to Death. Don't Die!

quest_29445.PrefaceText: We've seen how you can punch. But now you need to really test your kicking power. Go and kick some of those demon dogs -- those Cerberi -- to death. Take off your shoes and any leg guards so you can feel the complete motion of your limbs. [You must have the empty Feet and Legs slots, and kill enemies with Kick abilities, to advance this quest.]
quest_29445.SuccessText: See how much more range of motion you have when you free your limbs? Take that lesson with you. Think about how to apply that knowledge without reducing your survivability.

quest_29446.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "I'm quite skilled with punching weapons and claws, and I'll tell you what helped me unlock my full potential: sewer practice. Find your way down into the sewer and use your Slashing Strike on the slimes down there."
quest_29446.Name: Mastering the Claw

Objectives.Description: Use Slashing Strike on Sewer Slime and Defeat Them. Don't Die!

quest_29446.PrefaceText: I'm quite skilled with punching weapons and claws, and I'll tell you what helped me unlock my full potential: sewer practice. Find your way down into the sewer and use your Slashing Strike on the slimes down there.
quest_29446.SuccessText: Did you see how they slide around your fist, but cleaved clean with the claw? Slimes are resistant to crushing, but not slashing! I bet you didn't know that until now, right?

quest_29447.Description:
Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "Well, I'm convinced you know how to handle yourself! Why don't you do some clean up work for us out in the field? I can pay you from one of the military funds. Win-win, and you'll still be getting better with your skills. Win-win-win!

Of course, I can't compensate you if you die. Be careful out there!"
quest_29447.Name: Putting your Claws and Fists to Work

Objectives.Description: Kill Evil Prisms in Vidaria. Don't Die!
Kill Ghostly Rhinos in Vidaria (at night). Don't Die!

quest_29447.PrefaceText:
Well, I'm convinced you know how to handle yourself! Why don't you do some clean up work for us out in the field? I can pay you from one of the military funds. Win-win, and you'll still be getting better with your skills. Win-win-win!

Of course, I can't compensate you if you die. Be careful out there!
quest_29447.SuccessText: Excellent work! Many of our troops out there have focused on fighting demons, and these other crazy beasts prey on their lack of experience. You've saved lives today!

quest_29448.Description: Sir Hughes in Statehelm said, "Have you got time to handle more beasties in Vidaria? You're making things safer for our troops out there. Remember, safety is our top concern. It would obviously be mission-failure if you died!"
quest_29448.Name: More Soldierly Work

Objectives.Description: Kill Brain Demons in Vidaria. Don't Die!
Kill Demonic Flapskulls in Vidaria. Don't Die!

quest_29448.PrefaceText: Have you got time to handle more beasties in Vidaria? You're making things safer for our troops out there. Remember, safety is our top concern. It would obviously be mission-failure if you died!
quest_29448.SuccessText: Good on you. You're using your skills for good! Not everyone can say that.

quest_29461.Description:
Cynthia Rolfe in Statehelm said, "Nah, I don't think you can help with this roach problem. I need some of those fancy bug bombs, but they're hard to come by.

I guess if you're handy with a gizmo, you could build some and fumigate the place for us. I'd sure appreciate that!

Ser Hackley at the Council Headquarters could give you blueprints for the bug bombs, if you know how to read such things."
quest_29461.Name: Roaches in the Bar

Objectives.Description: Use Bug Bombs to Fumigate the Goblin's Armpit

quest_29461.PrefaceText:
Nah, I don't think you can help with this roach problem. I need some of those fancy bug bombs, but they're hard to come by.

I guess if you're handy with a gizmo, you could build some and fumigate the place for us. I'd sure appreciate that!

Ser Hackley at the Council Headquarters could give you blueprints for the bug bombs, if you know how to read such things.
quest_29461.SuccessText: Remga's Sweaty Balls! We're roach free! Give it a week and we'll be right back to where we were, but let's live it up while the living's good!

quest_29471.Description:
Steven Poplar in Statehelm said, "Arisetsu despises undeath. As any sane person should! I'm always on the lookout for potential undeath incidents, and I've detected one nearby.

In Vidaria there's a massive floating rock. Under that rock flow a constant stream of the undead. The soldiers are doing what they can to prevent the undead from swarming, but they could use help.

Seek out the "Lungers". They're causing the most harm right now. Oh, and the dark-casting skeletons. Oh and also the fiery ones."
quest_29471.Name: Preventing Undead Assaults
quest_29471.PrefaceText:
Arisetsu despises undeath. As any sane person should! I'm always on the lookout for potential undeath incidents, and I've detected one nearby.

In Vidaria there's a massive floating rock. Under that rock flow a constant stream of the undead. The soldiers are doing what they can to prevent the undead from swarming, but they could use help.

Seek out the "Lungers". They're causing the most harm right now. Oh, and the dark-casting skeletons. Oh and also the fiery ones.
quest_29471.SuccessText: Does it seem safer there? I hope so. When undead congregate in large enough numbers, it can be very difficult to stop them.

quest_29472.Description:
Steven Poplar in Statehelm said, "You've proven yourself capable on the battlefield. I wonder if you would like to learn of another way to help Arisetsu's mission?

It's a bit unorthodox. I'm sure my higher-ups in the church wouldn't approve. But I think it's worthwhile.

I'm sorry for being vague. You see, I promised someone that I'd let them vet anyone I wanted to pass on this knowledge to. He's dead, but his wife will know what he was looking for. Go get her blessing to learn the secret. Fransesca is in the wizard school. Yes, she's a necromancer. But she's one of the good ones. Trust me."
quest_29472.MidwayText: What? Steven sent you? Steven is dead! Oh. You mean the priest. Yes, I know what you're referring to. [Fransesca scrutinizes you for a moment.] Okay. You're clear. Tell him "fizzlebump". That's the secret code that means you're clear.
quest_29472.Name: Secret Permission
quest_29472.PrefaceText:
You've proven yourself capable on the battlefield. I wonder if you would like to learn of another way to help Arisetsu's mission?

It's a bit unorthodox. I'm sure my higher-ups in the church wouldn't approve. But I think it's worthwhile.

I'm sorry for being vague. You see, I promised someone that I'd let them vet anyone I wanted to pass on this knowledge to. He's dead, but his wife will know what he was looking for. Go get her blessing to learn the secret. Fransesca is in the wizard school. Yes, she's a necromancer. But she's one of the good ones. Trust me.
quest_29472.SuccessText: I'm glad she didn't have a problem with you. She's said no a few times and I can never guess the reason. But anyway, that's great news! I knew her husband better than I know her. His name was Steven too. I miss him. Uh sorry, anyway, let me teach you something interesting. [New Hangout Available.]

quest_29473.Description: Steven Poplar in Statehelm said, "Time to practice the technique I taught you to harvest excess negative emotions. Check my almanac to see what sort of undead are best to hunt right now. Then go kill them until you find some pearls! Remember: you don't have to be a priest to do this, but you do have to be wearing a Symbol of Arisetsu while you kill the undead."
quest_29473.Name: Pearl-Harvesting Practice
quest_29473.PrefaceText: Time to practice the technique I taught you to harvest excess negative emotions. Check my almanac to see what sort of undead are best to hunt right now. Then go kill them until you find some pearls! Remember: you don't have to be a priest to do this, but you do have to be wearing a Symbol of Arisetsu while you kill the undead.
quest_29473.SuccessText: Great work! I can turn this negative emotion into healing and warmth. Here, take this as thanks. In the future, you can convert these pearls directly via the evil spiky mirror.

quest_29474.Description:
Steven Poplar in Statehelm said, "It's that time again: time to ask for help paying the rent for over fifty would-be homeless people! We've promised to pay their rent until they're able to pay it themselves, and we need your help to do that!

For tax-clarity purposes, I would appreciate any donation be in the form of Council Certificates."
quest_29474.Name: Donations Accepted
quest_29474.PrefaceText:
It's that time again: time to ask for help paying the rent for over fifty would-be homeless people! We've promised to pay their rent until they're able to pay it themselves, and we need your help to do that!

For tax-clarity purposes, I would appreciate any donation be in the form of Council Certificates.
quest_29474.SuccessText: Thank you! You've been so generous. Here are some tokens of the church. If you'd like, I can trade them in for special favors.

quest_29481.Description:
Parella in Statehelm said, "I keep watch on the seas for Ranalon activity. And good thing I do! Recently a mysterious slab has appeared in the water on the other side of the city. You can't even see it from here, that's how far it is. They're trying to hide from me!

I think it's an assault force, hiding in the caves beneath the city. When the slab activates, they'll show up to attack. We need to activate that beacon early, before they're fully prepared. That will catch them off guard. The only trick is: how do we activate it?

I need to call in a favor from a ranalon I once saved. His name is Gozzaroon. He's hiding in an undersea cave off of Sun Vale. Sun Vale's this little island we druids like to congregate at. Go find Gozzaroon, tell him I'm calling in the favor, and demand the secret to activating these beacons."
quest_29481.MidwayText:
I see nothing, I say nothing! I... What? Parella? Oh no. The time has come. Very well, I made a deal and I will stand by it.

Here. I've written it down. Tell noone that I've betrayed my people this way. I'm hunted enough as it is!

I hope never to see you or Parella again!
quest_29481.Name: The Fishy Beacon
quest_29481.PrefaceText:
I keep watch on the seas for Ranalon activity. And good thing I do! Recently a mysterious slab has appeared in the water on the other side of the city. You can't even see it from here, that's how far it is. They're trying to hide from me!

I think it's an assault force, hiding in the caves beneath the city. When the slab activates, they'll show up to attack. We need to activate that beacon early, before they're fully prepared. That will catch them off guard. The only trick is: how do we activate it?

I need to call in a favor from a ranalon I once saved. His name is Gozzaroon. He's hiding in an undersea cave off of Sun Vale. Sun Vale's this little island we druids like to congregate at. Go find Gozzaroon, tell him I'm calling in the favor, and demand the secret to activating these beacons.
quest_29481.SuccessText: Gozzaroon came through! I half-expected him to renege on the bargain. Well, all of this seems pretty easily obtainable. Unfortunately I have to stay here and keep watch. Interested in getting your hands dirty?

quest_29482.Description:
Parella in Statehelm said, "Here's the recipe from Gozzaroon. Make one of these, find the stone slab in the ocean, and use the beacon there. Then watch out! Ranalon will come from everywhere.

Kill a bunch of them to stop their progress.

I suppose you could do this on your own, but were I you, I would gather some backup before attacking an army."
quest_29482.Name: Activating The Ranalon Beacon

Objectives.Description: Activate the Shrine and Kill Ranalon

quest_29482.PrefaceText:
Here's the recipe from Gozzaroon. Make one of these, find the stone slab in the ocean, and use the beacon there. Then watch out! Ranalon will come from everywhere.

Kill a bunch of them to stop their progress.

I suppose you could do this on your own, but were I you, I would gather some backup before attacking an army.
quest_29482.SuccessText: I saw you firsthand! Very brave stuff. You've put a damper on the Ranalon plans, and helped protect Statehelm.

quest_29483.Description:
Parella in Statehelm said, "I've been watching the scattered ranalon off the coast, and I have grim news. A powerful chieftan is ready to lead the remaining ranalon in an attack! You totally need to kill him.

Activate the same underwater beacon as before, and this time look for Dreadfin Absolum. Oh, and bring some backup, or you'll surely drown!

Don't worry, you have my confidence in you. It will serve as a guide!"
quest_29483.Name: Back to the Beacon

Objectives.Description: Activate the Shrine and Kill Dreadfin Absolum

quest_29483.PrefaceText:
I've been watching the scattered ranalon off the coast, and I have grim news. A powerful chieftan is ready to lead the remaining ranalon in an attack! You totally need to kill him.

Activate the same underwater beacon as before, and this time look for Dreadfin Absolum. Oh, and bring some backup, or you'll surely drown!

Don't worry, you have my confidence in you. It will serve as a guide!
quest_29483.SuccessText:
Absolum is dead! You've really made a difference today. And a very powerful enemy. But that's a problem for another day. Today we celebrate!

Okay, celebration time is over.

quest_29484.Description: Parella in Statehelm said, "I'm sorry to say that the ranalon are raising another army. I need you to activate the same beacon as before and slay them! Remember: if you die it will be seen as a sign of our weakness. Stay alive no matter what! [Dying will reset progress on this quest.]"
quest_29484.Name: Repel More Ranalon

Objectives.Description: Activate the Shrine and Kill Ranalon. Don't die!

quest_29484.PrefaceText: I'm sorry to say that the ranalon are raising another army. I need you to activate the same beacon as before and slay them! Remember: if you die it will be seen as a sign of our weakness. Stay alive no matter what! [Dying will reset progress on this quest.]

quest_29491.Description:
Sir Fisk in Statehelm said, "I met the famous Denton Razor while I was stationed in Vidaria. You might say he's my nemesis: I'm the master of the crossbow and he the bow. But I'm not afraid to say that he's my better in most respects. Once I had a chance to kill him, and I let him live. Things got strange after that.

I'd like to goad my nemesis by giving him his most-hated flower. If you did this for me, he'd know immediately who was responsible, and it would completely ruin his day! He deserves it, don't worry.

Sometimes when you look through the weeds of Vidaria you find particularly vibrant painclovers. Deliver some of those to him!"
quest_29491.MidwayText: Where'd you... [Denton breaks into a grin.] The fucker remembered my birthday. Tell him he owes me a duel, and that I'm still waiting. But tell him I won't wait forever. He'll know what I mean.
quest_29491.Name: My Archery Nemesis

Objectives.Description: Give Vibrant Painclover to Denton Razor

quest_29491.PrefaceText:
I met the famous Denton Razor while I was stationed in Vidaria. You might say he's my nemesis: I'm the master of the crossbow and he the bow. But I'm not afraid to say that he's my better in most respects. Once I had a chance to kill him, and I let him live. Things got strange after that.

I'd like to goad my nemesis by giving him his most-hated flower. If you did this for me, he'd know immediately who was responsible, and it would completely ruin his day! He deserves it, don't worry.

Sometimes when you look through the weeds of Vidaria you find particularly vibrant painclovers. Deliver some of those to him!
quest_29491.SuccessText:
Thank you for doing that. I wish... Things were different. In another life, I'd be so much happier.

Erm, I mean happier without him taking up so much of my mindspace, I mean! In the end, having a nemesis isn't as fun as I'd imagined it'd be.

quest_29492.Description:
Sir Fisk in Statehelm said, "I have a lot of friends in the field and I'm afraid for them. We crossbowmen are seriously outclassed against the gargoyles in particular, and I fear an attack from them soon.

If you were to go take care of some gargoyles, I could make sure some of the discretionary fund ends up in your pocket."
quest_29492.Name: Gargoyles Kill Archers

Objectives.Description: Kill Gargoyle Invaders in Statehelm. Don't Die!

quest_29492.PrefaceText:
I have a lot of friends in the field and I'm afraid for them. We crossbowmen are seriously outclassed against the gargoyles in particular, and I fear an attack from them soon.

If you were to go take care of some gargoyles, I could make sure some of the discretionary fund ends up in your pocket.
quest_29492.SuccessText: That's impressive work. I appreciate it.

quest_29501.Description:
Sir Fisk in Statehelm said, "You're the one that brought me the painclover from Louis, right? Yes, it was definitely you. How did he look? Still sickly? He'd taken so much demon poison that I didn't think he'd survive. I'd almost given up hope, actually.

But if he's healthy now, he needs to come here and live in my camp.

As you're obviously a florist of some skill, could you find some of Louis's favorite flowers and deliver them to him? He'll know what it means. And I will pay you zealously. For your efforts as much as for your discretion."
quest_29501.MidwayText: These are from Denton? That man! He hurts my soul! He wants me to desert my post! How presumptuous can a man be? And the worst part is that I so wish to do it. Perhaps it's a spell. No, I think he's a master psychologist. He's turned my thoughts against me. Tell him I'll always ... Tell him that I would... [Sir Fisk turns from you and waves you way.]
quest_29501.Name: Blasted Louis
quest_29501.PrefaceText:
You're the one that brought me the painclover from Louis, right? Yes, it was definitely you. How did he look? Still sickly? He'd taken so much demon poison that I didn't think he'd survive. I'd almost given up hope, actually.

But if he's healthy now, he needs to come here and live in my camp.

As you're obviously a florist of some skill, could you find some of Louis's favorite flowers and deliver them to him? He'll know what it means. And I will pay you zealously. For your efforts as much as for your discretion.
quest_29501.SuccessText: Fucking coward. Not you, Louis. What he and I did is already a crime! Many times over! They'd take his cock if they knew. And he knows I can keep him safe here. And we all know he's unhappy where he is! I'm so tired of cowards that say they want love and then they can't handle it. I thank you for your efforts. If you happen to see him again, ... don't tell him anything, actually. We've said our peace.

quest_29511.Description: Jenny Foster in Statehelm is a werewolf and has invited you to find her "in the sewer" during the full moon. She can teach you new moves in exchange for Tokens of Norala.
quest_29511.Name: Meet Me Under the Full Moon
quest_29511.SuccessText: You talked to Jenny Foster during the full moon.

quest_29521.Description: Captain Gregory in Statehelm said, "We always need extra ammunition for the front-line troops. Today they're asking for Amazing Arrows. I'll pay handsomely for them, but you need to make them to military standards, so no using old musty stock."
quest_29521.Name: Amazing Arrows
quest_29521.PrefaceText: We always need extra ammunition for the front-line troops. Today they're asking for Amazing Arrows. I'll pay handsomely for them, but you need to make them to military standards, so no using old musty stock.
quest_29521.SuccessText:
Excellent work. You may have saved lives today.

Come back tomorrow because we'll no doubt need something else!

quest_29601.Description: Help exterminate the ratkin muggers that have spread throughout the town. [Quest can only be advanced at night.] [Progress is lost if you die.]
quest_29601.Name: Statehelm: Ratkin Muggers

Objectives.Description: Kill Ratkin Muggers Before Dawn Without Dying

quest_29601.PrefaceText: There are a LOT of muggers out tonight. You could make a big improvement to the city's safety by exterminating a bunch of them before the scurry back into whatever hole they came out of. But you know that your safety is paramount: you mustn't die on such a mundane errand! [Quest can only be advanced at night.] [Progress is lost if you die.]
quest_29601.SuccessText: A job well done. Of course, due to their incredible reproductive prowess, a new generation of ratkin will soon replace the ones you've slain. There will be just as many ratkin out tomorrow night -- but they'll be a little less smug about it.

quest_29602.Description: Help exterminate the myconain vagabonds that pop up wherever there are broken streetlamps at night. [Progress is lost if you die.]
quest_29602.Name: Statehelm: Myconian Vagabonds

Objectives.Description: Kill Myconian Vagabonds at Night. Don't die!

quest_29602.PrefaceText: Whenever a streetlight stays broken for too long, a miserable myconian vagabond sprouts up. They attack anyone who gets too near, making them dangerous. These varieties are not intelligent enough to communicate with, so they must be removed! Safely! [Progress is lost if you die.]
quest_29602.SuccessText: A job well done. Of course, trying to stop the growth of fungus is a doomed adventure. But doomed adventures are the ones they write about in the history books, right? No, that doesn't make sense here.

quest_30.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on a total of 25 different candles inside the nearby crypt! That's going to take a lot of delving.
quest_30.Name: Fiery Secrets, Round 3
quest_30.PrefaceText: Okay, last time. Just go touch candles until your hand burns off. Hyperbole! Relax! How about 25, just to be damned sure we've got it done?
quest_30.SuccessText:
Yes! That's it! See this pattern here? They burn tiny near-imperceptible scars into your flesh. It's a pattern, see? I think the dots make the outline of a snake. Weird...

Well, I'll study it more. Thanks! Here, take this.

quest_30101.Description:
Percy Evans in Eltibule said, "You have a lot of friends, right? I need your help fast or I won't make it. When the moon was new, I called upon Talerra to find out where my wife's soul went. She answered me! And now I pay her customary price: I can't feel hope for a full year.

I know it sounds foolish, but I thought I'd outsmarted her by stockpiling Pick-Me-Up Juice. As long as I'm on the Juice, I can feel some hope, but I go almost catatonic when it wears off. Last time that happened, I almost died of dehydration before Hogan happened to stop by.

So I try to keep it in my system at all times. But I was never very good at math, and a few hundred bottles won't last even close to a year! I need a bigger supply."
quest_30101.Name: Guild: Percy's Gamble (10-person)
quest_30101.PrefaceText:
You have a lot of friends, right? I need your help fast or I won't make it. When the moon was new, I called upon Talerra to find out where my wife's soul went. She answered me! And now I pay her customary price: I can't feel hope for a full year.

I know it sounds foolish, but I thought I'd outsmarted her by stockpiling Pick-Me-Up Juice. As long as I'm on the Juice, I can feel some hope, but I go almost catatonic when it wears off. Last time that happened, I almost died of dehydration before Hogan happened to stop by.

So I try to keep it in my system at all times. But I was never very good at math, and a few hundred bottles won't last even close to a year! I need a bigger supply.
quest_30101.SuccessText: Thank you so much. I have another favor to ask: help me avenge my wife's death and retrieve her soul!

quest_30102.Description:
Percy Evans in Eltibule said, "You have a lot of friends, right? I need your help fast or I won't make it. When the moon was new, I called upon Talerra to find out where my wife's soul went. She answered me! And now I pay her customary price: I can't feel hope for a full year.

I know it sounds foolish, but I thought I'd outsmarted her by stockpiling Pick-Me-Up Juice. As long as I'm on the Juice, I can feel some hope, but I go almost catatonic when it wears off. Last time that happened, I almost died of dehydration before Hogan happened to stop by.

So I try to keep it in my system at all times. But I was never very good at math, and a few hundred bottles won't last even close to a year! I need a bigger supply.

I also need something to inhibit my memories of despair... it makes the Juice last longer. Some ditzy elf gave me a few bottles last week, but she said she can't make enough to keep me going. Elves: always flaking out when you need 'em! Ahem... no offense to you and your friends, of course."

I also need something to inhibit my memories... there's a potion that does it, but damned if I can get a steady supply of it. But any amount is helpful.

Oh, and I'd be much obliged if you could clean up some of those damned fairy bears! I haven't been able to get to thinning their numbers myself recently."

quest_30121.Description:
Percy Evans in Eltibule said, "When I beseeched Talerra, she told me what I'd somehow known all along: my Lydia didn't fade into blessed nothing. The thing that killed her captured her soul and keeps it as a trinket.

I'm helpless to save her -- she's in that damned fairy realm, but it's not reachable from the portal I know about. There must be some other way to get in. If you find the way in, kill all the fiends you can! Look for a floaty snake thing called the Despair Puck. It will have Lydia's soul."
quest_30121.Name: Guild: Storming the Nexus (10-person)

Objectives.Description: Kill Winter Trolls in Winter Nexus
Finally, Give the Soul to Percy

quest_30121.PrefaceText:
When I beseeched Talerra, she told me what I'd somehow known all along: my Lydia didn't fade into blessed nothing. The thing that killed her captured her soul and keeps it as a trinket.

I'm helpless to save her -- she's in that damned fairy realm, but it's not reachable from the portal I know about. There must be some other way to get in. If you find the way in, kill all the fiends you can! Look for a floaty snake thing called the Despair Puck. It will have Lydia's soul.
quest_30121.SuccessText:
This is her soul? Oh... oh. I guess I should shatter it and free her, huh. ...

I can't do it! She's in pain in here, but I can't bring myself to release her. There has to be another way! If only Lord Eltibule were still alive. Hmm... that gives me an idea...

quest_30141.Description: Spot in Animal Town said, "Hi! If you like to help animals, you should help us, because we're animals. And we need help! Sebastian and Grana went away to rescue some smart snails in Verta, but they took too much of our food. Now we don't have enough. When they come back I'll say, 'I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed,' and they'll know I'm actually really mad. But right now we need new food."
quest_30141.Name: Guild: Resupply Animal Town (10-person)
quest_30141.PrefaceText: Hi! If you like to help animals, you should help us, because we're animals. And we need help! Sebastian and Grana went away to rescue some smart snails in Verta, but they took too much of our food. Now we don't have enough. When they come back I'll say, 'I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed,' and they'll know I'm actually really mad. But right now we need new food.
quest_30141.SuccessText: You did it! That's a lot of food! Now you should go help more animals since you like helping animals. You should go find Red and Mittens, they need help. But it's really cold in Kur and I can't go. Okay, love you, bye.

quest_30143.Description: Spot in Animal Town said, "Hi! If you like to help animals, you should help us, because we're animals. And we need help! Sebastian and Grana went away to rescue some smart snails in Verta, but they took too much of our food. Now we don't have enough. When they come back I'll say, 'I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed,' and they'll know I'm actually really mad. But right now we need new food."

quest_30161.Description: Red in Kur Mountains said, "Well, if Spot likes you, I guess you're okay. With your help, we might make it through winter after all. But I'll warn you: you'll have to go up against werewolves. If you want to back out, I completely understand. I'm not stupid enough to take werewolves on either!"

Objectives.Description: Kill Insane Werewolves in the Forest

quest_30181.Description:
Nissim in Amulna said, "I want Amulna to be a welcoming place for all creatures, but so few desert-dwellers behave appropriately. Even our fellow Rakshasa have attacked our settlement several times this year. And then the roving packs of cat-things attacked... and of course those ridiculous human-faced cat things...

Simply put, the Sand Seer is the only reason we haven't been overrun already. But she won't be living here forever. This part of the desert must be made more secure!"
quest_30181.Name: Guild: Securing the Ilmari Desert (10-person)
quest_30181.PrefaceText:
I want Amulna to be a welcoming place for all creatures, but so few desert-dwellers behave appropriately. Even our fellow Rakshasa have attacked our settlement several times this year. And then the roving packs of cat-things attacked... and of course those ridiculous human-faced cat things...

Simply put, the Sand Seer is the only reason we haven't been overrun already. But she won't be living here forever. This part of the desert must be made more secure!
quest_30181.SuccessText:
Ah, all current and future citizens of Amulna thank you! We won't forget your hard work.

The Sand Seer mentioned that she needed the help of you and your friends -- you should see her as soon as you can.

quest_30201.Description: The Sand Seer in Amulna said, "It was good of you to see me. I fear for this little town's future, and it's not because of the meager creatures that rove the desert. No, the trouble comes from deep beneath the sands. I've learned that there are thousands of Crone Hegemony troops down there, left behind after some relatively-recent war. They are breeding, and scheming, and very, very angry. It's only a matter of time before they rise up and claim the desert. You must strike while they are still weak and unprepared. Seek out their tunnel entrances and put an end to the danger."
quest_30201.Name: Guild: Menace Beneath the Sand (10-person)

Objectives.Description: Kill Giant Beetles Beneath the Sands

quest_30201.PrefaceText: It was good of you to see me. I fear for this little town's future, and it's not because of the meager creatures that rove the desert. No, the trouble comes from deep beneath the sands. I've learned that there are thousands of Crone Hegemony troops down there, left behind after some relatively-recent war. They are breeding, and scheming, and very, very angry. It's only a matter of time before they rise up and claim the desert. You must strike while they are still weak and unprepared. Seek out their tunnel entrances and put an end to the danger.
quest_30201.SuccessText: So your skirmish was successful? Very good. They may still rise up, but I have confidence that you and your allies will be able to handle them if they do. It seems your services might be appreciated in the Vidaria demon efforts as well. You should seek out one of the army's leaders there.

quest_30202.Description: The Sand Seer in Amulna said, "It was good of you to see me. I fear for this little town's future, and it's not because of the meager creatures that rove the desert. Seek out their tunnel entrances and put an end to the danger. Oh! And since you'll be heading down there anyway, perhaps you could collect some items for me? I mean, it'd be foolish to waste this opportunity to study Hegemony weapons..."

Objectives.Description: Kill Giant Beetles Beneath the Sands
Give Minotaur Hammers to Sand Seer

quest_30221.Description: Nelson Ballard in Serbule said, "I'm worried about something that's probably far-fetched... but I don't dare ignore the possibility. That fool elf Pennoc invited a traveling circus from Senoca to come visit here. We're much too small for a circus to normally bother with, but he promised them an exceptionally friendly welcome, "in elven style", and he even promised free room and board for weeks! I would have had Pennoc thrown in the dungeon if we had a dungeon. Sigh. What if his ploy works and the circus comes here? I barely have enough supplies for the elven refugees, let alone a bunch of circus freaks! Can you help me prepare for the worst-case scenario?"
quest_30221.Name: Guild: Afraid of The Circus (10-person)
quest_30221.PrefaceText: I'm worried about something that's probably far-fetched... but I don't dare ignore the possibility. That fool elf Pennoc invited a traveling circus from Senoca to come visit here. We're much too small for a circus to normally bother with, but he promised them an exceptionally friendly welcome, "in elven style", and he even promised free room and board for weeks! I would have had Pennoc thrown in the dungeon if we had a dungeon. Sigh. What if his ploy works and the circus comes here? I barely have enough supplies for the elven refugees, let alone a bunch of circus freaks! Can you help me prepare for the worst-case scenario?
quest_30221.SuccessText:
Thank you so much. Even if the circus doesn't come here -- and I hope they do not -- your work will not be wasted. I'm sure there will be more elven refugees arriving soon enough, and we'll be able to make them feel at home here, thanks to you.

And as for Pennoc... I'll deal with him soon enough.

quest_30241.Description: Percy Evans in Eltibule said, "I need you to help me reincarnate Lydia. Her soul is still trapped in this bauble you retrieved for me, but I think I can get her a new body. How? Well... don't ask me how I got a hold of this ritual, because that would make you sad. Instead, just help me bring her back! I need some very specific ingredients. Lord Eltibule is buried with one part. The other parts might be harder to find... but you're resourceful, you can do it!"
quest_30241.Name: Guild: Reclaiming Lydia (10-person)

Objectives.Description: Give Lord Eltibule's Signet Ring to Percy

quest_30241.PrefaceText: I need you to help me reincarnate Lydia. Her soul is still trapped in this bauble you retrieved for me, but I think I can get her a new body. How? Well... don't ask me how I got a hold of this ritual, because that would make you sad. Instead, just help me bring her back! I need some very specific ingredients. Lord Eltibule is buried with one part. The other parts might be harder to find... but you're resourceful, you can do it!
quest_30241.SuccessText: Good. That's all of the ingredients. Now I have some deals to make. I'll complete the ritual when the moon is right. Come visit me later and I'll let you know how it went. You should be proud: you and your friends are lifesavers, literally! Hopefully...

quest_30261.Description: Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "We need all the help we can get. The demons seem to be never-ending, and our supplies are ever-dwindling. Armor, weapons, rations - you name it, we need it! Statehelm is providing as many as they can, but it's simply not enough. Can we count on you and your people to aid us?"
quest_30261.Name: Guild: Support the War Effort (10-person)

Objectives.Description: Give Decent Chainmail Coats to Ser Lorentz

quest_30261.PrefaceText: We need all the help we can get. The demons seem to be never-ending, and our supplies are ever-dwindling. Armor, weapons, rations - you name it, we need it! Statehelm is providing as many as they can, but it's simply not enough. Can we count on you and your people to aid us?
quest_30261.SuccessText: Excellent work. Excellent work! With these supplies, we have a fighting chance after all. Your assistance will not soon be forgotten, not by me nor any of my troops.

quest_30281.Description: Ser Lorentz in Vidaria said, "We are fully stocked up on supplies now, and it's time to take the fight to the demons! Gather your own troops, and help us cull these endless hordes."
quest_30281.Name: Guild: Join the War Effort (10-person)
quest_30281.PrefaceText: We are fully stocked up on supplies now, and it's time to take the fight to the demons! Gather your own troops, and help us cull these endless hordes.
quest_30281.SuccessText:
On behalf of my troops, Statehelm itself, and indeed all of Alharth, you have our heartfelt thanks. You did amazing work out there.

I'll instruct Ferris to share as much knowledge about the demons with you as we can.

quest_31.Description: Jace Soral has asked you to defeat a hugely powerful werewolf named Bleddyn, somewhere in the forested part of the Kur Mountains. He mentioned that you'd need allies to do it. He also mentioned that silver weapons are extra effective against him.
quest_31.Name: Defeat Bleddyn

quest_32.Description: When you first awoke on an island, you met an elf named Riger who seemed depressed and asked for something to cure his depression. Unfortunately, he wasn't clear about what that might be.
quest_32.Name: Cheer Up Riger

quest_33.Description: A Summer fairy named Fazzi taught you a ritual that you can use to free some Summer fae that are being tortured in the Winter Corridors.
quest_33.Name: Free Tortured Fairies
quest_33.SuccessText: You freed them? Great! That was a nice thing to do. Twenty thousand years of torture is just really a lot, you know?

quest_34.Description:
Landri the Cold asked you to enter the dungeon underneath the tower in Kur and find her old mentor, a necromancer named Lomas. She wants his skull as proof that he's fully dead.

Landri gave you a special amulet that can let you enter the ice barrier deep within the dungeon.
quest_34.Name: Into the Kur Tower

quest_35.Description: Leonard Allenson won't talk to you without proof that you're not a horrific monster. Conveniently, he knows the perfect way: bring him a stack of bacon.
quest_35.Name: Convince Leonard

quest_36.Description:
An old elf named Elmetaph said he could teach you Teleportation. You just need to find an amethyst first.

He suggested you search around the old teleportation platforms for lost gems, but mentioned that amethysts might be anywhere on the island.
quest_36.Name: Find an Amethyst

quest_37.Description: An old elf named Elmetaph taught you some Teleportation magic. He told you to find a teleportation platform on the island and practice binding yourself to it. [ Stand on a teleportation platform and press the Crafting button on the right of the screen. Find the Bind Circle recipe and use it there. ]
quest_37.Name: Find an Amethyst

quest_38.Description: Elmetaph thinks he can change your bind location to be 'somewhere' off of this island, which would let you teleport out of here. But he needs to do some calculations first. Get the info he needs by finding four obelisks on the island.
quest_38.Name: Obelisk Math

quest_39.Description: Yurra the hag suggested that you might find Dalvos somewhere in Serbule. She said that an elf in town had been inspecting the giant red crystals that Dalvos is known to make. Find this elf and see if she can help you.
quest_39.Name: The Red Crystal

Objectives.Description: Find Someone Who Knows About Crystal

quest_4.Description: Use the wolf whistle at the teleportation platform in the forest South of Serbule, then defeat the mystical wolf pack that appears. It will be a difficult fight! Use cunning!
quest_4.Name: Defeat the Wolf Trial

Objectives.Description: Kill wolves near the teleportation platform

quest_40.Description: Yurra the hag said that the brain bugs infesting Serbule were made by Dalvos. Find where they are coming from. They are most prevalent in the north, so search there for someone who might know more.
quest_40.Name: Brain Bug Infestation

Objectives.Description: Find Someone Who Knows About Brain Bugs

quest_40001.Description: Druids, assemble in Serbule immediately. Multiple kraken eggs have been spotted there, along with several young adults. Krakens are not indigenous to this continent and represent a terrible threat to nature. Defeat them now, before they become the size of cities!
quest_40001.Name: Druid: The Krakens Are Hatching!
quest_40001.PrefaceText: Druids, assemble in Serbule immediately. Multiple kraken eggs have been spotted there, along with several young adults. Krakens are not indigenous to this continent and represent a terrible threat to nature. Defeat them now, before they become the size of cities!
quest_40001.SuccessText: Good work, my druids. The kraken incursion seems to be over. Just clean up any loose ends and then return to your peaceful lives with Dreva's blessing.

quest_40002.Description: Druids, assemble in Serbule immediately. Multiple kraken eggs have been spotted there, along with several young adults. Krakens are not indigenous to this continent and represent a terrible threat to nature. Defeat them now, before they become the size of cities!
quest_40002.Name: Druid: The Krakens Are Hatching!

quest_40003.Name: Druid: The Krakens Are Hatching!

quest_40003.SuccessText: Good work, my druids. The kraken incursion seems to be over. Just clean up any loose ends and then return to your peaceful lives with Dreva's blessing.

quest_40031.Description:
The troubled valleys of Eltibule are even more dangerous than they should be. Droaches have leaked out of the dark places in the ground to cause mayhem to the surface ecologies. Druids, go now and make it right.

Fire droaches flow from the dwarven statues and congregate near the central keep. Defeat them to lure out the more calculating electric droaches, and then defeat those as well.
quest_40031.Name: Druid: Droach Invasion
quest_40031.PrefaceText:
The troubled valleys of Eltibule are even more dangerous than they should be. Droaches have leaked out of the dark places in the ground to cause mayhem to the surface ecologies. Druids, go now and make it right.

Fire droaches flow from the dwarven statues and congregate near the central keep. Defeat them to lure out the more calculating electric droaches, and then defeat those as well.
quest_40031.SuccessText:
Excellent work. Most of the droaches are now defeated.

You have stymied the schemes of a foul and perverse god who I shall not name. Trust that your actions here were worth the price. Go now with Dreva's blessing.

quest_40061.Description:
Hark druids, in a cold and distant land named Kur, a dangerous enemy plots and schemes. You need not deal with this foe directly, but you must stymie her plans before they come to fruition.

From the frozen waters come many giant ice elementals, each as strong as ten soldiers. Dismantle them.

Nature is, as always, your ally, so you should have little fear of the icy winds while my blessing is upon you. Now go!
quest_40061.Name: Druid: Ice Giants
quest_40061.PrefaceText:
Hark druids, in a cold and distant land named Kur, a dangerous enemy plots and schemes. You need not deal with this foe directly, but you must stymie her plans before they come to fruition.

From the frozen waters come many giant ice elementals, each as strong as ten soldiers. Dismantle them.

Nature is, as always, your ally, so you should have little fear of the icy winds while my blessing is upon you. Now go!
quest_40061.SuccessText: I sense the seething rage of our dangerous foe. This can only mean that you have succeeded! Many thanks to you. Bury your fallen comrades and go back to your simple lives. Do not worry overmuch about any remaining elementals -- they will decay in time, for their master no longer drives them.

quest_40091.Description:
Relics from a long-finished war arise in the sands of the Ilmari Desert. These 'overseers' are remnants of a demonic army. They will communicate with their demon masters and convey the state of our world to outsiders. Druids, slay these creatures quickly! Every moment they exist puts our world in further peril.

Their otherworldly defenses would prove too much even for your powers, so I have augmented your 'Rotskin' ability. Use it to cut through their preliminary shielding.
quest_40091.Name: Druid: Arising From The Sands
quest_40091.PrefaceText:
Relics from a long-finished war arise in the sands of the Ilmari Desert. These 'overseers' are remnants of a demonic army. They will communicate with their demon masters and convey the state of our world to outsiders. Druids, slay these creatures quickly! Every moment they exist puts our world in further peril.

Their otherworldly defenses would prove too much even for your powers, so I have augmented your 'Rotskin' ability. Use it to cut through their preliminary shielding.
quest_40091.SuccessText:
You have broken the ranks of the creatures. Some remain, but perhaps that works to our advantage: they will communicate back to their masters that this world is not an easy target.

You have done well today, my druids. Go with Dreva's blessings.

quest_40121.Description:
Druids, head to Serbule Hills! Ranalons there have begun a ritual invocation of Enoyos, beseeching him to turn all the lakes of Serbule into brackish water.

Their stone offering-boxes surround the lake. Desecrate these boxes to disrupt the ritual, then find and slay the head shamans that swim in the lake itself.

The offering-boxes are strongly enchanted, so multiple druids will need to desecrate each one. Since the desecration ritual requires the petals of the rare Rotflower, I have caused this flower to bloom throughout the hills and mountains of Serbule Hills.

Find the Rotflowers, desecrate the offering chests, then execute the shamans.
quest_40121.Name: Druid: Flowers of Desecration
quest_40121.PrefaceText:
Druids, head to Serbule Hills! Ranalons there have begun a ritual invocation of Enoyos, beseeching him to turn all the lakes of Serbule into brackish water.

Their stone offering-boxes surround the lake. Desecrate these boxes to disrupt the ritual, then find and slay the head shamans that swim in the lake itself.

The offering-boxes are strongly enchanted, so multiple druids will need to desecrate each one. Since the desecration ritual requires the petals of the rare Rotflower, I have caused this flower to bloom throughout the hills and mountains of Serbule Hills.

Find the Rotflowers, desecrate the offering chests, then execute the shamans.
quest_40121.SuccessText:
Good work. Any attempt to alter the balance of nature must be dealt with harshly. And so you have!

Be ready for further incidents from the ranalon. They worship Enoyos, the god of oceans and water, and Enoyos has vowed to flood the world and drown all land-dwellers. I fear he may be mobilizing his minions to bring about this scheme.

But that is a problem for another day. For now, relax and enjoy the fruits of nature!

quest_41.Description: A friendly mantis named Azalak suggested that the brain bugs in the area are coming from a cave west of him. Azalak asked you to find out what happened to a human named Commander Ferrows, last seen in that cave. In exchange, you'll get something that will be useful when encountering Dalvos.
quest_41.Name: The Fate of Commander Ferrows

quest_42.Description: Dalvos isn't in Serbule. You need to find him. Eltibule is the next logical place to try.
quest_42.Name: Chasing Dalvos to Eltibule

Objectives.Description: Find someone who knows about Dalvos

quest_43.Description: Ashk in Rahu believes that a gigantic eyeball is hunting him whenever he uses his augury powers. Ashk said, "In the desert near Rahu, look for a giant skull embedded in the face of a cliff. Ignore the skull and look for a large staff in the sand near it. Stand near the staff and say something like, 'I'm going to start soothsaying now!' That should get the eye to emerge. Be ready! It is no ordinary foe. You will likely need help. Slay the creature and you shall have my utmost appreciation!" Note: this is a difficult encounter that will require a small group.
quest_43.Name: The Eye of Fate

quest_44.Description: Oritania in Eltibule has information about Dalvos's whereabouts. But she won't tell you unless you help her with some errands first. Get that info!
quest_44.Name: Learn Oritania's Secret Info

quest_44001.Description: A nature spirit hinted to you that it would appreciate your help removing junk from the Serbule moat.
quest_44001.Name: Angling: Junk Removal

Objectives.Description: Angle Rancid Ink from Serbule Moat

quest_44001.PrefaceText: Greetings, taker of fish. I cannot tell if you are a friend or foe of nature. If you be a friend, help make my home clean. A surface-walker dumped hundreds of bottles of rancid liquids in here, and then left. They are making fish sick.
quest_44001.SuccessText: You are an ally of nature! I was right!

quest_44002.Description: A nature spirit asked you to help remove invasive fish from the Serbule docks.
quest_44002.Name: Angling: Invasive Species
quest_44002.PrefaceText:
You can hear me, can you not? Then you are more than a mere fishmonger! You've taken fish, now can you give back to the sea?

Pinfish have invaded this brackish water. They are outcompeting us. It's not fair; it isn't right.
quest_44002.SuccessText:
Thank you, fisher, for helping find balance! I will teach you a way to practice your craft without taking unnecessary fish. Take what you need, but remember balance.

I mean, except for those asshole pinfish! You should eat those pan-fried.

quest_44021.Description: A nature spirit asked you to help reduce the number of scray eggs on the easternmost side of the eastern lake in Serbule Hills.
quest_44021.Name: Angling: Scray Overpopulation

Objectives.Description: Angle Scray Eggs from Serbule Hills' Lake (Easternmost)

quest_44021.PrefaceText:
A non-ranalon! Please help!

The ranalon are mostly very kind to nature, but their scray are a problem. It's already a very crowded lake, and the scray just laid more eggs! If those eggs hatch, it will be disaster for the native lake fish. Get them out!
quest_44021.SuccessText: Thank you for doing your part. Here: I found it in the lake, and it doesn't belong. Take it with you.

quest_44041.Description: A nature spirit asked you to cull some of the poisonous slugs, and their eggs, near the waterfall in Eltibule.
quest_44041.Name: Angling: Poison Slug Infestation

Objectives.Description: Kill Poison Slugs in the Lake
Angle Slug Eggs from the Lake

quest_44041.PrefaceText: Can you hear me? Then you must answer my plea. I am but a humble immortal telepathic fish and I cannot save my home! There are slugs are everywhere! Please remove them!
quest_44041.SuccessText: I am so relieved. Thank you so much! I will teach you something useful to your trade. Just don't use it on me.

quest_44042.Description: in a lake just southeast of Eltibule Keep, a telepathic spirit of some kind asked you to catch a "scary" pike that's invaded. The pike can only be caught at night.
quest_44042.Name: Angling: The Scary Pike
quest_44042.PrefaceText: You are a reasonable fisher, I hope. This lake needs your help to remain a fishing paradise! A human dumped fish in this lake a season ago. One of those fish has grown into a cruel, gigantic, horrible death beast! It only comes out at night. Please get it out of here!
quest_44042.SuccessText: I'm saved! I mean... the lake is saved! Thank you, fisher. By the way, I believe that evil pike would taste delicious pickled!

quest_44061.Description: On Sun Vale's main island, on the northeast beach, some sort of entity asked you to remove a huge clownfish. It can only be caught at dusk or dawn (5am or 7pm).
quest_44061.Name: Angling: The Overgrown Clownfish
quest_44061.PrefaceText:
Greetings! Are you a druid? Or just psychic? I need your help either way!

Druids used growth magic on the fish here, which was nice at first. But one of the local clownfish managed to get a triple dose of magic and now he's out of control! He's massive! You can catch him when he hunts -- either at dusk or dawn. Please catch him!
quest_44061.SuccessText: You are truly kind! Here. I want you to have this land-dweller ornament. And this forbidden technique for consuming my kind.

quest_44062.Description: Some sort of entity spoke to you on Sun Vale Island's south beach. It asked you to remove invasive ice fish via angling.
quest_44062.Name: Angling: Unnaturally Cold Waters
quest_44062.PrefaceText: You don't seem to be an ice fairy. Can you help us? We fish are dying! The ice fairies let loose horrible unnatural fish in the lake. They're making things cold! Please remove them.
quest_44062.SuccessText: Thank you. Our eggs wouldn't have survived in that colder water! By the way, I noticed your bait is very unappetizing to fish. Let me teach you a better recipe.

quest_44063.Description: On the south end of Sun Vale's "Ranalon Island", a psychic fish asked you to help remove extremely vicious eels via angling.
quest_44063.Name: Angling: Vicious Eels
quest_44063.PrefaceText: Help! The frogs are raising vicious eels that kill everything else! We can't compete! You have to help us! You must!
quest_44063.SuccessText: Eels are unnatural. Well, I think they are. Thank you for saving us! Take this thing. It came from a frog.

quest_44064.Description: While you were angling on the north end of Sun Vale's main island, a strange voice begged you to remove some of the starfish feeding on the local fish egg population.
quest_44064.Name: Angling: Killer Starfish
quest_44064.PrefaceText: MY EGGS! THEY'RE EATING THEM! Starfish are eating my eggs. What are you doing, save them! Stop this madness!
quest_44064.SuccessText: Thank Enoyos! The starfish are gone! I only have a few hundred eggs left, but maybe -- just maybe -- that'll be enough.

quest_44081.Description: While angling in the ocean in Kur, a strange voice asked you for help. It wanted you to angle frozen posion jars out of the sea.
quest_44081.Name: Angling: Frozen... For Now
quest_44081.PrefaceText: Grutak! Hello! Viazink? Oh, the second one works! Hello! A moon ago a ship came here. As it was offloading land-dweller junk, one of the crates fell into the sea near the beach. The crate is full of deadly poison! Fortunately, the poison is currently frozen solid. But when summer comes, it will melt, and we'll die! Save us!
quest_44081.SuccessText: You aren't so bad for a land-dweller. I'll remember you. Here is an offering.

quest_44082.Description: While you were angling at Bonnie's Hot Spring in the Ilmari desert, a psychic slug asked you to catch a particularly cruel Dorado. It only comes out at night.
quest_44082.Name: Angling: Baby Slugs Need Help!
quest_44082.PrefaceText: I've done it! I've pierced the veil of your mind! You can hear me! That's great news! So long story short, I was a wizard's familiar back in the day. Now I'm just trying to raise a slug family in safety. The geyser slug is our hero -- keeps us safe from most predators. But we still have a problem. There's a huge and particularly cruel dorado swimming in here. Can you get him out? He only comes out at night. And hurry: he already ate one of my children! I have a lot more, but still.
quest_44082.SuccessText: What a relief! Now I can get back to what's important: mating. Thank you!

quest_44101.Description: While you were angling on the docks in Rahu, a psychic creature asked you to help remove a toxic type of seaweed that is choking nearby sea life.
quest_44101.Name: Angling: Toxic Blooms
quest_44101.PrefaceText: Hello... Hello... Hello... Hello... Wait! It finally worked! I've been trying to reach you for a while. You gotta help us, chief! Most of my friends aren't as smart as me and they're eating toxic seaweed and dying. It just flowed in last night, and already we lost Mertie. That's what I called him. He didn't answer to the name, of course. But he was a good cod who didn't deserve to die that way.
quest_44101.SuccessText: Thanks, chief. You know, I used to be a wizard's familiar until I escaped. That's how I know you'll like this! It's a better-tasting bait recipe. But, uh, you gotta promise you'll only use it to catch fish, not to EAT them, fair?

quest_44121.Description: While angling near the town of Povus, a mysterious voice contacted you and asked for your help. Apparently "ghost bass" are causing havoc among the local fish and need to be removed. They can only be caught at night.
quest_44121.Name: Angling: Ghost Bass
quest_44121.PrefaceText: Welcome to my home, friend of nature. I am a sea treant and you are welcome here. But I could use your help. My homewater is overrun with ghost bass. They eat all the food, and then fade away at dawn, taking the food with them! Even worse, I am psychic and can feel their angst. These fish were maimed and tortured to death! They suffer. You must help them, and us. Please! The ghosts only come out at night.
quest_44121.SuccessText: Thank you for removing some of the ghost fish. I hope that this helps the area to recover. My name is Spotleaf. I may call upon you again some day.

quest_44122.Description: While angling in Povus near orcish land, a strange voice asked you to help kill Old Dreadtooth. Apparently it's a pretty big fish, and it only comes out at midnight.
quest_44122.Name: Angling: Old Dreadtooth
quest_44122.PrefaceText: Finally! One of you orcs is psychic! Or whatever you are. Look, enough is enough. You orcs have had plenty of time to catch him. You even gave him a name! While Old Dreadtooth might just be a fish story for you, he's a HORRIBLE MONSTER for us! You have to get him out of here! Just wait until midnight when he shows up, then catch him!
quest_44122.SuccessText: I can't believe you did it! You're a better angler than the orcs that live around here! And if you promise to use it for good, I will teach you how to be even more irresistable.

quest_44123.Description: While angling in a lake in northeast Povus, you encountered a voice that asked you to remove some of the aggressive frogs from the lake. These frogs can be caught with angling at dusk, and a little while after. (7pm-8pm)
quest_44123.Name: Angling: Too Many Frogs
quest_44123.PrefaceText: They come at night! The froooooggggsss! It's just too much! As a sovereign independent psychic insect lord I demand you aid my swampy kingdom. Please? The frogs come out at dusk and they leave a while after. Come on. Do a bug a favor.
quest_44123.SuccessText: You won't regret helping me! That's an order. From a sovereign insect lord. By the way, you should really use better bait. I'll show you. Then begone!

quest_44141.Description: You caught an odd fish which you aren't sure how to fillet. You're an old hand at this though -- catch a few more and you'll figure it out!
quest_44141.Name: Angling: The Pyrocarp
quest_44141.PrefaceText: This so-called Pyrocarp is a very odd fish. You aren't sure how to fillet it, but if you catch a few more you'll no doubt get the hang of it.
quest_44141.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Pyrocarp now!

quest_44142.Description: You caught an odd fish which you aren't sure how to fillet. You're an old hand at this though -- catch a few more and you'll figure it out!
quest_44142.Name: Angling: The Crater Gar
quest_44142.PrefaceText: This so-called Crater Gar is a very odd fish. You aren't sure how to fillet it, but if you catch a few more you'll no doubt get the hang of it.
quest_44142.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Crater Gar now!

quest_44143.Description: You caught a radiant muskie: a large yet bony fish. Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44143.Name: Angling: Radiant Muskie
quest_44143.PrefaceText: The Radiant Muskie is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44143.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Radiant Muskie now!

quest_44144.Description: You caught a vidarian pickerel, which is famously tricky to prepare. But catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44144.Name: Angling: Vidarian Pickerel
quest_44144.PrefaceText: The Vidarian Pickerel is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44144.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Vidarian Pickerel now!

quest_44145.Description: You caught a sorubim and aren't sure which parts are edible. But catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44145.Name: Angling: Sorubim
quest_44145.PrefaceText: The Sorubim is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44145.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Sorubim now!

quest_44146.Description: You caught a grouper and you're not quite sure what to do with it. You'll need to catch a few more to figure out how to prepare it.
quest_44146.Name: Angling: Grouper
quest_44146.PrefaceText: The Grouper is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44146.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Grouper now!

quest_44147.Description: You caught a bonefish, which isn't as boney as you'd come to expect, but is still boney. Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44147.Name: Angling: Bonefish
quest_44147.PrefaceText: The Bonefish is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44147.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Bonefish now!

quest_44148.Description: You caught a triple-tail, which seems to not actually have three tails. Beyond this disappointing revelation, you have no idea how to prepare it, but you'll get the hang of it if you catch some more.
quest_44148.Name: Angling: Triple Tail
quest_44148.PrefaceText: The Triple Tail is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44148.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Triple Tail now!

quest_44149.Description: You caught a non-Drevan (a/k/a salt-water) snook. Are snooks poisonous? You aren't sure. Catching a few more will give you the info to safely prepare it.
quest_44149.Name: Angling: Non-Drevan Snook
quest_44149.PrefaceText: The Non-Drevan Snook is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44149.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Non-Drevan Snook now!

quest_44150.Description: You caught a tarpon. Pretty big but not huge. Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44150.Name: Angling: Tarpon
quest_44150.PrefaceText: The Tarpon is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44150.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Tarpon now!

quest_44151.Description: You caught a wahoo. This is a massive fish! Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44151.Name: Angling: Wahoo
quest_44151.PrefaceText: The Wahoo is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44151.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Wahoo now!

quest_44152.Description: You caught a Vertan tuna. This is the smaller cousin of the famous Ormalan Tuna. Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44152.Name: Angling: Vertan Tuna
quest_44152.PrefaceText: The Vertan Tuna is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44152.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Vertan Tuna now!

quest_44153.Description: You caught a striped bass. Huh. The stripes are pretty subtle, all things considered. Catching a few more should give you the knowledge to fillet it.
quest_44153.Name: Angling: Striped Bass
quest_44153.PrefaceText: The Striped Bass is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44153.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Striped Bass now!

quest_44154.Description: You caught an eagle ray. This is one freaky fish! Is it even edible? You'll need to catch some more to figure it out.
quest_44154.Name: Angling: Eagle Ray
quest_44154.PrefaceText: The Eagle Ray is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44154.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Eagle Ray now!

quest_44155.Description: You caught a marlin! It's massive and quite difficult to catch, but you did it. Catch some more to learn how to fillet it.
quest_44155.Name: Angling: Marlin
quest_44155.PrefaceText: The Marlin is a tricky fish to fillet; you need some practice catching more of them to figure it out.
quest_44155.SuccessText: You've got the hang of catching and cleaning Marlin now!

quest_45.Description: Oritania in Eltibule told you about a device used by Dalvos to teleport to another place. The pieces of a spare machine are somewhere in the goblin dungeon below Eltibule Keep. If you find all the pieces listed below, Oritania will give you the final piece.
quest_45.Name: Find Dalvos's Machine Parts

quest_45001.Description: It's time to enjoy summer activities! Complete the check-list before this event ends to receive a few summer reward items. [Night time activities only count after 7pm and before 5am] [Goblins hoard the secret of fireworks!]
quest_45001.Name: Event: Summer Experience

Objectives.Description: Cook a meal with fish in it
Get stung by an insect (or spider, etc.)
Butcher a tiger for its meat
Lastly, say 'Ahh, this is the life'

quest_45001.PrefaceText: It's time to enjoy summer! Your quest journal has a check-list of traditional summer activities. Complete them all before the event ends to receive some items that'll help you enjoy the weather.

quest_45002.Description: Sie Antry in Eltibule asked for your help in getting rid of hungry rabbits. Just grow some plants in any garden area, and they'll come running!
quest_45002.Name: Event: Garden Invasion

quest_45011.Description: Zhia Lian: Who doesn't love a candied apple when the weather turns cool? Don't answer that. It's not important. What's important is that you make a candied apple from scratch! It's easy! I've already injected the recipe into your brain! Just go make one!
quest_45011.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Candied Apples
quest_45011.PrefaceText: Hey! Can you hear me? Finally! It is I, Zhia Lian, the Goddess of Whimsy! I've been trying to reach your mind for almost a week! Your brain is really hard to break into. Anyway, I was at a party last week and you'll never guess who showed up: the other undead gods! So I got to talking with them. It turns out Chalice is in close alignment with Alharth right now, and they're flooding the continent with undead! I have some friends on Alharth so I figured I'd help them out... by helping YOU out! You're pretty strong and I think you can help fix this. And we'll have some fun along the way, too. Stick with me, mortal, and you won't regret it! [Check your quest journal for quests to get you started. Complete those quests and you'll unlock additional quests. The quests have varying degrees of difficulty and you probably won't be able to complete a lot of them, so focus on the ones you can complete. You'll be rewarded for each quest. Good luck, and happy Halloween!]
quest_45011.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: Great! Enjoy that tasty... well, no... that kind-of-tasty homemade treat! You'll need your energy for all the undead-slaying you have to do!

quest_45012.Description: Zhia Lian: It's the time of year for candy. Lots of candy! And what's the best way to get free candy? Right, you guessed it: beating the crap out of the undead. [All undead, as well as some other creepy monsters, have a chance to drop candy as loot right now.]
quest_45012.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Monster Candy

Objectives.Description: Eat candy you find on horrible monsters

quest_45012.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: It's the time of year for candy. Lots of candy! And what's the best way to get free candy? Right, you guessed it: beating the crap out of the undead. [All undead, as well as some other creepy monsters, have a chance to drop candy as loot right now.]
quest_45012.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: Hopefully you aren't overloaded on sugar yet. We're just getting started!

quest_45013.Description: Zhia Lian: It's pumpkin-carving season! That's kinda whimsical, so I approve. You can get most of the ingredients you need by... yep: killing the undead. Obtain a pumpkin from an undead fiend, as well as a recipe book for Jack O' Lanterns. Then carve it up! If you don't have a butcher knife, you can buy one in town, I'm sure.
quest_45013.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Jack O' Lantern
quest_45013.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: It's pumpkin-carving season! That's kinda whimsical, so I approve. You can get most of the ingredients you need by... yep: killing the undead. Obtain a pumpkin from an undead fiend, as well as a recipe book for Jack O' Lanterns. Then carve it up! If you don't have a butcher knife, you can buy one in town, I'm sure.
quest_45013.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: Nice job! You can place that pumpkin in town for others to appreciate! Or whatever. Let's move on.

quest_45014.Description: [Note: this quest is for gourmands. Pumpkin pie requires Gourmand 35!] Zhia Lian: Everybody loves pumpkin pie. (Yes, you do.) So eat one! You can find the recipe on the undead, or you might be able to obtain a pumpkin pie from another hero. [This quest will reward you with 1000 Councils, so even if you pay that much for a pie, you won't lose money.]
quest_45014.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Eat a Pumpkin Pie
quest_45014.PrefaceText: [Note: this quest is for gourmands. Pumpkin pie requires Gourmand 35!] Zhia Lian: Everybody loves pumpkin pie. (Yes, you do.) So eat one! You can find the recipe on the undead, or you might be able to obtain a pumpkin pie from another hero. [This quest will reward you with 1000 Councils, so even if you pay that much for a pie, you won't lose money.]
quest_45014.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: See? Everybody loves pumpkin pie!

quest_45015.Description: Zhia Lian: I overheard Ilth Hale say she was going to make some ghosts from people who died without being mourned. Help keep the world safe from ghosts by mourning other heroes' tombstones.
quest_45015.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Mourn the Dead
quest_45015.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: I overheard Ilth Hale say she was going to make some ghosts from people who died without being mourned. Help keep the world safe from ghosts by mourning other heroes' tombstones.
quest_45015.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: You're very compassionate! I understand that's a good thing.

quest_45016.Description: Zhia Lian: You should understand your enemy better. I think you should drink from the foul undead concoction known as the Gruesome Spooky Punch. Normally only an alchemist could make the stuff, but if you collect the ingredients, I'll mix you up a batch... plus you'll get the recipe, so you can make more later.
quest_45016.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Concoct a Gruesome Punch
quest_45016.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: You should understand your enemy better. I think you should drink from the foul undead concoction known as the Gruesome Spooky Punch. Normally only an alchemist could make the stuff, but if you collect the ingredients, I'll mix you up a batch... plus you'll get the recipe, so you can make more later.
quest_45016.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: Good work! Here's the punch, plus the recipe. Drink up!

quest_45017.Description: Zhia Lian: Pumpkin smoothies are delicious! I decree it, so if you don't like them you'd better get with the program. Collect all the ingredients and I'll give you the recipe! (If you don't already have it.) [Note: it requires Cooking 30 to make a pumpkin smoothie! But even if you don't have enough cooking skill yet, you can still complete this quest to learn the recipe for future use.]
quest_45017.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Pumpkin Smoothie
quest_45017.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: Pumpkin smoothies are delicious! I decree it, so if you don't like them you'd better get with the program. Collect all the ingredients and I'll give you the recipe! (If you don't already have it.) [Note: it requires Cooking 30 to make a pumpkin smoothie! But even if you don't have enough cooking skill yet, you can still complete this quest to learn the recipe for future use.]

quest_45018.Description: Zhia Lian: Giant bats are common this time of year. And you can be one! Just get bitten often enough by a giant bat, and you're sure to catch the disease. Then practice being a bat long enough to learn echolocation! And don't worry, I'll make sure you can get back to your normal self later. If you want to be boring again. [You can find giant bats in some deep caves, but it may be easier to just let other player-bats bite you.]
quest_45018.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Bat Out

Objectives.Description: Become a giant bat and learn to echolocate

quest_45018.PrefaceText: Zhia Lian: Giant bats are common this time of year. And you can be one! Just get bitten often enough by a giant bat, and you're sure to catch the disease. Then practice being a bat long enough to learn echolocation! And don't worry, I'll make sure you can get back to your normal self later. If you want to be boring again. [You can find giant bats in some deep caves, but it may be easier to just let other player-bats bite you.]
quest_45018.SuccessText: Zhia Lian: Hahaha! Flap, bat, flap! You look absurd! I love it!

quest_45019.Description: Zhia Lian: You know what you need? A drink from a Cauldron of Vile Thoughts. Alchemists can obtain the recipe from the undead. Find somebody willing to share their Cauldron, and sip! But be ready for anything.
quest_45019.Name: Zhia Lian Event: Drink from a Cauldron
