quest_45601.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "Milking non-sentient cows is exploitation! Or I think it might be -- this morality thing is hard. And there aren't really enough sentient cows to go around. Anyway, I want to try this fake milk I've been hearing about. I'll teach you the recipe if you don't know it. I picked it up from a dead goat."
quest_45601.Name: Harvest Event: Not Quite Milk
quest_45601.PrefaceText: Milking non-sentient cows is exploitation! Or I think it might be -- this morality thing is hard. And there aren't really enough sentient cows to go around. Anyway, I want to try this fake milk I've been hearing about. I'll teach you the recipe if you don't know it. I picked it up from a dead goat.
quest_45601.SuccessText:
Huh. It's not half bad! Doesn't taste much like milk to me, but it's tasty enough.

Here, here's a small reward for helping me.

quest_45602.Description:
Ricatu in Povus said, "It's the harvest season and all my friends are eating turkey: perfectly baked turkey, turkey stir-fry, turkey pot pie ... But killing turkeys to consume their flesh is obviously wrong.

I hear you can make fake meat out of that fake milk somehow. I don't know if I believe myself, but it sure would be convenient to have a plant-based turkey!

I hear that Braigon in Eltibule knows how. Why don't you go ask him?"
quest_45602.Name: Harvest Event: Learn About Tofu
quest_45602.PrefaceText:
It's the harvest season and all my friends are eating turkey: perfectly baked turkey, turkey stir-fry, turkey pot pie ... But killing turkeys to consume their flesh is obviously wrong.

I hear you can make fake meat out of that fake milk somehow. I don't know if I believe myself, but it sure would be convenient to have a plant-based turkey!

I hear that Braigon in Eltibule knows how. Why don't you go ask him?
quest_45602.SuccessText: Some rakshasa wants to know about tofu? Are you sure he didn't mean cheese? Everyone loves cheese! Tofu is so boring, so last decade. But sure. Do me a couple of favors and I'll show you the basics.

quest_45603.Description: Braigon in Eltibule said, "I'm working on some mozzarella right now. Bring me some whey and we'll talk about the tofu."
quest_45603.Name: Harvest Event: Whey for Braigon
quest_45603.PrefaceText: I'm working on some mozzarella right now. Bring me some whey and we'll talk about the tofu.
quest_45603.SuccessText: Yeah, yeah, this will work. Thanks! Tofu is really, really simple. Curdle some soy milk, strain out the solid bits and press out the rest of the liquid in a tofu press. It's actually a lot like cheese, except you don't age it -- and it's much more boring. Too simple. I don't have one here, but I think there's an old tofu press setup down in the dungeon with all those goblins.

quest_45604.Description:
Braigon in Eltibule said, "Are you still stuck on the tofu thing? Tofu is useless on its own, that's why I stopped pursuing it. It's not really worth eating alone, like cheese is! I could teach you some nice cheese recipes instead ... No?

Okay. Well I'm working on some Roquefort, and I need pungent rennet. Get it for me and I'll teach you a simple tofu recipe."
quest_45604.Name: Harvest Event: Rennet for Braigon
quest_45604.PrefaceText:
Are you still stuck on the tofu thing? Tofu is useless on its own, that's why I stopped pursuing it. It's not really worth eating alone, like cheese is! I could teach you some nice cheese recipes instead ... No?

Okay. Well I'm working on some Roquefort, and I need pungent rennet. Get it for me and I'll teach you a simple tofu recipe.
quest_45604.SuccessText:
Smell that rennet!

Here, this is how you make the most very basic tofu meal. Just remember: cheese is inherently better!

quest_45605.Description:
Braigon in Eltibule said, "Now you know the most bland, basic tofu dish. Take that back to your rakshasa and see what he thinks.

And if you want to know how to make fancier kinds of tofu, I suppose I could trade that fancy knowledge for some fancy cheese..."
quest_45605.Name: Harvest Event: Not Quite Meat

Objectives.Description: Cook a Tofu Dish for Ricatu

quest_45605.PrefaceText:
Now you know the most bland, basic tofu dish. Take that back to your rakshasa and see what he thinks.

And if you want to know how to make fancier kinds of tofu, I suppose I could trade that fancy knowledge for some fancy cheese...
quest_45605.SuccessText: This is the fake meat? Hmm ... It's a bit bland. Doesn't really taste like turkey. Maybe chicken, though ...

quest_45606.Description:
Ricatu in Povus said, "My friend Kelim in Amulna says he's got some spices that might help this fake meat taste more like turkey. I think he's trying a little too hard to sell me on them, you know? But it might work.

Go see if he'll give you some harvest spices."
quest_45606.Name: Harvest Event: Let's Spice Things Up
quest_45606.PrefaceText:
My friend Kelim in Amulna says he's got some spices that might help this fake meat taste more like turkey. I think he's trying a little too hard to sell me on them, you know? But it might work.

Go see if he'll give you some harvest spices.
quest_45606.SuccessText:
Ricatu sent you? Yes! I can get rid of some of these infernal spices! Er ... I mean ...

Yeah. I don't know if the harvest spices I have will help with the taste of this fake meat, but help me out, do me a favor or two, and I'll give you some to take back to him.

quest_45607.Description:
Kelim in Amulna said, "I prefer real meat, and I love a good turkey sandwich this time of year. Damned turkeys can be hard to find, though. They hide in underbrush, and there's not much of that around here!

You might have to travel a bit, but see if you can whack a few and bring me back their plump, juicy carcasses."
quest_45607.Name: Harvest Event: Turkey Killer
quest_45607.PrefaceText:
I prefer real meat, and I love a good turkey sandwich this time of year. Damned turkeys can be hard to find, though. They hide in underbrush, and there's not much of that around here!

You might have to travel a bit, but see if you can whack a few and bring me back their plump, juicy carcasses.
quest_45607.SuccessText: This will work! A little oregano, some salt ... Thanks!

quest_45608.Description: Kelim in Amulna said, "Oh, right, the spices. Before I let you have some, can you bring me some cranberries? Cranberries are amazing with turkey. "
quest_45608.Name: Harvest Event: Cranberries!
quest_45608.PrefaceText: Oh, right, the spices. Before I let you have some, can you bring me some cranberries? Cranberries are amazing with turkey.
quest_45608.SuccessText: Thanks! Here, have a packet of spices. If you need more, I'll trade you spices for turkeys.

quest_45609.Description:
Kelim in Amulna said, "If Ricatu thinks my spices will help his fake turkey, more power to him. Why don't you cook him a fake turkey meal and ask him how it tastes?

I don't have any recipes for that -- you'll have to find one yourself!"
quest_45609.Name: Harvest Event: Tofurkey!
quest_45609.PrefaceText:
If Ricatu thinks my spices will help his fake turkey, more power to him. Why don't you cook him a fake turkey meal and ask him how it tastes?

I don't have any recipes for that -- you'll have to find one yourself!
quest_45609.SuccessText:
Hmm ... Hmm! Yeah, this will do! It's not quite right but it isn't horrible. Thanks!

I think I'll call it tofurkey. It's a pun, or play on words, see?

quest_45610.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "Gravy would be perfect with this tofurkey you brought me -- give it some extra moistness. Can you make me some? You'll have to find the recipe yourself, though."
quest_45610.Name: Harvest Event: Torfurkey Gravy
quest_45610.PrefaceText: Gravy would be perfect with this tofurkey you brought me -- give it some extra moistness. Can you make me some? You'll have to find the recipe yourself, though.
quest_45610.SuccessText: Ah, this gravy works wonders! And no moral complications! Thanks!

quest_45611.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "Plain old tofurkey is ... plain. Bring me a better one! One with some bite! Maybe some citrus to cut the savory some. But you'll have to find the recipe yourself."
quest_45611.Name: Harvest Event: Lemon-Glazed Tofurkey
quest_45611.PrefaceText: Plain old tofurkey is ... plain. Bring me a better one! One with some bite! Maybe some citrus to cut the savory some. But you'll have to find the recipe yourself.

quest_45612.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "Plain old tofurkey is ... kind of dry. Gravy helps, but I bet you can do better. Maybe a sauce ... Oh! How about cranberry sauce! You'll have to find the recipe yourself, though."
quest_45612.Name: Harvest Event: Tofurkey with Cranberry Sauce
quest_45612.PrefaceText: Plain old tofurkey is ... kind of dry. Gravy helps, but I bet you can do better. Maybe a sauce ... Oh! How about cranberry sauce! You'll have to find the recipe yourself, though.
quest_45612.SuccessText: Braigon was right -- cranberry is amazing, even with fake turkey. Thanks!

quest_45613.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "Kelim was telling me about a turkey meatloaf he ate recently, and it sounded really good. Think you can do the same thing with tofurkey? You'll have to find the recipe yourself."
quest_45613.Name: Harvest Event: Tofurkey Veggie Loaf
quest_45613.PrefaceText: Kelim was telling me about a turkey meatloaf he ate recently, and it sounded really good. Think you can do the same thing with tofurkey? You'll have to find the recipe yourself.
quest_45613.SuccessText: Eh, this is okay I guess. Doesn't really make the tofurkey shine, but you did what you could. Thanks.

quest_45614.Description:
Ricatu in Povus said, "I want some meatballs. Think you can do meatballs? But it needs to have something harvest-y going on.  You'll have to find the recipe yourself.

And remember, no actual dead turkeys -- or gods forbid, cows!"
quest_45614.Name: Harvest Event: Cranberry-Glazed "Meatballs"
quest_45614.PrefaceText:
I want some meatballs. Think you can do meatballs? But it needs to have something harvest-y going on.  You'll have to find the recipe yourself.

And remember, no actual dead turkeys -- or gods forbid, cows!
quest_45614.SuccessText: Nice! It even holds together, more or less. Good job!

quest_45615.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "I used to really enjoy beef kebabs. There's just something primal about ripping chunks of flesh off a pointy stick. I mean, that's disgusting to me now, but ... It was kind of fun. Anyway, think you could whip up something similar? You'll have to find the recipe yourself."
quest_45615.Name: Harvest Event: Tofu Pumpkin Kebab
quest_45615.PrefaceText: I used to really enjoy beef kebabs. There's just something primal about ripping chunks of flesh off a pointy stick. I mean, that's disgusting to me now, but ... It was kind of fun. Anyway, think you could whip up something similar? You'll have to find the recipe yourself.
quest_45615.SuccessText: This is a lot less satisfying than I thought it would be. But that's on me. Thanks for trying!

quest_45616.Description: Ricatu in Povus said, "I really need a good dipping sauce to go with all this 'meat'. I heard you can do something with pumpkins -- that should be interesting.  But you'll have to find the recipe yourself."
quest_45616.Name: Harvest Event: Pumpkin Hummus
quest_45616.PrefaceText: I really need a good dipping sauce to go with all this 'meat'. I heard you can do something with pumpkins -- that should be interesting.  But you'll have to find the recipe yourself.
quest_45616.SuccessText: I like this a lot. It's not exactly a sauce, I guess, but it tastes great on raw vegetables. Thanks!

quest_45617.Description: Braigon in Eltibule said, "Tofu can be made in three main ways. Firm tofu is used when the recipe calls for a protein that won't fall apart! I can teach you how to make it in exchange for a fresh Brunost cheese."
quest_45617.Name: Harvest Event: Firm Tofu
quest_45617.PrefaceText: Tofu can be made in three main ways. Firm tofu is used when the recipe calls for a protein that won't fall apart! I can teach you how to make it in exchange for a fresh Brunost cheese.
quest_45617.SuccessText: Ah, this brunost is wet and squishy, exactly like firm tofu isn't! Ha! Here's the technique.

quest_45618.Description:
Braigon in Eltibule said, "Tofu can be made in three main ways. Soft tofu is even mushier than regular tofu. Personally I think it tastes disgusting, but perhaps you're more cultured than me!

I can teach you how to make it in exchange for a fresh brie."
quest_45618.Name: Harvest Event: Soft Tofu
quest_45618.PrefaceText:
Tofu can be made in three main ways. Soft tofu is even mushier than regular tofu. Personally I think it tastes disgusting, but perhaps you're more cultured than me!

I can teach you how to make it in exchange for a fresh brie.
quest_45618.SuccessText: Oh, this brie is lovely! I'm going to enjoy this for lunch! Here's the technique for making disgusting soft tofu.

quest_46.Description: Oritania wasn't able to assemble Dalvos's machine. She sent you to find a fairy in Eltibule named Jesina. She lives on Sie Antry's farm, west of Eltibule Keep.
quest_46.Name: Get Jesina's Help

Objectives.Description: Pierce the veil to find the helm
Use both levers to unlock the gloves
Go beyond the dead-end to find the boots
Take a jog to find the pants
Return to the pedestal to claim the key
Find the secret passage in the first room
Defeat the guardian to find the suit and blade
Return to the pedestal to claim your birthright

quest_48.Description: You've rescued Jesina's sister Sarina, who is repairing your broken nexus adjunct matter aligner. It should be ready in time for dinner. (Hang Out with Jesina to advance the quest.)
quest_48.Name: Meet with Jesina and Sarina

Objectives.Description: Discuss the portal with Sarina and Jesina over dinner (offline)

quest_49.Description:
You now have a working nexus adjunct matter aligner! If you can get into the nexus and attach it to an inactive gate, it will open a portal that should lead you to Dalvos.

The nexus entrance in Eltibule is in the northeast corner. You'll need a key to get in. A human named Percy Evans lives near there and is known to have a key.
quest_49.Name: Chasing Dalvos Through the Nexus

Objectives.Description: Activate an inactive nexus gate and enter it

quest_5.Description: Find some of the cultural lore items scattered throughout the town of Serbule.
quest_5.Name: Get Some Culture

quest_50.Description: You jumped through the nexus portal and arrived in a cave. There's a crystal nearby that seems to beckon to you.
quest_50.Name: A Dark Surprise

quest_50001.Description: Deliver 10 Strange Dirt to Fitz the Boatman on the Serbule docks. Reward: 72 councils.
quest_50001.Name: Strange Dirt

quest_50002.Description: Deliver 10 Antlers to Fitz the Boatman on the Serbule docks. Reward: 248 councils. Note from orderer: "Time for a stag party!"
quest_50002.Name: Antlers

quest_50003.Description: Deliver 10 Fire Dust to Fitz the Boatman on the Serbule docks. Reward: 2,133 councils. Note from orderer: "Rumor has it that Fire Dust can be found all over the place in Serbule and Eltibule. You are very lucky! It is not so common here in Verta."
quest_50003.Name: Fire Dust
quest_50003.PrefaceText: Rumor has it that Fire Dust can be found all over the place in Serbule and Eltibule. You are very lucky! It is not so common here in Verta.

quest_50004.Description: Deliver 10 Giant Mantis Claws to Fitz the Boatman on the Serbule docks. Reward: 698 councils.
quest_50004.Name: Giant Mantis Claws

quest_50005.Description: Deliver 10 Ivory Horns to Thimble Pete in Hogan's Keep, Eltibule. Reward: 10,867 councils. Note from orderer: "I have heard that rhinos in the Council Lands grow ivory horns instead of horns made of animal fat. I must see these for myself!"
quest_50005.Name: Ivory Horns
quest_50005.PrefaceText: I have heard that rhinos in the Council Lands grow ivory horns instead of horns made of animal fat. I must see these for myself!
quest_50005.SuccessText: Thanks! I'll make sure it gets to Statehelm. Here's your coin!

quest_502.Description: Franklin Mallus in Statehelm said, "My wife Ariadne works at one of the vendor stalls. The hours are terrible and the pay is awful and I feel bad for her. I want to visit and drop of her favorite lunch, Broccoli Squash Bake. But I can't cook. This makes me sad."
quest_502.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Lunch for Ariadne

Objectives.Description: Report to Franklin Mallus or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_502.PrefaceText: My wife Ariadne works at one of the vendor stalls. The hours are terrible and the pay is awful and I feel bad for her. I want to visit and drop of her favorite lunch, Broccoli Squash Bake. But I can't cook. This makes me sad.
quest_502.SuccessText: Hey, this is my wife's favorite! She's gonna love it. Thanks! Here, take these beets I found in the street -- I won't need them anymore!

quest_507.Description: Jaunce Zodiac in Statehelm said, "I have a new idea for how to cheat at keelflip. I just need some pebbles. But they have to be perfectly balanced!"
quest_507.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Pebble Scheme

Objectives.Description: Report to Jaunce Zodiac or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_507.PrefaceText: I have a new idea for how to cheat at keelflip. I just need some pebbles. But they have to be perfectly balanced!
quest_507.SuccessText: These pebbles are too small. You did technically bring me what I asked for, but OBVIOUSLY what I asked for wasn't specific enough. You cared more about getting the job done than about whether the job should be done or not! No tip.

quest_508.Description: Jaunce Zodiac in Statehelm said, "I have a great new scheme to win big at keelflip: bomb threats. Don't worry. Nobody is going to get hurt. Everything wil go according to plan."
quest_508.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Bomb Scheme

Objectives.Description: Report to Jaunce Zodiac or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_508.PrefaceText: I have a great new scheme to win big at keelflip: bomb threats. Don't worry. Nobody is going to get hurt. Everything wil go according to plan.
quest_508.SuccessText:
Thanks. But I talked to my card reader Gossamyr and she predicted that I would be maimed and go to prison if I tried my plan. And she said it like it was completely obvious to everybody. But if it was obvious to everybody, why did you fulfill my request?! I kind of feel like you aren't really my friend.

But I'll tip well for your discretion anyway.

quest_511.Description:
Cassandra White in Statehelm said, "Oh it's so nice to have your ear! Well, my husband was killed by a bear a long time ago. And I witnessed it! We were hiking through the forests south of here, as young lovers do, and came upon a bear with green fur. Lennel was a strong man but stupid, and he tried to hit it with a longbow. The bear killed him, scattering blood everywhere, and then it did the most cursed thing: it picked up his bow, stared right into my eyes, and snapped the bow over its knee. It was a very human thing to do.

I learned that the locals call him the Mangler. And I promise you this: it has been decades, but my hatred still runs deep. I've paid to have him killed, but he's immortal and he keeps coming back! No, what really upsets him is to see his beloved friend injured. They call that one The Mauler. If you ask me I think they're gay bears who are gay for each other, but nobody ever asks me. After you kill The Mauler, say "This one's for Lennel.""
quest_511.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Bear Revenge

Objectives.Description: Report to Cassandra White or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_511.PrefaceText:
Oh it's so nice to have your ear! Well, my husband was killed by a bear a long time ago. And I witnessed it! We were hiking through the forests south of here, as young lovers do, and came upon a bear with green fur. Lennel was a strong man but stupid, and he tried to hit it with a longbow. The bear killed him, scattering blood everywhere, and then it did the most cursed thing: it picked up his bow, stared right into my eyes, and snapped the bow over its knee. It was a very human thing to do.

I learned that the locals call him the Mangler. And I promise you this: it has been decades, but my hatred still runs deep. I've paid to have him killed, but he's immortal and he keeps coming back! No, what really upsets him is to see his beloved friend injured. They call that one The Mauler. If you ask me I think they're gay bears who are gay for each other, but nobody ever asks me. After you kill The Mauler, say "This one's for Lennel."
quest_511.SuccessText: Did you say it? "This one's for Lennel"? Oh, it brings a malicious tear to my eye knowing that bear was upset. They'll be back, and they'll outlive me, but I will make them rue the day they heard the name of Lennel White! That's a promise. Oh where are my manners. This is for you.

quest_512.Description: Cassandra White in Statehelm said, "It's coming up on that time of year again: the anniversary of my Lennel's death at the hands of a bear. I was wondering if you could do a poor widow a favor. Could kill some bears for me? I'm not too particular about the type of bear. I hate all bears! Every one of them. And they're a menace to humanity, that's what I say. They kill humans! Why do we allow them to live?! I'll tell you why: magic's made us soft. People don't go out of town anymore so they don't realize how deadly the bears are. But you and I, we're no fools."
quest_512.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Bear Murder In Memoriam

Objectives.Description: Report to Cassandra White or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_512.PrefaceText: It's coming up on that time of year again: the anniversary of my Lennel's death at the hands of a bear. I was wondering if you could do a poor widow a favor. Could kill some bears for me? I'm not too particular about the type of bear. I hate all bears! Every one of them. And they're a menace to humanity, that's what I say. They kill humans! Why do we allow them to live?! I'll tell you why: magic's made us soft. People don't go out of town anymore so they don't realize how deadly the bears are. But you and I, we're no fools.
quest_512.SuccessText: Yes! We have to take matters into our own hands! The Council isn't going to kill those bears until they try to invade the city. By then it'll be too late. You did the right thing. This money will assuage any misconcieved feelings of guilt.

quest_516.Description: Gregory Pincackle in Statehelm said, "Somebody needs to take care of all the damned leg bones wandering around in the graveyard! It's one thing to run away from a full skeleton but I'll be damned if I'm running away from a single leg. I was able to suspend disbelief at a whole fleshless body, but just one leg? One leg that for some reason kicks like a mule? I won't have it. It's an undignified way to die, and the graveyard needs all the dignity it can muster. So as I say, somebody should do something about it. Somebody braver than the town guards. [Gregory looks at you.]"
quest_516.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Leg Bones in the Graveyard

Objectives.Description: Report to Gregory Pincackle or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_516.PrefaceText: Somebody needs to take care of all the damned leg bones wandering around in the graveyard! It's one thing to run away from a full skeleton but I'll be damned if I'm running away from a single leg. I was able to suspend disbelief at a whole fleshless body, but just one leg? One leg that for some reason kicks like a mule? I won't have it. It's an undignified way to die, and the graveyard needs all the dignity it can muster. So as I say, somebody should do something about it. Somebody braver than the town guards. [Gregory looks at you.]
quest_516.SuccessText:
Thank you. Now maybe I can visit my son's grave. If I can just avoid the animated rib bones.

You know, living in a mageocracy has its downsides. Shit like this is always happening.

quest_521.Description: Gareth Plumsy in Statehelm said, "When you finally corner one of the professors at Tennenbrandt and get them to actually give you a lesson, they teach FAST. It fells like they're shoving knowledge at you faster than you can process it! But you know what helps? Pineal juice. Illegal here, of course. So I know you wouldn't have any on you. That's a shame because I have a pretty rough day of lessons coming up."
quest_521.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Long Bardic Days

Objectives.Description: Report to Gareth Plumsy or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_521.PrefaceText: When you finally corner one of the professors at Tennenbrandt and get them to actually give you a lesson, they teach FAST. It fells like they're shoving knowledge at you faster than you can process it! But you know what helps? Pineal juice. Illegal here, of course. So I know you wouldn't have any on you. That's a shame because I have a pretty rough day of lessons coming up.
quest_521.SuccessText: Thanks for the relatively discreet delivery. This will get me through another week of intense lectures.

quest_522.Description: Gareth Plumsy in Statehelm said, "Tennenbrandt University teaches important music and magic theory, but they're not very hands-on. It's important to see other performers work their magic -- that's part of my education too! But staying out all night leaves me exhausted for the next day. You know what helps? Pineal juice."
quest_522.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Long Bardic Nights

Objectives.Description: Report to Gareth Plumsy or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_522.PrefaceText: Tennenbrandt University teaches important music and magic theory, but they're not very hands-on. It's important to see other performers work their magic -- that's part of my education too! But staying out all night leaves me exhausted for the next day. You know what helps? Pineal juice.
quest_522.SuccessText: Hmm, I like this enhanced stuff! But I've heard there's even better pineal juice out there.

quest_523.Description:
Gareth Plumsy in Statehelm said, "I have a big test coming up at school and I need to be at my best. I could literally die if I'm not! This school is nuts! I need more pineal juice, but not the weak stuff you brought me before.

Here. I bribed an alchemist at the mage college to get this recipe. Of course, I don't know how to actually do alchemy, so I'll leave it up to you."
quest_523.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Burning the Midnight Brain

Objectives.Description: Report to Gareth Plumsy or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_523.PrefaceText:
I have a big test coming up at school and I need to be at my best. I could literally die if I'm not! This school is nuts! I need more pineal juice, but not the weak stuff you brought me before.

Here. I bribed an alchemist at the mage college to get this recipe. Of course, I don't know how to actually do alchemy, so I'll leave it up to you.
quest_523.SuccessText:
Wow. This stuff is potent!

If you think about it, me giving you that recipe was part of your payment. If you look at it this way you'll see that you're getting a pretty good deal for this stuff!

quest_524.PrefaceText: Hey, you've got to help me out again. BIG test coming up and I'm out of the juice! I need the cranked juice. Nothing else works anymore. I'll pay well!
quest_524.SuccessText: You're my savior! Just another year of classes to go and I can wean myself off of this stuff.

quest_526.Description: Tremond Rockhammer in Statehelm said, "I've been sent out as a gofer. Pretty insulting to my skills but you gotta take it on the chin sometimes when you work with humans. They're not exactly good at manners and shit. Problem is, though, that I can't find what I need: I need some pretty good armor stakes but with an extra thumbspan's length on the end. Say, are you a smith? You could whip them up for me."
quest_526.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Specialty Armor Stakes

Objectives.Description: Report to Tremond Rockhammer or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_526.PrefaceText: I've been sent out as a gofer. Pretty insulting to my skills but you gotta take it on the chin sometimes when you work with humans. They're not exactly good at manners and shit. Problem is, though, that I can't find what I need: I need some pretty good armor stakes but with an extra thumbspan's length on the end. Say, are you a smith? You could whip them up for me.
quest_526.SuccessText: These are... Well... these are... adequate work. Thank you.

quest_527.Description: Tremond Rockhammer in Statehelm said, "Hey, it's you! What a bit of luck. I need more specialized armor stakes. Can you bang these out today? Expert-quality, but with a peened head."
quest_527.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Specialier Armor Stakes

Objectives.Description: Report to Tremond Rockhammer or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_527.PrefaceText: Hey, it's you! What a bit of luck. I need more specialized armor stakes. Can you bang these out today? Expert-quality, but with a peened head.
quest_527.SuccessText: Hm. Not how I'd have done it, but these will work just fine.

quest_528.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Masterful Armor Stakes

Objectives.Description: Report to Tremond Rockhammer or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_528.PrefaceText: I was looking for you! Got a real tricky one for you this time. Masterworks, but with a slight intentional weak spot here and here. Never you mind what they're for, just make them to this specification and I'll pay well.
quest_528.SuccessText: Your work isn't conventional at all. Like someone who mastered their craft through sheer willpower instead of decades of practice! But I have to admit that it's serviceable work.

quest_531.Description: Flitilda in Statehelm said, "I've heard of a mortal flower called a tulip, but I've never seen one! I wish I had one. [Flitilda flutters her eyelashes at you.]"
quest_531.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Mysterious Tulip

Objectives.Description: Report to Flitilda or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_531.PrefaceText: I've heard of a mortal flower called a tulip, but I've never seen one! I wish I had one. [Flitilda flutters her eyelashes at you.]
quest_531.SuccessText: Is this... a tulip!? Oh, it's so ugly! I love it! What a dumb flower! Haha! I kind of expected something different. But I'll take it home and draw it for my upcoming botanical art book. Thanks!

quest_532.Description: Flitilda in Statehelm said, "One of my fae friends said that there are flitterbies growing here in this country, somewhere far south of here in a land called Eltibule. I need one for my drawings!"
quest_532.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Flitterbies? Here?!

Objectives.Description: Report to Flitilda or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_532.PrefaceText: One of my fae friends said that there are flitterbies growing here in this country, somewhere far south of here in a land called Eltibule. I need one for my drawings!
quest_532.SuccessText: Yep, those are flitterbie! Look at them twinkle! They even smell right! I mean, they smell like angry meat, but the smell is correct for flitterbies. You guys know flitterbies are invasive, right? I don't know what dummy planted these here but you'll never get rid of them now. They're immortal. Not great for mortal ecosystems. But I'm sure the wizards will figure something out before it gets too serious. Time to take this home and draw it for my book!

quest_533.Description: Flitilda in Statehelm said, "Hey, it's you again. Remember when you got me flitterbies? I was thinking about them. I bet you guys have no idea how flitterbies work! They're maleable to their environment even after they grow. If you have a ton of citrus on you when you pick one, it'll come out smelling citrusy itself! Can you confirm this actually works like I expect? Sometimes mortal-realm variants can act weird. [To advance this quest you must have 100+ citrus items in your inventory when you pick flitterbies.]"
quest_533.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Citrus Flitterbies

Objectives.Description: Report to Flitilda or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_533.PrefaceText: Hey, it's you again. Remember when you got me flitterbies? I was thinking about them. I bet you guys have no idea how flitterbies work! They're maleable to their environment even after they grow. If you have a ton of citrus on you when you pick one, it'll come out smelling citrusy itself! Can you confirm this actually works like I expect? Sometimes mortal-realm variants can act weird. [To advance this quest you must have 100+ citrus items in your inventory when you pick flitterbies.]
quest_533.SuccessText:
See, what did I tell you? These flitterbies smell better! There's a distinct citrus smell that kind of masks their other odors.

That means these are real flitterbies, not some weird lookalike. Thank you for helping me prove that. My upcoming botanical book needs to be extremely accurate.

quest_536.Description: Anamemerie in Statehelm said, "I'm so far behind on my deliveries today! Could you help? This one creeps me out. Take it to Fransesca Muradrake, and you can keep the tip. Let me know when it's done, though, okay? I'm still responsible for it. And don't steal it. Stealing is bad."
quest_536.MidwayText: Oh. You do delivery work? I'm very mildly surprised. Thank you for these. They'll be very useful.
quest_536.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Bone Delivery

Objectives.Description: Report to Anamemerie or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_536.PrefaceText: I'm so far behind on my deliveries today! Could you help? This one creeps me out. Take it to Fransesca Muradrake, and you can keep the tip. Let me know when it's done, though, okay? I'm still responsible for it. And don't steal it. Stealing is bad.
quest_536.SuccessText: I knew I could trust you! I appreciate the help. Necromancy gives me icky feelings. We don't have necromancy in the fae realm! It's gross.

quest_537.Description: Anamemerie in Statehelm said, "I'm so far behind on my deliveries today! Could you help? This one creeps me out. Take it to Strom Farblood, and you can keep the tip! And like before, let me know when it's done so I can check it off the list."
quest_537.MidwayText:
Ah, it's here. But where's the usual fairy? Are you authorized by the Overseer to deliver parcels?! Or did she just pay a random stranger to do her job for her again?

Give me that. I swear. Fairies as delivery-boys was a terrible idea. We should use delivery golems for everything!

Yes, yes, you may go.
quest_537.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Unguent Delivery

Objectives.Description: Report to Anamemerie or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_537.PrefaceText: I'm so far behind on my deliveries today! Could you help? This one creeps me out. Take it to Strom Farblood, and you can keep the tip! And like before, let me know when it's done so I can check it off the list.
quest_537.SuccessText: The ointments are delivered? Oh, good. I don't mind delivering ointments usually, but Strom has said some weird things around me. About using fairy wings for potions! Eugh. I'm just happier not thinking about that.

quest_541.Description: Gunther Ashbrown in Statehelm said, "I'm supposed to be making a custom chair for someone, but damned if I can manage to get it to come out right. Are you good with wood? Here's the specifications. See? Slightly too tall and slightly too short."
quest_541.Name: Helping Townsfolk: A Chair That Fits

Objectives.Description: Report to Gunther Ashbrown or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_541.PrefaceText: I'm supposed to be making a custom chair for someone, but damned if I can manage to get it to come out right. Are you good with wood? Here's the specifications. See? Slightly too tall and slightly too short.
quest_541.SuccessText: You know, when you walked away without even writing down the proportions, I was sure that you were gonna blow me off. But you actually did it, and you got the measurements right, too. Huh. Well good work. I'll take it from here.

quest_542.Description:
Gunther Ashbrown in Statehelm said, "Hey, you're the chair-wizard. You made that chair for me a while back, right? Well, I could really use your help this time. Here, look a this. See? Yeah. This is a quality chair. Far beyond my skill, I'll admit. And it needs to be made to these exact measurements.

I'm not saying you owe me anything. I'm just saying, since you obviously like making chairs so much..."
quest_542.Name: Helping Townsfolk: A Chair the Rocks

Objectives.Description: Report to Gunther Ashbrown or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_542.PrefaceText:
Hey, you're the chair-wizard. You made that chair for me a while back, right? Well, I could really use your help this time. Here, look a this. See? Yeah. This is a quality chair. Far beyond my skill, I'll admit. And it needs to be made to these exact measurements.

I'm not saying you owe me anything. I'm just saying, since you obviously like making chairs so much...
quest_542.SuccessText: Haha! You did it! The chair wizard strikes again. Here. This is half the money I got for the job.

quest_543.Description:
Gunther Ashbrown in Statehelm said, "I've been looking all over for you!

I delivered that last chair and got lots of compliments. And now I've got an incredibly tough order. I can't even get other carpenters in town to make this for me!

You're my best chance. I will give you half -- no, two thirds of the money for the job."
quest_543.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Awesome Custom Chair

Objectives.Description: Report to Gunther Ashbrown or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_543.PrefaceText:
I've been looking all over for you!

I delivered that last chair and got lots of compliments. And now I've got an incredibly tough order. I can't even get other carpenters in town to make this for me!

You're my best chance. I will give you half -- no, two thirds of the money for the job.
quest_543.SuccessText: Wow. The polish on this chair is immaculate. You went all out! And I'm going to reap the rewards! Haven't learned my lesson yet, hahaha!

quest_546.Description:
Shiriqa in Statehelm said, "Me and Jenny Foster have a prank war going on. You know, the server at the coffee shop? Yeah. She loves pranks! But she's terrified of osslars. Osslars are some kind of demon thing and apparently she had a scary experience with them. So you know what that means!

This will be a prank for the history books of this mortal realm. I'm gonna animate the skull and have it talk to her!"
quest_546.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Haunted House Prank

Objectives.Description: Report to Shiriqa or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_546.PrefaceText:
Me and Jenny Foster have a prank war going on. You know, the server at the coffee shop? Yeah. She loves pranks! But she's terrified of osslars. Osslars are some kind of demon thing and apparently she had a scary experience with them. So you know what that means!

This will be a prank for the history books of this mortal realm. I'm gonna animate the skull and have it talk to her!
quest_546.SuccessText: This is gonna be so funny. SOOooo funny! Here: I saved up to pay you. Be thankful!

quest_547.Description:
Shiriqa in Statehelm said, "Hey, you're the one who sold me that bad osslar skull. This is your fault! I performed an absolutely hilarious prank and now Jenny Foster won't speak to me! At all! She gives me the "silent treatment", which should definitely be considered a war crime if it isn't already.

Since you did this too, you should help me fix it. Jenny likes tea, so I want you to get her some exotic tropical tea. Make it extra sweet."
quest_547.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Making Amends

Objectives.Description: Report to Shiriqa or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_547.PrefaceText:
Hey, you're the one who sold me that bad osslar skull. This is your fault! I performed an absolutely hilarious prank and now Jenny Foster won't speak to me! At all! She gives me the "silent treatment", which should definitely be considered a war crime if it isn't already.

Since you did this too, you should help me fix it. Jenny likes tea, so I want you to get her some exotic tropical tea. Make it extra sweet.
quest_547.SuccessText: That's the tea? Okay. Good. I'm going to go apologize. You stay hidden!

quest_548.Description: Shiriqa in Statehelm said, "Jenny said that if I want to be friends with her again I have to swear off pranking her forever. She said she doesn't even really like pranks! She was just humoring me! Can you believe the audacity? Mortals are so unpredictable, it's scary. I don't even know how to deal with this. Wait: yes I do! I just need to show her the beautiful side of pranks. Can you make or find a pair of glued-together coins? I'll use them for a harmless prank. HARMLESS. I promise! She'll laugh!"
quest_548.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Jenny's Still Mad!

Objectives.Description: Report to Shiriqa or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_548.PrefaceText: Jenny said that if I want to be friends with her again I have to swear off pranking her forever. She said she doesn't even really like pranks! She was just humoring me! Can you believe the audacity? Mortals are so unpredictable, it's scary. I don't even know how to deal with this. Wait: yes I do! I just need to show her the beautiful side of pranks. Can you make or find a pair of glued-together coins? I'll use them for a harmless prank. HARMLESS. I promise! She'll laugh!
quest_548.SuccessText: This is definitely gonna work to make Jenny feel better. And if it doesn't, I'll blame it all on you. Thanks again!

quest_549.Description:
Shiriqa in Statehelm said, "I did the glued-coin gag to Jenny. I stuck them to the table and watched her struggle to pull them off. She was at it for a while and she wasn't laughing at all! So I ran over and stopped her.

I explained everything: how it was your idea, how you're fully to blame, and how I would never, ever, EVER do a prank to her again. Thanks for taking the heat for me!

What? You DID enable the prank. You can't be blameless in this!

Okay, look, I know I screwed up. Social scenarios with mortals are extremely tricky! Can you forgive me? I can't have you as an enemy! You're more terrifying than Jenny! I thought you'd understand!

Calm down, I know how to fix this: my prank fund! You can have it! It's a treasure chest full of precious gems. At least I think it is. I can't open it! But I have a plan on how to get it open. Here's what I need."
quest_549.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Taking the Blame

Objectives.Description: Report to Shiriqa or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_549.PrefaceText:
I did the glued-coin gag to Jenny. I stuck them to the table and watched her struggle to pull them off. She was at it for a while and she wasn't laughing at all! So I ran over and stopped her.

I explained everything: how it was your idea, how you're fully to blame, and how I would never, ever, EVER do a prank to her again. Thanks for taking the heat for me!

What? You DID enable the prank. You can't be blameless in this!

Okay, look, I know I screwed up. Social scenarios with mortals are extremely tricky! Can you forgive me? I can't have you as an enemy! You're more terrifying than Jenny! I thought you'd understand!

Calm down, I know how to fix this: my prank fund! You can have it! It's a treasure chest full of precious gems. At least I think it is. I can't open it! But I have a plan on how to get it open. Here's what I need.
quest_549.SuccessText:
Okay. Stand back. I put the resistance potion on the box and the cleanser on the lock, then I can use the picks, and... Haha!

For ONCE I wasn't scammed by a mortal. There really is treasure in here!

I'd planned to use this to pull an epic illusion prank on the whole city. But it's yours. ALL of it. I'm sorry. Please, please, please forgive me?

quest_556.Description: Salmpo Phelps in Statehelm said, "I used to maintain these loading golems, back when there were more of 'em. It was sort of my side-job. And, well, I guess since nobody else is taking responsibility, I still have to do it! So I've been doing safety inspections on the golems. I've made some easy fixes, but the scarier problems require special parts."
quest_556.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Maintaining the Loading Golems

Objectives.Description: Report to Salmpo Phelps or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_556.PrefaceText: I used to maintain these loading golems, back when there were more of 'em. It was sort of my side-job. And, well, I guess since nobody else is taking responsibility, I still have to do it! So I've been doing safety inspections on the golems. I've made some easy fixes, but the scarier problems require special parts.
quest_556.SuccessText: Thanks. The last thing you want is a loading golem to lose even a portion of its memory. Typically goes on a killing rampage. And then we'd be down a golem AND however many workers it killed.

quest_557.Description: Salmpo Phelps in Statehelm said, "The best loading golems have a cutting mode to open tough crates. The ones we have left on the docks don't have that feature, though. I was thinking, maybe I could install it. If I had some cutting arms, I mean."
quest_557.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Improving the Loading Golems

Objectives.Description: Report to Salmpo Phelps or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_557.PrefaceText: The best loading golems have a cutting mode to open tough crates. The ones we have left on the docks don't have that feature, though. I was thinking, maybe I could install it. If I had some cutting arms, I mean.
quest_557.SuccessText: Hm. Well this is a whole lot more complicated than replacing their N core. I may be out of my depth. But thanks for enabling my curious spirit! Having a project to work on is important. And don't you forget it.

quest_558.Description: Salmpo Phelps in Statehelm said, "Did you know there's really such a thing as a Salmpo? They're abominations. Created by amateur alchemists, mostly. I don't exactly know what they look like, but I've heard their hearts are made of leafy greens! I've always wanted to try one. Just to know what I taste like. So to speak."
quest_558.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Eating My Namesake

Objectives.Description: Report to Salmpo Phelps or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_558.PrefaceText: Did you know there's really such a thing as a Salmpo? They're abominations. Created by amateur alchemists, mostly. I don't exactly know what they look like, but I've heard their hearts are made of leafy greens! I've always wanted to try one. Just to know what I taste like. So to speak.
quest_558.SuccessText:
This is a Salmpo heart? Really?

Let me take a test bite ... well, it tastes like cabbage. I'm a little disappointed, but very thankful to finally have an answer to this very important question.

quest_561.Description: Terriva Jance in Statehelm said, "You know what I miss? Brown ale. Strong, sweet, but dry. Except the wet ones. I'm not too particular I guess. But every brown ale is better than what Cynthia serves!"
quest_561.Name: Helping Townsfolk: That Brown Brown Ale

Objectives.Description: Report to Terriva Jance or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_561.PrefaceText: You know what I miss? Brown ale. Strong, sweet, but dry. Except the wet ones. I'm not too particular I guess. But every brown ale is better than what Cynthia serves!
quest_561.SuccessText: Ahh. That was delicious. I could use another! Hah! No but seriously.

quest_562.Description: Terriva Jance in Statehelm said, "Hey how about one more tall glass of that brown ale? Don't worry, I can hold my stuff."
quest_562.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Can't Get Enough Brown Ale

Objectives.Description: Report to Terriva Jance or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_562.PrefaceText: Hey how about one more tall glass of that brown ale? Don't worry, I can hold my stuff.
quest_562.SuccessText:
Perfect! You know what, you're my favorite barkeep! Well, if you had a bar, I'd definitely be there!

Assuming it was close to the docks. I mean, you need to know your audience. What are you even trying to do with this business, anyway?

quest_563.Description: Terriva Jance in Statehelm said, "Hey! You're the brown ale expert. Hey hey good to see you again! I've been thinking about that brown ale. I want to order a keg of it! Can you deliver? I've been saving up!"
quest_563.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Never Enough Brown Ale

Objectives.Description: Report to Terriva Jance or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_563.PrefaceText: Hey! You're the brown ale expert. Hey hey good to see you again! I've been thinking about that brown ale. I want to order a keg of it! Can you deliver? I've been saving up!
quest_563.SuccessText: You're the best! I'm going to start selling this as my own creation. And you can be my secret supplier, okay? This is all the benefits of having a bar without any of the hassle. You'll see! Check back in a week!

quest_564.Description: Terriva Jance in Statehelm said, "I'm ready for another keg of the brown. Business has been good!"
quest_564.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Keep The Brown Ale Coming

Objectives.Description: Report to Terriva Jance or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_564.PrefaceText: I'm ready for another keg of the brown. Business has been good!
quest_564.SuccessText: Keep it comin', partner! I'll need another keg in a week!

quest_566.Description: Leopold Smith in Statehelm said, "I've lost my favorite Grand Shaping Hammer. And don't tell me it broke, it was brand new! I must have put it somewhere. It was special because it had a wider grip and shorter handle which made it a joy to use. I guess I'll have to get a toolcrafter to make me a new one some day. *Sigh*"
quest_566.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Misplaced Hammer

Objectives.Description: Report to Leopold Smith or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_566.PrefaceText: I've lost my favorite Grand Shaping Hammer. And don't tell me it broke, it was brand new! I must have put it somewhere. It was special because it had a wider grip and shorter handle which made it a joy to use. I guess I'll have to get a toolcrafter to make me a new one some day. *Sigh*
quest_566.SuccessText:
This.. It's my lost hammer! You fucking stole it! I knew you were a crook the moment I laid eyes on you! All smug. No you ddn't craft it. Like YOU could craft this masterpiece! Give me that! ... Oh. No, this is a different hammer.

Hey, I'm sorry I called you a thief! Uh, thanks for the immaculate hammer! I owe you one.

quest_567.Description:
Leopold Smith in Statehelm said, "Hey! Uh, sorry again about accusing you of being a thief. You just seem like ... ahem, well, anyway, I know NOW that you're an expert toolsmith! And that means you must have access to quality metal. I need some.

The Council provides me with the metal to fix horseshoes and fences, but I need fancier metal for a personal project I'm working on."
quest_567.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Need The Metal

Objectives.Description: Report to Leopold Smith or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_567.PrefaceText:
Hey! Uh, sorry again about accusing you of being a thief. You just seem like ... ahem, well, anyway, I know NOW that you're an expert toolsmith! And that means you must have access to quality metal. I need some.

The Council provides me with the metal to fix horseshoes and fences, but I need fancier metal for a personal project I'm working on.
quest_567.SuccessText: Here's your money. And I'm adding in a bit extra as an apology for earlier, and for your discretion. If someone, say Samantha Veilmoor, were to ask if I make swords, you would say that I definitely don't. Right? Great.

quest_568.Description: Leopold Smith in Statehelm said, "Oh, I'm glad I ran into you! I need some gems to finish my... project. A carnelian and an onyx. Actually, two of each! Just in case I'm unlucky."
quest_568.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Magic Touch

Objectives.Description: Report to Leopold Smith or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_568.PrefaceText: Oh, I'm glad I ran into you! I need some gems to finish my... project. A carnelian and an onyx. Actually, two of each! Just in case I'm unlucky.
quest_568.SuccessText: That's what a carnelian looks like? Well, good for it. I just hope this works. Thank you! I've got to go now.

quest_576.Description:
Gleanfeckle in Statehelm said, "I'm still geting used to having to sleep every day. The giant tree is making that hard, too, because the other fae are not quiet at night!

I've been using a magical dampening sphere to protect my ears, but the spell gives me a headache. Electra told me I should just get the local mortal equivalent. Do you happen to have any of this wax?"
quest_576.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Best Wax for Tired Ears

Objectives.Description: Report to Gleanfeckle or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_576.PrefaceText:
I'm still geting used to having to sleep every day. The giant tree is making that hard, too, because the other fae are not quiet at night!

I've been using a magical dampening sphere to protect my ears, but the spell gives me a headache. Electra told me I should just get the local mortal equivalent. Do you happen to have any of this wax?
quest_576.SuccessText: That's quite a lot of wax! I can make a lot of ear protectors from this. Thank you so much!

quest_577.Description:
Gleanfeckle in Statehelm said, "Oh, hi %PLAYER_NAME%! You got that wax for me, remember? I appreciate it, but turns out the wax was heavily scented, and the scent gives me a headache.

Flitilda studies local fauna and says the odors from these things would cancel out the scent."
quest_577.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Best Scent To Temper Wax

Objectives.Description: Report to Gleanfeckle or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_577.PrefaceText:
Oh, hi %PLAYER_NAME%! You got that wax for me, remember? I appreciate it, but turns out the wax was heavily scented, and the scent gives me a headache.

Flitilda studies local fauna and says the odors from these things would cancel out the scent.
quest_577.SuccessText: Wow, the combined odor is quite a lot. I'm having second thoughts about this plan, but since you seem to think it's a good idea, I'll give it a try! I'll bask in these odors before I sleep. Come back in a week and I'll let you know how it went.

quest_578.Description:
Gleanfeckle in Statehelm said, "Oh, it's you. The bozo who gave me an infested hexapus arm to sleep on! Well to your credit, all those horrific odors DID cancel out and I was able to get some sleep for a bit, but two days later I was in terrible pain. I visited Steven the healer, who declared that I had Hexapus Ear and cured me. Apparently the tentacle you gave me was covered in eggs, and they got all over everything!

I threw out the hexapus arm but I still keep getting infected with Hexapus Ear every night! It's disgusting! It's... humiliating at this point. Please, you have to help me sanitize my bed area! ... And also get me a tentatkiller arm to replace the odor of the hexapus arm."
quest_578.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Cure For Hexapus Ear

Objectives.Description: Report to Gleanfeckle or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_578.PrefaceText:
Oh, it's you. The bozo who gave me an infested hexapus arm to sleep on! Well to your credit, all those horrific odors DID cancel out and I was able to get some sleep for a bit, but two days later I was in terrible pain. I visited Steven the healer, who declared that I had Hexapus Ear and cured me. Apparently the tentacle you gave me was covered in eggs, and they got all over everything!

I threw out the hexapus arm but I still keep getting infected with Hexapus Ear every night! It's disgusting! It's... humiliating at this point. Please, you have to help me sanitize my bed area! ... And also get me a tentatkiller arm to replace the odor of the hexapus arm.
quest_578.SuccessText:
Oh thank the Fall King, I couldn't do this another night! It's just in time.

Hmm, the tentakiller arm doesn't smell at all like the hexapus arm did. But they're both tentacley smells, so this should work. I'll see what kind of sleep I get this week.

quest_579.Description: Gleanfeckle in Statehelm said, "Hi, %PLAYER_NAME%, I wanted to report back about my sleep habits. I've got the infestation cleared and the sound and odor issues under control! But it's slightly too chilly. The standard-issued blanket is too thin. I need a replacement!"
quest_579.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Blanket's Too Thin

Objectives.Description: Report to Gleanfeckle or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_579.PrefaceText: Hi, %PLAYER_NAME%, I wanted to report back about my sleep habits. I've got the infestation cleared and the sound and odor issues under control! But it's slightly too chilly. The standard-issued blanket is too thin. I need a replacement!
quest_579.SuccessText: Oh, how kind. Now I'm sure to get perfect sleep, thanks to you!

quest_581.Description:
Kasapar in Statehelm said, "They have many interesting spirits here, but I miss the drink of my homeland. Rahu has the most salivation-inducing tequila! I would love to have a cask delivered.

And of course, this would be a business expense, so I can tap into my generous expense account."
quest_581.Name: Helping Townsfolk: The Violent Taste of Home

Objectives.Description: Report to Kasapar or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_581.PrefaceText:
They have many interesting spirits here, but I miss the drink of my homeland. Rahu has the most salivation-inducing tequila! I would love to have a cask delivered.

And of course, this would be a business expense, so I can tap into my generous expense account.
quest_581.SuccessText: Hmm. The flavors are a bit suspect, but I cannot turn it down! Here. Perhaps return later and I shall perhaps need more.

quest_582.Description: Kasapar in Statehelm said, "I have enjoyed the tequila, my friend, and it has proven a very interesting talking point among guests. I need more! I shall pay you the same as before. As to the flavor profile, please surprise me with something delicious."
quest_582.Name: Helping Townsfolk: More of The Cactus' Bite

Objectives.Description: Report to Kasapar or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_582.PrefaceText: I have enjoyed the tequila, my friend, and it has proven a very interesting talking point among guests. I need more! I shall pay you the same as before. As to the flavor profile, please surprise me with something delicious.
quest_582.SuccessText: This will do, this will do indeed! Haha! Here you are. I shall need more soon enough, don't go too far.

quest_586.Description: Exalto the Extractor in Statehelm said, "I require human teeth. They must be in excellent condition!"
quest_586.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Human Teeth

Objectives.Description: Report to Exalto the Extractor or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_586.PrefaceText: I require human teeth. They must be in excellent condition!
quest_586.SuccessText: Thank you for the teeth. They will find a new life in new mouths.

quest_587.Description: Exalto the Extractor in Statehelm said, "I need more human teeth. Human dentristry is demanding: the teeth must be in good condition!"
quest_587.Name: Helping Townsfolk: Human Teeth (Again)

Objectives.Description: Report to Exalto the Extractor or Statehelm Mail Dropoff

quest_587.PrefaceText: I need more human teeth. Human dentristry is demanding: the teeth must be in good condition!
quest_587.SuccessText: Thank you for the teeth. They will find a new life in new mouths.
